NAME: Glauco
REVIEW: Another great dinner with amazing food at one of my favorites in Manhattan.

NAME: Caleb
REVIEW: Amazing food and an excellent wine selection. The service is outstanding and elevated. Everything was great—can’t wait to come back!

NAME: Kang
REVIEW: Great food and service. The best Spanish food that I have. The entree is remarkable. Love to try others next time.

NAME: Jack
REVIEW: Brought our 16 year old daughter here on a birthday trip to NYC. She was blown away, and we loved it again. Each dish looked amazing and was full of perfect flavors. Waiter was top notch and made a perfect wine recommendation.

NAME: Joshua
REVIEW: Amazing food.  Great somm.  Insane wine selection.  Fantastic meal overall

NAME: Mariana
REVIEW: Espectacular mi restaurante español favorito en NY lo amooooo

NAME: Gary
REVIEW: Amazing food and wine selections. Professionally run with everyone (and everything) top notch. Juan Pablo is the best!

NAME: Ellen
REVIEW: How do yall get better every year?  Improve on perfection?  Whats the secret??  Love yall!!!

NAME: Sahudy
REVIEW: EXCELENTE. LOS FIDEOS CON CHORIZO DIVINOS. EL CHURRASCO SABROSO Y EL PUDIN

NAME: Brian
REVIEW: Everything about our dinner was wonderful from the greeting to dessert and all the deliciousness and service in between.

NAME: May
REVIEW: the food was so good but unfortunately I have to give it 3 stars because of the customer service. If this is going to be Michelin guide restaurant, I expect better services. We were driving from Boston & called to see if they extend our table 30 mins later because we were not expecting this much traffic & when we just wanted to CONFIRM if there’s a 24 hr policy, whoever picked up the phone call said “you should’ve done that yesterday” well if I knew traffic was this bad, maybe I should’ve seen the future!! that’s totally my fault for not knowing traffic. When we arrived around 4:34 (4:30 reservation) we had to wait 20 mins for our table, so it’s fair for you guys to tell us when to sit but can’t keep the same energy. Other than that, food was good but just not sure if the customer service was meeting - therefore Casa Ora in Brooklyn is better.

NAME: Adriana
REVIEW: The food was delicious and the service was lovely.

NAME: Samara
REVIEW: Amazing food, amazing service. Mussels and meatballs were incredible and creative. Looking forward to going back and trying more things!

NAME: Dan
REVIEW: The food quality has gone down. The goat was dry and the croquettes were not that special. I was bummed as the last time I came it was an incredible Experience

NAME: Adam
REVIEW: Unbelievable food and great atmosphere. Great venue for a really cool night out.

NAME: Raina
REVIEW: Food was AMAZING but service was painfully slow. We had to signal to our server multiple times.

NAME: Mike
REVIEW: Amazing food, warm and delightful service, bustling atmosphere.

NAME: Blerim
REVIEW: First visit, awesome experience. Chef Diego, our Server, our Somm and the rest of the crew were great. Food was incredible, can’t wait to come back soon. Thank you for an amazing time.

NAME: Soni
REVIEW: Excellent food & service.

NAME: Maya
REVIEW: Amazing!!!! I love it there. Definitely my fav dinner spot

NAME: Piers
REVIEW: Fabulous range of typically Spanish dishes. Good advice on the wine list.

NAME: Sandrine
REVIEW: Great experience Excelent food Excelent service Recommended highly the place

NAME: Sharon
REVIEW: Wonderful food and service! Like a mini trip to Spain.

NAME: christopher
REVIEW: Encyclopedic Spanish wine list. Very experienced server.  Menu very focused menu with mostly seafood items.

NAME: Coni
REVIEW: The food, service and ambience were stellar, the bathroom was disgusting. Really disgusting.

NAME: John
REVIEW: Everything was great. Food and service were excellent. Will definitely be back.

NAME: Lindsay
REVIEW: The sommelier was great! After we decided on food, she created a complementary set of pairings based on our preferences.  I appreciated how well everything was coursed. The goat was our favorite dish!  And the bread pudding was a fantastic end.

NAME: Andres
REVIEW: Good food and a great ambiance made for a nice evening, but the service fell short. After taking our order and bringing the wine bottle, the waiter never returned to pour more or check on us. No one asked how our food was or if we needed anything else until dessert.

NAME: Lei
REVIEW: Outstanding food and service. Cozy atmosphere; We were there for a special occasion, Definitely will go back.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Genuinely excellent seafood dishes. Ambiance was wonderful. Would go back in a heartbeat for a special occasion

NAME: Toni
REVIEW: Food was delicious. Wine was great!  The vibe of the restaurant was cozy but festive. My favorite was the crudo and skirt steak. My husband’s favorite was the scallops and the burrata and squash. All was delicious. The service was attentive and fast but not rushing. Overall would totally recommend.

NAME: Alexandria
REVIEW: Have been going here since it opened and it remains consistently excellent. Casa Mono salad is one of my favourite things!

NAME: Raúl
REVIEW: Nothing short of outstanding meal and the service was impeccable.

NAME: Francisco
REVIEW: Excellent wine and atmosphere, food was a bit gimmicky. Croquettas were delicious, but the steak dish is terrible value for money, 1/4 steak 3/4 onion. The kitchen is obviously excellent, I just wish they would do one or two dishes a bit more traditionally.

NAME: Marieke
REVIEW: I was not convinced ! It’s definitely overrated and overpriced in my opinion. Yes, definitely some flavourful dishes, but you’ll find them in a regular restaurant in Spain for 1/4 of the price. The razor clams were tasty but had a lot of sand in them. We liked the burata but didn’t find it very special compared to other places serving this. We also liked the fluke crudo even though it was very small. Didn’t like the goat with avocado dish. The patatas bravas were very greasy and totally drenched in sauce. The bread pudding dessert wasn’t very convincing. The pulpo that we ordered never arrived (not sure if we paid for it: didn’t check). Overall I felt quite sick after the meal; probably from the greasy patatoes. Having dined in Michelin restaurants before, this one is definitely not worth a star. It’s a nice neighbourhood hang though and worth a try if you’re not able to go to Spain to get the same food for much less.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: You made my day Foods + wines + services Best place in NY

NAME: Cheryl
REVIEW: My husband and I love Casa Mono and Bar Jamon. Food is consistently delicious and service consistently warm and hospitable. Deepest Spanish wine list in NYC. Excellent and friendly somm’s will always help you pick a great bottle. Truly our favorite restaurant in NYC!

NAME: Aleksandra
REVIEW: Amazing food, lovely place, but offering outside tables in November without heaters or even a blanket is not very customer friendly

NAME: Mark
REVIEW: Had high expectations with the Michelin rating, and the definitely delivered. We had outside seating which was nice, but next time I would take the high top inside… the inside just had a more intimate feel. Best dish was the foie gras, a close second was the sous vide lamb, definitely get the desert. Great wine selection, even just the glass selections.

NAME: EdithL
REVIEW: Great food !! Would come over again. The pork belly was exceptional

NAME: fred
REVIEW: Wonderful.  Small venue. Great food and wine. Pre dinner bar is cool as well.

NAME: Rodrigo
REVIEW: Foo ñd was great, but the service was one of a kind.

NAME: Ahmad
REVIEW: The time for our dinner reservation was booked at 6:30 but we didn’t get table till 40 minutes after. We had to wait outside because bar was also full. Food was fair and I developed stomach pain at night, might be due to mushroom. Not a very good experience overall. Service was scrappy to say the least.

NAME: Joanne
REVIEW: Excellent dishes one after the next.  Tiny spot but fun atmosphere.

NAME: Dan
REVIEW: Wonderful as always. Only downside: seated outside and they no longer have heated outdoor structures. Got pretty chilly!

NAME: Jessie
REVIEW: Food is mediocre, not deserve the Michelin one star. we spent 90$ each person, but not even full after the meal

NAME: Amy
REVIEW: We love Casa Mono and continue to return! The restaurant always feels so cozy and warm and delicious. The combination of their deep red Spanish wine and their unique food is such a winner. I do find them quite expensive (like a lot of places in NYC right now ) considering the size of each small dish. But I still go back for their outstanding food combinations and flavors when I can!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono is my favorite restaurant in NYC. It never fails to surprise the palette and inspire the soul.

NAME: Kenneth
REVIEW: A fantastic experience all around with exceptional food and service.

NAME: Francesca
REVIEW: We had an unforgettable dining experience where we put our full trust in the team to select our food and wine, and they exceeded every expectation. Andrew curated a mix of all-star dishes, alongside some underrated gems that completely blew us away. His recommendations were flawless, and his presence throughout the meal was the perfect balance of attentive and unobtrusive.  To elevate the evening even further, Juan Pablo’s wine and sherry pairings were spot-on, bringing out the best in each dish. His charm was contagious, adding a delightful energy to the meal. This was truly a standout experience from start to finish.

NAME: Review
REVIEW: Service was poor, and the food was disappointing compared to last year’s visit.

NAME: Barbara
REVIEW: Really incredible food. The burrata was one of the best dishes I’ve ever had the experience of enjoying. Also enjoyed the octopus, and skirt steak plates. Hope to return!

NAME: GGSmith
REVIEW: Amazing flavorful delicious meal. Great wine pairing suggestion from our server. Love the ambiance.

NAME: Wayne
REVIEW: Would have been even better if we didn’t intially sit outdoors (but their outdoor heaters were delayed )

NAME: Luis
REVIEW: An amazing establishment. The excellent selections of food & wines are never ending and constantly refreshed. A well deserved Michelin Star and superb service by the staff. A must when we visit NYC.

NAME: Gretchen
REVIEW: Team - both wait staff and chef - showed great care managing some dietary limitations.

NAME: Jenna
REVIEW: We had a fantastic dinner here. Definitely listen to their recommendations, we were sceptical about the goat but it was 3/4's favourite dish. The waitstaff were very welcoming, and given how rich and luxurious everything tasted, the price was very reasonable.

NAME: Leslie
REVIEW: Food was great but the host really soured our experience from the jump. I much prefer Bar Jamon—you can tell they're trying to rush you and get as much turnover as possible at Casa Mono.

NAME: Ermina
REVIEW: So delicious- incredible food and service. A true gem.

NAME: Yennifer
REVIEW: Food was great, service could be a little better but would recommend 100%.

NAME: Andrew
REVIEW: food was very good, service was so so, waited a very long time for the menus and service was inattentive but it was busy so i understand.

NAME: William
REVIEW: Our favorite place, food, service, wine. Everything we like.

NAME: Kimberly
REVIEW: Amazing food and wine, great service and ambiance.

NAME: Fermanda
REVIEW: Los platos y la atención, simplemente, espectaculares.

NAME: Rodrigo
REVIEW: The best in town. Unquestionable!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

NAME: John
REVIEW: Definitely a delicious spot for a tapas meal. Very eclectic clientele. Equally delightful menu.

NAME: Matthew
REVIEW: Wonderful dining experience.  The food was delicious.  The service was absolutely outstanding!

NAME: suzanne
REVIEW: Inventive menu w/beautiful meat and fish dishes  but not lots for vegetarians…a great salad and burrata plate that is magnificent is on offer. Excellent wines as well. Small, intimate, good ambiance.

NAME: Kipp
REVIEW: Great meal from start to finish. Sitting at the bar facing the kitchen was a fun experience. The Crispy Pig Ears were delicious and the glass of wine paired well with dinner. 10/10

NAME: Damon
REVIEW: Great restaurant and service. A bit hard to find but the restaurant provides all of the direction detail prior to the reservation

NAME: Hector
REVIEW: Comida exquisita. El cordero sobre todo y la ensalada con manchego

NAME: MaClayn
REVIEW: Absolutely fantastic service.

NAME: Ruby
REVIEW: The fare, service and flavors were all excellent. It was a tight squeeze but it’s New York, so hey 👍🏽

NAME: James
REVIEW: Excellent and imaginative flavor combinations with a well-paired wine list and gracious service.

NAME: Lara
REVIEW: Bryant was the best! The food was epic and I’m so happy

NAME: Bob
REVIEW: The food could not be better and our server, Isaias, added to our enjoyment of the dining experience.

NAME: Brian
REVIEW: The goat was delicious !. The wine was excellent as was James . First time we were disappointed by a fish at CM but plan to be back !

NAME: Denise
REVIEW: We come every year on our anniversary - amazing as always

NAME: Richard
REVIEW: I very much enjoyed our visit to Casa Mono. I especially liked the fact that many of my favorite dishes to find anywhere, are all available there and deliciously presented. I love Bone Marrow, Razor Vlams, Foie Gras, Duck and Crème Brûlée. To find them all at one place is a real treat!

NAME: Geraldine
REVIEW: There’s a reason Casa Mono has been around so long!  The food is excellent, the service is attentive without being overbearing and there’s something for everyone.  Some standouts were the pulpo, the pork meatballs & the duck breast.  The server made great drink recommendations - with & without alcohol - (the phony Negroni was great!). Desserts were also good - the bread pudding was a favorite.

NAME: Niccolo
REVIEW: I've been coming here 6 times a year for 8 years. that's all I have to say.

NAME: Sandra
REVIEW: A cozy, authentic Spanish restaurant.  The menu is exciting, expertly prepared with high quality products.  Our favorites included the pork Sobrasada with quince & honey and the scallops with Serrano pepper green curry & minted cashews.   Leave room for dessert!  The burnt vanilla custard with battered deep fried bay leaves is outstanding.

NAME: megan
REVIEW: Every single dish did not disappint, do flavorful ans unique!

NAME: Evan
REVIEW: Always a great experience sitting at the counter. Fun evening. Great wine choice by James.

NAME: Danielle
REVIEW: Food was great, but the wine the some recommended elevated the whole experience

NAME: John
REVIEW: This is my fourth or fifth time dining here and it never disappoints. Charming neighborhood gem with amazingly prepared Tapas and an excellent Spanish wine list to accompany the courses. Our server Darwin was outstanding with excellent knowledge of the food and wines and a fun engaging personality.

NAME: Byron
REVIEW: Casa Mono has not lost its magic touch. The small kitchen prepares deservedly Michelin star plates to a packed house as effortlessly as the National Symphony Orchestra delivers the most passionate and stirring of melodies. We’ve never been disappointed and look forward to visiting when in Bew York.

NAME: Duncan
REVIEW: Always hits the spot been going for 15 years plus amazing food and vibe this visit was no exception. Delicious

NAME: Jeanne
REVIEW: Casa Mono is always an experience, not just a meal.  We sat at the counter to have the opportunity to watch the kitchen staff do their magic.  The dishes were inventive and flavorful.  The wine list was magnificent and there were plenty of great options to choose from. Though our waiter was experienced, he didn't really explain any of the dishes and I felt pressured to make decisions without any assistance.  I ordered wine and he never came over to fill my wine glass when it was near empty.  At the end of the night I was having a sherry digestif and we planned to send the rest to the back because it was more than I could drink and he came over and dumped its contents into my glass.  It felt more like a push to get out the door.  We've been coming to Casa Mono since it opened but don't live in NYC anymore and hadn't been in years.  The overall feeling is still a very special and delicious experience, but it feels more like a machine and not a sweet neighborhood delight, at least compared to the past.  I would still return because of the food and the ambiance.  Overall, a great restaurant!

NAME: Suzanne
REVIEW: Requested outdoor seating and was placed very far outside next to a tree where dogs passed and used as a toilet.  The food was very disappointing.

NAME: Benjamin
REVIEW: Great experience. took my wife for her bd. it was awesome

NAME: Robert
REVIEW: Honestly, I would avoid this place. The plates were advertised as small, but they were exceptionally, insultingly small. We ordered oxtail for example and there was such a small quantity of meat that we literally laughed. The beers cost 8 dollars and were only half filled. While the service was fine, the food was entirely too expensive and not at all authentic. I lived in Spain for years and I went with a Spaniard and we were all together unconvinced by this so-called “Spanish” food. The octopus was also more similar to what we would call in Spain chipirones. If you’re looking for authentic Spanish food in nyc I would definitely try another place.

NAME: Evan
REVIEW: Great time sitting at the counter. Razor clams are always a must!

NAME: Marc
REVIEW: Outstanding meal and excellent service. Great wine recommendation from sommelier.

NAME: ChristyB
REVIEW: Casa Mono was recommended to me by two different former Manhattan residents. Boy, it did not disappoint! We’ve had some fine meals in the US and Europe and this was in my husband’s Top 10 of all time. The service, to the food, to the vibe of the place - we loved everything about our experience. Our favorite dishes were the Pan can Tomate, Jamón Iberico, Fluke Crudo, and special duck liver pate.

NAME: Drlopezmdfacc
REVIEW: Must visit for elevated Spanish tapas experience. Pan de tomate, pulpo, jamon iberico, all well executed. Great wine list.

NAME: Andrew
REVIEW: What an incredibly special meal! We ordered heavy and every bite was delicious, nothing disappointed. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a fun and truly delectable meal.

NAME: Morg
REVIEW: Lovely dining experience. Food and ambience was amazing!

NAME: Rafa
REVIEW: Great Spanish tapas with a modern twist. Order the fluke crudo and definitely the scallops!

NAME: Kevin
REVIEW: Overall, great food and great value. A bit crowded, but not to the point it was not comfortable. My girlfriend and I celebrated her bday there, and all in all it was a positive experience. Service at times seemed rush with how they try to clear plates that you might want to hold on to for dipping bread into sauces, and would be nice if bottled cokes were chilled and not room temp (I do not appreciate a diluted coke over ice especially over a ‘heavy entree’), but all minor. Where we sat had a few flies or gnats that would linger around table. One managed to land in my drink and drown, but if you overlook that experience pretty good. Would recommend and would go back!

NAME: Scott
REVIEW: I love this place - it’s an oldie but a goldie. Went there to celebrate my friend’s birthday - amazing food. Really friendly and professional staff - if I could afford it, I would go here much more often. Highly recommended:)

NAME: lucia
REVIEW: As always, Casa Mono doesn't manage the tables correctly. Tables are always small and cramped.  I received a text message that my table was ready 15 minutes prior to my reservation and then when we were finishing our wine, the manager came over and said they needed the table.  You always feel rushed.  Years ago, if the table was needed, management would welcome people to the bar to buy guests a drink or allow to finish your bottle at the bar.  It's never a pleasant setting.  The food is always amazing and consistent for the past 20 years.  I also found it disappointing that the Sommelier didn't even know Italian Wine Merchants, which I believe the original investors (including Joe Biastanich) in Casa Mono and Babbo invested in.  The waiter, Darwin, was personable and great. The razor clams which weren't available my last visit, were as delicious and unique as always.  Too bad the seppie are no longer offered on the menu.  The skirt steak, excellent as always.  Duck breast was cooked to perfection and very tender.

NAME: Ben
REVIEW: Food is terrific. An incredible experience. Can’t speak highly enough. Servers rushed us which was a surprise

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Couldn’t have asked for a memorable dining experience. Everyone from front to the back of house made it a day we will never forget. Compliments to the chefs and to all of casa mono!! Counting down the days to our next visit!!

NAME: David
REVIEW: Phenomenal meal. Our waiter was very helpful answering questions we had about the menu. We had 5 dishes and each was amazing. The highlights for us were the skirt steak, duck egg, crispy pig ears, and burrata. So pretty much everything we ate. Great atmosphere and service, and reasonably priced, you can spend a lot or a little depending on what you're looking for. Highly recommend.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Truly loved this restaurant!! Counter seating was the best and the food was unreal. Absolutely adored this spot

NAME: LuisG
REVIEW: What an outstanding experience! Food, environment and service were taking to another level! Amazing job Benoit! You deserve a 🌟

NAME: Sebastian
REVIEW: Great food and a generous helping of wine per glass!

NAME: Selina
REVIEW: Second time here and more familiar with the menu so we’re happier with our choices.  Restaurant is extremely pestering with being on time with email reminders and text msgs.  Description of menu items needs to be better explained for those who are not familiar with Spanish food terms, ingredients and spices.  Staff likes to get order all at once so not easy for first timer and only a little better for second timer.  Difficult to gauge what order the food will be served.  Service is adequate and only had to ask for more bread once.  Once food is all on the table, staff is constantly coming around to pour wine and to check if dishes can be taken away, definitely feel like being rushed.  Since this is our second time, we are not shy at telling the staff NO.  The restaurant was quite full so the noise level was not good.  We skipped dessert because we felt being rushed and gave back the table within an hour of the reservation.

NAME: Conrad
REVIEW: Table location problem was immediately resolved.  Manager Danielle Pappas made absolutely certain that we were well served, and that our food orders were promptly cooked and served.  Danielle patiently explained the nuances in the dishes on the menu.  We will return!

NAME: Onute
REVIEW: *Sensational blend of unexpected, but stellar flavors in every dish. Each one was a marvel: a virtual taste explosion of pure delight! We were 2 diners: ordered 5 dishes. The only negative was wanting to try more menu items despite being fully satiated. *Service was ideal: truly attentive (not intrusive), friendly, meticulous. *Sommelier: made an ideal wine suggestion (after several clear questions to make his recommendation). *Noise level was high, but (to us) indicated everyone’s revelry @ enjoying such unusual excellence in every combination. Fun vibe.  Perfect: We’ll return frequently & very often!

NAME: PaulS
REVIEW: Smart, tasty and quite innovative food in a Spanish brasserie style setting. Fun watching the open kitchen from bar seats, but overall can get noisy. The originality and quality of the food make it well worth a repeat visit

NAME: Michele
REVIEW: Enjoyed a lovely lunch outdoors. As always!!! Started with the Casa Mono salad. So refreshing!!! Then had a small filet of fluke atop abed of black rice and a lovely green and creamy sauce. Finally a delicious pork belly and some delicious bone marrow… Yumm! Good thing we planned a LONG WALK along the Rast River after that beautiful and very TASTY lunch!!!

NAME: Jacob
REVIEW: Terrible experience here. Had to leave the restaurant because server would not even attempt to accommodate a gluten allergy. Basically said you can eat the salads. I have never heard of not being able to eat the meat/seafood at a restaurant due to a gluten allergy.

NAME: Daniel
REVIEW: An awesome experience from start to finish.  Over the past twenty years, everything has remained delightful and delicious.  Thank you.

NAME: Ian
REVIEW: Host sat us at a two-top next the only other parties in the place, also two-tops, when the rest of the small restaurant, consisting of three 4-tops, was empty on a slow weekday afternoon at 2pm.  When asked if we could be seated at one of the more comfortable tables, host said she wasn’t allowed.  After the meal, I suggested to the floor manager that she should give away the 4s when the place was empty, it’s just unfriendly not to. She agreed, expressing surprise that we were denied after asking.  Also the waiter upsold us on the wine, but the bottle (a red) was quite chilled when he brought it over so I declined, in favor a a more modest wine that he had a room temperature.  Not a fan of chilled red wine. He seemed a bit annoyed.  Food and food service were lovely.

NAME: Lynn
REVIEW: We went on a whim because we live nearby. We were so pleasantly surprised by the extraordinary food and dining experience. The dishes were all gorgeous and the staff was very competent and pleasant. I can’t recommend Casa Mono enough, and I can’t wait to go back.

NAME: IntolerantDiner
REVIEW: Absolutely delicious! Excellent service for both food and great advice from the sommelier. We had black rice with fluke and an amazing green sauce; then we had sautéed mushrooms and garlic which we always have and it was fabulous. Then we had foi gras with à honey sauce from Jerez and we had the lamb belly; also yummy. We finished with creamy pineapple sorbet. We love Casa Mono and will return next time we are in the big Apple.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Phenomenal food and excellent service. Recommend going with a large group to try most dishes on the menu - all are incredible. While not cheap, this is great value for money and worth every penny.

NAME: Thomas
REVIEW: Casa Mono never fails to impress on every level; friendly, knowledgeable service, charming ambiance, and truly brilliant food and wine.

NAME: Jessica
REVIEW: Absolutely amazing food and fantastic service!!!! Our reservation was running behind due to a rain storm but we were sat at the sister wine bar and given great care & a free appetizer until our table was ready

NAME: HKDiner
REVIEW: Pan con tomate, burrata, crudo, duck, sausage w honey, creme Catalan, and chocolate were amazing. Wine, sherry fantastic.  Staff are great.  Was the  pulpo supposed  to be crispy and flat?  Only miss of the night.  Would return in a second!!

NAME: natalie
REVIEW: Warm reception, always. Fantastic as always!! Service great, food great! We love everything about this restaurant.

NAME: Daisy
REVIEW: Really fancy and nice tapas, had a chef's experience seating and watching them cooking is very enjoyable

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I have never had an unpleasant experience here, and every dish I have eaten is extraordinary. The food is exceptional, the service is exceptional, the ambience is exceptional.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Very good restaurant with exciting food small cosy place

NAME: ArielD
REVIEW: Service was fantastic, waitstaff were friendly and always check on us if we need anything.  Our favorite was foie gras, duck breast and bread pudding with ice cream !

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food wasn’t great and it was very upsetting. Additionally, the wine that was recommended was not at all what we had described we wanted

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The decor at Casa Mono exuded a cozy ambiance, a pleasant environment for diners. The service was good with attentive and patient waitstaff. Our orders included pork belly, razor clams, Jamón Ibérico and others. The pork belly, while deep-fried, had a gamey aftertaste, necessitating the use of additional sauce to mask the flavor. The razor clams still contained residual grains of sand, which compromised their springy texture.The standout dish was the pig ear. The fried pork ear was immersed in a slightly sour sauce, and the addition of yellow peaches enriched overall sweetness of the dish.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Service and ambiance are great. Skirt steak was overcooked, no flavor. Duck breast and sobreasada are the best.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Good food, good service but the price was extremely expensive.

NAME: LillianA
REVIEW: Favorite restaurant in NYC! Never dissapoints, highly recommend it.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food is ok, but not worth it. Service is fair. Place is super loud and vibe is ok

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent food. Tapas were very inventive. I will definitely return

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Average and overpriced food. Took over an hour to get our order and that was at 2pm when it wasn't that busy.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food and service are always exceptional. Key items to not miss: - razor clams - eggs and uni - oxtails and peppers

NAME: Megablito
REVIEW: Food was average or just above average when compared to a good tapas place in Spain (Madrid, Salamanca or Barcelona). Had a total of 12 orders, so we tried almost all popular tapas. Razor clams, jamon iberico de bellota, fluke ceviche. The bread was not freshly baked (chewy). Will not go back unfortunately. Michelin star wrongly granted.

NAME: Anthony
REVIEW: Elegant restaurant- great food, very good service. Wonderful experience.

NAME: Kinka
REVIEW: A great service great ambience in the obviously great food you’re going to see on your table the orders you placed will not look like anything you really eaten before and that you were super super food. He really enjoyed tasting all the different dishes.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Amazing food. Came with 4 guests had about 8 plates, plenty of food. My favorite restaurant in the city hands down.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Every bite is memorable. You can’t go wrong at casa mono!

NAME: ali39
REVIEW: Everything we had was delicious, and the service was excellent. Highly recommend

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The pulpo was not a pulpo but squids also unsalted and flavorless, the black rice was extremely oily and the only flavor that you could taste was cilantro; the skirt steak was cold and rubbery the only I think we liked was the trio of sorbets. Definitely not a michelin star restaurant, disappointed our expectations.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Darwin is the best server we have ever had in NY. Please give him a raise and promotion ASAP!!!!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Outstanding food quality and originality. Great service and friendly staff.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Everything, Incredible! The food, omg!, the ambient, the service.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great food and service! Can’t wait to come back! Ps: loved the pouring amount of a glass of wine

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was good, unfortunately they were sold out of the main dish we came for which was the razor clam. As well, it was very warm inside, only slightly better than what it was outside and it was very humid outside. Being that the restaurant is very small, they need better cooling.

NAME: dlover
REVIEW: If you like to enjoy several plates with small group of people it is perfect place. Food is amazing and wine options are good too

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The restaurant was loud. Other than that, the service was intimate and very attentive. The food was fresh and the flavors exploded in your mouth. All in all, a great spot. I will return the next time I’m in New York.

NAME: MisterStars
REVIEW: Casa Mono is a very special place with amazing people, great food, and an amazing wine list.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Overrated and very poor services, waiter isn’t nice very impatient the table was dripping with AC water.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We have high expectations upon doing there for dinner, but we're pretty disappointed with the food. Overall, the food was very salty and definitely nothing to write home about. We ordered 11 items off the menu and I would say only three of them were reasonably good.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Wonderful sommelier! Tapas were very good, especially razor clams.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: pig ears, membrillo, sweet tomatoes & cheese, sidra. what a place.... you will fall in love with

NAME: RodneyH
REVIEW: Loved the overall dining experience. Food flavors were outstanding

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I'm SHOCKED that they have a Michelin star! The fluke crudo was marvelous, but every other dish disappointed. Burrata and octopus with no flavor (pea pesto bland, fennel and grapefruit bland). Lamb was soft and well-cooked but lacked any flavor. Skirt steak was fine but unremarkable. Razor clams were tasty but that's because butter and garlic are tasty. Not worth it. The bone marrow, however, was shockingly bad. Bone marrow is inherently unctuous rich and flavorful, but this was lumpy, oily, and tasteless except for the crema and fish roe which masked the flavorlessness but added an unpleasantly dissonant taste. Even the toast triangles were over-buttered, as if that would salvage them.  WORSE, service was bad. They didn't come enough to even get us to order more beer/wine! Their wine recommendation felt random and tasted Meh. There were large gaps with no food. No refilling of water or bread offered. Finally, the bathroom was just terrible. Tiny, with no room for the inevitable line of people, but inside it was repulsive. Wet paper towels piled on the garbage can and wet on the floor. Toilet that was likely clean but not sparkling enough to inspire confidence. We sat outside and had a lovely street view experience (despite the visiting rat!), but inside it was tight, hot, and loud. Some might have liked the inside, actually, but probably no one would give the bathroom a pass. The menu, be forewarned, is only in Spanish. Fair enough (though imagine that at a Chinese or Indian restaurant), but the table next to us had several foreign visitors and it caused confusion and embarrassment. The server answered questions but not with enough energy or clarity to help--it was minimal. I'm really just amazed that this place has been open so long, let alone that it has a Michelin star.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Sat on the sidewalk. Great experience. Food was excellent and the Fois Gras may be the best dish we have ever had.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Phenomenal time. Bit pricey tho. Pay to play is worth it here

NAME: Port
REVIEW: Greeters were unwelcoming.  Not going back.  Food was ok. Server was decent.

NAME: SeaCruz
REVIEW: Thank you all for our first time at Casa Mono, but not our last time. See you soon.

NAME: downtowner
REVIEW: We have been diners at Casa Mono since the night it opened.  We were very disappointed  with our recent lunch.  The sweetbreads were soaking in oil.  The duck breast was 2 mini slices.  The pork belly was so tough as to be inedible.  The 2 other courses  were, at best, fair. We would no longer recommend this restaurant.

NAME: DJMF
REVIEW: Food and service was excellent. Bone Marrow, Confit Goat, and Paella Croqueta were the stand out dishes and the sommelier suggested an excellent Catalan Rosado. Tables are very tightly squeezed together and it is quite loud but the vibe is lively without being pretentious. We will definitely come back.

NAME: AndrewD
REVIEW: Casa Mono was incredible. Great service, food was fantastic with unique and incredibly balanced dishes. Would absolutely come back.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Rich choice, excellent meals, very helpful service. Great value for money. The street seating area is a bit noisy, but we booked late and there were no tables inside.

NAME: OCYelper
REVIEW: Had been wanting to come here again for a long time. Not as good and charming as I remembered. Service was lackluster. Our server was pretty disengaged and did not come for quite awhile and did not check on us during the meal. The tapas was good but the prices are ridiculous for tapas. Having just come from St. Sebastian, Spain where they have a lot Michelin star rated restaurants for such a small city, Casa Mono is good but not worthy of the price. I got the nostalgia out of my system. No need to come back.

NAME: CarlosM
REVIEW: An excellent experience, food, wine selection and staff!

NAME: Louise
REVIEW: We ate outside. Food was delicious. Very inventive.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Recommended by a former nyc chef and acquaintance as his favorite place to “send people .” It was perfect in every way. Coming from Portland Oregon, it’s tough to impress with food. This was a wonderful experience altogether. Highly recommend

NAME: michelllew
REVIEW: Great food and service/ slightly disappointed there were no cocktails but excellent wines

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We had a good time with good food and drink, and services.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Not your typical Michelin star restaurant. To start with, the price point is lower, and the decor won't be confused with Le Bernadin, but the staff is friendly and attentive. Most importantly, the food is to die for. My best meal in months. Had a nice Albarino , although the prices on the wines are not the best, though it is more than a glass worth.  I think i ate here years ago when it was under Mario Batali. The entire experience is greatly improved since those days. . Highly recommended.

NAME: rebekahG
REVIEW: It’s manhattan, so it’s pricey, but so worth it! Highly recommended.

NAME: HuyT
REVIEW: Food was good but not insanely good!  Service was great.  Some dishes were misses. Came for the razor but no razor…

NAME: anita
REVIEW: Always fabulous.  the food is first-rate and presented beautifully.  The wine recommendation was perfect.  Staff attentive and not intrusive.  One of my all-time favorite NYC restaurants.  A gem.

NAME: DavidD
REVIEW: Specatcular food. The lamb was the best I ever had.

NAME: Joni
REVIEW: We were warmly welcomed by the hostess and sent to the bar to wait for our table where we were served by a nice young man. The food was spectacular, the ambiance a bit rowdy but entertaining. Our server, Lyla could not have been more accommodating had we been dining in her own home. She’s wonderful! Great place!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food here is so great with some classic items, but mostly inventive twists on tapas. The food presentation was sooo beautiful! The only thing was it is pretty loud and the tables are super close together, but that's nyc I suppose. The only thing that really was odd was we were perfectly on time for the reservation, but didn't even get water or service for maybe 10-15 mins? Would love to come back on a calmer night, and this place is on the perfect street in nyc, that is sometimes tranquil. Will be back and hoping the service is a little better next time.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Lovely complexity to the flavors. Unusual items on small plates. Excellent service and moderately priced. I'll be back and will recommend Casa Mono to friends.

NAME: Kramer
REVIEW: Probably was just bad night in a Michelin Star restaurant and I had the bad luck to be there that day, but I’ve never seen croquetas with the appearance that one of the 4 was burned out in rancid oil and I ask myself how can any restaurant allowed that to get to the table. The truth is that none of the plates from the left page of the menu were impressive and I could say subpar ( octopus, Pan con Tomate and of course the Croquetas) the plates on the Right Page of the Menu were pretty good and if you happen to go there just stick to it (the right side of the menu), the Oxtail plate and the Pork Sobrasada are outstanding. The Wine list is Very Complete with a ton of options from different Spanish’s regions wich i loved. Plus the sommelier is really helpful. No complains with the deserts and sweet Wine list even though the waitress kept pointing to the most expensive ones when ask for a recommendation  at least that was the impression  of the ppl in my table. Lastly when the check came we observe they charged us for the Bread that we never ask for and thought it was house courtesy as many restaurant does if you don’t ask for it. I don’t use to do reviews like many regular ppl don’t. But like me many regular folks read what other ppl experienced before taking a decision and that’s why I think it was important to write this one.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Wonderful experience!  Food, service, wine was all wonderful!

NAME: lamedoc
REVIEW: So loud. As in, 85 dB on my meter. Food was phenomenal; service was excellent. But my ears were still ringing 10 minutes after leaving the restaurant.

NAME: R0d1905
REVIEW: Michelin Star Restaurant exceeding expectations! Cozy atmosphere highlighting amazing tapas Can’t go wrong for a special occasion or a business meal bringing the best authentic Spanish cuisine

NAME: Katie
REVIEW: One of the best dinners we’ve had in the city.  The scallops with serrano curry were the absolute highlight of the meal. Truly the best scallop dish I’ve ever had. The duck was a close second. Razor clams were also great but in a basic butter/garlic/herb sauce - which was great but flavors that I have tasted at many other places. So get them, but don’t skip the other stuff!  We had our server pick our food and wine pairings and she did a great job.

NAME: Kevala
REVIEW: Great food and service.  The scallops are fantastic!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: My husband and I enjoyed very much our lunch at Casa Mono.   The Jamón Pata Negra was outstanding.  Our table was outdoors in the shade, so no problem with extreme heat or sunshine.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Absolutely loved every dish we got. The Fluke Crudo is a must, I could drink the sauce. Same with the Pan con Tomate and Skirt Steak. Get the Pazo Señorans Alberiño if you want a light white wine

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This was our third time at Casa Mono. We love this restaurant. The food is always amazing and our server was helpful and friendly. We hope to keep returning.  With this in mind, we do have some criticism. Firstly, I tried to cancel on open table more than 24 hours prior to the reservation. Open table would not allow me. I was at work and unable to call to cancel until the evening prior. I explained this to them and they said they would charge me $50 a person to cancel. I understand why they have this rule in place but they would not budge, even when I explained. We weren't a no show. We are repeat customers. I feel like they should have been more flexible. So we made it work. We showed up. We booked outside but the weather was uncomfortable. They were booked inside, which I understood so we opted for the bar. Except the air conditioning wasn't on and it was very hot by the stoves. So we asked to move outside. There was no one sitting outside at all but instead of the host offering to seat us under an awning, she offered us a table on the corner by the crosswalk and near a puddle. I had to ask to sit under an awning.  This restaurant is great but there is an attitude they have that WE should be grateful to be there instead of the other way around.

NAME: Gene
REVIEW: Great and interesting menu. Excellent preparation and presentation. Inventive. Fine wine list.Excellent service. Depending on weather, seating may be air-conditioned or open air whether inside or out.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent! Both the food and the service is excellent!!! 😊

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was excellent, looking forward to getting a table indoors next time!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food is excellent, we like every dish we ordered, especially the iberian ham

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Having been to Casa Mono on more than a few occasions, I am happy to report that the quality of its appetizers and entrees remains high.  We had savory pulpo a la plancha, mussels with chorizo, and sardines as appetizers before enjoying duck breast, grilled skirt steak, and pork meatballs, all of which were served in a timely manner by an attentive wait staff.  We completed these dishes with a 2012 Lopez and Heredia Rioja.  I recommend Casa Mono with enthusiasm!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Best experience ever! Wine was beautiful and tapas were out of this world!

NAME: TimothyB
REVIEW: they do not allow corkage for wine from the outside. most of their bottles were priced way high. this restaurant had wines $1000 to $5000 per bottle. totally ridiculous. I would not return.

NAME: JChilton
REVIEW: This lively restaurant pulses with energy, making it perfect for a fun night out. The exceptional food includes standout tapas dishes like the succulent goat confit and crispy croquettes. They have an excellent, inexpensive wine list with spot-on recommendations from the staff. With its energetic atmosphere, delicious tapas, and great wines, this is a must-visit.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Favorite restaurant in the world. Not sure why this app has a minimum # of characters.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa mono was very accommodating on reservation change request & food was presented well & yummy however,  low score given due to service. Staff was impeccably rude regarding requests & constantly seemed annoyed that we were requesting basic things like small plates , napkins , salt & pepper , a second coke & water with ice. We were given 1 receipt as final bill  & then charged something different on the machine which if we had not asked about price variance we would not have been advised reason for being charged more than the bill.   Staff needs some retraining on hospitality & small bathroom needs to be maintained cleaner & stocked with toilet paper.

NAME: MMMM
REVIEW: Amazing food! No one should miss the 5 onions seared foie grass! We have been coming to Casa Mono at least once a year and always want to return! Congratulations!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Fantastic experience! Good was amazing, service was excellent.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great wine. Great food. Server was knowledgeable and friendly.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Service was really slow, after being directed by the hostess to our table we sat without, menus, water or anyone greeting us for over 20 min.  It wasn’t until we walked over to the hostess and asked to speak to someone we were served.

NAME: StefS
REVIEW: Our server was absolutely incredible. Every dish was delicious and perfectly cooked. An overall wonderful experience!

NAME: MimiNYC
REVIEW: Although my friend arrived almost 15 minutes late, we were able to keep our reservation — that was the start of a genuinely near perfect meal. The Fidelos (angela hair with shockles and garlic sauce) were “life changing” as my friend said after having them for the first. The skirt steak (the one blip of the night) came under cooked just shy of medium rare in spots. We asked for it to be cooked just a little bit more to true medium rare but got nearly well done. Okay for my friend, lost its flavor for me. Our meal was rounded out by Pulpo and Barrata - both delicious! Overall an amazing meal.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great food!  Brought back memories of our trip to Barcelona and all the great food!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Incredible food, exceeded our high expectations. Andrew’s recommendations were spot on and made this dinner a special experience. We’ll be back

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Giving it overall only one star as I made the reservation a month previously for a birthday dinner at 6 pm and the first thing the hostess said to us as we entered was they needed the table by 8 pm for another reservation!!!! Excuse me.. how insulting. I said of course but it ruined the experience for us all. Won’t be back

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: perfect restaurant, exceeded my expectations in every way

NAME: Chuck70
REVIEW: Food was wonderful.  Very good service.  I'll be back!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Amazing experience and delicious food. See why the restaurant has 1 Michelin star.  Will definitely be back

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Got a reservation at 6:15 and ended up waiting out there till 6:45 in the damn cold with my family and friends. Total embarrassment.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Razor clams were amazing. The scallops could have been bigger but they tasted great.

NAME: Lotte
REVIEW: The delicious food always brings me back to Casa Mono, but time and time again, it never fails to surprise me how unpleasant the hosts seem to be. While the wait staff is always hospitable and delightful, the hosts seem to enjoy being inhospitable to guests with and without reservations. It was disappointing to see that the host during my most recent experience, sat Asian guests in a tucked away corner. It’s tiring to see this form of racial discrimination in 2024.

NAME: bpsf
REVIEW: Always a treat.  Great food, cordial staff offering great service.

NAME: bayareares
REVIEW: Excellent tapas. Very busy place. We definitely felt like we were rushed out of there, despite buying lots of food and 2 bottles of wine for just 4 people. Also, had to wave at servers before getting attention. For over $500 for 4, for tapas, maybe service can be enhanced.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent service , delicious tapas, the octopus and the bone marrow are amazing !

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Delicious food, great service & atmosphere. Outdoor tables great in warmer weather.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Wonderful meal!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Amazing and delicious - can’t wait to go back. Helpful sommelier!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Absolutely wonderful experience from beginning to end. The staff were amazing: friendly and incredibly knowledgeable. They really went the extra mile to ensure that we had a fantastic evening. The food was simply delicious . Every dish had incredible depth and a veritable explosion of flavor with every bite. I can’t recommend Casa Mono highly enough.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We had an amazing meal at Casa Mono for our son’s 11th birthday. Bond marrow, fluke crudo, confit of goat, Burratta with pea pesto were all delicious!!!

NAME: NathalieM
REVIEW: Food is really creative and tasty. Portions are small but deserve very much the discovery.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent sommelier, Christian.  Very enjoyable and interesting small plates.  None were disappointing

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Very good restaurant although not a one Michelin star. The service was good

NAME: happytochow
REVIEW: The food was amazing! The sommelier was wonderful. The waiter seemed a bit busy. But overall great night!

NAME: Madz
REVIEW: service was amazing and so was the food! we sat outside and it was so nice.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Ate in the outdoor seating! Food and drinks were good and service was quick, if not a bit rushed at the end as they needed to accommodate another reservation. Inside, it is a bit noisier and more compact.

NAME: SeanB
REVIEW: I wished I loved it - but the food just wasn’t as stellar as expected. Service was excellent, however.  Fairly pricey for some pretty standard tapas. $20 for pan con tomate? Pork belly was incredible.  Just not enough to bring us back unfortunately.

NAME: AmyD
REVIEW: We really love the food and wine and ambience at Casa Mono and we keep coming back!  Really delicious, fresh and interesting flavors.  Only downsides:  dishes are very meat-heavy (awesome dishes but a little too much meat), and the prices are definitely quite high for dishes that are basically "appetizer-size" or a little bigger---for almost entree prices.

NAME: Ilona23
REVIEW: Casa Mono continues to deliver on every level- food, service, hospitality and ambiance.

NAME: MichelleE
REVIEW: We had an exceptional time at Casa Mono. The food was great; service and assistance in wine pairing was warm and spot on. Even more importantly, for us, it was a really laid back and fun experience. We hope to return next time in NYC.

NAME: neontapir
REVIEW: The server and sommalier guided us through the menu and made it an unforgettable experience!

NAME: frequentdiner
REVIEW: Very creative tapas, but it is difficult to enjoy a meal in such tight quarters when a waiter or busboy is coming by every few seconds to try to clear the table while you eat.  We had an early reservation (5:15 PM) so it is not as if they had to turn the table around quickly. The check arrived, without our asking for it, while I was finishing my wine.

NAME: AndrewM
REVIEW: Really great restaurant. The interior is very cute and almost cozy/rustic. Food was excellent. Only complaint is that the food came way too fast. We ordered like 9 things and it was a group of 4 people and we were in and out in a little over an hour. They would bring 4-5 dishes at once which was a bit overwhelming. I’d come back for sure and just ask them to slow it down a bit

NAME: AriS
REVIEW: Highly recommend, one of the better restaurants in nyc.

NAME: humtai
REVIEW: I’ve been coming for years to Casa Mono. While the food he maintained consistency, the price-to-value equation has materially deteriorated in two ways. First, there are fantastic tapas options available and post-Covid, the Spanish restaurant segment has new alternatives. Second, the dishes are very good but not great. I think folks are the Michelin star and feel the dishes are elevated—but to me, they are very good but not great.

NAME: QueenCuisine
REVIEW: The food was delicious as usual. We love sitting at the bar. The young woman cooking was so much fun to watch! The service was okay.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great wine, desserts, and 5/10 of the tapas we ordered were great. Service was a bit slow.

NAME: AnaliC1
REVIEW: Amazing food and wines!!

NAME: Luis
REVIEW: Our server was great and the energy/vibe of the very small space is great. Appreciate the good selection of wines - but quite pricey. Not too many options for a group that may have more than one bottle. The food was alright - our highlight was the delicious bone marrow and the foie gras. Really great! Our bacalao croquettes were not as great as could be, nor was the octopus. The squid in ink was very good. So, in general - mixed feelings on the food, especially for some staples that one would expect would be perfect in a Spanish venue.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Everything was amazing! (we had 2 apps, 6 shareable entrees, 2 desserts) - highly recommended!

NAME: DJMXX
REVIEW: We absolutely loved every dish (too numerous to list so I assume everything is at the same high level).  The service was friendly and was at the perfect level of attentiveness. The ambiance is casual and relaxed. We ate outside on a cool night and were quite comfortable. The wines were well served by the very knowledgeable sommelier.  I can’t recommend Casa Mono enough and look forward to returning in the nearest future.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Dining at Casa Mono is always a great pleasure. The food was excellent and the sommelier did a great job helping us select the wine.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Thoroughly enjoyed the dishes. They were well constructed with enticing flavors.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food is top notch, but the service is definitely not Michelin standard

NAME: JamesM
REVIEW: This remains one of the best restaurants in NYC. Next level, modern Spanish cuisine with a superb wine list.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The staff didn’t let us get seated without our full party even though it was pouring rain and had us wait outside. They also denied giving my friend wifi when he asked.

NAME: SeksomS
REVIEW: Excellent tapas and drinks selection.   Charming space in a delightful neighborhood.   It felt a little rushed and overly structured at times.   But I think the intention to deliver a food experience was there

NAME: JordynnM
REVIEW: Wonderful experience! Our sever recommended a handful of dishes and wine to accompany and it was all fantastic!

NAME: Tubbs
REVIEW: Absolutely phenomenal! Every single dish was so delicious, excellently cooked and presented beautifully. The wine chosen for us was perfect. We loved this place!

NAME: TinaG
REVIEW: Delicious food! Didn’t have a bad bite the whole meal. We had the burrata, black rice, skirt steak, duck breast, croqueta with prawns, shishito peppers and finished off with crema catalana. Each dish was balanced beautifully. There were 3 of us and the waiter recommended 6 to 9 dishes. We went with 6 and it was plenty for us although if some of us had been hungrier we probably would’ve needed 7 or 8. The wait staff was friendly, attentive, and helpful. Lovely evening!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Best hidden gem in nyc.  Rare yet approachable food with casual / upscale vibe

NAME: Pontxo
REVIEW: The food is excellent. The service is lacking—definitely below average, but not horrible. The place is small and too tight. Not very comfortable.

NAME: GraceS
REVIEW: Food was not good at all. Best item was bread………..

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Fantastic. Great service. Great food. Altogether perfect.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was really good and cute environment! The squid ink dish and the pork were amazing.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We had the black rice and it was very good. The sweetbreads were different and also good. We’ll be back next tome in NY.

NAME: Lily
REVIEW: Excellent food, ambiance reminding me of local spots in Barcelona. Our server recommended 6 courses to share amongst my husband and I. We ordered 5 and dessert. My husband isn't as adventurous when it comes to seafood or fish. So we ordered the burrata, patatas bravas, skirt steak, razor clams, prawns and risotto croquette.  Highly recommend the skirt steak, so tender and atop an excellent romesco. I savored the razor clams, light buttery garlicky lemon. If we were to do again I'd skip the patatas and burrata and focus more on the other savories. We finished with a chocolate ganache was so rich creamy, cold and light. Perfect ending. Adding to our must visit stops in NYC in the future!

NAME: Banfi
REVIEW: Food was ok won’t go back - everything had an abnormal amount of mayo.

NAME: Rini
REVIEW: The food was exceptional, the wine list extensive! looking forward to returning!

NAME: smithmuniz
REVIEW: My fav restaurant in New York City, intimate and innovative interpretations of Spanish food, multi-layered with exquisite flavors that linger like fine wine. Not an everyday treat but each visit is bound to be memorable and worth the expense. Go with a date, go with best friends, go by yourself and sit at the counter and banter with the cooks. Enjoy the crowd. Enjoy the moment. And enjoy the wine.

NAME: GeorgeH
REVIEW: The food is fantastic. It was all excellently executed. The staff were friendly and helpful. It is a small space, so it is not quiet dining, so keep that in mind.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food and ambience were great! However, the host was not friendly and the waiting staff was not as attentive - we had to ask for menus twice.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We had nice dining experience but service was quite disappointed compared to previous visit. Food was a little bit cold.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We did not order, but simply asked the chef to through on the table what they believe are the best, and they are amazing! We walked in very hungry and 3.5 hours later, walked out very full and super satisfied. What an experience, highly recommend.

NAME: chait
REVIEW: Excellent dinner and service, every dish was a hit and I look forward to come again

NAME: Neel
REVIEW: Layla (spelling?) was amazing. Food was outstanding as well. Highly recommend.

NAME: Allie
REVIEW: Good food. Been year once before during Covid. The policies and host are ridiculous. Host didn’t seat us when 2 out of 3 of the party arrived. Kept reminding us what time we had to leave. Then sat us in the worst table that was in front of the waiters station. I asked to switch and they said “ another party of 4 would needed that table” even though we were already at a table of 4! The wait staff was nice. I just think that whole experience ruined it. Will never go back.

NAME: Kris
REVIEW: There is no better place for Spanish food in NYC.

NAME: David
REVIEW: Amazing flavours, great service, solid wine list, excellent location, this restaurant is superb. All that and it's still casual, which we love.

NAME: Sara
REVIEW: I went there for a business lunch, and the setting by the window in the winter is nice & warm in the winter. Food is fantastic! Only minor improvement I'd suggest would be to tone down the complexity of the bone marrow dish; it was hard to take the favor of the marrow with the yogurt (looking) sauce, spiciness of the onion and pungent flavor of the (salmon?) roes on top. All 7 dishes we tried were delicious! Waiter suggestion on the goat confit was so worth it! I wish we had a bigger table for all the dishes we ordered, but the service was mostly prompt to refresh the table. Will be back again with hubby next time.

NAME: ChrisD
REVIEW: Great place, one of our favorites. The lamb belly is 11/10.

NAME: Chanukha
REVIEW: Mark of a good restaurant in my opinion is how consistent is.  Some high flying names after catching the popular wave inevitably decline but Casa Mono is consistently good through the years. Really enjoyed all the dishes. Small cosy ambiance was perfect for niece’s birthday who’s graduating from college this year.  Great treat.

NAME: DanaP
REVIEW: Everything was outstanding - loved the help from the Sommelier. Thank you!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was amazing. We did have to wait an additional 30 minutes from our reservation and got seated at nearly 9:30/10 pm which is much later than we intended.

NAME: AROV
REVIEW: We sat outside and there were delays in service. Several waiters came to attend us for the duration of the meal. We found the food too garlicky in comparison to previous visits. This was not our best visit.

NAME: MelG
REVIEW: Amazing original delicious tapas!!! Felt like we were in Spain

NAME: ArthurB
REVIEW: This is a quality restaurant. The food is excellent! Small plates are not my favorite way of dining, but, our dinner worked out very well. Service, is professional, and friendly and welcoming. Ambiance is casual and a bit rustic. We liked it a lot!

NAME: Angie
REVIEW: Not the service you would expect at a Michelin star restaurant. They forgot one of the items we ordered. Had to move tables because servers kept bumping into husband. Definitely expected a different experience but the food was ok. The only dish that really stuck out to us was the foie gras dish.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This is the best tapas style restaurant we’ve ever eaten at. Excellent food, flavors, combinations!

NAME: Tonypdb
REVIEW: Not 1 Michelin star for quality and service , not worth the reservation wait…

NAME: jorgeolazagasti
REVIEW: Great place. The food was excellent, and the service was perfect.

NAME: KristinaK
REVIEW: What a wonderful birthday dinner!  Everyone in our family loved it.  The food and wine were outstanding.  Mussels were the best I've ever had!

NAME: mussi9
REVIEW: Always amazing. Our favorite restaurant in NY. See you soon.

NAME: PaulS
REVIEW: Different food: very good fish in incredible sauces and combinations combine together for an excellent place.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: La comida es exquisita. Las entradas, los principales, todo muy sabroso y excelente presentación. Muy buena carta de vinos

NAME: JohnE
REVIEW: We left a package, but the host called to make sure I knew!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food tastes great! The decoration of the store is also very good! This is my first dinner in New York! I think it is a good start!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Sinceramente non so se New York regali le stelle Michelin. Ma questo non se la merita. Il menu è davvero molto interessante ma purtroppo la riuscita non è altrettanto. Piatti pieni di aglio tagliato grossolano, non da stella Michelin. Poca tecnica. Uova di salmone finte molecolari, durissime con un sapore di salmone affumicato. Davvero, per quanto ho speso mi sono sentito preso in giro. Sono uno Chef europeo che gira il mondo e i ristoranti stellati da 16 anni. Servizio buono però devo troppo stretto, nemmeno 10cm di distanza l’uno con l’altro, sentivo cosa dicevano i miei vicini. Tavoli piccolissimi, non riuscivo a mangiare, dovevo stare attento a non far cadere il calice.  Voglio premettere che vogliono essere le critiche mie, costruttive. Perché il locale ha tutte le capacità e lo posso consigliare assolutamente in quanto l’intenzione di fare un buon lavoro c’è, però non ancora all’altezza di esporre le stelle Michelin.  Buona trattoria, consigliata

NAME: TedA
REVIEW: The food was simple.  Not super-Spanish, but well made and tasty.  Service was friendly and efficient.  The music is much too loud, especially for such a small place and how loudly people tend to speak.  It makes conversation difficult and it’s somewhat annoying.  Our table was ready 15 minutes past the time of the reservation, and they made us wait outside in the cold.  Not very elegant or welcoming.

NAME: RamonD
REVIEW: This is an amazing restaurant with delicious food,  great ambiance and polite staff.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We ate outside in their cabana on a cold February evening, and it was cozy. Food is so special, and the service is lovely.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We had an incredible time at the Tempernillo wine class hosted at Bar Jamon. Great value for the quality and also very educational. I hope Casa Mono continues these wine classes as I would definitely recommend and go again!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great food and large wine selection. Great service. Tiny space.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Fantastic food and service! Sommelier helped us choose delicious wine that paired with our meal

NAME: BrooklynMom
REVIEW: Love, love, love the razor clams! Great wine selection, too.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I have followed Casa Mono since it got its first Michelin star in 2009 - and finally got the opportunity to see if 14 consecutive one star awards is the real deal. As Michelin stars go, service is what seperate stars from no stars - food is always good even with non rated restaurants. The food was really good, wine even better (a great recommendation by the somm after some light guidance on our preferances). We were blown away by the goat and pork sausage dishes - a masterclass of sweet, meaty, fruity, acidity and texture. I’d like to focus on service - which sadly brings the review to a 4 instead of a 5. I will nit pick since any Michelin stars, in my experience, have been outstanding service. We had two servers, who were not communicating with each other - we were welcomed twice and given the course recommendation twice (we weren’t sure who our waiter was!). The restaurant was very tightly packed - not the best for a romantic date; it felt as though our fellow diners at the adjacent table were apart of the date too. Going back, I would sit down with a bottle of wine, and friend, and a couple selections from the whole animal section!

NAME: NTKT
REVIEW: I was initially hesitant when I saw my reservation was for an outdoor table. However, the outdoor (covered) area was such a quaint place to have dinner with friends. There was no noise level and the lighting/ambience was perfect. I haven't visited Casa Mono in years so it was a nice return to an excellent spot.

NAME: Suzi
REVIEW: The food was good. the goat was probably our favorite dish..  The service, however, lacked the standard that the menu and ambience promised.  Also the air conditioning seemed to be set to “freeze” in our corner of the restaurant.

NAME: ChevyChaseDiner
REVIEW: We came here many years ago and it still impresses. It was an special meal with excellent service. It still deserves its Michelin star.

NAME: MarinaK
REVIEW: Great restaurant.  Excellent food and service. Definitely coming back. And bit cramped but its NYC

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I have eaten all over the world and consider myself a foodie and Casa Mono is one of my favorite restaurants by far. Consistently outstanding. Service always the best. Can’t wait to go back. Get the pork belly!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great food and service. Pan con Tomate is a must try.

NAME: IsabelleO
REVIEW: Belle expérience. Le fideoa était particulièrement délicieux ainsi que le arroz nero.   Nous y reviendrons

NAME: ThaiFiend
REVIEW: Mind boggling wonderful. We had had duck breast ; pork sobrasada with honey comb, Albania’s, scallops, eggs with sea urchin. Bone marrow, crème Catalan, bread pudding, chocolate ganache and a superb glass of Tinto.  The chef is a genius. One of the best meals of our lives.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: One of our best Spanish culinary and wine experience - for a one star Michellin - value for money too

NAME: Kelso
REVIEW: The bone marrow was something to come back for. Creamy, deliciousness. The pig ears were fried to perfection - very reminiscent of fresh chicharrones. The pork sausage was also phenomenal, going surprisingly well with the sweet flavor of the honeycomb. The scallops were cooked to perfection and paired well with the crunchy pistachios. The chocolate desert was heaven.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Unique tapas, incredible expansive Spanish wine list.

NAME: DrazenP
REVIEW: Great restaurant with absolutely amazing food and staff. Unfortunately, the hostess is often unwelcoming and tries to seat you at the least desirable table every time.

NAME: EllenS
REVIEW: I've been wanting to dine here for a while and was excited to finally get a reservation. It lived up to my expectations.  All of our dishes were delicious. I appreciated that our server timed and paired them so that we felt we had a proper meal vs just random tapas, didn't feel rushed or overwhelmed, and it felt paced. The somm was great and very helpful. I want to go back and try other dishes that I didn't have. Though would be happy to have repeats. Razor clams, goat confit, pan con tomate, uni egg, prawns, had the shishito peppers which were fine but other than needing something green, would likely skip that one. It was fine but nothing special.

NAME: Mrudbeck
REVIEW: Just amazing and creative food menu, which was matched by excellent wine and service.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food is delicious Wish they had more table/seats inside

NAME: TonianneM
REVIEW: Very nice date night. It’s smaller than other restaurants in there but it gives a great comfy feel!! Food was amazing!!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The space is nice and small, it’s warm and the lighting is perfect, I recommend it

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent food, good service, reasonably priced. Very warm and welcoming environment although it’s small and could be crowded.  Overall it’s a great restaurant. Highly recommended.

NAME: momwhoeats
REVIEW: Didn't realize i was outside but it was incredible food.

NAME: Travis
REVIEW: We had a great meal and enjoyed the atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Could not see the wow affect about the food. ı would say there are better options

NAME: JoeM
REVIEW: This place is an amazing little gem. The food was superb and the service was great. It’s going to become a must visit restaurant for me whenever I’m in NYC.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Been here many times and had fantastic meals. This one was disappointing- given a poor corner table when there was only one other table taken; was told by person at the front door we’d have only 1.15 hrs, no one turned up for a long time so slot if fuss about nothing. Generally felt rushed, not a special experience on Xmas eve - All bar one dish came at the same time which has never happened to us, overwhelming and the flavours of what we nearly always order weren’t what they usually are. Came away feeling quite bitter about spending $430+ for three of us on an average experience and a disappointing meal.

NAME: RayB
REVIEW: Absolutely fabulous.  Duck, scallops, razor clams off the charts.

NAME: MichaelM
REVIEW: Big flavors in a small space.  They do a good job.

NAME: ChristianS
REVIEW: Most personel were smiling, but the one who recieved us at the door, seemed to have a tough day. Not many smiles. Food was okay, but far from perfect. Was reccommended the place from a friend and for now i can't recommend this place to others. Too much other good outthere. The crookets tasted like old fish.   Hope to see you back in shape in the futere. Stuff to work on

NAME: AllisonK
REVIEW: This is an excellent restaurant!  It’s a great experience from the food to the atmosphere…so delicious and cozy.  Our service was amazing…helpful, kind and very capable.  Thoroughly enjoyed our evening!

NAME: MarkS
REVIEW: Not a good experience. We love spanish food and were excited to try this Michelin starred restaurant for my wife's birthday. We had to wait 20 minutes after our reservation time to be seated. Service for drinks and order taking was quick, but it took over an hour for 6 small plates to reach our table. Some of the food was good, in particular the razor clams, but the rest was mediocre. Will not be back.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Cozy ambience, nice service, excellent & creative food.

NAME: krimart
REVIEW: Fantastic food as always , warm service, great vibe!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: An absolutely beautiful experience from start to finish. The Uni eggs, bone marrow, scallops, and burratta were some of the stand outs, but there was nothing short of delicious throughout. Service is impeccable, and the atmosphere is super vibey. Will be back soon.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Amazing experience at Casa Mono. The wine was delicious & the wine consultant (didn’t catch his name) was really helpful in matching a wine we wanted within our price range & taste range. The food was delicious & the wait staff was very knowledgeable on how much to order for 2 people dining together. Great experience!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: food was good but a tad on the salty side.  the service was okay, but i feel the prices were high for such small portions.

NAME: bettyc
REVIEW: the noise level was perfect because we sat outside.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The hostess was not very nice. We came a little early, table was empty but we were told to leave. When we asked for a suggestion on a bar close by, we were told that he didn’t know, he only worked there.  When we returned, everything was perfect except that it took awhile before we got the menu, had to ask for it after 10-15 minutes. Perfect food, wine and service from there on.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Me encanta Casa Mono. Me siento como que estoy en España

NAME: OpenTable Diner

The restaurant just gets better and better, staying fresh and current while keeping the tradition of tapas.  The staff is everything a diner could hope for-courteous, knowledgeable, and obviously passionate about the restaurant and the food.  Fantastic!!!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: One of our all time favorite places for lunch or celebrations.

NAME: Stephanie
REVIEW: Food was great, snd we had a super helpful waiter!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono always delivers. John Boy, Sarah & Michelle were amazing.

NAME: AmyD

NAME: OpenTable Diner

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: My favorite restaurant in all of NYC- fantastic food and hospitality!

NAME: hwang
REVIEW: Very attentive service. All dishes are well done in spite of the small portion size.

NAME: KarenZ
REVIEW: Coming back for the second time and the experience was equally amazing!

NAME: DebS
REVIEW: It was fine. Tbh I went in with higher expectations considering the Michelin star. Outdoor covered seating was originally super loud though it got quieter as new people came in.  Service was fine. Again, it was fine… nothing stood out as GREAT

NAME: DesirreH
REVIEW: Took my husband here for his birthday last night and had the most amazing time. We started at their sister bar next door with drinks and then had dinner here. The food was amazing, the service was great and overall we would definitely come again.

NAME: KakiToo
REVIEW: The food was absolutely delicious. The staff was horrible—rude and unprofessional from start to finish. We arrived early and were told to go next door to a wine bar and wait. There were no seats there.  I was wearing a knee brace and walking with a cane and could not stand, so we sat at the Casa Mono’s bar (there were 3 seats there) to wait for our table. The maitre d’ told us he needed the seats for a reservation and we should stand outside in the cold. They didn’t offer us a table to wait at in their heated outdoor space. We continued to sit at the bar and ordered a $90 bottle of wine. We were seated soon after. Service was deliberately slow. We had to wait 20 minutes for the sommelier to bring it to the table after he had shown it to us. We ordered three appetizers, which were wonderful. Our waiter ignored us for 20 minutes before coming to take our dinner order. He was patronizingly dismissive of our questions about the menu and did not answer them. My husband got very angry, lost his temper, and insulted him. After he took our entree order, a girl came to tell us that we would not be served any more food or wine because my husband had insulted the waiter and she left the check. We were told to leave immediately after without finishing our dinner. No one came in after us to take the 3 seats at the bar that the maitre d’ insisted were reserved for diners. I have never been treated so badly by wait staff. (Was it ageism? I don’t know. We were 3 well-dressed older people who know our way around good restaurants in NYC and had looked forward to eating at Casa Mono.) Needless to say, we’ll never go back.

NAME: Foodfan
REVIEW: For the price points, this restaurant is overrated.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: My second time at Casa Mono this year and for some reason wasn’t even close to as good. The food felt very average, and I ordered nearly all the same dishes I did in July. Quite disappointed.

I am less enthusiastic about having to sit at a small table in a tight, uncomfortable position with service people bumping into me or my chair especially if the people sitting inches from you are loud.  The food is very good, but at this price level it is not a great dining experience.

REVIEW: Amazing food and a lot of combinations of wine to go with the delicious cuisines

NAME: Raymond
REVIEW: pulpo was amazing! would recommend it to all if you are an octopus fan

NAME: LSSS
REVIEW: Such a fun, cozy nook with great food to drop in for lunch or dinner!

NAME: Chris

NAME: JulianaP
REVIEW: The food was excellent as well as the service We enjoyed an outdoor table and were able to talk

NAME: ElieR
REVIEW: hbjhjhjhnjhnjhjhbjhbhjbhjbjhbhjbjbhbhhjnjnkjnkjnjknjk
