NAME: NancyA
REVIEW: What a great place to enjoy the food and wine of Spain!

NAME: NataliaNG
REVIEW: The steak was over cooked. It’s incredible that happens in a Michelin star restaurant. The host was rude.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was good, unfortunately the service was really bad, does not meet Michelin star quality at all.

NAME: MirelaG
REVIEW: Love this place, have been there more many times. Prices have increased SIGNIFICANTLY since the pandemic, but let’s say we can understand that. The sudden collapse of their customer service it is harder to comprehend. First off, we got there and were two tables available , both for two people, one very well located, one hidden, cramped and undesirable. We asked to be sited at the better one but we were  blatantly  lied to when told that a party of three was expected. No, just another couple was sited ,  but a younger one. Is there an age limit for when you get sited in the front of the restaurant ??? Service was surprisingly bad. When asked for a new plate when we changed dishes, the waitress was confused and reluctantly change them but with an air of complete disapproval. Many small restaurants have failed. I hope you take this as a sign that we want you to survive.

NAME: TSunami
REVIEW: Amazing and inventive tapas in a very Spanish ambiance.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Sitting at the bar and watching the chefs at work is always a pleasure at Casa Mono. The service was incredible with a lot of attention to detail, and the food was superb, as always. The bone marrow and oxtail stuffed peppers were standouts! Might be the best bone marrow I have ever had

NAME: HillaB
REVIEW: Indoor space is quite small, so a bit noisy. Food - we came with high expectations , ordered 5 different dishes, they were all not 'wow' at all. Thanks.

NAME: AlexandraV
REVIEW: went on date night for spanish tapas. was incredible.

NAME: LyerkaM
REVIEW: We love Casa Mono. The food is amazing, the wine list is interesting and offers good values, the service is impeccable.

NAME: TK719
REVIEW: Wonderful dinner at Casa Mono. My frisee salad, scallops and patatas bravas were all delicious. The chocolate ganache dessert was equally superb. My server Andrew was amazing. He was extremely friendly and knowledgeable, and made certain that everything was perfect. Other staff members were also most helpful and professional. A terrific dining experience.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was exquisite!!! The combinations of flavors to make that perfect bite was incredible. Add to that the fact that Chef Jonathan Melendez is a very friendly and attentive chef who makes you feel like part of the family. Totally recommended.

NAME: Brooklyn101
REVIEW: For folks that have never had good Spanish tapas, this is perfect!

NAME: Shinobi
REVIEW: Amazing as always. First place to go after flying in from LA

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Comida rica, con buenos ingredientes y variada, pero no tienen ningún plato sencillo o no muy aderezado.  No tienen endulzante para el café, solo azúcar regular.

NAME: Charlie
REVIEW: Casa Mono is one of my favorite restaurants in the city and I come here often. Had the worst experience recently, however, as we wanted to do a bottle of wine and 2-3 tapas for a first date. 930 on a Tuesday evening and the waitress informed us that is was “full-service dining only” and we would need to order more than that if we wanted to stay seated outside rather than visit the communal tables at Bar Jamon. She proceeded to clear our table and waited for us to leave after conversing with the Som (loudly) that she “was so tired of people thinking that was OK.” In fairness, every time I dine here, we typically order 2-3 bottles of wine (the Numanthia is a favorite of mine) and the service has never been anything short of exceptional. I am so disappointed with the waitress and sommelier and upset that this has left a bad taste in my mouth for a favorite of mine. This would have been more understandable if there were not tables available or even a single person waiting to be seated but truly disappointing.  Above being said, I would still recommend Casa Mono as well as Bar Jamon - though be wary that there is apparently a minimum order required now.

REVIEW: Amazing service!!

NAME: ChefK
REVIEW: A member of our party has extreme food sensitivities that our waiter, Juan, patiently explored and accommodated.

REVIEW: Excelent food and service! Scallops are to die for!

NAME: AlexG

REVIEW: Lovely dinner- we had to wait an hour to be seated but the staff accommodated us.

REVIEW: Service was excellent and food was fantastic.

REVIEW: All good-but pretty expensive.

REVIEW: Great would definitely come a second time Recommend ordering wines

NAME: MisterStars
REVIEW: Always an amazing experience. Food, wine and hospitality are all outstanding!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent food and ambiance

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Always an incredible experience. The server and sommelier were both delightful in helping us celebrate a special evening.

NAME: NathanB

NAME: TheaH

REVIEW: Absolutely would go back. Inside is great and the food is very very good.

NAME: regrettable
REVIEW: Always outstanding food. Intense flavors, consistent quality, creative approach. All about the deliciousness!

NAME: Waki
REVIEW: Great outdoor setup. Staff was very accommodating, nice and knowledgeable- food to wine. Food was good though not 100% Spanish in case that is the expectation. We had a lovely time enjoying the dishes and a great bottle wine. A couple of suggestions:  Dishes can use less salt. Some were quite salty and detracted from the taste. We feel everyone, including the somm and the host should wear a mask if they’re coning to a table to talk to customers. That was not the case. Even if you’re vaccinated, you can be a carrier, lest they forgot.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Went there for my birthday, the staff was very attentive and friendly. The food was amazing and surpassed all expectations.

NAME: Derek
REVIEW: Some of the best food I’ve had in NYC.

NAME: Lizzie1234
REVIEW: Close quarters outside. Food excellent. Jamin iberica not worth 50.00 dollars

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Always outstanding.

NAME: BertH
REVIEW: Casa Mono is both expensive and no longer worth it. There are some decent dishes to be sure. The tomato bread is good. The chaucuterie platter is OK. The Iberico ham, at $50 for a small portion is what it is-if you are flush and love the taste it is fine but for many it will be an unnecessary extravagance. I didn't care for the grilled peppers in a kind of cheese sauce at all. The menu badly needs updating, the prices need to be reconsidered-$35 for a portion of skirt steak is really not appropriate, and with the coming of cooler weather, the outdoor dining terrace will no longer be a viable option. If you want Spanish food or tapas in NYC-there are other spots.

NAME: JamesM
REVIEW: One of the city’s longstanding restaurants remains as special as always. Elegantly detailed Spanish cuisine at its best. One of the most unsung wine lists in town too. Professional service. They haven’t skipped a beat through all the travails of the pandemic either. Bravo…

NAME: DianeM
REVIEW: Awesome experience.

NAME: Frans
REVIEW: Amazing food! Amazing people! Will definitely plan to go again and again!

NAME: Marianoc
REVIEW: Food is out of this world Service exceptional

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Incredible food, every dish impressed with their creativity and deliciousness.  Great service and value, muy bien!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Wonderful as always

NAME: Chris
REVIEW: Would have been 5 stars for food if the saltiness had been restrained.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Lovely and close to the subwY

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Restaurante español donde la mujer encargada de darte la mesa dice que habla muy poco español, la comida buena pero en poca cantidad, el precio para ser Nueva York aceptable, por eso supongo que las personas que van allí tienen muy poca educación, celebrábamos el cumpleaños de mi esposa, nos dan una mesa en una esquina enfrente de la puerta, a la derecha teníamos una mesa de 4 que reían como gallinas, a la izquierda una mesa de 6 que forzaban las carcajadas, la comida es correcta, el servicio malo muy malo, esperas para pedir, entre platos y cuando llegan los postres nos traen 1 de los dos que habíamos pedidos, reclámanos el segundo, viene otro encargado que si sabía español para que le confirmemos que sólo hemos comido un postre y después de 15 minutos llega el segundo postre que evidentemente hemos rechazado, nos piden disculpas y nos descuentan el postre consumido, a la hora de pagar sorpresa no aceptan pago con teléfono, me parece increíble que en una ciudad como está todavía quede algún restaurante que no acepte pago con el teléfono, finalmente  entre el efectivo de mi mujer y el mío hemos podido pagar la cuenta de 205$. Evidentemente borro este restaurante y no volveremos nunca, mal servicio mal ambiente y woe forma de pago.

NAME: MIchellerb
REVIEW: Casa Mono never disappoints. The food, atmosphere and service was outstanding!   I highly recommend to all my friends.

NAME: JamesO
REVIEW: Efficient and very friendly service.  Love the taste and the portions of the food(just the right size).

NAME: MichelleS
REVIEW: First time dining here even though it's been on "the list" for a while. We had a wonderful dinner with some friends to celebrate a birthday. Impressed by the menu, service and delicious wine list.

NAME: NycRestaurant
REVIEW: Lovely dinner outdoors.  Service was outstanding - friendly staff across the board.

NAME: MilindKam
REVIEW: Extraordinary food! The razor clams were an outstanding recommendation and must have. The pulpo and duck were the perfect size, flavor and happiness. I will definitely be coming here again and next time with the fam :) Yum!!

NAME: delishbutdeafening
REVIEW: I’ve been eating at Casa Mono since it opened and am happy to report that the food, service, and wine list are better than ever.  There are old standbys — sweetbreads, razor clams, skirt steak — and many new dishes on the menu; each executed perfectly.  The only change I hate is the music which in a small, crowded, hard-surfaced space rise quickly to a level requiring one to shout to be heard.  Don’t people like to converse any more as well as eat!?

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Table was a bit small for three people but otherwise great

NAME: FranK
REVIEW: very expensive for what it is but the food, drinks, and service are lovely

NAME: PeterC
REVIEW: Always a wonderful meal!  Wine selection is perfect and the tapas style menu is fun to explore.

NAME: ch268
REVIEW: It was our first time to eat here, highly recommended by our friends. Enjoyed the experience, service was excellent and the food was unique and very tasty

NAME: Neta

NAME: nprr
REVIEW: The food was absolutely delicious, but if you plan to sit outside, be aware that there’s very noisy construction well into the evening hours.

NAME: food
REVIEW: Delightful as usual.

NAME: lsfcmh
REVIEW: Business lunch completely ruined by restaurants construction. workmen deciding to do construction 10 feet away from where we were eating making it literally impossible to hear across the table.  Cannot comprehend  why they would do this in the midst of the lunchtime rush instead of before 12 or after 2. Complained to the waiter multiple times. Skirt steak, scallops, burrata were absolutely delicious. Pepper stuffed with short rib had almost no meat. Potatoes were so under cooked you could barely cut with a knife

NAME: WarrenS
REVIEW: I asked for a table for 3. They gave me a very small table, appropriate for 2, even though I asked for one with more room. This is a tapas restaurant with lots of little plates. We spent the whole meal juggling plates. It just didn’t work. I liked this place last time, but this really soured me on the experience.

NAME: JarBoston
REVIEW: This restaurant used to be much better. Looks like their success has lowered the standards for quality in both food and service.  It was also disappointing to see that kitchen staff and most waiters do not wear masks . They have one toilet that is not enough for the current capacity of guests and is not maintained well enough.    The highlight of the Menu used to be their razor clams but the last two times I visited they didnt have them...  If you cant get them dont leave them on the menu.....

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was good, but either food or service as expected for a 4 star Michelin.

NAME: JuminC
REVIEW: The food is exceptional. I enjoyed the every dish I ordered.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Love the razor clam

NAME: LaFleur
REVIEW: Nice dinner in the streetery. Missed the razor clams though.

NAME: Jason
REVIEW: My experience there started off very rocky.  While we were about to be seated, a girl at the host stand came up to us and in a very stern voice said "Just so you know, we need that table back at 7:30."  What a horrible way to start of the experience.  We weren't a walk in either, we had a reservation for 5:45.  After we were seated everything got much better.  A great wait staff that knew the menu in and out (my wife is celiac).  The food was incredible, especially the goat confit.  The wine list is fantastic as well.  I will be back, but hopefully that hostess won't be working that day.  If not for her, my overall score would've been perfect.

NAME: Ernesto
REVIEW: Service and food were amazing!!!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: A birthday lunch. Everything we ordered was delicious.  Small tastings of so many delicious things.  We were 3 people and ordered 7 different plates.

NAME: Nancy
REVIEW: I have been a long time customer of casa mono. love everything!

NAME: Drea
REVIEW: The food was absolutely amazing.  Each dish offered your palette a new tasting experience.  We will definitely be coming back to this restaurant.  It's a nice hidden gem on Irving.  My wife and I loved that tapas type vibe, and the music helped round out the entire evening.   Also, the wine selection was beautiful.  Highly recommend.

NAME: sparty
REVIEW: Absolutely amazing! Our favorite meal in NYC so far. The food, ambiance were perfect. We enjoyed fantastic wine and a wonderful evening out. Would return in a heartbeat

NAME: MyMusings
REVIEW: Simply one of the best meals I've had in NYC.

NAME: GeorgeK
REVIEW: table next to us had 2 extremely Loud customers . This was a business Lunch not at night. You should really try to space out tables

NAME: AnaY
REVIEW: Loved the food.  Razor clams, Confit Goat, Pork Belly, Pan con tomate, Fideos with Chorizo, Scallops -- they were all great!  All three desserts were good but it seemed like the chocolate ganache was the favorite.

NAME: 108NYC
REVIEW: My husband and I are serious cooks. We rarely go out to a restaurant -- but when we do we almost always go to Casa Mona. Consistently exceptional food and wine list, changing menu, small, intimate, casual. it always delivers excellence.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Everything was great! The only issue was being initially seated between 2 large tables full of people. The hostess was able to accommodate another table by the door which was actually great as it gave us enough space to have a sense of privacy. The only other issue was the 90 min reservation limit is too tight. No one brought it up but we were there more like 2 hrs which included dessert!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Service was terrible. First of all, we could only order once as there was dining time limit of 1.15hr. The server, Axxxx, came to our table only 2 times - when we ordered and when we asked for a check. Never checked on us while the octopus we ordered was over-‘burnt’. And the other server came and we asked how come it is burnt so much, and he was like ‘so do you want it or no?’ What kind of attitude is that at a Michelin star restaurant? I was so disappointed Foods here in general are normal, nothing special. I had much better spanish foods from other restaurants without Michelin star.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was great but our main server, Angie, was the least friendly and helpful server we’ve ever met.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: In a city such as New York City, where the food scene is ever-changing, the question “Which restaurants do you recommend or are your favorites?” can be so daunting. But Casa Mono is definitely one that stands out (in my humble opinion) and you should note, whether you are a local or visitor!  Don’t forget to order the Foie Gras, Bone Marrow, Sardines & Endive dishes!

NAME: GabyK
REVIEW: The food was Not great and our waiter was really bad and mean.

NAME: SomethingAbout
REVIEW: We had a great experience! We ate outdoors during the heatwave, so it as a bit hot, but that's the weather's fault, not the restaurant.  Every dish was excellent - flavorful profiles with surprising combinations that pleased the tastebuds. The sommelier was very knowledgable and recommended use a fantastic rose that I will be searching for again.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: consistent, delicious, well staffed, great presentation, creative menu. wines from everywhere. cool area!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Juan Pablo, nos explico todo y siempre atento

NAME: Benjamin
REVIEW: The waitress was very dismissive when we told her we were just going to have drinks and order a few bites. Apparently they have a sister bar for rif raf like us and we were moved around the corner to a whole different establishment to sit inside even though we reserved an outside table. It was very rude service for something that is not explained on their reservation site.  We had a great time at their sister bar, but being made to shamefully pickup our stuff and move? That set the tone and we won’t be returning.

NAME: MESBrklyn
REVIEW: Tasty Restaurant week lunch! I can't wait to try dinner

NAME: Helen
REVIEW: The service was fantastic! Foie gras is a must!!!!

NAME: WLBayRidge

NAME: DanR
REVIEW: This is a fantastic place for an inventive take on tapas. Each dish was unique and exquisite. The pulpo with fennel and grapefruit, and the pork belly were highlights. But everything was great. It’s a bit pricey, but well worth it. We’ll be back!

NAME: Fulen
REVIEW: Food was very good but table was too tiny to fit food and noise was overwhelming, even outside.

NAME: Spinsrod
REVIEW: Excellent food, service and ambiance!! Never ever disappoints

NAME: AmandaB
REVIEW: Great atmosphere and fantastic food. Service was impeccable. Sat outdoor and loved it!

NAME: GeorgeK
REVIEW: It was our first time , very close to our home , great food

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Such wonderful choices for food and unbelievable wine list. The staff always treats you right

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Tastes good but overpriced

NAME: Balserbaby
REVIEW: I have been going to Casa Mono for a long time, and this time the food was not quite as good as usual: overcooked razor clams, and sweetbreads so coated with breading and nuts that the sweetbreads themselves were not tastable. NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Insanely good tapas. Specialty iberico jamon is a must

REVIEW: The restaurant week menu had no selection just a fixed appetizer and entree.  Both were perfect, the salad was very crisp and the manchego cheese added to the flavor, the entree was grilled dorada fish which was perfectly cooked with crispy skin.  A very enjoyable meal.

NAME: T9Fu
REVIEW: What else could be said, outstanding in every way, and we really enjoyed the seafood offering for restaurant week!

NAME: MicheleR
REVIEW: The food set off an explosion of amazing flavors and textures in my mouth...and my nose caught wave after wave of intoxicating aromas.  The people engaged us with smiles that said, "I really care."  After being unable to see each other during the pandemic, we celebrated Italy's opening its borders and New York opening its streets. Next?  My friend from Morocco.

NAME: LeighH
REVIEW: Arrived at 4:45 for 5:15PM reservation. Empty restaurant. Told we could not be seated until our 5:15 reservation. Requested indoor seating when finally allowed to sit at 5:15 (still 80% empty in restaurant). Was told, "you need to give table back by 6:15." We sat at 5:15, server didn't come over to take orders until 5:30, drinks weren't poured until 5:40, first course arrived at 6:15, second arrived at 6:30. They didn't take the table back at 6:15, but rudeness of host and stress created by timing was extremely unpleasant - especially when service was inattentive/slow throughout dinner. Shame - this place used to be phenomenal. Hope they retrain/improve host and wait staff to provide an experience that is as high-caliber as the food they serve.

NAME: Alex
REVIEW: Service was non-existent, I would have ordered more drinks but I only saw my waitress once.

NAME: GabrielK
REVIEW: definitely a must visit place if you're a fan of tapas/spanish cuisine

NAME: ChrisI
REVIEW: As always great food and service from one of our favourite restaurants in NYC.

NAME: Xavi
REVIEW: First time since Covid  The food was amazing and full of flavor. The sweetbreads tasted better than I recall. The only thing I wish they still had on their menu are the razor clams.

NAME: Foodie
REVIEW: The food, the service, the ambiance were superb. Definitely making this place my go to for tapas

NAME: ChrisE
REVIEW: This place was truly outstanding. Spanish tapas meets Michelin star quality. A winning combination.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food is really amazing !

NAME: Partricia0915
REVIEW: All small dishes are delicious and We can enjoy with wines.  I like to watch open kitchen and always fresh foods are served.  I think they are always busy but not overwhelming services. I can be relaxing and enjoying to dine.

REVIEW: The service attitude is very bad!!! Will never go to again!

NAME: MJC123
REVIEW: Outdoor seating on a beautiful summer’s day.

NAME: jessicas
REVIEW: it was so good, the waiter was so good, there was a point when the music turned on and it got a little loud. My friend and I sat outside and the weather was perfect.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: AMAZING experience

NAME: DavidR

NAME: Saverin
REVIEW: A nice place, where I've always been a bit surprised that the food is as good as it is. Today was no exception.  All our food was extremely tasty. The portions were extremely small meagre. though we all are small eaters. Make sure you order a starter, in addition to dessert(we ordered it) or you'll certainly need to eat when you get home  Service was quite pleasant, though one jarring note: At home, I checked before coming your wine list.  It said that Valdespino Innocente was #13 for 375 ml.,  Waitress brought a small glass.  Told her menu said 375 ml.  She brought the half bottle, but when we got the bill, I was charged @35. Complaining about this sizable difference, I was shown the menu, which in the restaurant said$13/$35. I paid, though most unhappily; a real downer to an otherwise pleasant meal Website should be corrected, at the very least.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was delicious, the hospitality shown was superb. A must go.

NAME: MarioC
REVIEW: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Service  ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Food  Love to ho there , every time is better like before.

NAME: audreyw

REVIEW: Nice food, not really worth the price. Patatas Barabas is not what I am used too. Kampachi and scallops are good.

NAME: OpenTable Diner

The razor clams were amazing in the garlic sauce, so tender and tasty.  The skirt steak over the romesco with the onions was so delicious.  The pork belly was made perfectly with the right amount of crisp and flavor.  The Burrata and mushrooms complemented each other.  The patatas bravas were a nice twist to the traditional dish. Finally the crema catalana was just enough, perfect consistency and the bay leaf buñuelos were the finishing touch.   Would definitely go back — was worth the price point for the offerings, size of the tapas and overall composition and experience.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: It was a good experience with friends :)

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Very good food. Especially burrata.

Not in a hurry to go back.

NAME: ChristopherM

NAME: Jess
REVIEW: all the food was delicious, our server did not lead us astray with her suggestions! portions were small (as expected though for a Michelin star restaurant) but surprisingly filling.

REVIEW: Everything was superb! Can’t rave enough about the wonderful time we had. Every dish from the sardines to pulbo to rabo de toro were amazing. Perfect service perfect dinner. Bravo!

REVIEW: Fabulous food and great service.

NAME: Miguel
REVIEW: Excelente servicio y buena comida

NAME: SusanaL
REVIEW: The food was amazing and great service. The octopus with fennel and grapefruit was incredible!

NAME: VillageDiner
REVIEW: This was our first visit to Casa Mono, an unassuming restaurant on the quiet blocks south of Gramercy Park. The interior of the restaurant is small and cramped, but we ate on the somewhat larger sidewalk patio. Our table for 3 was no larger than a bicycle wheel, and since it is a tapas place there was some juggling needed to fit all the plates. We had 7 dishes, just about right for a big lunch. We had the bacaloa, goat confit, pimientos, skirt steak, pulpo, manchego salad and sobrasada. All were very tasty and very distinctive. The quality of the food was actually remarkable for such a small place. Service was friendly but a little slow, so plan on a leisurely meal in the Spanish tradition. At about $70/pp, taxes tip and wine included, Casa Mono is no bargain, but the quality of the food justifies the price. We expect to return.

NAME: Nancy
REVIEW: Excellent food and service in spite of noise from the construction 🚧

REVIEW: I love the whole vibe of Casa Mono.  Food is excellent as well as service.

REVIEW: Amazing dinner! Just top quality!

NAME: KevinT

This last time was by far the worst time and wondering the need to go back.  Items like the tomato bread coming with maybe one or two chunks of tomato (but mostly oil) or being told we ordered one serving of something when we ordered two.  Empty dirty dishes sat on the table waiting to be cleared and weren't removed until after the next plates came.  We never saw the waitress so when we had to ask the hostess for something, she seemed insulted.  Water was never filled and only one glass of wine for two of our friends - when they never were asked for a second, they just went without anything - our water was empty by then. The server was so nondescript in her approach and lacked any sense of what was going on.  Not impressed.

NAME: Deslyn
REVIEW: Food was excellent!

REVIEW: Great food and service!!!!!!!

I did ask for a birthday desert acknowledgement towards the end and it may have been forgotten but that was only  really disappointing part of the night.

NAME: Mudlark
REVIEW: I love this place. The food is so yummy. I mean, next level yummy. It's so cozy and gorgeous and fun. And the servers are so sweet, nice and have great suggestions.  I can't quite give it a full 5 stars however because there were three mistakes with our order, and that's just too many. First they forgot to bring the starter of pan con tomate. Then, I saw a server dropping off our food-- or trying to-- at another table. I tried to tell him that was our order, but he refused to believe me. The table sent one item back-- i guess they didn't want the fish-- but kept the side vegetable of greens! Yep. Then a little later, the server returned with the rejected fish (somewhat cold now), and I tried again to say "and those are our greens over there too" but again, he didn't seem to believe me. It was sorted out eventually-- long after the fish was consumed-- it's just, I kind of like to eat my sides, as a side... next to the main. And so by the time my tea with dessert was also forgotten about, I was definitely feeling a bit 'ignored.' All in all, tho the food is amazing... just be aware the service might be a bit spotty.

NAME: WilliamF
REVIEW: Wonderful dinner.

NAME: Nick
REVIEW: Still thinking about the foie gras

NAME: Chloe

The indoor dining is limited due to the small space so we were outdoors - less than wonderful but given the circumstances I could not complain! Happy to be back

REVIEW: I’d give it a 5 star review all the way but for the $$$$. This is one of those places where you cannot arrive hungry bc it’s tapas. Yet each tapas dish is anywhere from 15-28$. We shared three tapas amongst two people and it was good we weren’t super hungry. Aside from the expense the food is next level delectable. Like work of art. We had (photos attached) the pulpo, duck egg and goat confit. Each bite was like a slice of heaven. Service is super attentive and friendly. The ambience is so-so bc their outdoor structures (built for street dining for pandemic ban on indoor eating) are dark and dingy so it’s very wintertime feeling right now but they do have individual heaters for each table. I’d go here again (if someone else is buying) or to celebrate special occasions as I can’t justify the expense! If that’s not a big deal for you , then I’d say go again and again and try everything on the menu. I bet you they don’t have a single “ordinary” dish. The menu is simply extra ordinary!!

NAME: MarkD
REVIEW: I feel that I needed to write this in response to a review posted on 11/09/20.  I felt the review was unfair to the waitstaff, so I wanted to share our experience.   If, as she claims, she has been to “hundreds of restaurants” in “…New York and 11 other cities in America, Europe and the Middle East” during the pandemic is true, then I think it is entirely appropriate that the waitstaff, or anyone else for that matter, ask her to put her mask on.  Her dining out at hundreds of restaurants in 12 cities across the globe during the months of the pandemic places all at risk. If--what she says is the truth…  Hundreds of restaurants— in 12 cities— on different continents— during the pandemic— would be quite a feat.  We have dined outside at Casa Mono 3 times during the pandemic. At no time did any server ask us to put our masks back on before they would approach the table to serve, replace silverware or pour water. We kept our masks on when initially ordering, but then had them off through most of the meal, although we try and put them on when we know someone is approaching the table, but sometimes we are not that fast.  The servers here are dedicated professionals and we would hate to see a negative review such as this affect their business. Given the number of positive reviews, I doubt it will.  Contrary to her advice, we will continue to give this restaurant and the staff our “money”.  In fact, her “review” has prompted us to make our next reservation.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We arrived about 20 min early for our reservation and the host said our table was not yet ready. Understandably, we asked if we could have a drink at the bar and he said unfortunately those seats are reserved for people that are coming. So we said, ok we’ll go to the bar next door and come back. He quickly replied unfortunately Bar Jamon is closed for a private party. I didn’t even know the bar around the corner belonged to the same chain. So I said, ok what do you suggest we do then? I mean, it isNYC and I assumed there was more than one bar to go to. He said there’s a bar across the street, and then he said, oh wait. The private event is done at Bar Jamon. You can go there. We didn’t. We went across the street and were texted by an unknown number at 8:21pm, “your seats are ready. Please come to the host within 10 minutes of receiving this message.” Then I received a phone call from a different number at 8:27Pm from the same rude host telling us our table was ready and if we were on our way. We were literally right across the street. We went over at 8:30 exactly. They offered to take my coat while dealing with another couple at their entrance. He pointed to our seats and said you’re over there in the corner. We were not sat or directed with menus. He took my coat but not my brothers and I had to hand him my coat and go around the couple the we’re trying to assist. Our waiter did not introduce himself or make a connection or even discuss the menu. I don’t even know how he would have given the tight space we were in. The only thing I can say is the food was delicious. Of course on exiting the same host from early merely said, how did you like everything. I mean my brother is only in town for three nights and I used up one of them on this AWFUL HORRIBLE service. Michelin star? Maybe once upon a time. If the host hadn’t been so abrupt and rude on our arrival, I may have had a different opinion but the server did nothing above and beyond to change my mind.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The waiter was very rude and impatient. He seemed like he hated his job…

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great!! It was excelente in every category

NAME: Debra
REVIEW: The restaurant has a great vibe.  Loved the ambiance and energy.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Good food. Great service. Excellent Rioja 2010. Too tight space. Noisy.

NAME: AndSom
REVIEW: Great spot, perfect for date night or solo for great food.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Amazing! The food is delicious

NAME: Spinsrod
REVIEW: Food and service were outstanding as always!!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Wonderful night

NAME: KaranG
REVIEW: Been going here for years. Food is good but I remember it being better. Still a solid spot.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We had a pretty good experience. Some plates were great, others were off. Service was attentive and cordial but not as professional as I expected.  The kitchen's counter was not comfortable enough. That is a major difference with Mercado at Little Spain. Also the chef was not too shy and reclusive.

NAME: AlexZ
REVIEW: Casa Mono is probably, subjectively, my favorite restaurant in Manhattan; it is a pity I cannot afford to dine here every night.  For tapas, it simply can't be beat.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Ambiance and service was nice. Restaurant week meal was okay, not amazing.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Went for restaurant week. The croquet had a very long fish bone in it. From presentation to taste and texture, I cannot they got Michelin star. None of the dishes were necessarily good. I do not understand the high rating here and feel very disappointed.

NAME: DavidA
REVIEW: I am not a master chef nor am I a world renowned chef, however, I still have a great love, appreciation and admiration for food and fine dining.  To me and many others, Michelin star ratings are very hard to come by and with that certain standards and quality are supposed to follow.  Unfortunately, to start with, the service was non existent and absolutely no recommendations or suggestions were given.  I was simply told let me know if you need something, 15 minutes later asks me "you ready".  The bread, which was an appetizer of sorts came out very cold.  In addition to that the plates were substandard and I just simply felt none of the dishes were made with love.

NAME: TammyB
REVIEW: Birthday Great food and wind

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Bad service.

NAME: BrendanM
REVIEW: Amazing restaurant. Couldn’t be happier with the food as well as the server’s attention to detail and ability to recommend delicious small plates and wine

NAME: NoMadFAN
REVIEW: Have not been here in a couple years and it has not lost its quality in any respect. Still some of the best Spanish food in the city and the staff is great. We shared the Bacalao croquetas w/orange aioli, Sardinas Fritas, Scallops w/Curry & Cashew, Duck Egg with Mojama, and the Duck Breast - If that all sounds flavorful - it is! all great combos, super tasty - along with a lovely Basque White (txakoli). very enjoyable evening!

NAME: SamS
REVIEW: Spectacularly wonderful lunch well beyond expectations. Every dish was exceptionally flavorful and satisfying. I can’t wait to return. Deserves 10 stars!!  The Michelin rating is spot on!

NAME: BrianB
REVIEW: My favorite spot in nyc.  Outstanding menu executed perfectly.  Sit at bar to watch it get prepared.  Real professionals with real creativity not seen in so many restaurants.  Also, great pairings.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great food!We ordered the razor clam, skirt steak,goat with avocado,creamy eggs and also foie gras.That was a little bit too much for two of us. Foir gras&skirt steak was amazing.Creamy eggs tasted really special with nuts and lemon.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Service is fine, food is underwhelming and environment is awful. For the price point they charge consider the other great Spanish restaurants instead to enjoy!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This place is always amazing.   Even for that super early New Year’s Eve  dinner experience when civilized New Yorkers want to eat and get home because they wouldn’t be caught dead anywhere near Times Square late.   That being said Casa Mono is one of my favorites and I highly suggest sitting at the bar near the kitchen.   There is no other place for a foodie to sit and get the full experience.   Watching the line prepare your order is a thrill.   I always get the bone marrow here.  It’s superbly done and served with toast points that would pull anyone off a no carb diet.  The duck breast is always meaty and moist.  Grilled to perfection and served with a complement of perfectly pared flavor of items you’ll never want duck from anywhere else.   The wine and cocktail menu match the food menu with a sublime selection that goes with everything.  I always go with their recommendation and have never been disappointed.   Thanks again

NAME: Robman15
REVIEW: been coming for years.  felt like going through motions. food was just ok. sweetbreads overly battered.  other just ok.  spent a lot on top wine and asked for a half serving of something and not accommodating.  bummer as this has always been a favorite but maybe just offnight

NAME: Darv
REVIEW: Always delicious thoughtfully prepared food. Great service. Sorry but the tables tend to be real small. Great place generally.

NAME: AshtonZ
REVIEW: Truly authentic and exciting small plates. Don't miss this Chelsea gem!!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Our favorite spot in nyc

NAME: hungrygrl
REVIEW: All the above

NAME: cxxxz
REVIEW: i don't understand how pete wells of the times rated that abortion of Spanish food in Hudson yards ahead of casa mono

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Wonderful food and service.  A must if you’re looking for flavor, creativity and service.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Anniversary

NAME: Valqin
REVIEW: honestly one of the best restaurants in new york city hands down!!

NAME: Mandelbrot
REVIEW: Amazing food!

NAME: hungrygrl
REVIEW: Food amazing. Tables a bit close together but willing to suffer for the food!

NAME: MaryT
REVIEW: Great food but horrible service. It was 15 minutes before we got even a glass of water!!  We ordered wine which took another 15 minutes to appear. Even with a reservation we were seated at the worst table in the restaurant -- tucked against a wall of wine bottles -- and we insisted that we move.  The food at Casa Mono is truly wonderful but they've squeezed in far too many tables for the space and the service staff is overwhelmed! IF we were to return, we'd sit at the bar where the staff seemed more attentive.

NAME: Monty26
REVIEW: love this restaurant! dream of the razor clams! would go back in an instant!

NAME: Dinnerdate20
REVIEW: We had a wonderful meal at the chefs counter (where I in fact prefer to eat at CM). Clean flavors, flawless execution and sublime wine.  Don’t miss the foie gras.

NAME: DavidL
REVIEW: Very creative and tasty small plates. Somewhat tight but convivial crowd, only beer and wine--pricey

NAME: aryang
REVIEW: Amazing food with very intimate ambiance!  Every dish we ordered was extremely satisfying.   Highlight was the creamy eggs with uni, and foie gras!

NAME: GeorgeE
REVIEW: Unfortunately I have had better experience in the past here. Very pricey for portion size and flavor moving in wrong direction. Still good but disappointing.

NAME: Mikki
REVIEW: Very cozy place with excellent service food and great wine selection

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Fantastic meal and phenomenal service

NAME: OctDiner
REVIEW: Wonderful food and great wines. A little cramped - we didn’t realize how tiny the place was, but we managed. The food made it totally worth it. Would definitely return.

NAME: 1TP1
REVIEW: Consistently magnificent flavors, spectacularly deep wine list and expert service.  A bit less consistent is service, which ranges from terrific to somewhat inattentive.  Our sommelier seemed to be doing the heavy lifting for most aspects of our meal, which may have allowed our primary server to neglect replenishing our water.  A minor criticism of an overall wonderful experience with vibrant flavors and cheerful staff.

NAME: pk41
REVIEW: All was excellent: food and services, only the music was a bit too loud when we almost finished around 7pm.

NAME: Abez
REVIEW: Food turned out not to be that good.  The service was very slow between plates.  Some dishes had to be sent back twice to cook more.

NAME: Foodie
REVIEW: We came to enjoy a trip past memory lane fro our vacation to Madrid.  With an extensive Spanish wine list and the traditional dishes offered we were able to reminisce in the way we had hoped. We will be back!

NAME: SJOBklyn
REVIEW: We were crammed into a table so close to the window only our skinny kids could sit in those seats. The room is small, busy but very quiet. Whilst clearing our table between courses, a server managed to both almost shove me off my seat whilst squeezing between my wife and I and then spilled on me clearing a plate. Food wise, the level has gone down since our last visit in late 2017. The Patatas Bravas has moved from sublime to ridiculous and you have to search for tiny pieces of fingerling potato between oceans of sauce and onions(?). The Sobrasada and Razor Clams were amazing though. Overall a little disappointing.

NAME: JosephB
REVIEW: Outstanding. One of our favorite NY spots.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: It’s always exceptional. The food is off the charts... the wine selection is staggering, and the joy of watching the chillest chefs in the city casually throw together these little plates of gustatory art is unmatched.

NAME: TandT
REVIEW: Sit at the bar if you can. The restaurant is small and cozy - doesn’t feel cramped, just intimate and exciting. At the bar you can watch the chefs making everything in the kitchen behind the bar, which was really fun. This was a great meal - excellent wine recommendations by the staff and the food was amazing. Lives up to the hype.

NAME: christianb
REVIEW: This is my go to for business lunches. It’s typically not over crowded, so you get the benefit of even more attentive service, plus, Jahdea, the host and sommelier, is awesome and always makes me feel like a rock star!

NAME: Cecil
REVIEW: I was expecting excellent food but not everything was as good as expected. We have visited the place years ago and was excellent. Portions are small which I don’t mind when the food is delicious. Of our 6 orders we found only 3 very good, sardines, croquetas  and spaghetti with clams and chorizo which was the best.  Service was ok. Dessert was good different.

NAME: FrancisDoverian
REVIEW: Excellent food. Very accommodating and friendly service.

NAME: Darv
REVIEW: My partner loves this place and always asks to dine there when we are in NYC. Food is consistently great with thoughtful preparations. She loves the Sweetbreads and I love the Skirt Steak but had an excellent Lamb Chop this last time. Wine menu in Spanish is a bit confusing at times but staff help you navigate it. The only negative is the table spaces are very cramped in most of the restaurant. Overall we keep coming back so that says something.

NAME: LaFleur
REVIEW: Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Loved the ensalada, razor clams, pulpo, setas, confit goat, scallops. New plancha cook was on point. Great service from Stacey. Counter seating a must.

NAME: NicoleF
REVIEW: One of my favorite restaurants!

NAME: Nina
REVIEW: Service was great. Food was pretty good. However, cheese served on salad was just the crust.  I ordered the 5 spice lamb chop. They told me that it would take sometime to cook. When all entrees were served they told me my order was never launched so I had to quickly change to another dish to be able to eat with everyone else.  I was surprised to see they charged me for my dish when they made a horrible mistake for a Michelin rated star.

NAME: Duckie
REVIEW: We went in a week day lunch taking advantage of the restaurant week menu, the food did not disappoint, very up to par ingredients served . Table service good . Last minute , had to changed from 3 to 2 person for dining but the phone did not pick up until my third trials

NAME: SusanM
REVIEW: Charming smaller restaurant. Loved the tiled floor . Food is unusual.  Service friendly. Good location if you have been shopping at 14th St stores.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was delicious

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: If I hang out with close friends, I always choose this restaurant. Every dishes are great and savory. its a bit noisy but no problem for me.

NAME: Peggysmom
REVIEW: The food was delicious and full of flavor.   We felt welcome and our waiter was very pleasant and answered all of our questions.

NAME: mitsu
REVIEW: Nice and cozy place with good Spanish dishes. Very good, I recommend highly.

NAME: BJChelsea
REVIEW: I had great hopes for this restaurant. I went for lunch with a friend during restaurant week. Understanding it’s a tapas restaurant, the portions did not meet its description of lunch. I had Bacalao croquettes to start. Yes the cod is salted, but it was overly salted. The sauce was heavy and unappealing. So the dish was heavy on heavy. For my main I had Gazpacho with Dorado. The postage size  piece of fish was tasty. Sadly the soup was more of a sauce (very thick). The wine, a Navarro rose was great. The restaurant itself is very small and tightly packed tables. Service was perfectly fine. The restaurant has a Michelin Rosette and so I left confused. Unless the restaurant week menu was an afterthought, perhaps the main  menu is better. It’s a sad thing when restaurant week is many times the initial introduction to the cuisine of a restaurant. It didn’t work. I ned not return.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Epic dishes. We had the lamb, foies gras, and the razor clams, which were absolutely amazing.

NAME: KarenHNYC
REVIEW: excellent late afternoon lunch/early dinner ahead of a very early show.  The food was excellent. Service was excellent. The place is small (read: intimate) but a real find.  Thank you!

NAME: hypercritical
REVIEW: Went for restaurant week lunch and they had an extensive menu. Had dorado with gazpacho for main course which was excellent with perfectly cooked dorado. Salad with manchego for first course which was simple but well done. Outstanding chocolate can galleta for dessert. The room is kind of small with moderate noise level when half full at lunch. I suspect higher energy in evening when tables full.

NAME: AmyP
REVIEW: The waiter seems very upset when I asked for balsamic vinegar because it is a Spanish restaurant. When I asked for any vinegar at all, he told me he has sherry vinegar but he is sure I won't like it. We waited for an hour between our appetizer to main entry. The over all experience was poor

NAME: zepus
REVIEW: Place is small, but food is delicious. Price is decent. Nice place, worthy a try.

NAME: haosi
REVIEW: Fantastic food with great value to money. When will they come to HK?

NAME: PeterS
REVIEW: like being back in Madrid. excellent sommelier. review is based on one lunch

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Been coming here for over 10 years..food is great as usual..service can be hit or miss. Our waiter was definitely a miss this time.

NAME: Phoenixnupe
REVIEW: Wow!!  Just wow!!  Aside from the seating being a little tight, the food was just outstanding and the service was on point the entire night!!  The Black Bass was incredible!!  Why the sauce is not served here in the US more is astounding to me!!  Oxtail stuffed peppers was amazing!!!  Red snapper was incredible!!!  5 spice rack of lamb was cooked to perfection!!  No wonder this is a Michelin restaurant!!!  Worthy of all the accolades!!!!!  What an experience!!!  Run don’t walk down here!!  It’s small so make a reservation!

NAME: EdRR
REVIEW: I was extremely disappointed by this place. The place is small and the tables are almost on top of each other. The staff is not very nice including the hostess who needed an attitude adjustment that day. Maybe she was having a bad day. The food was definitely not what I was expecting. My pulpo was burned. This is not a place I would recommend. It was a disappointment.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Comida con muchas salsas y poca calidad. Platos pequeños y con poca cantidad. Servicio mejorable. Calidad precio muy caro.

NAME: WenchieB
REVIEW: Casa Mono exceeded all our expectations: excellent and innovative food, excellent service, just the right ambience all at a very reasonable price. It was such a good dining experience, my husband and I went back the next day for lunch. Casa Mono is a gem and we’re sure to come back over and over again ❤️

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono hasn’t let me down in more than ten years of visits. Everything was spot-on, the food and the service, and I really enjoyed the wine I had alongside.

NAME: ElenaB
REVIEW: Amazing experience in every way - from the food to the wine and the service.

NAME: manacapuru
REVIEW: Great very creative menu. I wish they had a full bar.

NAME: MarkL
REVIEW: Great for what it is supposed to be. Adventurous menu: soft eggs with colatura, walnuts and lime rind; sweetbreads with baby fennel: cod cheeks pil-pil all great. Wine list is well-selected (very well selected) but not much there for The budget conscious.  A go-to fave.

NAME: BEall
REVIEW: We are thanking our friends for recommending this restaurant to us. We loved the food. It is a tiny place, perhaps the only minus being that seating is tight. The sides are open, though, weather permitting, which is very nice in general and also keeps you connected to the pleasant surrounding neighborhood.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Best food and wine pairing. Would go back.. again.. and again!

NAME: RandR
REVIEW: The food at Casa Mono was incredibly delicious - and some dishes delicately layered with many unique flavors.  The problem with that is that it was incongruous with the loud, energetic atmosphere.  The more complex dishes were hard to appreciate in their entirety, which is a shame as they are indeed delicious.  Our server, Joro, was outstanding and made the night just that more enjoyable.

NAME: MandyH
REVIEW: The food itself was very tasty. However, they were not kidding when they said the portions were plats and require about 8-12 of plats to feed a table of four. The food came on tiny plates and as someone who can barely finish a bowl of ramen, I walked out of the restaurant hungry. We weren't sure if we liked the taste so we ordered five plats for four people. Usually, this was more than enough for us. However, we each had one single bite out of each dish. It also didn't help the dining experience that the servers took forever to refill our water and get us that missing set of silverware for our fourth person.

NAME: LoriK
REVIEW: Food was FABULOUS and wine list incredible.  This was our first time dining at Casa Mono so we went with our waiter’s recommendations.  They were excellent and the wine pairings perfect.  Can’t recommend this establishment highly enough!

NAME: BunnyRabbit
REVIEW: Exceptional food and a decent selection of Spanish wines. It's a bit tight and it doesn't feel like you're at a great place, but don't be fooled!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We were recommended to go to Casa Momo for a group of work colleagues that were there last year. We were very exited about going and me specially since i leaved in Spain for 7 years and LOVE their food and people. Overall experience was ok only because our server recommendation was not accurate at all, we were 4 women's she recommended 3 plates each since they were small, i know tapas are small but 3 each seems a lot specially when prices are not Spanish tapas prices. We ask if we could request some and see how we were going and request a few more after, she said no since the kitchen like to have all the order together, well in Spain you ask tapas as you go so little disappointed there . We went with the server recommendation...big mistake by the tame we got our last round of food they took the plates without being touch big waste of food and money. All the rest was fine ambience food was excellent and the fact our plates and silverware were changed every time was nice too. Will definitely come back but not following server advice .

NAME: 1TP1
REVIEW: Consistently a marvelous experience.  The authenticity of flavors, on the plate & in the glass, is extraordinary.  Expert service and magnificent wine list.

NAME: MRae
REVIEW: Great small restaurant that I wish I had in my hometown. Excellent food. Creative and yummy. I will return for another experience next time I’m in NYC!

NAME: LucijaB
REVIEW: It was much better than i expected. Great food, good ambiance, cute little restaurant with casual atmosphere. We enjoyed every dish on our table, very interesting and unique taste. Loved it! Will definitely come back

NAME: WilliamW
REVIEW: My wife and I sat at the bar for drinks and dinner, and had a fantastic waitress, named, I believe, Anna.  he gave us suggestions, all of which were delicious.  The restaurant had a fun neighborhood vibe.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Very good, creative menu

NAME: LenaH
REVIEW: Good food served in such a small room that the servers aren’t even used to their restricted space.  A bit uncomfortable since they are usually bumping into your chair :/

NAME: JonMero
REVIEW: Fun,delishious and worth every penny!

NAME: jbeats
REVIEW: You go for the food, which is superior... space is tight but welcoming and you can definitely talk to you companion (unlike other small places, think Mimi’s which is intolerable)... and the wine list is spectacular.  The food is super exciting without being weird - pitch perfect!

NAME: ADeatwell
REVIEW: Have been here many times over the years. This time the food was very uninspiring. The fedios were tasteless and greasy, with almost no chorizos and few tiny clams. The duck was a very small portion. The creme  brûlée was more carmelized sugar than anything else, and the fried bay leaf was absurd, since we were warned not to eat the bay leaf. Tables as always are right on top of one another and the service was very slow!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: All dishes i ordered were really great Service was good but a bit noisy to talk I always highly recommend this place to my friends

NAME: EugeneF
REVIEW: The food and wine is always stellar. I especially loved the creme brûlée with the fried bay leaf donuts.

NAME: francoiseJ
REVIEW: Both the food and the service were excellent.  My main criterion for restaurants these days is to discover something I would not know how to make at home, and this restaurant qualifies.  The flavors are a very successful and unusual blend of ingredients, creative but not weird, and the small plates allow for sampling a wide range of tastes.   Our server, Anna, was knowledgeable, efficient but not overbearing, a delight also.  We shall be back.

NAME: MicheleL
REVIEW: Friends birthday

NAME: LuisR
REVIEW: Absolutely my favorite tapas restaurant in the US. Been a fan since 2010.  Gets better every year.  Love the staff and the food.  There is no better Spanish wine menu anywhere in the country.  Big fan

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Red snapper was to die for and the service was impeccable! Look forward to going back

NAME: Phbnyc
REVIEW: We'd been several times to Casa Mono, always loving it, but it had been a while since our last visit. This was a slightly disappointing experience in that despite my having specified when I made the reservation that it was my husband's birthday, when we ordered dessert there was no acknowledgment of the occasion. In the past when we go out to a nice restaurant on a special occasion, they put a candle in the dessert and/or write "Happy Birthday" on the plate. Something! This time, nothing. That was kind of disappointing. Also, the waiter was slightly aloof and splashed some wine when he poured it for us. Felt rushed.

NAME: M2MHNWBend
REVIEW: Wonderful and authentic Spanish tapas. Great flavor combinations and extensive wine selection. Sit at the kitchen bar area and watch the food artists at work.

NAME: JoeP
REVIEW: I’m not a Michelin reviewer, but I think I understand why they have received a star for at least the seven years.  The pulpo was amazing, I brought my 11 and 13 year old as well as my 79 year old mother and my wife.  3 generations ate and enjoyed a terrific meal.   My favorite restaurant in NYC!

NAME: salemwitch
REVIEW: very attentive service, delicious food, and a fun place to go for a bite--esply if you sit at the bar.

NAME: Susie
REVIEW: Outstanding and very creative kitchen in combination with great service and great wine list - bravo!

NAME: Adjue
REVIEW: Great food! Really good wine. Ambiance good as well. Not cheap.... especially the wine

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: El menú delicioso y la atención de Ana magnífica igual que aus recomendaciones

NAME: ChristiQ
REVIEW: Delicious!  Fabulous seafood prepared perfectly. Octopus was excellent. Great service.

NAME: James
REVIEW: Great spot for Spanish tapas especially Costa Brava cuisine. Comfy and intimate will definitely come back!

NAME: Nellie
REVIEW: Excellent tapas restaurant. Very small dining area with few tables. Also bar seating. Great food and varied selection.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono is one of my happy places. The food is impeccable. The wine deliriously wonderful. James  D. has been my server a few times now and never steers me wrong.   I sit at the bar drinking wine ,eating and reading  contentedly.

NAME: BradTrent
REVIEW: This place always delivers. The food is continually spot-on, the staff is lovely and it all adds up to the most unfussy one-Star dining experience I can think of.

NAME: RXK8198
REVIEW: Overall an excellent meal, very good wines by the glass.  Tapas consistently of a high standard. The experience was marred, however, by the "helicopter" waiter--not working our table--who as he passed our table swooped in to take dishes off the table without asking, took my plate while my wife was still eating, grabbed the wine carafes before they had been emptied.  Never stopped to pour the wine. This showed a lack of training or, if trained in this way, then it reflected a strategy to rush diners along--either way not acceptable.

NAME: BrianB
REVIEW: Not to be dramatic- but best, most innovative food in the city in a casual atmosphere in a great neighborhood.

NAME: KateH
REVIEW: I have to be honest, it was hard for me to even enjoy my food and wine with the chaos of this restaurant.  I have a hard time understanding how this restaurant deserves a Michelin star with the noise levels and general overcrowded nature of the restaurant.

NAME: Sbb70
REVIEW: Casa Mono is consistent in serving delicious meals and great wine. You can’t go wrong!

NAME: Zilda
REVIEW: Exceptional, inventive food that isn’t show-offy or pretentious. Just magic

NAME: Douglas
REVIEW: Never disappoints. Been there more than a dozen times for our "Tapas fix", and they are consistent with a friendly, informative and professional staff.

NAME: JoeStevensNYC
REVIEW: Casa Mono never ever disappoints. Today’s brunch was soooo good!! The service is quick and simply amazing. The food is to die for and the smells and sounds and ambience. Love this place, best seafood based tapas...everything tastes better with chorizo. 😜 🥦🥖🍷🦞🦐🐙 #NYCFoodie #FoodBeast #Zagat #OpenTable #Resy #GoodFood #Eats #NewCityEats #NYCEats #Nomnom #Food #EatWell #EatingWell #FoodPorn #FoodGasm #HealthyFats #FoodGram #Brunch #SaturdayBrunch #BrunchFood #Gourmet #Nutritious #Delicious #Café #FoodCulture #DevourPower #EatFamous #CasaMono

NAME: AngelaW
REVIEW: tiny place sublime food wonderful attentive wait staff

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Service is not good. Food was good.

NAME: mrbillnyc
REVIEW: Always the best food and service! It gets better everytime!

NAME: RonanW
REVIEW: Been a big fan for many years, at most recent dinner here I noticed the first fall off in food quality I have ever seen here. The razor clams were fundamentally disappointing for example.

NAME: Taste
REVIEW: I love the food and wine at Casa Mono. The muscles with chorizo currently on the menu is bowl licking good. Everything is tasty and will remind travelers of Spain. I love that they change the menu up seasonally to keep things fresh. It's just a little louder and more cramped than I would like. I'll go back for the food of course.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food is always off the charts - amazing meal. Servers could have been a little more friendly otherwise a great experience as always

NAME: Atul
REVIEW: Enjoyed a birthday lunch.   Was greeted with a glass of champagne by our server, Stephanie.     The entire meal and experience was amazing.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Incredibly disappointed with casa mono.   Some of the food came out cold (lamb chops) and the waiter said—these just came off the grill.  -no need to argue with us.  They were cold.   Our other dishes were mediocre and overall, just a bad meal...and not cheap either.   I am almost always satisfied/happy with every nyc dining experience and casa Mono simply failed at food and service.

NAME: jacquelineW
REVIEW: PRETENTIOUS, PRETENTIOUS, PRETENTIOUS  FOOD!!!!!! I HAVE HAD SOME BAD MEALS IN NYC BUT THIS RANKS UP THERE IN THE TOP 3!!!!! FIRST YOU NEEDED A MAGNIFYING GLASS TO SEE THE FOOD!!!! WHEN THE SO CALLED BACALAO CROQUETAS CAME OUT I KNOW I WAS IN FOR A DISASTROUS  MEAL!!!!  I HAVE HAD FROZEN FISH STICKS THAT TASTE BETTER AND THE JARRED AIOLI SERVED WITH IT TASTED LIKE IT WAS FROM THE JAR. THE RESTAURANT ADVERTISED OXTAILS WHAT A SURPRISE WHEN THOSE 2 LITTLE PEPPERS CAME TO MY TABLE WITH MAYBE 2 OZ. OF SHREDDED MEAT INSIDE (NEXT TIME MY AUNT MAKES OXTAILS I'LL INVITE THE CHEF OVER TO SHOW HIM HOW THIS DISH IS DONE) THE ONLY SAVING GRACE OUT OF THIS DISASTER WAS THE SWEET LADY WHO WAITED ON ME. I WON'T BE GOING BACK TO THIS CRUMMY RESTAURANT AND I WON'T BE RECOMMENDING IT TO ANYONE EITHER

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Bacalao croquetas were a little too salty. Foie gras was great. Oxtail stuffed in peppers was also creative and delicious. Nice wine list.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Nice and tasty place for tapas or small sharing plates.

NAME: Scar
REVIEW: Enjoyed the food very much. We ordered the NY restaurant week menu and the selections are well prepared and presented. Nice experience. Would come again.

NAME: MademoiselleBao
REVIEW: beautiful meal. made me discover and feel in love with shellfish. amazing staff.

NAME: nibbles
REVIEW: Great food. Great food. Great food. Great food. Great food. Great food.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Love, love,love. Spanish wines, fantastic food and service

NAME: luisc
REVIEW: No era lo que esperábamos del restaurant. Se califica como un gran español pero no tiene nada de bueno. De los 4 platos que pedimos no hacías uno.  Definitivamente no regresaremos

NAME: TimberMom
REVIEW: The food was delicious, I must say. Our server was friendly, attentive, knowledgeable, courteous - I was very happy. they had interesting wine choices, and the glasses were nice (simple, thin, with the right sound & weight). We went for the Restaurant Week lunch. It was a 2-course, not 3, and the main dish was basically a tapas size, I thought. The ambiance is ok but not particularly special, and very little room to maneuver between tables. Pricy & small servings - but very delicious:))

NAME: YvonneM
REVIEW: Visiting from out of town, this was our first visit to Casa Mono. We went for a Wednesday lunch and did not have to wait to be seated. The restaurant was about half full. We sat at the counter where we could watch the food being prepared. It was Restaurant week, so there was a fixed price menu. I had the salt cod croquettes, which were very tasty, with a citrus aioli , which I found to be a little oily. For main course I had the dorado fish with a red pepper almond sauce. It was delicious. As a starter my friend had the meat croquette and then the oxtail stuffed peppers, both of which he enjoyed a lot. He had the only beer on the menu and I had a carafe of the house white. Both were very nice and reasonably priced. The restaurant is small but it was not too crowded so that was fine. The servers were all very pleasant and friendly, helping to explain the menu - which we needed. It was an excellent experience and I would not hesitate to go back.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food is very good! The service is 7.5/10.  Will recommend to my friends because of the taste of the food.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We went for the restaurant week but we also ordered additional dishes from the menu ... the best patatas bravas we have ever had !! Great wine and amazing desserts

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Terrible food!

NAME: carylnyc
REVIEW: Have been meaning to go to Casa Mono for years --so happy to have made it finally. All the foods we ate were delicious --variety of fish and lamb and veggies.......all tasty.  Tables are small and shaky --but adds to relaxed atmosphere ---

NAME: jhh1
REVIEW: Great food in a cramped space.  But not cheap.  Worth the trip for the food.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Let’s get the bad stuff out of the way first.    The noise level is horrific.   You can only talk to someone else by shouting with your head bent towards them.    The illumination is so low that we were not able to read the menu or the wine list.    I could not read the numbers on the check when it came time to pay.   A waitress read them for me.  The staff were very helpful.    The food is really good.     If conversation over dinner is important, this is not the place to go.    Bring your own illumination, then you will be able to read the menu, wine list and check.    What a pity.    If only we could get the food without the noise.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food is excellent as usual. Wine and dessert Recs were great too

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Bien en general. Inflexibles algo al querer ampliar el horario

NAME: elise
REVIEW: Food was delicious. A good place for a small group or a date

NAME: ChrisS
REVIEW: Excellent tapas: recommend skirt steak and pork belly most highly.  Good service.  In/out in reasonable time, ate pre-show.

NAME: maubo
REVIEW: 100 por ciento recomendable es pequeño el lugar pero acogedor la comida muy buena e innovadora en cada platillo pruebas algo nuevo y diferente no es tan caro aunque tampoco es un lugar barato. A mi en lo personal no me encantan las tapas y aun asi lo disfrute mucho y el trato fue bueno. Un detalle curioso aunque el restaurante es de inspiracion española la musica que ponen es primordialmente latina por lo que me senti como en casa aunque hubiera estado bien escuchar algo español.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was excellent the waiter was great unfortunately the manager could not accommodate another person at our table and we had to leave.

NAME: MRose
REVIEW: Great scallops and creamy eggs with Uni. Always a treat.

NAME: NickT
REVIEW: Highlight of our NY trip. We honestly didn’t know what we had gotten ourselves in to, but the food was so diverse and wonderful. Nothing disappointed. We experienced nothing but great food the whole week, but this came out on top. The dining area is a little cramped but that quickly leaves your mind once the food arrives.   Pro Tip: arrive a little early and head over to their wine bar next door. They will bring your drinks to your table if you’re called over and the place is super cool.  Have to get: Scallops in Green Curry if still available.

NAME: EmilyS
REVIEW: every bite was delicious and our server was excellent.

NAME: Mayzbee
REVIEW: Half birthday

NAME: AJDEsq
REVIEW: Fourth or Fifth visit to Casa. Quality of the food is there but that's about where the positives end. Very, very cramped seating. Very difficult to be comfortable. Not inexpensive so if you are ok shelling out while being cramped then fine, but it's a tough slog to pay up and yet not be able to be relaxed.

NAME: local
REVIEW: I love the place. the menu is creative and I try to get in there once a year. This time 4 out of five of the dishes were outstanding but one fell short. The Cod Cheeks needed another minute under the broiler because they were too raw even for me and a bit chewy. Besides that minor glitch, the place rocked and I will be back. Keep in mind that this is a tiny space with small tables so, if your planning on taking out your "BIG FRIEND" perhaps you re-think this spot or call the hostess and ask for one of the larger tables.

NAME: LJOB
REVIEW: If you are a tapas fan and you ou want the best of the best, this place is for you.  We opted for a lunch visit as we couldn’t get an evening reservation. First advice ...sit at the bar so you can watch the magic happen. The food is absolutely delicious!!  We couldn’t stop ordering as we wanted to try everything, and each dish was fabulous in its own right.  A few highlights include the grilled octopus paired with grapefruit segments, fluke with radish and pineapple salsa, goat confit (a 24 hour process to make), razor clams (one my must haves when on the menu), lamb sausage, and sea urchins with beautiful creamy scrambled egg.  Now you understand why we had to cancel our dinner reservation!!  The food and atmosphere are amazing!!  You won’t be disappointed!!!

NAME: Katherine
REVIEW: The tapas were delicious, especially the scrambled eggs with sea urchin, but the service was underwhelming. The servers did not make us feel very welcome.

NAME: RichS
REVIEW: Excellent meal, the only disappointment was that the razor clams weren’t available.

NAME: AntonioB
REVIEW: Never got a table. Hostess was very unpolite

NAME: Delicious
REVIEW: By New York standards, I was not impressed with Casa Mono. For Spanish fusion tapas style food I found it to fall short. It was overpriced for the portions and I didn’t find the risks taken with the cuisine to be worthwhile. The lamb with tomatillo sauce was quite disappointing and actually undercooked. (I say this as a medium rare girl, who doesn’t even mind it a hair closer on the rare side.)  It was decent in that it was cozy and charming. The marmalade and sobrasada appetizer was a redeeming part of the meal, but not worth a second visit.

NAME: SusanS
REVIEW: The food and everything else were wonderful.  My friend and I thoroughly enjoyed it.  I hadn’t been there in years but now look forward to getting there often

NAME: eagleeyes
REVIEW: The best of everything at fair prices!  Great spot, especially at not too noisy off hours.

NAME: Whnyc
REVIEW: Disappointed that menu at restaurant was much abbreviated than what was shown on website. However, every seafood dish selected was fresh, flavorful, and cooked to perfection.

NAME: Robb
REVIEW: Very cold when the door opens. Space extremely small.

NAME: hoipolloi
REVIEW: Food was great as always. Just because you sit at the bar doesn’t mean that you should be ignored/invisible.   Zero hospitality and a big let down.

NAME: Douglas
REVIEW: Always consistently excellent, with friendly and helpful staff

NAME: ymmmy
REVIEW: Great food. We ordered 5 small plates and 1 dessert for 2 people. Loved 5 out of the 6 dishes. We were a little uncertain about the sea urchin with walnuts but the ingredients are of good quality. The foie gras is one of the best I had in the city so far (though the sauce could be a little less salty). Our server is very friendly and passionate. Definitely on the list of worth revisiting.

NAME: LW007
REVIEW: Phenomenal experience at Casa Mono. Every bite was an explosion of flavor and savored every bite. The sommelier helped us pick an amazing bottle of wine which was superb with the meal. Highly recommend for special occasions. It is expensive but definitely worth it.

NAME: squadoosh
REVIEW: we liked every single thing about this place. we liked every single thing about this place.

NAME: Nick
REVIEW: Seating and table size made this restaurant not recommended  Dinner was not enjoyable with strangers on top of you

NAME: EmmaG

REVIEW: Small cosy happening restaurant. Nice dinner experience.

NAME: aLib

REVIEW: Outstanding service , food was prepared  perfectly great flavor combinations. Wil l recommend to everyone.

REVIEW: Loved the warmth of this place.  Also the bar next door Bar Jamon is a must visit.

NAME: ViX1
REVIEW: very friendly and witty waiter made our dinner outing a super fun evening

NAME: NIcholas

The chef has taken some creative license with traditional Spanish tapas and in every instance I tried, the outcome was delicious.  I have not eaten a lot of goat in my lifetime but I will certainly order goat when I next return to Casa Mono!  Great desserts as well.

REVIEW: Great Food. Seating way to tight.  Noisy Loud because so small is f eating area.

NAME: OpenTable Diner

NAME: ManuelR
REVIEW: Casa Mono  is my favorite restaurant in NYC.  And I was surprised to find that at lunchtime it  is kid-friendly.

NAME: Micheke
REVIEW: Flavorful dining. A menu that stands out.

NAME: LaFleur
REVIEW: Fantastic tapas in a fun atmosphere. Great Spanish wine list. Be sure the order the ensalada Mono, razor clams, and scallops. Also the whole animal menu is phenomenal. Sit at the chef counter and watch the plates fly. Enjoy.

NAME: JandEfromNYC
REVIEW: Went for a birthday celebration- food and service was fabulous. We’ll return.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: food is  really nice and beyond expectation. Unfortunately they sold out razor when we came.

NAME: soprano
REVIEW: Excellent cuisine, but a bit too rushed. I took my daughter here for lunch. We ordered four dishes - (1) Confit Goat with Avocado Queso, Scallion Ash, and Pistachios; (2) Creamy Eggs with Sea Urchin, Walnuts, Lime and Ancient Anchovy Oil; (3) Fluke Crudo with Blood Orange, Lemon and Ancho Dust; and (4) Scallops with Serrano Pepper Green Curry and Minted Cashews. All four were very good but only two were outstanding. Both of us found the creamy eggs with sea urchin just a bit too rich. We loved the confit goat and the avocado in that dish was extraordinary (seemed to be grilled, bursting with flavor). We also loved the scallops with green curry. The fluke crude was okay but not that interesting. So we'd go there again, but we'd be careful about ordering. However, one thing that wasn't great is that we were essentially rushed through our meal. Between when we arrived and when we got our bill was maybe 30 or 40 minutes. A bit too fast for any Michelin starred restaurant.  Not sure how to get them to slow down.

NAME: EdaC
REVIEW: Good/great food, OK service.

NAME: MAAS
REVIEW: Food was amazing, each dish was better than then prior; rabbit was off the charts...

NAME: christina
REVIEW: amazing amazing food! didnt really look into the menu beforehand but they serve small plates which are the perfect size for two people. my boyfriend and i ordered six plates and it was just the right amount of food. we loved the pork belly and scallops!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: 料理もサービスもとても良かったです！ また利用させて頂きます！

NAME: OpenTable Diner

NAME: Hamilton

The creamy eggs with sea urchin was my favorite. The seating is very tight which is why I prefer to eat at the bar. What is my overall assessment of Casa Mono? I don’t return to a restaurant that doesn’t satisfy my quest for great food. As I said at the beginning, I have eaten at Casa Mono many times.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: One of the best restaurants in the city!! You have to try the Spanish sobrasada and Foie gras with cinco cebollas, everything on the menu was so good!!

NAME: SigG
REVIEW: It is a small restaurant on the corner, quite cute, but honestly I could not understand why they have one michlen star. There is nothing remarkable or unique about it. Yes it is nice and interesting concept of small plates which typically you would need 5-8 for two. There are around 12 tables, the seating is not  comfortable, very small tables and chairs so its a challenge to try to fit right and we struggled. Service is fair, but not excellent, waiter was quite impatient and gave judgmental looks when you would ask to repeat or exlain stuff, but on a positive note brought everything we ordered without time wait, Some dishes were good, while others like sausage for example was very salty  and not tasting so great so i could not finish it. Desserts were not delicious at all. place was clean, including the bathroom. But in my opinion not worth the price tag and nothing to remember about.

I love Battali's other restaurants, but Casa Mono didn't hit the mark for me. I might try again during dinner and get different dishes (other than the clams), but for brunch this is a huge pass for me.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Fantastic food and service

REVIEW: We have been coming here for 10 years, never disappointed with any of their dishes or wine.

NAME: RowlandH

NAME: ArgenmexFamily
REVIEW: I ordered octopus and it was really hard. My husband ordered the bone marrow and he really enjoyed it.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: It was one of the best meals I’ve had in a very long time!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We had an amazing experience celebrating our anniversary! We’ve been there many times but Fernando made it extra special. Thank you!!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Visited Casa Mono for NY Restaurant Week & wasn’t disappointed. The food is impressively fresh & the staff is very attentive (they came over to level our table).

I’m definitely looking forward to visiting this place again.

REVIEW: This is one of our favorite spots but the food was not as memorable tonight as it usually is

NAME: WilliamP
REVIEW: “Sometimes monkey business is the best business of all” -curious george

NAME: myosh

REVIEW: One of my favorites in NYC!

NAME: Bram
REVIEW: I went for a late lunch, and it was very comfortable, quiet, with excellent service, interesting wine, and excellent food.

NAME: PodF
REVIEW: Top class food with exceptional and welcoming service. Treated like we were regulars even though it was only our second visit.  Would highly recommend for a very relaxed but very high standard dining experience. Great wine list with excellent recommendations.  Will definitely return on next visit to NYC

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Wonderful tapas, great ambience. Wonderful lunch options

NAME: ItsGVH
REVIEW: My wife and I have been going to Casa Mono since we first met and it never disappoints.  Sit at the bar/chef table enjoy the view of the chefs doing what they do best.    Casa Mono is our happy place.

NAME: LarryW
