REVIEW: Wife and I dined at Casa Mono on a Sunday evening while visiting NYC... we felt rushed..had to order all our plates..5 of them at the same time..we thought they would come one at a time..but no 2 came the as soon as they were done here come the other 3..several of the plates got cold..we had all of our plated within 20 minutes...I did talk to the manager and she took one plate off the bill explaining that this standard serving procedure for this restaurant ..we prefer more relaxed dining so I doubt we go back

NAME: RobertoV
REVIEW: It would be great if the chefs behind the counter would smile from time to time.  The kitchen is in the middle of the restaurant, chefs should be open to it ...

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: It was loud and really cramped and we were seated at a table with two strangers, which wasn't really ideal since my fiancé and I had gotten engaged earlier that night. Service was very good, food was solid.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was good and so were the staff.  However it was big plate pricing for small (tapas) plates. The dining room is very small but cute. Needless to say I have had much better tapas for a fraction of the price.

NAME: Ktnyan
REVIEW: My absolute favorite restaurant in NY. Never disappoints me. The counter in front of the chef is definitely recommended!

NAME: marty
REVIEW: Amazing food, notably the mackarel and flank steak.  The brussel sprouts were disappointing as they are deep friend but everything else was excellent.  The wine recommendation was also bang on.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was ok Very small place you can't even move

NAME: JesperS
REVIEW: Very nice restaurant! We visited for a Saturday lunch in late February and had a mix of servings from the menu. Top service, extremely well tasting food. Great cozy/busy feel. We can imagine it gets even better on a warm summer evening!

NAME: JoseManuel
REVIEW: Excellent food and outstanding service, I will Come back very soon

NAME: chrise
REVIEW: Great meal, great service. Quiet and intimate space.

NAME: WILLIAML
REVIEW: Glass all around and packed room make for horrendous noise. Food is excellent made of small plates for sharing,  just bring earmuffs...

NAME: ScottAB
REVIEW: Same as it ever was; excellent........................!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Solid food and wine list. Space is super tight but that's NYC

NAME: Tia99
REVIEW: Wonderful Spanish restaurant.  Went on a Monday night and loved it.  Razor Clams are amazing!  Loved the Quail too.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Highlights included the pork belly, stuffed quail, and Fideos with chorizo and clams.  Fantastic wines by the glass as well.  The restaurant is pretty tight quarters but the service was fantastic and we received great recommendations.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I'd been wanting to go here for ages but it was always booked.  My favorite dishes were the steak and the bruschetta but everything was good.  Really enjoyed the wine choices as well.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great for late-night dining (it is Spanish-themed, after all).  The menu is beautifully conceived and executed and the wine list is outstanding.  Our waiter was very attentive.  A favorite when we are in New York.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent tapas and larger plates, with good accompanying wine list. It's a snug place, so it gets a bit crowded fairly quickly. If you show up more than a few minutes before your reservation, they're liable to shunt you off to their Bar Jamon, next door, which is a good place to start your first glass of wine.

NAME: Nube
REVIEW: Wonderful creative Spanish meal! The appetizers of fluke carpaccio and pan seared octopus were stellar as was the branzino.....

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great food, but in small amount😂😂😂

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Impecable service.

NAME: Atilla
REVIEW: Impressive.....even during restaurant week the menu, the kitchen and the staff are first rate.  Unlike some restaurants that prepackage (dear I say, 'reheat') or 'dumb down' their restaurant week offerings....not the case here....the dishes were every bit as good and prepared with the same level of attention as I have experienced during my other visits.    As always, I think the seating is not great (too cramped...hence the 4-star for overall), but the food is so good and the service so seamless that I take the seating as a price worth bearing in order to experience the food, service and 'feel' of this consistently good restaurant.  Highly recommended.

NAME: kave
REVIEW: We had a wonderful experience at Casa Mono! Everything was great - the delicious food prepared right in front of us, the courteous service, and cosy atmosphere! Definitely recommend and will come back to explore more.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Anniversary

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This place is great! It was my second time going and it was even better this time around.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Staff is well  mannered , food is excellent ! Will def come again !!

NAME: ronc
REVIEW: Over fried and over salted. Don't be seduced

NAME: Nickidom
REVIEW: Incredible tapas menu. Great variety. Delicious.

NAME: Stas
REVIEW: One of the best restaurants in NY;  consistently excellent.

NAME: alwayshungry
REVIEW: Despite being a rainy Sunday evening the restaurant was lively throughout our meal. The space is not large so the tables were close together but the unpretentious vibe gives it a cozy feel, as one would expect at a bar in Spain. Dishes are boldly flavored; the razor clams and charcuterie board I particularly recommend. Definitely leave room for dessert.

NAME: KatherineG
REVIEW: Our waiter was fabulous. He helped w/wine selection and organizing our tapas order. Wine and food were very tasty.  Waiter was very helpful and customer conscious. Ambiance was comfortable. Tables are a little close as I kept bumping stuff when getting in/out. Minor. But glad mo one was sitting at next table;)

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Very small, cramped space, extremely loud music which led to diners nearly screaming to have a conversation.  The food was just ok.  We arrived around 10pm for our reservation and, given that it's a tapas place, we asked if could order a couple of dishes at a time, because even when the kitchen spaces them out, it all tends to come out very closely together.  Our server seemed annoyed with our request and then seemed to actively ignored us when we were ready to order.  By the time we had finished our first set of dishes, crudo and cod croquetas, the place was half empty, so I don't know why asking to take our time was such a big deal.

NAME: Amy1
REVIEW: Great neighborhood spot.  Wonderful food and wine, relaxing atmosphere, welcoming vibe.  What more could you ask for?

NAME: 108NYC
REVIEW: Food was even better than I remembered (and that was very very good)! Outstanding. Service was incredible server was so knowledgeable. We were pre-theater 5:15 so may explain the quiet noise level. A real gem.

NAME: flo2lux
REVIEW: Tapas at their best! I keep going and going to this small restaurant @ Irving place because their food is phenomenal and the atmosphere really good! Each tapas is tasty and their Spanish wines are really good. If you can have a place at the counter you can enjoy the cooking show ! One of my favorite place in the city

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Poor food. Overpriced wines.

NAME: jrbernardi
REVIEW: The tables were tiny and packed together like cells in a beehive. Unfortunately they seated someone right on top of us. That person talked loudly and incessantly. I could barely hear what my guest was saying. The food was good, although too salty, even though we requested that they not oversalt.

NAME: DanZ
REVIEW: Honestly, for a Michelin star reataurant, I was disappointed. For the price, go to any one of the thousand other tapas restaurants in NYC. Service was great though. They really were on top of their game and had pride in their job, which was much appreciated during a mediocre meal. This place did not live up to the hype. Duck=chewy, quail=salty, goat=off putting, sea urchin=scrambled eggs (if you have had this dish you know what I mean). On the other hand, the burrata and fluke crudo were pretty good. Maybe I ordered the wrong items on the menu, but I definitely would not recommend nor will I go there again. As a Batali fan this was a total letdown.

NAME: FrankH
REVIEW: What a great place.  Close to the subway.  Intimate setting.  Great wine list.  Great menu.

NAME: PatiPalma
REVIEW: Great Spanish tapas. Fabulose Spanish wine selection

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Incredible food.  Beautifully presented, amazing flavors, really creative menu well executed, and very extensive wine list.  True to Spain and Tapas

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great tapas bar, probably the best I've been to in Manhattan.  Jamon is the best in the city although not up to the same standards as the jamon in Spain. Great ambiance and great wine selection

NAME: Fitzdrum
REVIEW: The food was outstanding and our server was fantastic. HOWEVER, the Hostess is not fit to work at any restaurant let alone an establishment that prides itself on quality. She opened the doors late, but worse, when a colleague joined us after we ran up a bill of $500+, she said we must move tables - the restaurant was half empty. In addition, the restaurant sent me a link to review the experience, but the site has a bug and my review could not be submitted. This occurred after I spent 10 minutes writing it. This WAS a great restaurant, but it is showing signs of failing. I can no longer recommend it.

NAME: KirstenP
REVIEW: Wonderful intimate restaurant with inventive food.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Amazing tapas! Great food such as the razor clams and the bone marrow! Try the baby clams! Great selection of Spanish wine! Great service and ambience! Will return!!!

NAME: rons
REVIEW: We cannot come and visit NYC without dining at Casa Mono. It is truly our favorite restaurant in Manhattan!

NAME: Doug
REVIEW: I wish it is more value based then just tasting the larger than tapas.   Also, the wine menu should be more like the European style rather than the US wine menu style.   Maybe I had too much expectation for Casa Mono being all the stars (from NYT and Michellin) but I was somewhat disappointed.   I still like the bone marrow and squids but others were not outstanding....

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: My husband and I absolutely love Casa Mono! Every dish here is phenomenal...expertly prepared with quality ingredients! Highly recommend this restaurant to all my friends who are foodies!

NAME: JeromeV
REVIEW: food was good, but desserts slight letdown. serivce a little sloppy. place is very tight

NAME: ChairmanMeeow
REVIEW: Amazing meal, delicately prepared and expertly served. Knowledgeable handling of food allergy requests.

NAME: TrianaTeresa
REVIEW: A charming, intimate space with top notch service and exquisite tapas.  The fois gras and skirt steak were sublime.

NAME: JennyE
REVIEW: We had a great time at Casa Mono. There were 4 of us and we ordered 8 dinner items plus 2 desserts. Had the meat & cheese plate, Brussels sprouts, scallops,  salad, quail, razor clams, lamb, skirt steak, chocolate ganache, and creams brûlée. We loved it all. It was a fun experience too with the small plates.

NAME: Marietta
REVIEW: Casa Mono was just as good as I remember it 7 years ago. Beautiful room, even better food. We let the waiter pick 7 tapas for us. All were great. Fideos were exceptional. Order a Cortado with your dessert.

NAME: oanjao
REVIEW: Casa Mono is a tiny little tapas restaurant with a lot of character. It's expensive, but it's a good value for a special occasion. The food was excellent, and even the cheapest "by the glass" wines are good. You can spend as much as you want to on wine at Casa Mono.

NAME: jenesais
REVIEW: Strangely quiet even for a lunch time, thank goodness. This is a tiny space usually only do-able for the slim with perfect hearing and no intimacies to convey across the minute tables.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was excellent but the hostess rushing us through dinner and wine at the end of the meal because "the next reservation had already arrived and was waiting" completely ruined the experience for us. The poor review on service doesn't reflect our waiter, who was lovely.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great. The food is great, the atmosphere is great, the staff are attentive....it. Is a brilliant restaurant where you feel like you could sit for an entire evening. Perfect

NAME: JoeP
REVIEW: We had the last reservation of the night, and sat at the bar in front of the kitchen.  From the recommendation of the wine, to the recommendations for dinner, everything was terrific.  Although we were the last out, we never felt rushed.  An absolutely fantastic place.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: It's been a while since I've been here, but I was sadly disappointed with the food.  In the past, it has been inventive and flavorful, but I found it bland and unexciting this time.  We had the pan con tomate, squid, duck breast and scallops.  It made me sad that it wasn't a great meal.

NAME: gregs
REVIEW: Great restaurant.  A young Chef named Tyler was amazing to watch work.  Dishes are so creative and the atmosphere is energetic.  One of NY's best.

NAME: LJVPB
REVIEW: This is a cozy, comfortable place with knowledgeable servers. The dishes were very good to outstanding. We shared four plates and two different wines and we were quite happy with our experience. We'd eat here again!

NAME: Lovemyfood
REVIEW: Very slow and inattentive service. Need improvement.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Each dish better than the next. One of a kind in NYC. Feels like you are in Spain.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This was our second time eating here in the past month or so.  We travel a lot so we are afforded the opportunity to eat great food from all over.  With out a doubt this is our favorite restaurant all around.  We can not wait to come back again.  The bone marrow rocks!!!!

NAME: JoeB
REVIEW: Awesome place.   Very diverse small plates menu Excellent service.    I stop here every time I come to Manhattan.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Pricey with small portions but with absolutely exquisite flavors.

NAME: Mike
REVIEW: The cafe is very intimate and therefore a bit loud but also very cozy.

NAME: RichardM
REVIEW: First visit, thoroughly enjoyable, early dining before it became too boisterous (for us).  The sausage, duck, scallops and snapper were all delicious with seasonings and variations from the usual.  The "Spanish prosecco" was a good start to the meal, and the overall wine selection opened up new tastes.

NAME: Choly
REVIEW: Too many tables crammed into a very small space. Food was pretend Spanish. The only acceptable dish was pan con tomate and the crema catalana. Do not waste your time or money. Very disappointed.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Small and cozy!  Outstanding wine and food!  Service was attentive but not overbearing! Home run in my opinion. I cannot wait to go back.

NAME: RedGinji
REVIEW: I had the roasted marrow bones. Simply delectable. The accompanying mushrooms and toast were perfection. More imagination.  Better than I have had in Paris! My husband had the lamb sausage and skiry steak. Both deLooking forward to trying more tapas.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Was fine - nothing to write home about.  The space is nice but cramped.  Lots of servers but not much service - had to get up a few times to ask for things.  Food was nice but again was lacking the wow factor.  One notable dish was the brussel sprouts.

NAME: Warren
REVIEW: A very small restaurant with around 20 seats. Dishes were delicious and prices were reasonable, one issue is that when I asked for check they suddenly added a bottle of sparkling water into my check, which I think their service shouldn't be like that.

NAME: OlivierSaintVincent
REVIEW: The Michelin Star is a real mistake : Spanish wines are only chosen because of high end price (when the Spanish wine market is still very affordable). Food is not even close from any tapas bar in Madrid. Service is rude.

NAME: Nick
REVIEW: Amazing spot with spot on food and flawless service!

NAME: tastymorsel
REVIEW: Fantastic food, wine and service. Attentive and knowledgable staff, great menu. Wonderful experience from start to finish.

NAME: lulu
REVIEW: We had a wonderful night at Casa Mon from start to finish. We were lucky and got a 10pm reservation on a weekend night just a couple of weeks in advance. We arrived a little early, but there was a table available so we sat down right away. The open kitchen was hopping and the crowd in the small space was happily engaged in conversation. It is not a quiet place, but you can hear the waiter and your dinner companions, and for me that is what matters.   There were just two of us, so we couldn't order everything we wanted to try, but that just gives us incentive to return. It was a great meal. Everything we ordered was good. The highlights for us were the quail with potato puree, the razor clams and the Salvador Dali egg with truffled celeriac soup -- and then the saffron ice cream!   For wine, since we were only two, we were happy to be able to select glasses of excellent varieties and we chose our different ones to try - none a disappointment,   This was a real treat and I thank my brother for the recommendation. We will return!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Every dish was done perfectly with exquisite detail. Every bite was as good as the first

NAME: SusannaT
REVIEW: Love it here, always has innovative dishes with complex flavors. well executed and delicious!

NAME: LBNYC
REVIEW: Wonderful food and knowledgeable server. We learned about the cuisine and a selection of sherry that complemented our meal perfectly.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We'd like to start by apologizing to the staff at Casa Mono for arriving much later than our reservation. We understand that that can sometimes be difficult to deal with. We are grateful for having been accommodated.  Dinner Wine: Les Paradetes 2011 (If I'm recalling correctly)  Dinner date with the girlfriend was great! Servers were friendly and managers were actively participating in the ongoings of service.  Word of advice: Never skip the Jamón Ibérico.   The Fideos dish is an all time favorite (We've had it before). The caramelized fideos with bits of chorizo remind me of a Dominican rice dish, Arroz con Fideos, commonly found at mom's dinner table. We also had a bone marrow dish whose succulent and earthy flavors carries the mind into the comfort zone. This dish can really set the mood for the rest of the evening. The sea urchin and creamy eggs was, by far, the most extravagant of the group. The dish, we felt, was well-balanced in its many layers. Each component held its own ground but came together quite profoundly. Eggs scrambled with a very healthy serving of olive oil were a great compliment to the sea urchin and a slight tinge of palette-cleansing bitterness from the lime zest to finish each bite.   Dessert was delicious but lacking in comparison to our savory tapas. The Helado de Azafrán,  for instance, was, in all likelihood, intended to be subtle in flavor. However, the mangos coupled with other fresh and dried fruit atop the bowl-shaped helado was perhaps too safe a choice for us.  Always a worthwhile trip to one of our favorite restaurants.  Buen provecho!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Really lively place, it was neat getting to see the cooks in action just feet away from you. The food is quite fantastic. The service from the host is amazing, but my server wasn't incredibly attentive or friendly. It's a really convenient way to have some amazing food in a great part of town.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Small restaurant, small plates, big flavors!  Thoroughly enjoyed our meal.  Service was attentive, helpful and friendly.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Good food & excellent staff !! We definite come again !! Awesome Wine selection ...

NAME: Kmcc
REVIEW: This restaurant was honestly disappointing. I had very high hopes after reading many reviews about it and really wasn't blown away. The food was just ok, the service was just ok, and the setting itself was too.

NAME: DimiT
REVIEW: Very cozy space, friendly and attentive staff and some creative dishes. But 3/5 dishes were hit and miss, and the wine, unless you go for a very expensive one, was average - even average priced wines at this institution should be excellent.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food is delicious and outstanding and the service is friendly and efficient.  The only drawbacks are that the tables are small, so one spends some time moving around plates and glasses, and the table bases are big, so sometimes it's a little tricky to figure out where to put your legs.  But the food makes up for all of that.

NAME: Marieandkids
REVIEW: We had a wonderful dinner! All was perfect !! See you soon.. Best wishes From France

NAME: PamelaC
REVIEW: What a great birthday dinner for my 12 year old son. He is a foodie and tried everything. Great mussels with chorizo, pulpo, razor clams, steak, lamb sausage, fideos, patata bravas, mushrooms with garlic, and of course wine. He loved watching the open kitchen, and the service was great. I hadn't been in a long time and we'll definitely be back soon.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Amazing food.  We will be back very soon.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Impecable. Comida simple pero sofisticada. Grandes sabores. Muy buen ambiente y buen servicio. Un imperdible en NYC.

NAME: judiful
REVIEW: When 1 of the two dishes we ordered for our  second course arrived we were told that they were out of the food we ordered 40 minutes after we placed the order.  They brought another dish 10 minutes later then after 10 more minutes brought our original order way past the time we wanted it and they only comped us for the dish they brought after we didn't want anything else. Food was very spicy garlicky but NOT fresh.

NAME: sher
REVIEW: At first we were disappointed because they did not have razor clams in menu but that was soon forgotten because everything we ordered was fabulous.  Service was excellent.  Great food and wine,  what more do you need.

NAME: dannyqg
REVIEW: A nice surprise. Small restaurant but with fabulous food. Will definitely visit again.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The meal was very lackluster for the price. The house charcuterie was great, with the exception of the terrine, which was overwhelmingly salty. We ate the pan-asian squid next to an oddly flattened, chewy octopus pancake over chunks of smokey grapefruit in a bed of fennel. They were both excellent in concept, but poorly executed. The sausage in the cuttlefish was overcooked and rubbery, the dough fried on bay-leafs was undercooked with the creme brûlée... only the scallops were executed well. It was a disappointing meal that clocked close to $200 - there's many better expressions for that price.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Amazing experience -- as always. Work with the server to discuss each dish's nuances, so you get exactly what you want. Ask for help with the killer wine list as well

NAME: StanleyC
REVIEW: Love this place and it NEVER DISAPPOINTS.  Love the constant menu items that are fresh and flavorful.  Service is great and even though tight.  Think food, friends and a great lunch.

NAME: Marisa
REVIEW: Host was terrible. A table for 4 was open and she made my table (reservation for 3) wait until 15 minutes past our reservation time for a smaller table. The table for 4 remained vacant for the next hour. I understand the need to fill tables according to group size. But I don't understand the lack of service.  On top of this, she was rude.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Came here 5 years ago & the food hasn't lost its tastefulness! Fabulous dining in great, relaxed atmosphere

NAME: Sonic
REVIEW: This is a gem of a restaurant! The tables are tight and you can hear your neighbor's conversations but all is forgiven with the warm inviting service and the amazing food!  I really like the atmosphere in the restaurant, had a energetic buzz.  We tried many dishes but the most memorable for me was the sweetbreads which I have never had before but an now intrigued to try from each new menu I come across.   Great lunch Casa Mono team - will be back, hopefully soon!

NAME: susanjo
REVIEW: another wonderful dinner at Casa Mono - this has definitely become my favorite restaurant- Friday night shared it with my husband, sister and brother-in-law to celebrate my birthday! the wine suggestion was great and reasonable in price, the service is outstanding and the food is always a great adventure!

NAME: VinoKai
REVIEW: Has been a favorite of mine for inspired Spanish tapas and excellent wine list. Never disappoints. Tables are cozy!

NAME: DoctorJ
REVIEW: We were a party of four and lucky enough to get a corner table at the window which afforded a bit more privacy and less noise than  tables in the middle of this small space. The helping sizes varies considerably which makes it difficult to order for a group; we ordered 7 dishes for four people which did turn out to be ample. We were underwhelmed by the cod croquettes but really enjoyed the confit of duck and the lamb sausage. The service was very good.

NAME: R7898
REVIEW: Great food and fun place. Wish it was a little more spacious. Very tight quarters. But always enjoy a meal here

NAME: sevenseas
REVIEW: This is a delightful restaurant with flavorful food and a smart staff.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: nice place with excellent food and top service  good spot for a biz meeting and would come back for dinner some time

NAME: SharonS
REVIEW: Great place to go. You won't be regretted. Tasting food, Cosy atmosphere, good service!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great food experience - would definitely go back

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Razor clams were amazing. Also had the shishito peppers, shirt steak and baby squid. All wonderful. Razor clams were favorite!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Lovely little restaurant  with great ambience and food! We loved the different courses, all were very artistic, well-tasting and beautifully created.

NAME: sevenseas
REVIEW: Small, intimate, deliciously flavorful food.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono is one of my all time favorite New York restaurants. It never disappoints any time of day or night.

NAME: Taster
REVIEW: Casa Mono is our all time favorite when visiting NYC.  We plan ahead which dishes we want to try.  Razor clams and bone marrow are winners for us.  Every dish on the menu is great.

NAME: SusanaL
REVIEW: The food is fantastic with very unusual combinations, loved the octopus, baby squid, scallops and razor clams, which are rare to find! excellent service. The restaurant is very small, but cozy.

NAME: ACox
REVIEW: Casa Mono is a small, quaint little restaurant. Having the feeling of being a neighborhood place. The tables are small and close, the atmosphere energetic. The staff are friendly, with good if not quite great service. This was the second time I'd come here in 4 weeks. If I'd reviewed it the last time the food would have gotten, very good. Some dishes didn't really work, like the rabbit, the eggs and unit not enough uni. However those that did work soon prompted a return visit. This time everything was excellent, everything. The Sardines, the Goat and the Bone Marrow were exceptional. I should be back again in a few weeks! Well deserved Michelin Star.

NAME: BobbyN
REVIEW: They Run out of key dishes on weekends. Would like to see aa greater selection of food

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: we enjoyed having an excellent lunch and nicely well advised by Anna (one of the waiters )

NAME: Chunky
REVIEW: Very unusual menu selections. Very tasty. Great atmosphere. Good service. Lots of bars nearby. Great location.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: A lovely experience, the waiter made good recommendations and the food was excellent!

NAME: TTTT
REVIEW: Always a pleasure to visit Casa Mono. I was greeted with complimentary sparkling wine, and that was a big plus for the occasion. I usually have a set menu, but this time I deviated and got a couple new ones - looks like everything they serve is great. Can't wait to visit again soon. =)

NAME: NMC47
REVIEW: Excellent wine list and great tapas!

NAME: MiriamC
REVIEW: Delicious food, attentive staff, and right around the corner from W Union Square, where we were staying.

NAME: AnjaliK
REVIEW: The whole experience was excellent!  I look forward to going back and tasting more food items on the delicious menu. The service was wonderful to say the least!

NAME: Dave
REVIEW: Very creative cuisine.  Spanish tapas, but many of the dishes seemed to be created with a fine dining Japanese aesthetic in mind.  Have one of the drier sherries with your meal to get the maximum enjoyment of the flavors of the food - and of the sherry itself.

NAME: MichaelH
REVIEW: Food was solid ...with first-rate calamari.  Wine list frightening as to price - you must look hard for value.  Concern over allergies - as all food cooked on the same plancha - was exemplary.  Real concern!   Service mixed....friendly....but disorganized.  Got a crick in my neck looking for our waiter to refill glasses, order more wine, etc.  Tiny place which is much like a left-bank bistro .  The "jamon" was puzzling.  VERY pricey for fairly ordinary Spanish ham.  Our server told us it was" the bottom of the top".  NOT good value.   Menu a bit limited.

NAME: BrianB
REVIEW: Stunning food, service and wine pairings all in a casual yet sophisticated environment.  This is my favorite restaurant in nyc, and I have been living and aggressively eating in Manhattan for many years.  Tough to beat the creative and seasonal menu that is professionally prepared and delivered.  Sitting at bar watching the chefs and having to sommelier pair wines with the series of courses will make for one of the best meals you will ever have.    And finishing the meal with a visit next door to bar Jamon for Serrano, manchego and Rioja is a great approach.  Enjoy.

NAME: Micheke
REVIEW: A succulent slice of Spain  A charming, rustic, somewhat cramped space makes for the perfect spot for delicious intriguing and innovative tapas. At night it is a bustling place which can get a little overcrowded and hectic. At lunch however, it is somewhat more subdued and a fun place to sample some very interesting and somewhat intricate Spanish dishes.We enjoyed scrambled eggs and sea urchin, and a dish of sardines cooked three ways as our appetizers. Both dishes were quite delicious. The sardines, our favorite of the two consisted of one served raw and marinated, one grilled and one fried served alongside a bowl of perfectly dressed fresh cucumbers, tomatoes and red onions. Then on to our main course which consisted of bone marrow served with toast points and lamb belly, both absolutely delectable. We were both more than satisfied after quite the rich lunch but decided to try the brown butter tart nevertheless. OH MY…..it turned out to be the perfect way to end a lovely meal. The tart was made  with brown butter and topped with the creamiest of homemade CREME FRAICHE ice cream surrounded by sweet berries. I adhered to my three bite maximum regimen although it took quite a bit of will power...the dessert was simply so delicious. The entire experience was one of great pleasure from start to finish thanks to our lovely server, Caitlyn who recommended certain different dishes, and who was more than attentive, kind and on point. For someone who enjoys tasty innovative tapas-style fare, an energetic and vibrant somewhat noisy atmosphere, I highly recommend Casa Mono, a charming rustic Mario Batali venue on Irving Place!

NAME: LaFleur
REVIEW: One of our fav NYC spots. Has a great vibe and authentic Spanish feel. Very cramped, but in a good way. Staff is fun and friendly. Love the razor clams, fish dishes, and veg/salads. Best selection of Spanish wines around.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Had a great meal here, one of our best in NYC. Very helpful service, excellent food in a relaxed though lively atmosphere. Will go back.

NAME: truedat
REVIEW: Consistently delicious! First time back in a few years, but just after a trip to Spain and I felt as though I were eating in Barcelona.  The dishes are delicious, authentic, and reasonably prices, as are the wines (especially the house wine!).

NAME: WalterC
REVIEW: We had four dishes.  The scallops were just ok.  The melon with honey, jamon and Parmesan was superb.  The quail was perfect.  My favorite, the sweetbreads, the best.  Followed up by a cheese plate.  A few glasses of wine.  A perfect lunch.

NAME: Pearl1107
REVIEW: I went there for my husband's birthday. We love to go to Spain and miss foods there, so we decided to visit Casa Mono as a substitute. Everything we ordered were very tasty and the waiter we had was kind and efficient. The foods are more upscale-style and pricier than we usually eat in Spain, but I cannot complain. If we can get such a quality Spanish foods here in NYC, I am happy.  (pan con tomate, razor clams, pork belly, and croquetas are our favorites)

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: A little gem anongst all the hustle & bustle of New York! Great food, in particular the softshell crab & quail dishes. Good wine selection. Excellant!

NAME: KDavid
REVIEW: Every dish explodes in flavor and showcases creativity, skill, and most importantly, love for the individual ingredient.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Came here expecting amazing food based on the NYT's 3 star rating and review. Was quite disappointed with the food, everything We ordered was ok... But each plate was either missing something (a bit of crunch, a touch of acid to brighten it, etc) or had an execution problem. A soft shell fried crab sounded great on the menu, but came with a strawberry sauce that was simply overpowering and made the whole thing taste only of strawberries, drowned out the delicate taste of the crab. Some dishes were over seasoned. Our waiter rushed us to order and never came back to pour our wine, we had to pour our wine ourselves the whole evening.

NAME: Rick
REVIEW: Very good food and ambiance though a bit cramped. Can't wait to try again.

NAME: Vanessa
REVIEW: Haven't been in years as we live in Toronto. Only had 1 night in NYC and contemplated trying something new. So glad we decided to go back to what we love. Every bite, bite after bite, was simply delicious! This is a staple for every trip to NYC!

NAME: RobertM
REVIEW: We came across this place a year or so ago when we realized we had time before the KMFDM show at Irving Plaza. A quick yelp search and here we were. We were so impressed with the overall meal and experience I made sure to make reservations for our Anniversary.  Another epic meal commenced. The foie gras was divine and the pulpo did not dissapoint again. Bone Marrow, Pork Belly and Burrata this place never lets u down. Perfectly balanced dishes meant to share. Do not hesitate to try new things. We will be back

NAME: HungryInBrooklyn
REVIEW: We liked best the creamy eggs with uni, razor clams, and burrata.  Skip the foie gras which was served on soggy toast and completely overwhelmed by the sweet tangy sauce it was served in.  Service was friendly and attentive.  Cute intimate open space on the corner.

NAME: MargeauxH
REVIEW: Food was average at best and the service was adequate but nothing special.  They gave me my check without asking us if we wanted coffee or anything else because they had another reservation after us and wanted us out.  When we came in though someone was at the table we were supposed to be at so they made me wait at the small bar next door, and then sat us at another table, so clearly those people were not forced out for us.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Those razor clams are just so delicious!

NAME: allyjean
REVIEW: Casa Mono was outstanding!  Upon arrival, the host let us know that our table wasn't quite ready yet (we were early), but that we could stay for a drink at their sister bar, Bar Jamon, next store.  My boyfriend and I always love to have a cocktail before dinner, so this was just as well!  Not to mention the fact that they had already been extra accommodating when I asked to move my reservation from 8:30 to 7pm.  We had delicious Vermut cocktails in the bar, and since our table ran over, they took care of our drinks for us!  We then began dinner, and because the menu is so delicious, my boyfriend and I were having difficulty deciding what we wanted to eat.  The sommelier was MORE than helpful when deciding which glass of wine we wanted.    And they serve their wines in quartos, so you get a little bit more than a glass full, so you're really able to enjoy your wine!  We wanted to order a few items and then wait to decide on the rest.  And this is why I give the service 4 stars instead of 5.  Our server was annoyed that we wanted to order a few dishes, and then order a few more.  I couldn't tell if it was because he wanted to be able to course our food properly, or if it was because he wanted to turn his table.  But it was a Sunday dinner, and we were buying a lot of food and wine, so I don't think it's right to rush someone.    However, for the rest of the meal, we never felt rushed.  So, I'm assuming maybe he was trying to make sure our food came out properly.  Either way, it was something that irritated me.  That being said, the meal was AMAZING!!! All of the food was delicious and just the right amount!  We had baby squid, razor clams, bone marrow, oxtail, tomatoes, and burrata!  We also had the custard desert, and coffee!  Everything was absolutely fabulous!  And we were VERY full by the end of the meal. After the meal, we loved our wine so much we went next door to bar jamon and had more wine!  What a fabulous meal and experience!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: What a disappointment! DON'T GO  When we walked in the person at the door said we only have 1h 45 min to eat and then we have to leave as next reservation is coming. LIKE WHAT? I go to michelin star restaurants all the time (I do prefer 2 and 3 star ones as I never been disappointed, but decided to give this one star place a try). The place is small and very loud, felt like I am trying to have a dinner at a local college pub. Zero for decor and service!! We wondered how this place can have 1 star, because so far this has been the worst restaurant experience in NYC!! So there was hope for food.. although it had good presentation, most items where WAY to salty. Won't be returning!

NAME: RegB
REVIEW: Consistently reliable food and ambience with low key vibe.

NAME: KenB
REVIEW: Excellent dining experience. Varied, unique menu, delicious food and very cordial and attentive service. Highly recommend the creamy eggs and the razor clams. Can't wait to go back for another fantastic dinner!!!

NAME: Patoni
REVIEW: Great chef and sous chef!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Every dish we tried was delicious, especially the fluke crudo, the sweetbreads and the skirt steak. Service was outstanding: warm and attentive, but not cloying. A wonderful meal.

NAME: LisaAnnP
REVIEW: This is a quaint little restaurant with great creative menu selections.  We had the mussels, quail and skirt steak.   Each had unique flavors that blended very well.  Everything was delicious.  The staff was very accommodating and friendly.  The seating leaves a little to be desired.  Its just not the most comfortable, tables a little small, chairs a little stiff.  I will definitely return to try more dishes.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Lively ambiance, food and service both excellent.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Love the foods there, everything was amazing. I will definitely go back again.

NAME: Gormay13
REVIEW: The rabbit was incredible, so many different textures. Love the summer menu!

NAME: LLin
REVIEW: Wonderful food and a fun cozy atmosphere. Scallops and skirt steak were amazing and the whole menu was full of interesting ingredients and flavor combinations.

NAME: Respecttruehospitality
REVIEW: Always a delight. Never rushed. Wonderful food. Recommended!

NAME: Emily
REVIEW: The service is always impeccable and I love the extensive wine list.  My only complaint this time would be the sun's glare through the front windows blinding our server (but he never said anything) and my date.  It was also quite warm inside the restaurant on a hot summer day making it a little uncomfortable.  Some type of pull down shade is really needed.

NAME: cl69
REVIEW: Service was very unfriendly.    While we were having dinner  Waiter came about 5 times to clean up the table  . We could not finish  because it became very unpleasant. Same happen with the dessert.

NAME: gregg
REVIEW: such a special place! i've been there about 10 times and it never disappoints

NAME: rpa619
REVIEW: Food quality and cramped seating doesn't justify the high prices.  Service is mediocre.

NAME: Miguel
REVIEW: Everything was great in terms to food and quality. The only thing not good is that you can get your eyes itchy and red because of the fumes from the kitchen ; so try to seat as far as you can from the kitchen, considering is a small restaurant.

NAME: ilbe
REVIEW: Amazing array of flavors - this is a great place for sharing dishes. Excellent service, the waiters and waitresses were both knowledgeable and attentive. An impressive wine list with lots of great values. A compact place where one is taken care off very well.

NAME: reviewer
REVIEW: Awful food. There's no relationship between the food we ate and the wonderful food of Cataluña or any other part of Spain. One can eat better food at a rest stop by a highway in Spain.  Never again.

NAME: FranciscoP
REVIEW: Recomiendo casa mono para hacer un alto en la visita a las distintas atracciones y comer una de lasmejores tapas incluso mejores que enEspaña

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono is a must go place when I travel to NYC. Every friend that I suggest going there thanks me for the  tip.

NAME: NenS
REVIEW: Definitely will one back

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The only restaurant that our family members from overseas insist on visiting when they're in NYC. Consistently outstanding food, friendly and knowledgeable staff, flawless service, perfectly relaxed atmosphere. A late afternoon lunch at Casa Mono is one of life's treasures.

NAME: Johnnieye
REVIEW: I have been to Casa Mono several times and it never fails to exceed expectations.  The menu is adventurous and foodie-approved (if you have non-adventurous eaters in your party, this may not be the place for you).  The dishes are authentically Spanish, bursting with unique flavor combinations.  My only problem is that I have found so many dishes that are "must order" (creamy eggs with sea urchin, fried sardines, bacalao croquette, jamon, charcuterie plank, etc.) that it is difficult to explore other things on the menu that look amazing.  They even have a dish that is dedicated to my favorite food writer (heck, favorite writer) Jim Harrison - the lamb tongue.    All in all, one of my favorite casual dining spots in NYC.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Too noisy and too cramped.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: One of my favourites in NY...As always the food were outstanding...We started with the Mono salad followed by scallops with clam , duck egg with truffles , quail with potato pure and a delicious pudin de pan as desert...There is no way to go wrong at this place

NAME: MCNP
REVIEW: Wonderful service, delicious food, beautiful presentation. We were also very pleasantly surprised how quickly the food came out. The ambience and decor was also very fitting for the cuisine. We will be back!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Deliciosa comida muy bien atendidos! Mucho aire acondicionado lamentablemente como en todos los lugares de usa

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Every dish we ordered was excellent. My only major complaint--which affected our ability to enjoy our (expensive) meal--was that we were seated in a back, semi-claustrophobic corner with  no AC on a hot NYC day. When we asked about why the AC wasn't on, we were told that it was because the windows were open. The breeze must have been nice for those not tucked away in a corner with no access to open air...  I recommend requesting specific seats in this small restaurant.  "Not the hot corner" should suffice.

NAME: DreDre
REVIEW: Unfortunate as I think chef was off.  Everything was very over-oily.  Early in evening and tables did not fill, but we were put on the side with heat from grill wafting over us.  Will probably not return

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food tastes great, but on the pricey side for portion sizes. Also a bit cramped. Otherwise a good experience with great service.

NAME: LeaS
REVIEW: Food and wine were amazing!! Be adventurous and try everything. We were 5 and shared the dishes, this allowed us to try almost all the menu.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The restaurant had a nice ambiance, and the food was very good (sea urchin was a fave).  A bit crammed, but also cosy.

NAME: PhyllBird
REVIEW: Food choices were amazing.  Four of us had 7 plates which was plenty. However, I would suggest more vegetable choices to go along with the awesome meat choices.

NAME: paular
REVIEW: Food was delicious and portions are on the small side.  Just right for me!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great wine great food.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Delicious food and good service! The baby squid dish is fantastic and the wines are terrific. Quite a small, cozy place with an energetic vibe.

NAME: joycie
REVIEW: Excellent food but very expensive  for what you get.

NAME: maurolaura
REVIEW: charming place with very friendly and efficient service Food good interesting,good but not fundamental

NAME: Lizzielou
REVIEW: I have always eaten at Casa Mono from the very beginning. I find it to be just perfect and a wonderful place to take out of town friends and family for a very unique dining experience. Service is always perfect and the food is just delicious.. Thank you for being so unique

NAME: NeelR
REVIEW: I've been coming to Casa Mono for years. The food never disappoints. It always seems to be packed, but I like the atmosphere!

NAME: MiguelY
REVIEW: The flavors and aromas at Casa Mona are intense. The preparations are great! The staff knows there wines and help you pair the wine to the food.

NAME: Kimmer95
REVIEW: Food is way too rich for my stomach. Everything is saucey, buttery or oily. Tasty but not worth the stomachache. And a bit too pricey.

NAME: KenB
REVIEW: The food is always delicious and even sometimes memorable...like the loose eggs with sea urchin or the cod cheeks pil pil or the bone marrow or the orange infused bread pudding with caramel ice cream 👍👍👍👍👍

NAME: Kltten
REVIEW: The food, service, and ambience was excellent. Small dining room setting. Cozy and comfortable. Not a great option for large groups, but perfect for date night or celebrating a special occasion. Plan to return soon.

NAME: JT10022
REVIEW: Everything is awesome here and I love getting a drink at Bar Jamon before dinner. I've been coming here for years and it never gets old.

NAME: kuhun
REVIEW: It was little busy when I had dinner. And space is not enough for larger groups. Food was good and server was kind. No restroom in the restaurant.

NAME: Alex
REVIEW: Food was good. Service? Well, if a waiter with a toothpick in his mouth asking you "How was everything?" is considered to be a proper serving etiquette in a one Michelin Star restaurant, then service was good, too.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was incredible. We really enjoyed the Creamy eggs with uni and the razor clams. The waitstaff was very attentive, patient, and friendly to our 3 and 5 year old children. We had an early seating and got out just as the restaurant reached full capacity.

NAME: Ninalovesfood
REVIEW: We enjoyed great service and some unique food items: razor clams, uni with soft scrambled eggs, lamb belly, mussels and chorizo, and more.  I could have had everything on the menu.  Our server Fernando was an absolute delight with great food and wine recommendations. High energy spot which was totally booked on a Sunday after 2PM.  Our food and wine arrived quickly and was perfection.

NAME: Simplebalance
REVIEW: The Food and service were exceptional, we will definitely be back!

NAME: IsabellaK
REVIEW: We had a wonderful time! The dishes wee amazing and the service top quality. We highly recommend it!!

NAME: RachelM
REVIEW: The place is tiny and thefoods incredible. Went with friends during a trip to NYC.

NAME: jtour
REVIEW: This was my second time here and it was once again excellent.  The rib eye tartar is out of this world.  Every dish was above average and the service was great.  Normally i hate tapas because i feel like i'm always hungry later but this was a filling meal.  Six dishes across two people is more than enough even if both are hungry.

NAME: anonymous
REVIEW: Great innovative food. Each dish a real hit. Noisy, packed,cramped. Real New York.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food all tastes so good

NAME: Aviva
REVIEW: Amazing rib eye tartar. The burrata was top notch.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We could not have been more thrilled with our dinning experience. Saying we were satisfied does not do our experience justice.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This place is very small but the food they offer is something you can never have in other restaurants. I have tried the cauliflower, mussel, burrata and pork belly, and they all tasted unforgettably good. They come in small plates so you have to expect 2-3 dishes per person though. The service could use some brush up; I didn't see my waiter smile to us nor the tables beside us. But still, I would definitely come back for the irresistible food!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The uni and scrambled eggs with walnuts was my favorite dish of 2016. The razor clams were a study in perfection.  The service was impeccable and the wine was spectacular.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Delicious once again.

NAME: flo2lux
REVIEW: This tiny spanish restaurant surprised me: warm welcome, good service and delicious food!!! Expect high quality and gastro tapas! The wine list of spanish wines is impressive. The only downside is the odor of your clothes when u r leaving :-) this is due to the open kitchen. Anyway I'll get back.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This restaurant is consistently excellent.  The food is inventive without being pretentious and the service attentive without hovering.   Everyone I introduce to Casa Mono shares this view.

NAME: AndreZ
REVIEW: Our first experience at Casa Mono (about 4 years ago) was so positive that we decided to go back during this trip (we are from Canada). The food was again very good. Our favorite dish was the Pork croquetas "Massimo Bottura".    However, I was seriously disappointed with the pacing of the meal. Our waiter told us that we should order all the plates we want at the same and that the chef would pace the meal. Well, that did not work out well. We were not done with our first plate that our second arrived. I told myself that if the 3rd one arrived as quickly, i would tell the waiter to slow the pace. I did not have the chance to do so since our last 3 plates were served at the same time ! This was very disappointing. This was at 5:00 pm Friday March 5th and half the tables were empty and still were when we left after our meal around 6h30 pm (which we extended by ordering desert and coffee - otherwise we would have been done in less than an hour....)  We ate at Momofuku Ssam Bar  the night before, and we ordered our plates two at a times. The result was a meal properly paced and much better overall experience.  I really enjoyed the food at Casa Mono but I may skip it on my next trip to NYC.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was quite salty, but the service was great! Particularly the sausage and steak were too salty to enjoy.

NAME: FoodArchitect
REVIEW: One of our most favorite restaurants in the city....always inspired by the menu and food is absolutely delicious. While it can get crowded and noisy it is worth the squeeze. If only 2 or 3 we would recommend sitting at the food bar and watch the food magic happen!  Wine list is well balanced and offers many great choices and price points.  Can't wait to go back!

NAME: Radish
REVIEW: Menu was full of exciting options: sweetbreads, pigs' ears, rabbit, goat... I found the dishes heavy. For example the sweetbreads, which were fried, were served on top of fennel--which was also oily, and it was served with a Romesco sauce (chopped almonds). The croquetas, which looked like breaded mozzarella sticks, were large and sitting on top of a (to my mind) completely unnecessary thick white sauce. To cut through the unctuousness of the food, several dishes  had an acidic kick. I felt like I was eating my food with a side of vinegar. We had an OK plate of roasted vegetables, the highlight of which was one very tiny eggplant. The other little, round vegetables all looked similar to each other and tasted a lot like potatoes. Lovely dessert of a slice of cake with grapefruit and olive oil ice-cream. Lightest dish of the night. Great wines.

NAME: CKUSQ
REVIEW: My friend and I had delicious quail and Moroccan lamb dishes. They were superb, as was the Mallorcan red wine by the glass. Our experience was at lunch, which accounts for the quiet noise level.  At a previous dinner, the noise level would have to be rated as loud.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Came here for my birthday, i was really excited when i saw their menu because it seemed exotic and exciting. Honestly, i was a bit disappointment. The food was just okay with the exception of the razor clams - those were amazing. I was especially disappointed about the Foies gras, they overpowered it with some sort of sweet and sour sauce. Foies gras is good by itself, but they just over did it.   The ambiance was okay, the staff was really friendly. The wine list was extensive but i dont think i will be returning.

NAME: njlink
REVIEW: I recently visited Casa Mono, where I hadn't been in several years, for lunch during Restaurant Week. When we arrived at 12:15, it was relatively empty and quiet, but it did fill up within the hour. Although the fried artichokes were delicious and were followed by cockles/pasta-like, I was still hungry because the portions were tiny! The churro and chocolate (thicker than a mousse) was fantastic, too! Maybe it's better this way...you eat less!

NAME: KenB
REVIEW: The food/small plates...but not too small/ are wonderfully varied and delicious. Everything my wife and I ate, and we ate a lot, was scrumptious. We will certainly go back very soon and many more times.

NAME: JROSE
REVIEW: Staff was barely friendly enough for the service not to be bad but the vibe was very off putting and cold. Seating is uncomfortable and they don't do anything extra to make it good enough to recommend or go back.

NAME: dancer
REVIEW: It's a small place.  The table where we sat in the corner was in very tight quarters.  The portions were small but adequate for lunch.

NAME: AnnH
REVIEW: We enjoyed our restaurant week lunch thoroughly.  The food was delicious, service very good.  I plan to return w/friends for another lunch very soon.

NAME: susanjo
REVIEW: We returned to Casa Mono for dinner after a performance at Classic Stage Company on E 13th St and it was as wonderful as ever. This time we were a party of 4 which enabled us to taste more dishes which was great. Some items on the menu are pretty constant - have to have the razor clams- and some change which is great. The wine list is extensive and there are excellent options on the lower end of the price scale. Casa Mono never disappoints but it is small so reservations if you want a table are a must!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: No wonder they are well qualified in the Zagat and Michelin guides, you feel the vibe of a real tapas place in Barcelona. The menu is bold, a it has what you really need in a tapas BAR/ Restaurant. Just don´t expect friendly personnel , being said that you can really feel in Barcelona.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great great great always great

NAME: CarolW
REVIEW: Loved the uni and egg - and the vanilla pudding dessert. Really enjoyed the blending of flavors in all my tapas.

NAME: Lloyd
REVIEW: yummy food, but really not a good business lunch place, VERY small portions, small dish sharing kind of thing which is fine when you're with friends. we left hungry and it is pricey.

NAME: DosCompadres
REVIEW: The food was really different, delicious, and well prepared. We had 7 different dishes and loved them all. The sommelier picked us a wonderful wine in our price range that really complimented the food. A thoroughly enjoyable experience. We will go again when we return to NY.

NAME: Riribear1006
REVIEW: I have been to Casa Mono 4 different occasions and the food never disappoint.  When you go to the same restaurant more than 3 times and the quality remains superb, you know you've got a gem on your hands. The ingredients of every single dish is well thought out and the flavoring  is nothing short of amazing.

NAME: GazNYC
REVIEW: I could go every day and not get tired of it, menu is mind boggling-ly large for such a small kitchen & everything comes out perfect every time. I'm counting the days until my next visit.

NAME: TAPASnWINE
REVIEW: Table of four, two couples, a waiter that was all about excellent service, wine suggestion, plate advice, and a wonderful setting to get out and just have time to get to know new friends.  CASA MONO is a treasure.  Highly recommended.  Will go again.

NAME: Michelle
REVIEW: Had a fantastic meal at Casa Mono as always. For such a tiny restaurant, you really get outstanding food and first rate service. It's truly deserving of its Michelin star.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Delicious foods! Especially Razor clams and foie gras!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great ambiance set us up for a terrific evening. The wine list was excellent, as was the advice to get through it. We enjoyed a delicious 2005 Rioja. The food choices were excellent, but stand out dishes were the oxtail stuffed peppers and the seared foie gras.

NAME: Bianca
REVIEW: Food is great, but if you can get service.  We were thee at Christmas Eve, which made it easier to reserve.  The sommelier was fantastic and very friendly, which unfortunately I cannot say for the service, which was inattentive and not exactly friendly I should say.  So we ended up asking our questions to the sommelier and he also helped out with the food service which he did not have to.  We would go again but management has to really check on the service.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Experience was very bad. It started with a very poor interaction with the hostess. They gave us a poor table even though two superior tables of the same size were open the entire time we were there. The hostess have us a time limit to finish our meal!!!! Service was among top 5 worst service and on top of that food was mediocre and not a good value for money

NAME: fvaccari
REVIEW: Food was amazing. unique dishes, large portion sizes. The service however was disappointing. We had many waiters ask us the same questions (two asked for our drink orders, same waiter asked us twice if we wanted coffee after we had already received the coffee),  we ordered 5 dishes and they only brought 3 out.

NAME: Reviewer
REVIEW: Large, creative menu.  Well executed by the kitchen.  Service prompt.  Wine list is the broadest selection of Spanish wines I can recall. However, the place is tiny and cramped.  Hope they can move to a bigger space.

NAME: Piner
REVIEW: Very affordable dinner for Michelin quality dining. Food was fun, wine list is fun, ambience is casual and inviting.

NAME: MD121490
REVIEW: The menu is great, with a wide variety of fairly exotic selections (although not so exotic as to be inaccessible to most).  If you're not a particularly knowledgeable foodie, you'll find the menu refreshingly new.  If you are more on the experienced end, you'll still find some new fare that you may not have seen elsewhere in a while.   Wine menu is solid; good selection.  Not the most groundbreaking selection I've seen, but certainly more on the developed end.   The service can be characterized as...attentive, but not overly invasive.  And when you're on a date, I think this is ideal.    Lastly, the space is pretty small/packed in.  You won't be on top of other people, but you also won't find yourself with a ton of space.  Fully expect your neighbors to be able to eavesdrop on your conversation with ease, if they wanted to.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I had been craving tapas for some time now and this restaurant hit the spot.  The food was very flavorful and savory, just how I like it.

NAME: Brian
REVIEW: We had late night reservation (11.15pm), and it felt like we were rushed a bit by the kitchen pushing out dishes. I didn't bother us too much, as I figured this might happen ahead of time.   Most of the dishes were absolutely incredible.  Dorado, steak and one lamb dish in particular were incredible.  I'd give pass on patatas bravas if returning. Not very good really.  Great wine list of course, and friendly, helpful servers.  A very down to earth experience for being such an acclaimed restaurant.

NAME: Mar2014
REVIEW: I have been living in NYC for a couple of years, I´m a foodie and I´m hard to please. This place is one of the best restaurants I´ve been in NYC. The octopus, the ham, the rabbit, the fideos, the duck and the wine were great, really, it is a must!

NAME: susanjo
REVIEW: This was my 5th visit to Casa Mono and it never disappoints! It is indeed very small which is part of the charm and it can get noisy but they also have tables for 2 tucked away by the window that helps with the noise.  The variety of small plates changes regularly so never tire of going there!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I found a lot of the dishes hit or miss.

NAME: Martha
REVIEW: We went early, before a film, so noise level may be higher later in the evening. However, food was excellent as well as ambiance. Very small restaurant!

NAME: Sabsy89
REVIEW: Wasn't as great as I expected, and I was really looking forward to this place. The service was pretty low for a Michelin star place. No one smiled and it took forever to get the waiter's attention (enough this there are only 10 tables in the restaurant). Food was a bit salty, but still innovative and well made.

NAME: PattyS
REVIEW: Casa Mono continues to amaze me with the delicious and variety of tapas.  Amazing wine list to match and staff exceptional.  No wonder its hard to get dinner reservations.  But worth it.

NAME: DanielW
REVIEW: Casa Mono was fantastic both times I visited. The small plates are all delicious, and the menu changes often enough that you don't get bored. The serving staff do a great job of pacing the meal as well. The slight downside is how small it is, but I love Casa Mono just the way it is.

NAME: WouldJohnEatIt
REVIEW: Every item which we ordered was something exotic and very tasty.  My favorite was the quail.  Members of my party enjoyed the Lamb and Goat dishes a lot.  I enjoyed the mussels - especially the broth.  We ordered about 60% of the menu and everything was great, I recommend trying something you have never tried before and you will not be disappointed.  We didn't try the pig ears though, I guess that will be for next time.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Spectacular lunch at what has now become an NYC classic. Thank you.

NAME: ebwp
REVIEW: Every dish we tried was delicious.  Very tight quarters is the only detracting characteristic but everything else about the restaurant was superb.  Can't wait to go back!

NAME: Xfw50
REVIEW: Always a delight to dine here. The mixtures of  different flavours that they manage to include in the changing menu never fails to take me by surprise.

NAME: susanjo
REVIEW: Always a pleasure to dine at Casa Mono if you love variety and small plates to share.  Wonderful wine list and very knowledgeable staff. Only disappointment was the squid dish that was too heavy on the batter so lost the taste of the squid but the other dishes were great.

NAME: Cowhoma
REVIEW: Dinner was wonderful with a large array of tastes and textures. Four of us ate the roast iberico pig, the stuffed lamb belly, the soft scrambled eggs, the potato croquettes, the Mexican meatballs, the Brussel sprouts, and several other small plates. We oohed and aahed at each new taste. Our waiter was warm and helpful. The only minus was the noise level. These are the best tapas I have had outside of San Sebastián.

NAME: Parent19
REVIEW: Our experience at Casa Mono was a good one.  My wife and I felt that the servers were attentive.  For a quiet place with music in the background, we almost wished the volume was just a little louder, but that's not a big deal.  The lighting was nice and low enough, but bright enough to really see what was happening.    The menu was unique and had many options.  We had the Dorado, which was good, but not great.  The baby squid wasn't too bad either, but not great.  We finally tried the bone marrow.  We didn't know what to expect, but overall, it was new and exciting.  I might not order that again, but I was glad we had it there to try.  The rabbit was fantastic!  Man was that good.  We would come back again to try some of the other options.  Nice little place.

NAME: ElizabethH
REVIEW: Lovely atmosphere, food delectable!!

NAME: JulieH
REVIEW: This restaurant was perfect for our girls night out. Every item was delicious and authentic. Space was cozy and intimate. Perfect!

NAME: FoodieNJ
REVIEW: Having been a fan of Mario Batali, my partner and I have been wanting to visit this restaurant for quite a while.  After finally getting some prized reservations, we made it in and a very nice corner table was provided for us.  The place is small and very tight but they were incredibly accommodating to us consider we're both big guys.  We began to order food and it started coming in like the wind.  Our waitress was on point, quick and very detail oriented without being over bearing.  The Razor Clams, Manchego Salad, Fideos, Sweetbreads, Octopus, Sardines... I could keep going - trust me - it was an awesome meal!!!   Every dish better than the next.. the place is loud and tight, but fun and it's all about being with friends, having fun, enjoying your food and your company.  Book a reservation now - you won't regret a second of it!

NAME: BobR
REVIEW: This is a fantastic restaurant. The only thing I would recommend is to ease up with n the salt. Food was delicious and artfully presented.

NAME: CSRNYC
REVIEW: My friend and I shared 5 tapas dishes (clams, jamon, lamb confit, hen of the wood mushrooms, one more) and a dessert (bread pudding).  Everything was superb.  He especially enjoyed the wine.

NAME: KellyRT
REVIEW: I went to Casa Mono with my boyfriend for his 30th birthday. Our server was fantastic and made very good recommendations regarding the food, and the sommelier recommended a great, bottle of wine as well as two dessert wines at the end of the meal. My boyfriend and I both thought each dish we ordered was excellent, and we had a fantastic dining experience until the end.   The restaurant is very small and the tables close together which is understandable for the neighborhood, but one of the restaurant staff was surprisingly rude in pushing my chair in and telling me I needed to move in so he could get through.    Then immediately after we paid the bill, but while we were still finishing our desert and desert drinks, the host came and said they had another reservation and that they needed us to finish up at the bar. It sounds like something small, but it really impacted our experience and turned us off from the restaurant. When we spent as much money as we did on the meal, we expected to at least be able to finish the end of the meal without being booted from our table. But it seemed like the moment we paid, they no longer cared about the experience we were having. There are just so many restaurants in NYC where you can get excellent food AND excellent service for that much money to deal with that. It would be one thing if we were lingering over our water for a half an hour, but we hadn't even finished the meal when they told us they needed us out of our table. Also, there was a 2-3 person table in a better location in the restaurant that had been empty all night and was empty when they asked us to move, so I'm not sure why they didn't seat us in the other table from the start if they thought reservations might run into each other. So unfortunately despite having a really great experience with our waiter and really enjoying the food, we won't be going back to the restaurant because of how the meal ended.

NAME: KatNDSpain
REVIEW: This was a great meal for a birthday dinner with a group of 6. I frequent Spanish restaurants in the city, but hadn't been back to Casa Mono in a long time (partly due to living near several other great Spanish options). The food was outstanding, and with 6 of us, we were able to try lots of things. Dessert and wine were also fantastic!

NAME: Panamadave
REVIEW: This was our second trip to New York in 4 years and we booked Casa Mona as our culinary treat - we live in France and have also lived in Spain for many years and have eaten dozens of Michelin Starred meals over the years. On this occasion it was no where near Michelin Starred standard, in fact our last  one star Michelin meal was on the Northern Costa Brava a month ago which was fantastic and in a different league to this.    The restaurant is small and informal - which we love having eaten in many such settings in Spain, France and the UK- but why the loud music, surely its not necessary in a lively,  busy upscale restaurant which creates its own buzz. However this is a minor point, the food was way over salted, lacked subtlety and refinement and was way below the standard we have experienced for a one star restaurant.   On our last trip to NYC we ate at Aldea another Michelin one star restaurant not far from Casa Mona and this was every bit as good as our European experiences, so this is not a Europe v USA debate.  On the upside the staff where attentive and polite - although we had to ask for one of the dishes to be explained to us- and the wine was well selected and very reasonably priced. However, this does not make up for the real disappointment of the food, this should have been one of the highlight of our holiday and its only succeeded in leaving a really bad impression. Michelin judges what are you doing?

NAME: Maja
REVIEW: We loved everything here, didn't even mind that the tables were so close together. The tapas were indeed phenomenal, and the service was even better!

NAME: Alyoops
REVIEW: Cases Mono is delightfully small with attentive service and excellent tapas. Each dish is carefully constructed and full of flavor. We had scallops with tiny apple slices. Simple and refreshing. Pork croquetta - yum - roasted vegetables with a beautiful sauce and flavorful minced lamb. Only criticism: very tight seating and frequently getting knocked about by servers. But it was worth it.

NAME: Juju
REVIEW: My friend and I were stuck in the table right next to the entrance.  Waiter service during the beginning of the meal was good.  Near the end of the meal when we had 2-3 bites left of our food and half our wine glasses still filled, we were asked about 2 times if we were done (despite seeing us STILL eating).  After the second time, we felt we were being hurried out of there so we took the hint and literally just stuffed whatever was left on the dish in our mouths and finished the wine.  As we were doing this, we were told we had to get out of our seats in 5 minutes because there was another group that reserved the table.  Now, I understand that this restaurant is popular and have reservations back to back, but come on.  I'm a relatively quick eater and have never been told to get out asap....Food was salty--maybe biased by my lackluster dining experience here.  Disappointed having heard good things about this restaurant from my friends and colleagues.  Probably won't be back...for awhile at least.

NAME: Native
REVIEW: We were 3 and seated at a table for 2, it was late lunch and the place wasn't crowded.  The server was surly and unhelpful.  We ordered 3 things to share and barely got any food.  The prices are outrageous for the amount of food you get and the atmosphere and service is horrific.  I saw that if you were "known" here you got a completely different experience.  BOOOOO.

NAME: ffranny
REVIEW: The food was great, but if the waiter takes pains to describe the dishes as "meant for sharing," then *please* plate them so two people at a small table in a small restaurant can divide them easily without surgical instruments and advanced gymnastics.

NAME: IngaO
REVIEW: Dishes were hit or miss. Very cramped and loud. They only serve wine and beer. No full bar.

NAME: DeliaG
REVIEW: We have been to Casa Mono many of times. Our waiter was excellent. On this occasion we had a friend from Japan joining. At one point he was trying to catch the attention of a waiter that was not our waiter. I do admit that he was being loud about, but that is what he is used to. When the other waiter came over my husband said...please pardon my friend. He replied..yes, he is being rude. We were very disappointed by his sarcastic comment. A restaurant in NYC should be more culturally aware of its clients and when we actually made a statement, he should not have been the sarcastic rude waiter.  Next time we go to Casa Mono we will make sure to get Brian and not sarcastic Rude waiter.

NAME: Feedmegood
REVIEW: Every dish seems to be too salty. Do not like most of the combination of the taste.

NAME: Frank
REVIEW: Overrated. Ok tapas, had much better. good wine program. Table too squished on top of each other. Everyone gets bumped reoeatedly.Not sure who paid off Michelin to get six year's worth of a one star. Maybe a Bib no way a star.

NAME: Hatetocook
REVIEW: We went to this restaurant for a friends birthday.  I reserved on open table and was given a choice of either 4:45 or 9:00.  During our dinner the restaurant was virtually empty so it seemed strange that we couldn't get a later time.  The staff was wonderful and explained everything and answered our many questions,  We all ordered different things so we could taste as many things as possible.  My one and only complaint is the wine.  There is a very extensive list that none of us understood.  With the help of the waiter, we were all satisfied with our selections.  The wine was served in a Cuorto or something like that.  It was supposed to be a glass and a half.  It was barely a glass.  50% of our bill was the wine.  Since we were not familiar with the wine, we had no idea how overcharged we were.  But certainly the food was delicious, just with I could bring my own wine!

NAME: Rado
REVIEW: Having heard about Casa Mono for so long and never having been before, was delighted with the variety and the delicious productions from the kitchen.  Can't wait to go back and explore other tempting dishes. I guess the one down side is that being small it is quite noisy, but makes up in flavor!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Amazing food at a reasonable price. Not too busy at lunchtime either. Should definitely be on everyone's short list of go-to places.

NAME: CaliforniaDiner
REVIEW: Delicate Tapas flavors, exquisite. Need to upgrade their tables and chairs

NAME: Fluffernutter
REVIEW: We shared everything- started w fideo w chorizo and clams, skirt steak w romesco and onion marmalade. Both were good. Following those, we had the goat confit (absurdly tender but a teensy bland) and the stuffed, braised lamb belly w mint and kohlrabi salad (AMAZING). We weren't drinking, the bill was 97$. Well worth it for a quiet, leisurely and delicious lunch.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I used to love this restaurant. But I don't think I will go back there after tonight.  After several visits here, I decided to bring my coworkers to treat them as I had been satisfied. It was 4 people and we ordered 6 items with a bottle of wine. My co worker found one small piece of black rubber from Pulpo. I let server know about it. He took the dish and did not come back to ask to have same item or different item from the menu. He just disappeared.  I found a piece of hard shell from pig ears appetizer right after we complained. At this point, I did not want to embarrass anyone and ruined dinner so I shut my mouth up.  Mussels and lamb belly were not great. Mussels were too salty and lamb belly was so greasy. Skirt steak was great and that's the only one recommendation among 6 dishes we ordered.   Service was attentive though. One star for him.

NAME: Saek
REVIEW: To have a meal that doesn't fail in any way simply doesn't happen enough.  The wine list was a book in itself and it was superior to many places that cost more.  Pan con Tomate, Ensalada Mono, Dorado, Steak, Potatoes and Mushroom are cooked to bring out incredible flavor. The Crema Catalan just brought back Barcelona.

NAME: annabelle
REVIEW: I've always enjoyed the food here, but don't expect a friendly server or good hospitality.

NAME: Frenchie
REVIEW: Great romantic NYC dinner!  Delicious plates to share and wonderful wine list.  Definitely well worth it!

NAME: AdamC
REVIEW: Better than ever. Service, food, wine service... Everything was impeccable. One of my favorite dining experiences of 2015.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The waiter recommended great dishes and wine.  He was right.

NAME: TheBlacklist
REVIEW: The meal and the service were both excellent, as always. The level of excellence is incredibly consistent that I could easily copy and paste my reviews from prior experiences and it would still be spot on. This is also the reason I enjoy purchasing Casa Mono GCs as I feel comfortable and confident that the recipient will have an equally enjoyable dining experience.

NAME: PBfoodie
REVIEW: We had a stellar evening at Casa Mona! The reservation is hard to get and typical not on the ideal date or best time but it's worth it! A 10!

NAME: Jazzfid
REVIEW: Superb. Loved it five years ago but even better now.  We had Sepia, Pork Belly and Lamb.  Quality of the meat and fish was superb. Preparation was imaginative, seasoning distinctive. The bread pudding was transcendent.

NAME: dalb
REVIEW: We had a really disappointing experience last night at casa mono. Overall, very pricy, 100$ per head with 1 glass of wine and 1 beer; food is good, not all the dishes have equal quality but overall food is fine. Portions are fairly small, but I guess this is the tapas style. We were squeezed on one small table sharing it with three other people and asked to move to an other table with more room, but the manager told us this is not the policy of the restaurant (???!?!?) that table was empty for 1 hour BTW. An other of this over rated NY restaurant which might have been nice once but lost all it's candor being popular.

NAME: Orlando94
REVIEW: We really enjoy our visit to Casal Mono! The food, the service, the ambiance, the attention to detail from The General Manager, Miguel de Leon, the servers, everything.  The best mussels and croquettes! Obviously, we loved it! Great experience.
