NAME: Panoh
REVIEW: The Spanish inspired cuisine was wonderful and varied. Our server was very knowledgable and attentive.

NAME: NewYorkFoodie
REVIEW: Pervasive over salted ruined the food. What might have been great skirt steak, was overwhelmed with salt. Great fideos - very salty sea beans. Fish - salty sauce. When I told the waiter the food was overly salted he thanked me. Everything we ordered seemed to also have an abundance of onions, which we did not appreciate with the undercooked patatas bravas. I understand trying to elevate a classic using fingerlings, but the dish did not work. The only really good dish was the fideos, and if not for that, we would have left hungry. Noisy with uncomfortable chairs,  and overpriced small portions - we will not return.

NAME: Crystal
REVIEW: Great service and we really enjoyed some of the dishes. Others were bland like the one chorizo dish. The lamb was amazing and so was the olive oil served with the meal. Pork belly dish was tasty as well.

NAME: NJlovesNYC
REVIEW: We loved this restaurant.  Tables for 2 limited, so in a corner.  Would opt for bar stools (offered) next time.  Everything was delicious and interesting.  Will be back to try other dishes and wine!

NAME: SRadjy
REVIEW: A few people in our group were a bit skeptical about menu items as they had unexpected combinations of ingredients but everything we had was absolutely delicious, with original and subtle pairings creating a really wonderful dining experience. Some favorites were the eggplant escabeche, leg of lamb with mushrooms, mussels with chorizo and cava, skirt steak, and burrata (I am sure I am forgetting a few). In addition the smaller plates make it perfect for sharing, and for trying more dishes than you could ever enjoy otherwise! Service was a little less adaptable/flexible/casual than ideal but still pleasant. We will definitely be back.

NAME: Nick12
REVIEW: Everything on the menu sounded great so it took a few minutes just to narrow down our choices.  My date and I split 5 dishes, 1 glass of white wine with our seafood dishes, 1 glass of red wine with our meat dishes and a dessert.  Every dish was amazing.  We had mussels in an amazing sauce, the grilled baby octopus over fennel, quail with smoked peppers, oxtail stuffed piquillo peppers, and the pork belly.  I would love to go back and try new things but it would be hard to not get some of these dishes again.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Allways a great experience. The food and wine are over the top good. Fun if you can eat at the bar and eneract with Chiefs...

NAME: MermaidMagicDines
REVIEW: Food has gone way downhill. Sardines tasted way too fishy.  I love sardines and have eaten them here before and these were horrible today.   Sepia was overcooked and chewy.  Sent it back. Octopus was so tiny basically about an inch.  Once they were grilled and sent atop a cold fennel salad they tasted like fennel.  No taste and not crispy grilled, just seared and served over a cold salad.  Tasteless. Sunflower Salad was different but braising sunflowers in red wine gave them too much tannin, and made your mouth scratchy. We went to casa  mono for their amazing razor clams, they were out!  This place is not half of what it used to be. Sad to see one of my favorite restaurants lose what they built their name on: great tapas!!! Not here any longer

NAME: daviboi
REVIEW: Though our table couldn't have been wedged in more closely, once the food began to arrive who could have cared?  In particular, the razor clams rocked my world - go as soon as you can, and as often.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Restaurant is cozy and intimate - smaller and a bit on the noisy side, but adds to the energy!  The black ham is amazing!

NAME: LaFleur
REVIEW: We love Casa Mono. Especially sitting at the bar. Everything there is delicious. But if they have the razor clams, order as many as they will sell you. They are an herby and garlicky treat that should not be missed.

NAME: KNYC
REVIEW: I like this little place a lot. Great for a long lunch. Excellent service & ambiance. Small tables mostly for 2, but the tapas is brought  2-3 plates at a time so the table never seems overcrowded. A well conceived and thorough Spanish wine list with lots of choices at every price. Order the razor clams even if they're not on the menu...they usually have them. Scallops & foie gras also terrific.

NAME: Wolff
REVIEW: Fantastic food and great ambiance. We'll definitely be back.

NAME: Glory
REVIEW: They opened their doors late but once they did we were seated and our order taken immediately.  Our first server didn't seem to know what was going on very much but later on - someone else arrived who was much more friendly and could explain the menu. There are NO cocktails here - just wine.    The food is SUPERB so you overlook the other flaws because its so yummy.

NAME: Jenny
REVIEW: Firstly the small plates aren't that small. Two of us ordered 4 plates to share and we couldn't finish. We had the special dish for the night - quail which is so delicious, grilled dorado was also very nice, bone marrow was super large dish and was ok.. And the rabbit - all of the meat was used including liver and kidney, which was also ok. We would come back for the quail and dorado.

NAME: todi7254
REVIEW: Cozy restaurant and bar,  excellent choice of wines and delectable small plates make this a fun and informal spot with 1 michelin star.

NAME: aJadedNewYorker
REVIEW: Is a bad joke, mini portion, don't participate I you can't serve regular portion with some garnish

NAME: Jess
REVIEW: Very disappointed. The space is too small and the food is not as good as Michelin star food should be. The ensalada is good. The oxtail is very salty and burned. The desert is also badly made, not even as good as I can make. The service is also not good. Nobody came to fill my water when it is completely empty. I would not recommend the restaurant week menu to anybody. Maybe the normal dishes are good. But for the restaurant week, Casa Mono should make a little more effort to please its customers.

NAME: Tommy
REVIEW: Actually the food is pretty good, the environment is not bad too. I like the restaurant a lot because it is quiet and people can talk to each other rather than too louder. The service is very good too because the waiter will keep check back to our table to make sure our food is good or not. Overall, only one thing i don't like it from this restaurant is the food is too oily.  But i still recommend my friend to come try it

NAME: teach29
REVIEW: Vibrant ambiance, great food and service.

NAME: Jessica
REVIEW: My partner and I took two other couples to Casa Mono, one of our favorites in the city, for dinner and everyone raved afterwards about how wonderful the food was and how much they enjoyed the restaurant. I come here regularly and have never had a dish that I didn't like. The service is always fabulous, and I will definitely keep coming back for more.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: this was a wonderful dinner. Everything from the choices of dishes, the service, the wine list, the ambience. And most of all the food was terrific. Sorry I had never been here before, but will certainly be here again!!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: expensive expensive expensive!!! The important thing need to repeat three times.we ordered the restaurant week but were unable to use. The food is good, but not worth the price tag! I would rather spend the same money to stripe house for fantastic steak!

NAME: JeffM
REVIEW: About a month ago, we took a class at the Institute of Culinary Education "Classic Dishes fro Casa Mono" taught be Andy Sasso - head chef at Casa Mono.  We loved the class and wanted to check it out.  Tiny place, but to start with -service was friendly attentive and knowledgable.  Between us we had 6 plates - oysters, baby squid, cod croquettes, potatoes bravado, pork meatballs with clams, and pork belly.  Food was delicious, beatifully presented, and the serving size was perfect.    We will return soon.

NAME: Extremens
REVIEW: Charcuterie plate was good; everything else overpriced and salty.

NAME: Fooder
REVIEW: The food is very well made and the service professional. Wine list is thorough and well chosen, but coravin white wines are served by the glass  at cellar temperature (in other words, not at the correct one). However, the only relevant nit is a certain odor of fry produced by the kitchen, which is not perfectly neutralized by the exhauster. Not the most inspiring thing to experience in a restaurant.

NAME: kmrebello
REVIEW: Great ambiance, very small space but you immediately feel at home in Casa Mono. Interesting dishes and wine selection, we couldn't get enough. Our new favorite spot. Try the razor clams and the pulpo!

NAME: Delightful
REVIEW: Delightful, as usual, especially for nonNYC friends!

NAME: amblouin
REVIEW: Great find recommended by a chef friend. The service is impeccable, the wine list is just wow (lost of private imports from Spain so talking to the sommelier is a good idea) and the food was truly outstanding. From the olive oil and bread to set the table to the rabbit, pork belly, oyster mushrooms, clam and pork dish, charcuteries, patatas bravas and so on and so forth.

NAME: Martha
REVIEW: Came here the first time on a double date. The food was good but be prepared that the menu is modern fusion. Portion is also slightly larger than a typical serving size. Our favorite is the pig ear.

NAME: MJ1203
REVIEW: Unique small plates of Spanish gourmet foods in a very small, energetic space. Delicious wine and fantastic service!

NAME: Boo13
REVIEW: We drove in from  CT for a Fathers Day lunch. They seated our party of three at a table for two pushed up against another table for two with three people. We asked to sit where two tables were put together more comfortably but were told they were reserved.  Everyone who walked by bumped into our chairs. Service was rushed. We were out of there in under forty minutes and, by the way, no one ever sat at the two empty tables we asked to move to. Temperature in the eighties outside but no air conditioning. The food was decent but we will never go back.

NAME: LeeA
REVIEW: We had a group of five (5) for this past Friday lunch and it was perfect! I knew that going into this that the restaurant is intimate in size, but it ended up being just the right amount of intimacy as the food selection an plate ingredients sparked animated conversation. As I was the host, I solicited suggestions from the group as to what they wanted/didn't want and went from there. Service and pace of the dishes coming out was great and overall, could not have done anything different to make this lunch better. Would definitely go back again!

NAME: Lichi83
REVIEW: Food was good, wine was excellent. great service and nice bar area next door. Pricy.

NAME: Nina
REVIEW: Don't miss the scallops and the pork belly plates - they are delicious. The place is smallish though. We arrived just a tad bit before the opening time but we were allowed only at the exact opening time. Try also their churros chocolate.

NAME: DPaul
REVIEW: One of the closest places to feel like eating in Spain.  It is outstanding. Every single dish was so good and no need of complex ingredients. It is a most!

NAME: Eateat
REVIEW: I didn't have one dish I did not enjoy! The flavors were surprising and original. We had a hard time  picking which dish was the best. The sauces on the clam razors , mussels and calamari were each outstanding! (Wish I could bottle each of them and serve over pasta!) The service was excellent, attentive but not overbearing! Just an excellent experience!

NAME: Douglas
REVIEW: We live in the Flatiron, and Casa Mono has never disappointed. We treated friends from Montreal the other night (they and their city are very into food) and they loved it. The dishes were varied and uniformly excellent (the lamb belly, the crispy pigs ears, the bone marrow, the sardines, the jamon Iberico to start . . . ). Our server was professional, informative, friendly and our sommelier came up with a great wine recommendation. In fact, he checked the wine before pouring it - if was off - and apologized that our jamon Iberico would now arrive a few minutes earlier than the wine while he went searching for a replacment. That's service self-awareness at its best.  Every visit makes us want to go back for more!

NAME: YummyFoodForager
REVIEW: We got the razor clams (not on menu, had to be requested), skirt steak,  oxtail stuffed peppers, and soft shelled crab. My husband still cannot stop raving about the razor clams, which we've only had previously in Spain. My favorite was the skirt steak and the remoulade that came with it, even though I normally am not big on beef. It was very tasty!  The service could have been better. Our server seemed to be annoyed that we asked about the razor clams, because we'd heard about them from a friend, yet it was not on the menu. He said it was a special, yet we were never told the specials. He also managed to hit his foot on my chair every time he walked by, possibly due to there being very little space in the restaurant. However, he became nicer towards the end of the meal, when we got the absolutely delicious olive oil ice cream. All the other staff seemed extremely nice.  While my husband would love to visit again asap, I thought Casa Mono was good restaurant to bring back memories of Spain, but there are many other restaurants to try also.

NAME: PeteNYC
REVIEW: Great food, Great atmosphere, perfect for celebrations.  Not a big place, good for groups of 4 or less, mostly tables for two.  The octopus and bone marrow were out of this world.  Highly Recommend.  Also, very extensive wine list.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Each time I go here the food gets better. Try the new piquillo stuffed with oxtail it is not to be missed. Wine list is by far the best Spanish list in the city, perhaps the country.

NAME: Pinkie
REVIEW: The food and wine @ Casa Mono has never disappointed. Service is patchy at best - have had great waiters but gee it's a drag when you know more than they do - and they don't get it! Oh young people these days ...so be guided by your palate  in choosing the food combos and  stay with the carafes.  Not for novices but  if artichoke octupus and goat appeal you are in for a treat😋

NAME: KristinaM
REVIEW: As always, fantastic food. I go to Casa Mono every time I come to NY

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Perfect tapas restaurant  as a gift for Mom's birthday. We both enjoyed the open eatery feel; much like a small Parisian cafe. The food was outstanding, creative and an absolute delight. Staff was pleasant and prompt in their service. Would certainly recommend for any and all persons to enjoy.

NAME: FGS1201
REVIEW: I live overseas and come every year and Casa Mono hasn't disappointed. Creative, tasty and reasonably priced too.

NAME: BillW
REVIEW: Average service, too packed tables, way too salty dishes.

NAME: pbjp
REVIEW: Food and service great. Ventilation needs improved. Clothes reeked of fryolator next morning. Not clear why will not seat until all have arrived. Quaint but outdated. Sets negative tone.

NAME: Kemmie
REVIEW: As great as I remembered it in the first couple of years when it opened. The pork belly is the best I ever had, period.

NAME: DrDan
REVIEW: Every detail counts in presentation and assembly of  each dish. Superb!

NAME: CityChick
REVIEW: Came here to celebrate my husbands birthday on a Monday night. The restaurant was full. Very nice interior cozy, open kitchen, good for a work dinner but also romantic enough for a couples dinner. We ordered five plates off the entire menu and were quit full at the end of the night. Our waiter was very knowledgable and recommended the most popular dishes to us.  The creamy eggs with sea urchin and oxtail stuffed peppers were two of my favorites. Overall our experience was very pleasant, good food, good atmosphere and pleasant staff.

NAME: eattting
REVIEW: The razor clams, the quail and the lamb with chocolate sauce especially. Good wine list too.

NAME: RediscoveringNYC
REVIEW: What a great find! How did I live in NYC for so many years and nor know about this place? The tapas were so creative and tasty. So much better than all the generic tapas places I've eaten at all my life, in the U.S. and Spain. The clams are a must eat!!!

NAME: LoveIt
REVIEW: We sat at the bar instead of a table by choice, because it gave us a front seat view of open kitchen, which was really fun and added a lot to the experience. Food was crazy delicious.

NAME: Thelesis
REVIEW: Eggs with sea urchin, walnut and lime zest were silky, indulgent and delicious, interesting contrasts in flavor and texture.  The fideos with chorizo and clams didn't hold up to my memory -- skimpy on the clams and the fideos were mushy.  Pimentos stuffed with oxtail were good, pretty much exactly as one would imagine them.  The rabbit with habanero sauce was a standout.  All the different portions of rabbit were cooked to perfection, the habanero sauce had a mellow, fruity heat and the house-made kimchee provided a bright note of acid to offset the richness of the rabbit.

NAME: Joey
REVIEW: I guarantee if you take the dishes recommended then you won't regret it! We couldn't believe how much flavour was in each dish. We were also very impressed by the wine list and recommendations given for the wine.  We have travelled extensively around Spain and the knowledge of the Sommelier was really impressive.  The only wish would be that I had enough room to taste the whole menu here.  This restaurant would easily be one of my all time favourites ever! Thank you Casa Mono, it was sensational!

NAME: Steve
REVIEW: Absolutely phenomenal tapas restaurant. Though a tad pricey, you are getting high quality authentic Spanish cuisine. Definitely a romantic spot for a date. I don't recommend going with a group larger than 4 as seating is close and sometimes limited. Watching the chefs prepare the dishes is a real treat as their motions are fluid and professional. They're also ready and willing to have a conversation or to answer any questions you have with the food. I recommend starting with the buffalo milk burrata.

NAME: Gourmet
REVIEW: The food was delicious - great wines and very good service - Servers were knowledgable and very pleasant.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono is my favorite restaurant in NYC. The wine list is amazing and incredibly unique. The food is extraordinary. Sit at the bar where you can watch the chefs cook in front of you.

NAME: aolaw
REVIEW: Something is wrong from the last several times I dined here.  The fideos with clam dish wasn't prepared with care.  The dish was not run under the salamander to crisp up the fideos, the fideos were just thrown together with the clams in haphazard manner. It looked like a dog's breakfast.    The pulpo/grapefruit/fennel salad also didn't look fresh and didn't taste the same from the last 3 previous visits.  Given the high prices, not coming back.

NAME: Storm6482
REVIEW: I was first taken to Casa Mono over 5 years ago, and I had little experience with Michelin starred restaurants at the time.  I was wow'd by everything, justifiably so.  I took my fiance this weekend, and this time, I went with much greater experience in great dining.  The food has held over the years but the service was quite disappointing and almost a little embarrassing since I took my fiance for a special occasion and expected that Casa Mono would make every table feel special.  There was no extra care or attention that was given to us, actually, barely any attention at all.  The bussing staff was very pleasant when dropping off the food but I think the waiter spent a total of 5 minutes at our table all night.  It was the most impersonal dining experience I've had at such a reputable restaurant.  When leaving (after paying more than $200 for our meal), no one even acknowledged our departure.  For that, I have sadly had my last at Casa Mono.

NAME: AllOvrNYC
REVIEW: The food is awesome at Casa Mono but they need more space - the place is way too crowded and you always feel pressured to get in and get out quickly.

NAME: KINNG
REVIEW: Cozy restaurant with great food

NAME: Willajane
REVIEW: Great food- authentic tapas style. Seafood , veggies and meat- mostly pork. Something for everyone. Great spanish wine list. Crowded and cramped but it's part of the fun.

NAME: drcs
REVIEW: Enjoyed our dinner. Selected multiple Tapas.  Worked with the Sommelier to make an excellent wine choice.  Spanish cheese to finish.

NAME: DRRDM
REVIEW: Very good tapas style menu.  Everything that we got that night was excellent, even though they forgot to bring us our razor clams.  The portions are the right size to where you don;t need to order a bunch of plates just to try to get full.

NAME: deecath
REVIEW: We've been coming here every year since our first date, and are always thrilled. The menu is diverse and our server was wonderful at helping us navigate and choose accompaniments that made for an amazing meal. You know you'll be tucked in snugly and well fed. Go with the recess and you won't go wrong!

NAME: Staiffy
REVIEW: Two of the 6 courses were very good (the razor clams and the beet salad).  The brussel sprouts were cloyingly sweet, swimming in a sugary syrup.  The three meat dishes were cold by the time they were served and the sauces had begun to congeal.  We would not recommend this restaurant.

NAME: kiki
REVIEW: we had a reservation here at 1015 on a saturday night. we asked to sit at the bar instead of a table. the menu is great, inventive but traditional flavors of spanish tapas.  we ordered our food and asked for it to come out slowly, and one at a time.  our first course was served before we even got our wine. so we waited to start eating until we received our wine. from that point on, the plates came out incredibly fast and we couldn't eat them fast enough while they were still warm. we were sitting at the chefs bar and the chefs still prepared our dishes when they could see that we weren't ready for them.  the waitress was nowhere to be found the entire time we were dining and we could see her standing behind the bar drinking with other waitstaff. no one filled our water the entire meal. unfortunately, the service overshadowed the food that were delicious, and likely ever better if we could have eaten them warm.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Disappointing - there was sand in several of the mussels and overall food quality had gone downhill since I went a year ago.

NAME: Kbsou97
REVIEW: Great birthday lunch with my mom and friend

NAME: Hippo
REVIEW: I would say the size of food was too little for both of us. They shrinked it. Waiters are good looking.

NAME: Terrific
REVIEW: Flavor rules at Casa Mono. Each dish has the intensity you look for in truly great food. Try the razor clams, pulpo, sepia, skirt steak, pork belly, fideos, and many others. Nothing not to like in this place.

NAME: hcf2
REVIEW: Food was very good, if on the saltier side.  Space is tiny--we were wedged into a corner where the waiter had to struggle to reach us, which means he checked up on us less than he should have (plus less water refills, etc).  They had empty tables for the larger area of the restaurant too--they just really wanted to squeeze the 2 person tables into this tiny area.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was delicious!

NAME: gotosunshine
REVIEW: Amazing tapas food and excellent wine menu. The hostess is extremely nice and very accommodating. Great service. The restaurant is very small but the ambiance is great and it is fabulous in the summer when they open the windows and it feels like you are outside while being inside. Definitely my top restaurant for Spanish food in the city.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The service has gone downhill. Waitresses had weird attitude, seemed as if they didn't want to serve you, or couldn't wait to get out of work. When I asked for wine recommendation, not only was she disinterested, but simply stopped talking after pointing to one wine on the menu, saying it was fruity and dry, full-stopped.  Been going to both Casa Mono and Bar Jamon, since they first opened...but the most recent experience will likely put a stop to it.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: It is normally much better. Coming late, you seem to get the bottom of the casseroles. It remains on of my favorites but i will go earlier next time

NAME: BintheBigApple
REVIEW: I took my boyfriend to Casa Mono for his birthday, partly because we'd read how great it was and partly because I hoped it would bring back memories of our fantastic trip to Spain last summer. It exceeded my expectations and we had a wonderful night and a truly delicious dinner.

NAME: KJtravelers63
REVIEW: Small neighborhood gem; Michelin award winner with superior quality food/fresh farm ingredients and plenty of menu choices (meat, fish, veggies, etc); amazing dishes with clear ties to traditional Spanish meat & preparation; this is a fun place to try lots of dishes that are high quality in prep, presentation & flavors!   we went as a part of 6 which is tougher for the restaurant (small size; parties of  2 and 4 are ideal) however it we still had a fabulous time. Service is extraordinary; they provide new silverware and plates periodically which is great given sauces and other 'left behind' traces after a few dishes; servers know the wine list well and can provide recommendations with ease based upon your taste preferences and target $

NAME: AllOvrNYC
REVIEW: The food is absolutely delicious but you get the impression they are in financial trouble from the service. From the moment you walk in the servers are on you to order drinks and food and definitely make it clear they have a quota for flipping tables. Doesn't make for the most relaxed or enjoyable dining experience to have staff breathing down your neck. That said, the food is excellent so as long as you're prepared to fight the staff it's totally worth it!

NAME: Soto
REVIEW: We spent two weeks in Spain last month and have been re-sampling the Spanish and tapas restaurants in NYC, trying to find something that compares with the amazing food we remembered in Madrid and Barcelona.  Casa Mono does a respectable job in many ways.  First, the disappointment: the Jamon Iberico was dry and cut too thick, so it didn't have the silky mouthfeel or sweetness of the real deal, but to their credit, CM is one of the few places we've found so far where they actually cut it by hand rather than on a slicer.  On the positive side, they had a great action of Spanish wines and the Rioja we selected was lush and round and delicious.  The baby octopus with fennel and grapefruit was a great mix of sweet and savory; the skirt steak with romesco sauce was intensely flavorful and perfectly cooked; the Brussel sprouts with chorizo will convert anyone who does not normally like them; and the peppers stuffed with oxtail were so meltingly delicious and rich that I had to cut them into quarters and wait a few minutes between each bite.  The place is small and invariably packed, and there is nothing to absorb the racket of the enthusiastic crowd, so be sure to prepare for them din.  We'll definitely be back for the food though.

NAME: Cather123
REVIEW: It's not quite being in Barcelona, but comes pretty close.  Cooked food quite delicious, especially the vegetarian dishes.  Best brussells sprouts, great potatoes.  Skip the expensive jamon iberico - it's just not what you'd get in Europe and not worth it.  Pan tomate quite tasty.  Comb the extensive wine list for bottles you can afford, or speak to the helpful wine steward.

NAME: alexa
REVIEW: as a tapas officionado, i was a little bit disappointed in the breadth of both the wine list and the side dishes. the mains took up too much of the menu. definitley get the razor clams and the oxtail. avoid the artichokes with mint (very lemony). not a bottle of wine in the 30-50 dollar range that was my type at all.

NAME: Lynn
REVIEW: We loved everything about Casa Mono - food, service, ambiance.  We often have out-of-town guests, so we will be sure to return for lunch or dinner.

NAME: LWilliamz
REVIEW: Casa Mono has been a destination dining experience for me for years. This most recent experience was very poor. We had an early reservation in order to accommodate our evening plans. The restaurant was not busy. The waiter paid us very little attention and did nothing to describe the menu or help build up our experience. The food itself also fell short of my expectations. I'll be finding a new favorite NYC restaurant.

NAME: SbsNYC
REVIEW: The food is varied, tasty, served on small plates. One's tendency is to order practically everything, knowing and trusting that each item will be pleasing. A personal favorite is the bone marrow. The bones are cut lengthwise. Oh my. Also, we were given a taste of the wine in order to choose the one we liked best. This seems a positive good gesture on the part of any good restaurant.

NAME: YDV2015
REVIEW: I was drawn to this place because of the pictures they post on Instagram. The food looks AMAZING! And the plates looked like a normal size. Well they're not. All they have is tapas which is fine but get ready to pay $20 or more for each and they're VERY small servings...like the waitress recommended you would need at least 3 to be some what satisfied. We were a group of 4 and our bill was $468 plus tax and gratuity which included 2 bottles of wine. But still I think that's way too much $$$ for just tapas. The place is very low key for that kind of pricing.

NAME: Chanukha
REVIEW: I don't think there was a dish that we didn't like. Very consistent and attentive service.  Probably the best tapas in NYC at the moment. Plan ahead and make reservations far out in advance.

NAME: alexa
REVIEW: very fun -  tapas delicious- go with groups who like to share food

NAME: Noah
REVIEW: Haven't been in a while but it was great as always. The food here is the star, the Fidelios are my favorite. But the foie gras was to die for.

NAME: Fressman
REVIEW: We had been to Casa Mono several times in the past, but not for more than a year. We were pleased, as in the past, at the high level of food quality again on this visit. Of the four dishes we had two were absolutely stupendous and the other two were quite good. I don't think I'll bother with dessert the next time, but I will return for the rest.

NAME: ywing
REVIEW: Not as good as last time. Food is a bit too salty.

NAME: Dirnyl60
REVIEW: I continue to be impressed with the food, service and general ambiance of this wonderful neighborhood restaurant.  Great wines and wonderful sharing plates, whether for two people or a larger group.

NAME: UES84
REVIEW: I've had both lunch and dinner here.  Dinner was packed and the service was excellent.  During lunch there was barely anyone here yet my friend and I were told to sit in a cold corner by the window.  When asked to move, we were told we could move to another table by the window in a corner.  There was barely anybody there so I'm not sure why we couldn't sit in the middle of the restaurant.  Because we were in the corner, I felt like the waiter forgot about us.  The tapas came out about 20 min apart which was difficult bc the waiter knew we weren't sharing but ordered our own.  The food is excellent which is why I will go back.

NAME: Nycfoodie
REVIEW: Still sublime after 11 years in business!  Thankfully, keeping old favorites and introducing new ones constantly.  OMG - eggs and sea urchin!!!!!!

NAME: Obeofthebest
REVIEW: We got there at 1110 and our reservation  was at 1115 we got sat really fast and server was right on point.  The food here is great,  I've tried the oxtail and the goat, and I have to say it's they were both delicious. Wine selection is also pretty good.

NAME: Somuchtosee
REVIEW: Casa Mono is consistently wonderful.  Although it's a small place and it can be difficult to get a reservation, the food is worth the effort; it's creative, delicious and innovative.  I've been many times and still want to go back and try more items on the menu.

NAME: Riomalleo
REVIEW: Noise level is pretty high and it is a little difficult to hold a conversation …. especially a romantic one.

NAME: Chanukha
REVIEW: I don't expect to be waited hand and foot in NY, nor to have exceptionally attentive service but Casa Mono takes disinterested service to a new level.  Perhaps the servers don't get paid on time. The waiter kicked my chair maybe 15 times while I was there.  The food is good but I don't know if I will go back. I can't take waiters who seem to be doing me a favor to take my order or get my check.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: small portion..taste ok.a little expensive.One of waiter is so so.A Korean good is good.

NAME: foodie
REVIEW: Every single dish was outstanding! We tried the Foie Gras with Cinco Cebollas (super flavourful), Bone Marrow with Tomato Jam and Pickled Sandía (tomato jam was  an uncommon and welcome addition to the bone marrow), Skirt Steak with Romesco and Onion Mermelada (steak was cooked perfectly and the romesco was delicious) and Confit Goat with Avocado Queso, Scallion Ash and Pistachios (the avocado was a great complement to the goat).   For dessert, we had the Pudín de Pan and the Chocolate, Crème Fraîche, Cherry Calimocho. Both were delicious!

NAME: MAndersen
REVIEW: A splendid tapas bar! The space is small and vibrant; the selections are unusual but can also accommodate less adventurous palates,from jamón serrano,fried squid , and quail to Duck egg , bone marrow, crispy pig's  ears. Service very good.  The selection of Spanish wines is spectacular.  It is noisy, though less so at lunch.  This makes it all the more authentically "Spanish," I would argue.

NAME: lovetotravel
REVIEW: My husband and I went to this restaurant specifically to try the sea urchin. While the food was good, the rest of the experience was lacking.The waitress was very inattentive, never explained the plates to us, and we needed to look like we where shooing away hornets in order to get her attention. The server, when delivering our plates only mumbled. I was also disappointed that the wine list only carried dry wines, thus I ate my meal with just water.

NAME: PeckhamIndian
REVIEW: A fantastic gem serving innovative dishes, as cook I will be stealing their ideas! Great wine list too. The staff are excellent - I only wish I had listened to my waitress when she told me not to order so much, but the menu is so inviting for one who has eyes bigger than their stomach. I would certainly recommend Casa Mono.

NAME: Diner
REVIEW: The pan con tomate was spectacular.  The pulpo was good but not spectacular, and the marrow was a little short on marrow, but still tasty.

NAME: Atilla
REVIEW: This was probably my 10th visit over the past several years.  In the past I have always found everything to be first rate and the flavors of the various dished making it more than worthwhile to put up with the crowded, cramped dining room.  This time the service, and more importantly, the food were not up to past standards.  For example, the quail was several stages beyond well done and the beet dish (always a favorite in the past) was approaching the end of its shelf life.  I hope this was simply an off-night for both the kitchen and the wait staff.

NAME: LoveNYCdining
REVIEW: The food was very good but the space was too crowded.  Very little leg room.  The wine list was outrageously priced.

NAME: MadameKebab
REVIEW: This is a place to keep on the top of your list. It's a very special place and the food is very creative and delicious.  It can be a bit noisy, so you have to be in the mood, but once you settle in you forget about it. Dinner reservations you have to book well ahead. Lunch is fantastic and not too crowded.

NAME: keepemhonest
REVIEW: dont go there on a monday, the food is left prepared by bus boys

NAME: Angostura
REVIEW: I love everything about this restaurant, the location is perfect, the menu is inventive and there is always something that will please any palate with its variety of dishes, the amazing 100% Spanish wine list, the service is very attentive. It's tiny and quaint and it reminds me of so many places I've eaten in Spain. This is one of my regular choices for places to have lunch with a friend or a client or to have an intimate dinner with a couple of people.  This is one of the places you must try if you are visiting New York. Not for children, not for large groups!

NAME: GlobalFoodie
REVIEW: Simple, tasty, inventive Spanish tapas.  One of my favorite spots for a quick bite.  Restaurant is small, so big groups maybe tough.

NAME: Fede
REVIEW: Very nice, vibrant atmosfere for a casual dinner with great wine and a nice, rich food. Not the most traditional Spanish recipes but well executed and presented.

NAME: mannieelizabeth
REVIEW: I've been there twice now and I think it's amazing. It's a very small place. Some might claim it is too tight... But the food and service are perfect. I went with my mom and we shared 5 courses and 2 desserts accompanied with a bottle of rose. Each dish got better and better! We had sea bass cevice, octopus, scallops, foie gras and rabbit. The rabbit was the most filling and satisfying (entree size) and the foie gras was served in a way I've never had before and was so rich. Our server was so nice and helpful, I let him pick our desserts, olive oil ice cream and chocolate creme fraiche. You can either sit at the bar, kitchen counter, or table. All three are great experiences in their own way. Will be going back again for a special occasion!

NAME: Trimalchio
REVIEW: Inventive, tasty tapas in an extremely small space.  The staff copes well with the limitations.  $21 is too much for a glass of wine.  Not a place to linger.  Coat check should be provided gratis by the house.  Expecting yet another tip for so essential a service smacks of extortion.

NAME: Honeybee
REVIEW: Our server was excellent, helpful and informative.  I'm gluten intolerant and he was very accommodating in working with me.

NAME: bostonsuzette
REVIEW: We made a special trip from Boston to Casa Mono in NYC to relive the great cuisine we enjoyed in Spain this past summer.  However, we were disappointed.  The dishes sounded exciting and innovative on the menu, but the bold fresh flavors were not there in some dishes and the execution was uneven.  The razor clams were flavorful but too chewy, and I suspect overgrilled. The oxtails in peppers lacked a richness in taste. The baby octopus also tasted overcooked and we've had better elsewhere.  However the goat was perfect, and the eggs with sea urchin was deliciously memorable.  The service was superb!  But for the $$$, it was good food, but not a memorable food experience.

NAME: brkgny
REVIEW: Olive oil and squash was different. Calamar was really good.

NAME: ratatat
REVIEW: This is a very special place. The service is good and the small plates are delicious. Its fun to share tastes and though I have been back several times, the quality is always superb and there is often something new on the menu. My favorites are the skirt steak, the razor clams, the goat fritte, the sea bass ceviche. Actually, every dish is great - it just depends on your mood. I like sitting at the bar when there are just two of us because it is fun to watch the chefs prepare the food.

NAME: FLLdiner
REVIEW: Our best meal, hands down, during 4 days in NYC.  This is seriously good eating.  Sweetbreads, octopus, headcheese, all dressed up with the most delicious accompaniments.  The room is vibrant and the diners are serious.  It's all good.

NAME: lpks
REVIEW: Fun and delicious for lunch or dinner, as the small plates menu allows you to have a unique experience each time you go. Loved both the scallops dish and chorizo meatballs this time around.

NAME: jayj
REVIEW: First time trying tapa Loved it Must try razor clamp Thumbs up!!

NAME: Genn
REVIEW: My sister and I have made it a yearly tradition to come here and add new food experiences to her palate. Last year is was sweetbreads. This year? Foie. The service is perfect, as is the food. We love sitting at the chef bar. It's like dinner and a show!

NAME: Bobette
REVIEW: Great menu, service not very friendly, too expensive for the experience. Does seems like a local place is spain

NAME: LindaF
REVIEW: The food was terrific and the tapas larger in quantity than what we expected.

NAME: Macjohn
REVIEW: We declined our middle-of-the-room table for a perch at the bar at this cozy and vibrant night spot off Union Square.  Enjoyed terrific service and tapas that will make your senses sing!  Wine recommendations were spot on with the dishes we ordered:  Buffalo's Milk Burrata with Saffron Oranges, Raw Soho Salmon with Flor de Anis and Champagne grapes, Sepia a la Plancha with preserved lemon, green olive and shallot vinaigrette, skirt steak with Romesco and onion marmalade, rabbit with Haberno Cuajada and Mono Kimchee ... :) Wishing we could return and do a second round - so many tasty looking tapas to try!  We'll be back.

NAME: Chrisbrasileiro
REVIEW: If you love food and are curious to see chefs performing right in front of your eyes, you must go see this place. Ask to be seated at the bar.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: It can get noisy. The food there is a refreshing change.

NAME: Tigrrr
REVIEW: Casa Mono had incredible tapas. Very innovative, fresh, and delicately made. Space of the restaurant was right but the ambience was nice. Great wines!

NAME: Edabo
REVIEW: Most of the food was too greasy. We made the reservations nearly 1 month ago and got the worst table in one corner. Also the service was poor.

NAME: Wheresthebeef
REVIEW: An amazing wine selection and the most interesting Iberian flavors

NAME: Jason
REVIEW: Very nice food Too small tables  Restroom too small and not clean Very tight dining room

NAME: KKickit
REVIEW: Food, ambiance, wine, atmosphere all great.  Only complaint, and it happens at most restaurant is wait staff tries to take your plates too fast!

NAME: petergjp
REVIEW: delicious food, great atmosphere, excellent service.  nothing more to be said!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food and service has gone down hill dramatically here.  Four or Five years ago you got a really meal of tapas, but the quality has gone down dramatically and the prices are really terrible for the value you get.  Unfortunately I will not be returning in the future as there is far better value (and more space to sit) in numerous tapas-inspired restaurants throughout the city.

NAME: Pratali
REVIEW: The ideas of Spain Tapas is pretty nice. Small plates and you can try many diferentes tastes. And they até excellent in that place.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: this is my 4th time eating here and they have exceeded my expectations every time in terms of quality and creativity of the food and the recommendation of the wines and cava...

NAME: Jenn
REVIEW: My husband and I came here for dinner after receiving a recommendation from a friend. Would HIGHLY recommend to anyone! We are total foodies and this is one of the best places we've been to - ever! We sat at the bar by the kitchen which totally enhanced the experience! Five stars! :)

NAME: JuliaK
REVIEW: We came to NYC for our 10th anniversary and ate at many excellent restaurants during our weekend here. But Casa Mono was by far our favorite. Beautiful carefully prepared food, an enthusiastic and knowledgeable waitress, and great sherry and wine. Our favorite was the goat- completely and unexpectedly delicious. But all the dishes were fabulous. We would come back again in a minute.

NAME: rshorens
REVIEW: Casa Mono is a good place for meeting friends for delicious tapas, Serrano ham, Cava, and other drinks. We had bacalao and smoked salmon with grapes. Food was beautifully served and delicious. I loved the open air setting- very European. Service was attentive.

NAME: KCazador
REVIEW: Very nice neighborhood place. Excellent food and service. Can't ask for much more.

NAME: Amy1
REVIEW: Great food, great wine, great place.  The whole package.

NAME: tiden
REVIEW: loved my recent experience at the restaurant.  Great variety of food on the menu plus 2 additionnal special of the days (which where both very good).  we had 5 plate for my girlfrind and I, which we found was enough ofr us.    Wine was on the expensive side but choice is impressive.    Overall, great experience  thanks

NAME: LaFleur
REVIEW: Casa Mono is crazy good. Amazing range of small plates. We try something new each time we go. This time loved the goat confit, pork belly, mussels, sepia. And the selection of Spanish wines is second to none. But if you are prone to claustrophobia, it might not be the place for you.

NAME: Xfw50
REVIEW: This restaurant never fails to impress! I've been here about 4 times now and have always had the same high quality service, while casual and unobtrusive. The variety of different flavour combinations on your plate are a revelation.

NAME: zizza
REVIEW: Oh wow, there's some really good food at this place.  The sea urchin deviled eggs were sensational, as was the skirt steak.  I'll be back!

NAME: Foodie
REVIEW: Once again, FANTASTIC.  Food and wine were outstanding. Service was excellent at this adorable restaurant.

NAME: ESNFit
REVIEW: This is one of those restaurants that does not necessarily stand out; it is a small corner spot that I would probably have never explored if it hadn't been for a colleague's recommendation. However, it was one of the best restaurant experiences I have ever had. The food was carefully prepared, beautifully presented, and bursting with flavor. The best part of it all was that we had the opportunity to sit at the counter and watch all of the food be prepared. The wine list is extensive--definitely expensive, but we were not unsatisfied. The service was also excellent. Our waiter helped us choose an appropriate wine (that we loved) and the chefs, while in action, were happy to answer our questions.

NAME: RAHPT
REVIEW: Small and intimate interior. I would consider bar if single or small group to watch cooks. Excellent food, small portions, but delicious. Decent wine selection. Great servers: knowledge and service. Adequate support staff but seemed to be just doing their job.

NAME: Vishne
REVIEW: We're occasional customers at Casa Mono and always enjoy the food and wine. This time we tried out their restaurant week menu. The food (other than the dessert) was delicious, featuring a particularly outstanding pulpo appetizer served on a bed of creamy avocado, but the portions were tiny. I say this as a petite woman: three slices of chorizo does not a main course make, even at lunch. My chocolate cake was tragically stale: it looked like a molten cake, and possibly was one when the pastry chef took it out of the oven a couple of months ago, but by the time it reached my fork it was cold, hard, and insipid. But by that point I was too merrily sloshed on the brimming quartino of rose our server clandestinely poured for me to care.

NAME: NYCGER
REVIEW: We used restaurant week as an excuse to try as many dishes as possible - we ordered one of everything on the special lunch menu.  The favorites were:  paella croquetas, pulpo, the grilled tomato, dorado, and for dessert, the chocolate cake and the melon sorbet.  Most of these items are not on the regular menu, so my advice to future diners is try everything!  NB - this place is tiny!  There are very few tables and they are so close together, you can share a dish with your neighbors without stretching.  Eating at the counter might be a better option...

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: It used to be one of my favoriate restaurant. But after my latest lunch visit during NYC Restaurant Week, I am a little hesitate to say so. To be fair, the food is still good there. But the service is the worst I've ever seen. The waitress asks if we would like to order any wine first. After I told her that no wine for us as we need to go back to the office. She abruptly left and we waited there forever for her to be back to take order. And she didn't show up again during the entire meal. And they charge $10 for syrup on sobert?? $10 to make up the profilt for participating in NYRW? When I try to reason this with her, she said "don't show me the attitude"..... I can't believe Casa Mono hires such a rude person to damage it's reputation.

NAME: sandrab
REVIEW: The size of the portions for appetizer and entree were ridiculously infinitesimal and could hard,be considered lunch!! Secondly, our waiter couldn't describe the dishes and seemed annoyed we asked, disappeared and was generally not interested in providing the attention a waiter should. They shouldn't be on Restaurant Week if they're not going to offer an appropriate meal!!!

NAME: Buburin
REVIEW: Not very impressive. Would not recommend this place. The choice for tapas were I impressive and ridiculously priced. Skip it!

NAME: Cookiegirl27
REVIEW: This Michelin star restaurant has am eclectic and amazing menu of small and a few large to share using organic meats and accompaniments! Delicious meal and ambiance. Reservations are a must as it's a hard table to get as a walk in!

NAME: LadyM666
REVIEW: We really loved all foods we ordered… already discussed go back again!!!

NAME: CasaMonoFan
REVIEW: One of my favorite dining places in the city. Everything there is delicious.

NAME: Gera
REVIEW: I was very satisfied with the appetizer, but my entree was as big as my appetizer basically.  Other than that everything was delicious.

NAME: Moses
REVIEW: The food is what shines at Mono. The small plates are great for sharing.  The tables are close together, so a noisy neighbor can be an issue.  Service wasn't up to One Star standards.  The staff seemed untrained and rushed.  A waiter plunked down a dish on our table and left so quickly we couldn't tell him it wasn't what we ordered.  It took several minutes to get anyone's attention to explain. When they ran my credit card the slip I was given to sign had a higher amount on it than my bill (about 20% higher).  I thought it might be a gratuity, but there was a line for tips.  The waiter said it was wrong and re-ran my card.

NAME: UWSMom
REVIEW: A great first visit to Casa Mono. We had the chickpea fritters, green tomato w/ goat cheese, chorizo and a few other items all were terrific. The creme catalan was a spectacular finish to the meal. There was a lot of staff in the restaurant who were pleasant but not overly friendly.  Not the best choice with kids ( who loved the food)  only because of the tight table space and the staff  didn't know how to deal with them.

NAME: cz123
REVIEW: Food and service are good. but the space is really small. The restaurant week menu is not as good as regular menu. we ordered from the regular menu, it's pretty tasty.

NAME: DougsDad
REVIEW: This was one of our favourite restaurants in NYC, when it was on the way up... This time was so so. Food still good, but from a more limited menu. And nothing blew us away this time, which had been our experience in the past. Maybe the success has allowed them to coast.  We were seated early (told that it was our only option), but the restaurant remained mostly empty around us for the two hours we were there.

NAME: Kate
REVIEW: One  disspointing evening. Rude, careless waiters in an excessively noisy ambience made it impossible to enjoy neither food nor conversation. Never again.

NAME: Vd00
REVIEW: Really outstanding service, inventive and eye opening food and a well curated wine selection for all price ranges makes this restaurant truly worthy of a michelin star. My only comment would be a suggestion to have more off-menu seasonal items available. The one item they did have, I tried (it was roasted eggplanted over an eggplant/anise puree) and it was fantastic!

NAME: Foodie
REVIEW: We had a great early dinner . The food and wines made us feel like we were transported to Spain for the afternoon !We recommend Casa Mono to foodies and others that are looking for new tastes.

NAME: brooklynisbetter
REVIEW: some dishes are good, but some are just not that great.  it's way overpriced, like all tapas joints. we won't go back.

NAME: BegoQ
REVIEW: Incredible food and service!!the scallops and lambada leg amazing!! Also Mono Salad deliciosa! Very nice place!

NAME: tester
REVIEW: A great combination of atmosphere, service and amazing food.  The wait-staff and wine-guy are not snooty but are very knowledgeable and helpful.  They bring out the tapas with perfect order and timing.  Small place, but a very pleasant atmosphere.  The sauces are world-class.  Only imperfect thing is that I think the desserts are not quite as good as everything else.  E.g. bread pudding was flavorful but too sweet.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Such a wonderful restaurant. Whenever we're in NY, we always make sure we eat at Casa Mono...great food, great ambience... Wish we could bring you with us to Hawaii

NAME: Wastingfoodisasin
REVIEW: Too crowded to wait at bar counter, so I had to wait outside for all my friends to gather. Food was good, but size was small if you consider the price. If you were a Spanish wine lover, this restaurant is the must to go.

NAME: John
REVIEW: Perhaps the best Tapas in NYC. Great wine list - principally Spanish as is appropriate. Irving Place is a reasonably quiet street so when they leave the sliding doors open it is quite comfortable. Love to sit at the bar and watch how they turn out the variety of dishes as quickly as they do. I have only done lunch at Casa Mono. It is a small space so I can imagine it is overflowing at dinner.  Particularly enjoyed the razor clams, octopus with fennel and crispy pork belly.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: While our actual server was great, we were stunned by the fact that both the hosts refused to allow us to sit down because the third member of our party had not arrived, at 4:55 PM when the restaurant had TWO customers in it only and it was 85 degrees outside. Talk about a stupid policy. Our friend was late, so while we explained we were happy to sit and begin reading the menu and even ordering on our friends behalf, they refused. Then when our friend did arrive at 5:15 they informed us we would have to "hurry up" and be out by seven because they needed the table. The food here is good, but we were all surprised by the obvious stupidity of policy over common sense and hospitality. Our check would have been much higher if they'd let us sit.

NAME: MicheA
REVIEW: If you ever had the opportunity to eat at Bar Pinotxo at La Boqueria in Barcelona the food here is the closest you'll get in NYC, with upgraded service and fantastic wine.  This is an exceptional dining experience.

NAME: Papaya
REVIEW: Casa Mono is one of my favorite tapas spots in the city. I always find something new on their menu that I need to try. This time around, the stand out dish was Fideos with Chorizo and Clams. Quite literally, the entire table just FOUGHT OVER the savory fideo noodles and fresh clams. I would go back and order 2 next time. The foie was a bit underwhelming in portion/price, but pig ears and squid was also widely enjoyed and fun to eat. Overall, a great experience as always.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: What a find. Great tapas and fantastic ambience. We wanted a good restaurant for a special night out in New York and we certainly found it in Casa Mona.

NAME: Decepcionado
REVIEW: We really didn´t like it at all. It is a pretentious restaurant. The food comes not in small, but in tiny portions, but of course at steep prices. It is not a Spanish food restaurant (nothing with Uni can be called a Spanish-food restaurant). I´d never go back again, never.

NAME: soakaroo
REVIEW: If you love Tapas this is pretty good.  It's almost Spain like good.   A little pricey if you don't mind.  Service might be a little slow but definitely worth a try.

NAME: E2nyc
REVIEW: always a favorite. service is excellent and food is always consistent.

NAME: fun2eat
REVIEW: The regular menu plus specials provide great choices for everyone.  The food is consistently very good, with courses timed very well.  The staff is friendly and the wait staff particularly knowledgeable.  Warm weather allows the restaurant to open the doors giving an "outdoor feel".  Always a great choice.

NAME: Ellibelli
REVIEW: Food was pretty good overall, though my setas & garlic (mushrooms) was way too salty, we couldn't eat it.

NAME: jsm23
REVIEW: I've been coming to this restaurant for almost a decade and it has never disappointed. I love that my favorite dishes (fideos with clams, sweetbreads, bacalao) are always on the menu, but do not remain stagnant, with pleasant and surprising tweaks to the preparation. On this visit, the crispy pork belly was rich and sweet and meltingly delicious, and the blackened beet salad amazed this beet-hater, it may have been my favorite dish of the night! One change I noticed since my last visit a few years ago is that the waiters and hosts, while still very knowledgeable, were much friendlier this time and, gasp, even smiled! Lovely. (But where are the wonderful tables with the little desks underneath? Was it just mine, or are they all gone? Pity!)

NAME: hyrax
REVIEW: This is my second time visiting casa mono, it is always my favorite

NAME: reviewer
REVIEW: Had 6 plates between the two of us, each an excellent adventure.  Goat confit was the favorite by a nose.  We ordered wine by the glass due to the varied nature of our dishes.  We were very impressed by the attention paid by the sommelier.  This was a nice touch.  Crowded and noisy, but what would one expect from a Manhattan hot spot?

NAME: Mike
REVIEW: Had always heard that this was the best tapas place in NY. We were unimpressed by the food - we ordered some of the more famous dishes and werent really wowed by any of them. The service wasnt too great and the dining room was small and cramped. Wouldnt be going back here any time soon.

NAME: Louandwamp
REVIEW: Over cooked seafood, and seemingly everything overpriced for small servings.  The ramps with romesco were delicious. Service was best part of meal.

NAME: Alpr
REVIEW: Tapas style, great way to eat several menu items. Food was very flavorful. They cannot accommodate parties larger than 6. Everyone enjoyed their meal.

NAME: ABCalifornia
REVIEW: Good wine selection and interesting menu choices, great small plates.  Would definitely o back - moderate pricing too.

NAME: CRMD
REVIEW: Imagine sharing dishes that you have to fight over...so delectable that you would run over your grandmother to get a 2nd bite.  Sure, the dishes are perfect for sharing...make certain that you get 6-7 for a full evening's meal, but don't be surprised if you are jousting your partner for the last bite or jamon or lamb belly.

NAME: DoubleA
REVIEW: This bar is fabulas.  Food quality is 5 stars on par with the top tapas places in Barcelona   Small but good ambiance and service

NAME: CatherineH
REVIEW: I had been wanting to get to Casa Mono for a while and finally tried it for lunch. (When it opened it was just too crowded.)  The food is very good, very sharable, not horribly pricey.  We had oxtail stuffed piquillo peppers, silky scallops, salad with manchego and everything was great.   Our server was completely bored by us.  She asked a question and then looked out the window waiting for a reply.  I'm not sure if she had teeth --if so, she never showed them with a smile.   The place is very small, so you have to wait on the sidewalk for your party to arrive as they will not seat you for 5 minutes alone -- even at a 1:30 lunchtime with a half empty restaurant.  Mario needs to read one of Danny Meyer's customer service books.

NAME: alwayshungry
REVIEW: Tiny cramped space but well worth it.  Every plate was delicious, creative and almost addictve.  Pigs ears, fideos, pulpo, pork belly, anchovies.  Bring some friends so you try more dishes.  Union Square gem.  Sorry I didn't discover this place sooner.

NAME: jojonyc
REVIEW: First time there and loved it! Sat at the bar looking at the open kitchen, very fun dining experience.  Food was great! A couple dishes were indeed a bit on the salty side as some reviews said on here, but flavor-wise still very good.

NAME: Atilla
REVIEW: I have dined here half a dozen times in the past year.  Some of the dishes are inspired while others are good.  If you would like tapas, but cannot make it to Spain, then this is a very good choice.  The dining area is, to say the least, "cozy"; this impacts the service as it is difficult for the wait staff to move around.  The wine list is excellent.

NAME: frequentdiner
REVIEW: Very creative menu.  Superb tapas, razor clams, foie gras, fideus, and so on and so forth.  Terrific wine list with wonderful Spanish wines.  Tight spaces.

NAME: andycali6
REVIEW: I liked EVERYTHING! A bit pricey, but I highly recommend it.

NAME: wineanddinegirl
REVIEW: The bottom line is that Casa Mono is a wonderful dining experience! It is a small restaurant with a huge opportunity to taste truly uniquely prepared food! Musts on their menu ... foie gras, pork belly, quail ... our group of four enjoyed the small plates, adding and ordering more choices as we sat sipping our wine and becoming more and more adventuresome as the evening wore on.  Mario Batali deserves his Michelin stars for this restaurant!

NAME: Jacq
REVIEW: The food at Casa Mono was absolutely amazing. The butterscotch scallops was the best thing I've had in months!

NAME: marlene
REVIEW: we've dined here a number of times and the food is consistently very good. The tables are pretty close , not a lot of space to move around, but the good wines help you forget this impediment:) Consider 2 tapas per person to share , that would be enough,

NAME: francemichele
REVIEW: I keep going back and every time I'm dazzled by the array of flavors in their tapas, such creative cooking. Among my favorite the foie gras, the marrow bones, the razor clams, the artichokes with miny

NAME: debbpaer
REVIEW: My friend was in from out of town and I took her here for lunch.  We ordered the foie gras, the bone marrow, the duck egg and cured tuna, the confit goat, and the pig's ears (and an ambulance).  It was ALL AMAZING!  The chef was great to watch, she made it look so easy.  But everything was nailed.  Such a great experience.  I've been 3 times now for lunch and dinner and each time is fantastic.

NAME: Jackie
REVIEW: Unique menu! Everything was yummy. Great location as well.

NAME: Wonderfulwino
REVIEW: The razor clams are fantastic, the foie gras is outstanding, etc., but has Casa Mono become a bit static or complacent? Let's add some new and innovative dishes to the menu...

NAME: foodie225
REVIEW: Everything on the menu is great - my favorites were the quail, bone marrow, and patatas bravas. The staff also provides excellent wine recommendations for the food you order. The only complaint I have is the strict rule against ordering more food - seems very inflexible!

NAME: gourmet
REVIEW: Casa Mono has unique and luscious food! I adored this  restaurant, had high expectations and was not disappointed. The mushroom,potato,and scallop dishes were divine! Anyone who truly LOVES great food will be unbelievably happy here.

NAME: Jecca2244
REVIEW: Awesome meal. Wine list is fantastic and really accessible. We were sat a bit late for our reservation ( it happens, it is NYC!) but they sent over a complimentary round of cava and an appetizer. Loved the Patatas Bravas, duck egg, liver toast, pigs ears, artichoke, Brussels sprouts. So delicious.

NAME: kdh2812
REVIEW: The food at Casa Mono is delicious, inventive and well-presented. The service is okay, waitress was pleasant enough but the hostess was not. We were seated at a crowded, middle of the floor table although there were 6 more comfortable tables at the windows available. Over the two hours that we were there for lunch, 3 of those tables were never occupied. We did ask for one of those tables and were told they were reserved. Typical NYC power-play attitude. There are too many great places to go back to one with a bad attitude. When spending $200 at lunch, I expect more.

NAME: Danzilla
REVIEW: Every about this place is perfect. Food is always amazing, the wine is very very good, the ambience is great. Love it.

NAME: Dineout88
REVIEW: High quality tapas style dishes. Recommend the razor clams, duck egg with potatoes and the lamb with chocolate sauce.  Very good Spanish wine list.

NAME: Dkstar1
REVIEW: The food was mostly very good. Demerit for the one razor clam that was 1/3 uncooked (runny).  Major props for the lamb leg, pork sausage and rabbit dishes. Wine list was interesting and was happy with the bottle we got with helpful assistance from the somm. However in their desire to turn tables faster than any restaurant I've ever been, 1/2 full glasses of wine repeatedly got filled which was both annoying and detrimental to the pleasures of seeing a new (to me) wine evolve in the glass.   Great local spot, very tight, good to very good food, pleasant but rushing staff. Wouldn't go out of my way to go back but would be a regular at the bar stools if I lived in the neighborhood.

NAME: Yagarmeister
REVIEW: Excellent service! Wonderful flavors! Adorable place! It is a bit tight, but not uncomfortable. Worth a try. Will go on my favorites list.

NAME: MinnieR
REVIEW: This is my second time to eat at Casa Mono and I enjoyed it again. The razor clams, bacalao croqueta, and skirt steak are good. I dis not enjoy the iberico ham as much on this visit because it was served last, it should be served before the other saucy dishes this way we can savor the meat without palate prejudices. The cava and blood orange cocktail was refreshing, I ordered 3 glasses. I recommend the crema catalan with bay leaves for dessert. Service was good. We would have stayed longer and ordered more dishes and drinks but the hard wooden chairs were hurting my lower back, so we rushed to get out of there. Will be back again to try the other dishes and drinks we missed.

NAME: fresser53
REVIEW: Since it has been open, Casa Mono has been a fabulous purveyor of Spanish food. Not tapas, per se, but small plates that run the gamut of interesting ingredients and flavors. You could eat at Casa Mono 25 times and never have the same meal twice. Flavors or bold and interesting, but not overwhelming. All-Spanish wine list is comprehensive, and a good selection is available by the quarto, or small carafe. Tables are a little cramped, but that's because it's a small place. If you can, grab a seat at the counter by the open kitchen.

NAME: frequentdiner
REVIEW: Fantastic and varied menu of tapas. The razor clams, the bone marrow and the goat are standouts. Terrific wine list of Spanish wines.

NAME: bliu
REVIEW: very small place, hard to make reservations, overall the food is ok, but not as good as expected

NAME: Pearly
REVIEW: We were a party of three who was seated at a table for two in this very small and cramped restaurant. The hostess would not budge when we inquired about another table. (It was noon and there only two other parties seated at that time.) Our waitress, who overall was good, told us that we 'needed' to order all of our small plates at once rather than start with a few selections and move on from there. We picked the wrong spot for a relaxing, weekend lunch!

NAME: Sonja
REVIEW: Super restaurant, very good service and good food

NAME: Arthur
REVIEW: Best place in New York for grilled razor clams. Wonderful with a sear and garlic olive oil finishing. Always go there as many times I can when in New York. Great for a smack in late afternoon.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I rarely provide feedback. Casa Mono has great Spanish food, with a respectable wine list to match. It could have been an enjoyable experience if not for the hostess! She was short, unfriendly, and rude. Not at all what you would expect from someone in a customer service role. There are too many choices in NYC to be subjected to a teenage like attitude from the person who sets the tone for your dining experience.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I make it a point to fit in a lunch or dinner at Casa Mono whenever I visit NYC and love introducing it to my business friends. The food and service are excellent and the vibe makes you feel like you are a resident of the city.

NAME: Miguel
REVIEW: Always a hit. Food and service never fails at this place.

NAME: 2XtheScrilla
REVIEW: Casa Mono is a must for me whenever I go to NYC and my favorite Batali restaurant. I'm a fan of small plates, casual vibes, and Spanish wines, so this place is right in my sweet spot. The food is always excellent, the service is always friendly and attentive. Makes me think I need to make the trip back more often...

NAME: bac528
REVIEW: Definitely has joined my NYC top 5 list!!

NAME: Cindy
REVIEW: The food was good, although it's a tiny place so you do feel cramped the entire time. The biggest complaint was the dessert...our waitress recommended the chocolate dessert and made it sound fantastic...what did she bring out? a plate that had a smear of nuttela, a smear of something else and a friend banana. That does not qualify as even a half decent dessert, especially for the price!!! The goat is funny tasting and would not recommend it. The rest of the food was good, especially their mushrooms, bread with tomato, and potatoes.

NAME: Lahu
REVIEW: I lived in Spain for 10 years and have never had Pan Con Tomate this good! Great neighborhood spot, delicious dishes, hard to get a table because it's always so busy, but worth trying to get that booking! We were on time but our table wasn't ready so they suggested we have a drink at the bar next door (owned by same people) - Bar Jamon. I'd have preferred to have been seated straight away but the manager of the bar was great, was helpful with the wine choices, and when we'd waited a little while they even brought over a starter free of charge. That's better treatment than a LOT of restaurants in manhattan! My only minor complaint is that it's so tiny that the tables are really pretty squished together.

NAME: HeatherF
REVIEW: I've been to Casa Mono twice and both times have walked away impressed and satisfyingly full. Each time I have dined here I have eaten ingredients I would not normally order and have been blown away by their preparation and flavor. The staff is very knowledgable and helpful with their extensive wine list and helped us in ordering a wine that complemented all of our dishes. The atmosphere is cozy and perfect for a date! Will look forward to visiting again.

NAME: Atilla
REVIEW: The food features combinations of ingredients that range from those that work well to, in some cases, are spectacular. If in doubt, the staff is very good about describing things on the menu. Even if you order at random, you are sure to have a few unbelievably good choices. The liver and pate offerings are always a safe bet....in this case 'safe' means certain to be spectacular.  The wine list is extensive with a broad range of prices and varietals from various regions of spain.  The one down-side, especially for large and/or tall people....the tables are small and without much legroom.  Overall an excellent choice for an informal, but noteworthy meal.

NAME: GaryF
REVIEW: I liked everything about this place. It's a good vibe, professional service, good wine selection at reasonable prices, great menu. If only I hadn't order the sardines…and I love sardines. They were, well, chewy. Ah, I can overlook one dish one time. I'll be back.

NAME: Fooder
REVIEW: Everything we ordered was very good. The place is a bit squeezed and the wine service could be better - as usual in NYC the red wine was served at room temperature, a basic mistake. Apart from that the food was good enough to justify a future return. Recommended.

NAME: FoodieGal
REVIEW: I've been several times. The menu, which changes seasonally, is always exciting. Casa Mono is on my personal top five favorite restaurant list.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: It was impossible to relax and celebrate my husband's birthday with our two adult children because of the rude and disruptive service we received from the moment we arrived until we left. We had made reservations well in advance and we had indicated that this was to be a birthday dinner. The food was delicious with the exception of the way too salty oxtail stuffed piquillo peppers.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food is really tasty and the menu is always original and innovative. Wine pairings are also nice.

NAME: lovetoeatinnyc
REVIEW: If you like small plates cooked very well with imagination Cafe Mono is for you. If you get carried away can be expensive. If you watch what you order it is great.

NAME: Elvin
REVIEW: As a serious sucker for tapas and Spanish food, I came into here with high expectations. The place did not disappoint. There are so many unique interesting combos and delicious foods. Add on the incredibly comprehensive wine lists and highly knowledgeable waiters with knowledge of all the dishes, they helped pick out all the tapas that hit the right spot. I highly enjoyed my time here and would gladly do it again.

NAME: ReviewerA
REVIEW: The food was delicious as always. I was surprised to see they use the same menu for brunch that they do all day. I wish they had some more traditional brunch options.

NAME: Brian
REVIEW: So we show up for a table for 2 Sunday at noon to find that of the 8 window tables (which we prefer) only 3 are taken. We ask for anyone of the other 5 and are told, it won't work with their seating plans for the day ! After much back and forthing between us and the maitre de (who in no way apologizes even though we have a reservation) she takes a cold ,silent stand implying we sit in the middle of the room or just leave. We sat in the middle of the room……5 minutes later (maybe 7 ?) she seats another pair of patrons at one of those tables and when we leave one hour later two tables were still empty !! …..but no….she'd made her point ! Cold, unprofessional, unnecessarily rude treatment .

NAME: helenr
REVIEW: Changed menu from one posted. Nothing for me. I left. Went somewhere else. Left a tip Waiter was nice.

NAME: AnaXimena
REVIEW: We were impressed with the mix of flavors and, the presentation and the great service. A place to go back!

NAME: Tong
REVIEW: Never disappointed after more than 4 times visits.

NAME: Loveeating
REVIEW: We had lunch during NYC restaurant promotion week. The ambiance, service and food quality are good. But the food portion is quite small for the promotion menu. We 3 girls all felt that we didn't have enough food after we finish our three course lunch.

NAME: NoraBernadette
REVIEW: Casa Mono was a great restaurant for a couple, whether you are friends or on a first date or special occasion, the cozy restaurant appeals to all. The food was phenomenal, small sharing plates although slightly bigger than other tapas restaurants. The wine list was huge, although didn't have too many reasonable bottles. I wouldn't recommend for groups, and certainly go with a reservation. The pork croquettes and the chocolate salted ganache were both standouts.

NAME: alexandra
REVIEW: As usual, Casa Mono was completely perfect. Great and unexpected dishes, the absolute perfect wine pairing, and fabulous service.

NAME: TravelingFoodies
REVIEW: We had to wait an extra half hour for reservations. The waiter took forever to take our order. At least 2 dishes were never delivered to our table. When the reservations were made I said we were celebrating a birthday which was never noted. And, one of your chefs was texting on his phone will preparing and never walked his hands. We watched him do this for a few minutes. Needless to say none of the 6 people on our group ever plan on returning.

NAME: frequentdiner
REVIEW: Creative and varied tapas, better than I've had in Barcelona and San Sebastien. The razor clams are amazing, also mushroooms, goat, artichokes, etc. Large Spanish wine list with something for everyone. Service was fast and knowledgeable, with the waiter recommending an excellent and affordable wine, when asked.

NAME: restaurantgroupie
REVIEW: While the food was tasty, the portions served for RW lunch were a complete joke. Usually RW lunch is too much food, 3 courses, dessert, etc. Us three girls left hungry. Also, they crammed our three top at the smallest table ever, even though it was the very end of lunch service. I guess since the plates of food were so small, we didn't have too many issues, but they had to remove our small bread plates to start serving food. Highly do not recommend this place for RW lunch. My previous experience at dinner was better.

NAME: Felipe
REVIEW: pros: presentation, service, ambience, culinary quality  cons: space (cramped), noisy

NAME: Aliceinwonderland
REVIEW: It was my first experience at the Restaurant Weekend and at this restaurant. We booked at 4PM because my husband and a friend had to work in the morning and there wasn't any other hour available before that. When we sat at the table we were told that the special restaurant week menu wasn't available anymore, only until 3:30PM. First question is where can the customer read this information? Obviously we weren't aware of it. We are from Spain and miss fabada. This course was offered in the special menu but not in the usual one. We asked for fabada, just in case, but there was no possibility of having it. We ended up paying more than double the restaurant week menu and not enjoying the meal at all. We felt rip-off.

NAME: fuzzylemon
REVIEW: Really good food. There seemed to be a hiccup with the service, in that we were seated and asked about our water preference....and then sat there for 10 minutes. I had to ask the hostess to bring water and then ask if we actually had a waiter assigned to us. But once we got a waiter, the service was friendly and efficient. The food was very, very good. Really solid on both traditional tapas and imaginative dishes. Highly recommend.

NAME: nannysue
REVIEW: Delicious food, great combinations. Amazing to believe that the meal comes out of such a tiny kitchen. The restaurant is very small, almost uncomfortably so. Bottom line: worth it for the food.

NAME: Goodtimes
REVIEW: The food was fantastic, cozy place, good and quick service. Not for strollers as the space is limited.

NAME: marlene
REVIEW: we have tried several tapas and they were all good!!! excellent wine list (some very expensive though). You can't beat the location-perfect for Union Square . we will go back soon

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: For such a nice restaurant, with amazing food and a great reputation, I was shocked with how poor the service was.

NAME: Vieve
REVIEW: My friends and I thoroughly enjoyed the food. The razor clams amazed all of us, even those who proclaimed they don't like razor clams. And I, who have been averse to sweetbreads since my first try, loved the fried sweetbreads here. They were reminiscent of fried chicken of the best variety.  But the waitstaff could have been more attentive. When we had their attention, they were great. But when we weren't engaged with them directly, we had to try several times to flag someone down before we succeeded in getting our water refilled.  Maybe it was just an off night. I'd still come back to give it a try.

NAME: Mario
REVIEW: The food is creative and great.

NAME: toby
