REVIEW: I took a few of my colleagues (wine lovers) over to this place. Being there a several times, I love this place and was confident that the place will be good for them as well.  Our first disappointment: They asked us to order all food and drinks upfront. We were surprised that we had to plan out our bottles (we wanted to start out with white and then go for reds afterwards) and tapas dishes. It took us a couple of inquiries and about half an hour before we settled on all of our dishes and drinks.  Second Disappointment: Razor clam was one of my favorite dish there, but this night, it was awfully fishy... and didn't pair with wine. I'm now wondering if this dish was ill prepared or the clam was bad.

NAME: Jeff
REVIEW: Always one of my favorites. Especially eating at the kitchen bar!

NAME: StefaniaK
REVIEW: My favorite of all the Mario restaurants - food is consistently good and innovatively prepared. Small plates are filling and there is a great variety to select from. The restauratant is congested, tables are crowded and service/greetings can sometimes be abrupt (and incomplete parties will NOT be seated). Generally once seated, the service is efficient, often friendly and the food speaks for itself. The wine list is extensive and tends toward expensive, though the red wine quarto we selected, was reasonably priced and excellent. It can get noisy too --- so the less crowded/noisy Sunday brunch can really be an enjoyable alternative to evenings.

NAME: User0328
REVIEW: The food there is really appealing and i would come again definitely but the service is kinda taking off some points. Around 5pm they had a meeting for the waiters and waitresses so we had to wait a long time for our food or anything.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: first time to casa mono, took a friend for her birthday. we both loved it so much. the service was excellent- our waiter was attentive and helped to navigate the menu when we needed recommendations and worried we ordered too much food and needed to know which ones were the best. The quality of the food was superb and just the right seasonings. My favourites were the scallops, ribeye special, and rabbit. We were lucky and got a corner table so our location was nice and quiet. Didn't take much look at the wine list so can't speak too much on that, but the Riesling that was recommended went well with our food. Would definitely return.

NAME: TRWG
REVIEW: Great time at Casa Mono. Food was inventive, well prepared right in front of us, and creatively plated. Service was outstanding, especially for as busy as it was and how tight the restaurant is. Loud, energetic, and a whole lot of fun.

NAME: CTNYC
REVIEW: Inspired dishes but each dish was overly salty and oily.  Would not come back.

NAME: Susan
REVIEW: Go. Experience. Indulge. Savory. Smile.

NAME: shelby
REVIEW: Great food! Not super traditional tapas, but delicious nonetheless.

NAME: ms0926
REVIEW: 8:30 reservation on a Sunday. Seated immediately in an otherwise full house. Food was exceptional. Small plates concept but portions were quite generous. Server kindly made wine suggestions upon request which were spot on. Wine list is pricey, but worth it. After dinner sherry, also suggested by server, was perfect end to the meal.

NAME: Meghan
REVIEW: Food was poor. The pork croquette was very dry. However, I must say the goat was surprisingly good. We had a table next to a shelf of red wine. When I inquired as to where the wine was from. He responded "it's all Spanish". I asked where, what region. Because the name of the bottle wasn't spanish. He didn't know and kept repeating 'all spanish'. for a spanish tapas restaurant I was disappointed the waiter didn't know this. The desserts were awful. We had the chocolate and white chocolate with fennel. Don't order! The white chocolate dessert tastes medicinal and the caramelized fennel is not a nice addition. In addition the waiter seemed annoyed when I mentioned I was allergic to seafood.

NAME: Wmw322
REVIEW: I was on time my guest not so much by 12 minutes. After checking in I was refused my seat until I was a full party of 2. Ridiculous procedure as were I a solo diner I'd be given the same table. She sat us at a center table crammed next to 2 other diners. I asked to be sat at the end table, she refused me saying she had to push the 2 tables together when we left for a 4 top. Made ZERO sense! & guess what, she sat a couple there not 10 minutes later. She lied! I expect a better greeting & treatment from this Michelin noted, charming hot spot on Irving place. Our meal was over the top amazing. We ordered 6 or 7 small plates. Wine well paired for our meal by our attentive server. Cappuccino fantastic. My 2nd visit. They need a better hostess!

NAME: Strider
REVIEW: First experience with tapas. Food was excellent. The advice we received from the servers was spot on. The delivery of dishes was paced perfectly. This was a wonderful introduction to the world of tapas. We'll be back.

NAME: Kram62
REVIEW: Well, look no further than Casa Mono. Mouth watering delights to eat and perhaps one of the best Spanish wine lists in the country? Excellent service and delightful, helpful and knowledgeable sommelier. The only negative....smallish tables that are quite low....if you are over 6ft tall then bring knee pads!  But cannot wait to return....5ft 9"...

NAME: Bobby
REVIEW: Great place to get some good food you can not find anywhere else and also to meet some interesting people.

NAME: Carolyn
REVIEW: The food at Casa Mono is always top notch-- the right mix of classical spanish cooking and inventive, contemporary approach to good food. The servers are always competent and polite. It is a small place. Table space is tight, and though they do the best they can to make use of the space, you may end up sharing more of your neighbors' conversation and experience than you might wish. The food more than makes up for it, though.

NAME: Tamraepaz
REVIEW: We have dined at Casa mono many times and each time is a different food experience as the menu changes frequently. The waiters are very knowledgeable pairing wines with chosen food. They specialize in small plates and sharing Great for special occasions as well as an everyday treat

NAME: gorm
REVIEW: Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in NYC. Great atmosphere and even better food and wine!

NAME: Sweetbread
REVIEW: I have eaten here several times. I return because it is always good, even excellent at times. It is a great place to eat with a friend as then there are twice as many tastes - if she will share her scallops. When I have been on my own I have had a great contact with fellow eaters and with the cooks while sitting at the bar. I will return.

NAME: baby
REVIEW: Really great food, waiters don't care, if you ask for salt or olive oil they say yes and it never comes. Wait a long time for the waiter to take order and then they try to rush you out to turn over the table. Made for a mixed bag in dining experience.

NAME: MydaT
REVIEW: Went for lunch with my 2 adult daughters, both of whom love good food. Well, Casa Mono did not disappoint. Razor clams, confit of goat, bone marrow, all of which were worthy of plate licking. And with Estrella beer, we were very happy girls. This is one place I will return to when visiting NYC.

NAME: dp88514
REVIEW: best way to enjoy this gem is to sit and watch the chefs making the various plates, then pick the ones that are most appealing... No rush, no hurry, wonderful and caring service... A treat to observe and savour...

NAME: FoodieJC
REVIEW: We went here on December 23 and had a phenomenal experience with a group of 4. Upon arriving at the restaurant, we were informed our table was not yet ready and were invited to wait in Bar Jamon, the wine bar. We waited for about 20 minutes and the bartender at the wine bar came over to us informing us our table was not yet ready, but for our inconvenience they had sent us a plate of jamon iberico - well handled!!! Everything we tried once seated was exquisite with the standouts for the group being the duck egg, pig's ears, the bone marrow and the rabbit. One member of our party actually tried 7 new things that night and enjoyed all of them! Great spot. Can't wait to return!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The tables are way too small for the restaurant proposal. We had to order many plates that wouldn't fit the table size. The tables were so close that we had to make an really big effort to be able to seat down, especially with all the coats, bags, scarves...

NAME: JavierB
REVIEW: Very happy we picked casa mono for a special occasion - the food was delicious and we felt transported to Spain. I've been to Spain a few time and this is the closest in taste and environment I have found in the city. A bit expensive but worth it!

NAME: Comelon
REVIEW: We eat out on a regular basis and have eaten in numeous restaurants around the world. The food here was fantastic especially the rabbit. The wine menu was extensive. It took a while to seat us even though tables were visibly open and we had a reservation. But once we sat down the process was orderly. Got lots of help on the wines. Tables could have been a bit bigger. I was suprised at how small the restaurant is. We will come back and will take friends over when they visit NYC and ask what is new and good!

NAME: Amazing
REVIEW: Wine list is a little hard to decipher but the food is incredible!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Amazing food. Will definitely return.

NAME: LGeats
REVIEW: Went here for a birthday dinner for my fiancé. We ordered six different plates. Every single one was excellent and delicious. The two desserts we had were always outstanding making the entire experience a special one. Dinners here are expensive but well worth the cost.

NAME: montrealer
REVIEW: We went there to celebrate my birthday.  We had a reservation at 10h and arrived at 10h10. We were immediatly told they were about to give away our table, and repeteadly told they only keep the tbale 20 minutes after the reservation. We were there 10 min late. My friend was smoking outside, we were told she had to come in immediatetly to be seated. this was our first 2 minutes in.  The waiter was extremely indifferent to us and our demands. Never cracked a smile. When we told him it was my birthday and we were there from Montréal to celebrate it there and it was very special, the waiter barely acknowledge us and told us his shift was ending.  We were very disappointed with the service and the lack of friendliness of the staff.

NAME: Sally
REVIEW: Our new favorite spot in the Big Apple. From our marvelously gracious waitress to the outstanding food, we can't be back quickly enough.

NAME: Kristie
REVIEW: I have been here several times so know and expect the cramped dining room. Every single dish is very good, right down to the simple pan con tomate. I love all the different meats they offer as well. The only problem with my last dining experience here was with a 7pm reservation we were only allowed the table for 2 hours, I wish they would tell you that when you reserve a table, my group of 3 were not even offered a dessert menu and were hastily told to leave when the 9:00 reservation arrived. So, this is NOT a place for a leisurely dinner to drink, eat and catch up with friends.

NAME: Foodie
REVIEW: For lunch or dinner the food here is consistently extraordinary and still worth it when it is very loud (not always).

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: one word: AMAZING! Always a good place to celebrate a special occasion. And so far I've always taken my husband here for his birthday.

NAME: tixy
REVIEW: I really enjoyed this place. The menu is very unique and all is delicious! Everything was perfect I just wasn't happy they dropped a check at 6 pm on Sunday without checking if we want anything else. If the server waited another minute we would have asked for it :) so it spoiled the impression just a little.

NAME: SS82
REVIEW: My husband and I were visiting NYC for the weekend. Had dinner at Casa Mono on Saturday night after a friend's recommendation. We were not disappointed! The food was outstanding, the service was flawless and the wine list was great (I know nothing about Spanish wines but our server's suggestions were great!). The restaurant is tiny and pretty jammed but it just adds to the atmosphere. We had an absolutely fantastic experience at Casa Mono

NAME: amocomida
REVIEW: One of the best restaurants in the city. Complex flavors. Consistent. Great wine.

NAME: SajaTourbah
REVIEW: Ever since discovering this place, it is a go to every time I'm in New York. Perfect sized plates since all the dishes are absolutely amazing. Very Interesting flavor combinations cooked to perfection!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We were completely disappointed in the service at casa mono. The food was fine, nothing special but the service ruined the whole experience for us. The hostess and manager were terrible for business and rude to paying customers. Our server was very nice but the hostess and manager were the first people we saw and they set the tone for the whole evening. I would never go back there nor reccomend it to anyone.

NAME: SteveBeau
REVIEW: Great food and good vibe. Veal was fantastic!

NAME: STXER
REVIEW: Went to Casa Mono expecting just another tapas restaurant. This one is way different. It's tiny, I sat at the counter just a few feet from 4 chefs watching them turn out delicious dishes. A very friendly vibe here and thee service was perfect. Can't wait to go back!

NAME: R7898
REVIEW: Food and service is excellent. Restaurant is very small and a number of tables are very tight. On a cold day you freeze when the door opens, unless you have enough of the wonderful wine to warm you up. It is a fun place, particularly for foodies. Very interesting dishes and combinations. And they all work. We have been here many times and food is consistently excellent. We will be back.

NAME: constanteater
REVIEW: The wine list was outstanding, great variety and selection, However a number of the itrems are rather overpriced Also the locati0on was a bit difficult to find. Not well lit.

NAME: meateaterlovesavegan
REVIEW: This restaurant is open until 2am, so it is ideal after a show. The food is just ok though. For my taste, the dishes were quite salty and each dish had one unnecessary ingredient that took away from the flavors. The servers did a nice job trying to accommodate my vegan boyfriend, so that was a plus.

NAME: SydneyFoodie
REVIEW: Fantastic food. It was refreshing to visit a restaurant that embraces ownership of their products and uses nose to tail concepts within their menu. We were impressed by every disc that we sampled.  Great Spanish wine list.  Service was good, but not amazing. As is to be expected in a very busy, small restaurant.  Casa Mono is small and packed, so gets very noisy. Not really the place to take kids. Go early if you can to avoid the rush.  We'll be back.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We've been to Casa Mono many times because the food is so spectacular but this time the service was so bad, the attitude dismissive. We were greeted without a smile, no effort to accommodate our request (for another table), the waiter showed up when he needed to, never asked how our meal was, made no effort to explain the specials of the day, just almost threw down (put down?) the sheet of paper with specials on our table and walked away. I was actually astounded and didn't want to make a fuss because it was a special occasion and I didn't want to ruin the evening but the service at Casa Mono almost did that on its own.

NAME: Mich
REVIEW: This restaurant is okay - not bad but not great. I live a few blocks away and had intended on trying it a long time ago but never got around to it until this week. It's super small and always packed so I had high expectations. The menu is unique and has a variety of options however, the prices are very high for the tiniest tapas I've ever seen. I also didn't particularly care for the waiter pressing us to order more than we wanted at 9:45pm, which is quite late to eat heartily. We ordered a tapa per person plus a few sides, a 2nd round of wine, and dessert. Our waiter informed us more than once that we were ordering lightly and treated us as though he didn't appreciate our business. I will take my business elsewhere next time.

NAME: Faile
REVIEW: Great place to go to sample a variety of small plates, for two diners we ordered four and were pleased with quality (but weren't exactly full afterward!). Lots of interesting and well-made dishes on the menu, although we felt the rabbit was rather overpowered by the sauce. Leg of lamb with salted chocolate was fantastic, though. Order a variety of things to share and you should be pretty happy!

NAME: FoodArchitect
REVIEW: Always have a great experience at casa mono...food and wine are always wonderful.

NAME: Nancy
REVIEW: I am a frequent client of casa mono. The food and service are always up to par. Never get tired of this place!

NAME: LiJu69
REVIEW: the wine was excellent, and the location perfect. The apetizers was really good ....Love the restaurant ...Great food!!

NAME: LovetoEat
REVIEW: I have been to Casa Mono several times. My only complaint is the lack of space between diners and the slightly nauseating clientele that frequents the establishment. Sometimes you just have to put up with loud talkers and clueless people and just enjoy the food and drink.

NAME: Foodie512
REVIEW: The food was very good. Creative dishes and pairings. Good service as well. The only drawback which will probably keep me from returning is the space. It is way too small to accommodate that many tables. We were sitting on top of another table and we could hear each other's conversation even though the noise level is fairly extreme. In addition, the wait staff kept bumping into my chair as they were trying to get through. My sweater fell on the floor twice and my purse (which was hanging on the back of my chair) kept banging into me. In warm weather, however, they do have outdoor seating which would cut down on noise but probably wouldn't resolve the space issue.

NAME: ChrisinLondon
REVIEW: Our first time. 6 excellent dishes and very good wine. A bit noisy. But we liked the originality of the food (e.g. goat confit) as well as the quality of the cooking

NAME: downtowner
REVIEW: We had not been here for a while and were surprised to realize that they have been around almost 10 years! the place is getting better! The fideos with manila clams and chorizo was memorable. I could eat it again right now. Lamb with chocolate sauce was unique and terific. The morcilla and tongue was spectacular. Though the wine list seems daunting there are several well priced reds. Ask the extremely helpful staff for assistance. Too bad the place is so small. It is not conducive to lingering or coming with a large group. We will be back again soon.

NAME: jlw1234567
REVIEW: Great food, awful service. Waited 20 minutes after being seated for the waiter to take our drink order, and another 20 to order food after wine was delivered. Great wine and great food but would not return because of the service.

NAME: jyujnovich
REVIEW: Post Marathon meal was very good. A little bit limited choice in terms of non-meat dishes but overall extremely good food and service. Second time I have been here and it didn't disappoint.

NAME: GerP
REVIEW: Could have been a nightmare experience. Had reservations for 8:30 and upon arrival was told, "we are running behind." But after a short wait, we had one of the best meals during out NYC trip. The host was appropriately apologetic - and offered us a glass of Cava to ease the pain of our wait. We were given a table tucked in the corner away from the energetic crowd. The waiter was great - we ordered - bone marrow (the best); scallops, calamares, octopus, lamb belly -- stayed away from what seemed usual. All was excellent. The waiter recommended a moderately priced Basque, white wine, which was perfect as it cleansed the palette after each bite. Advice is to be adventurous and bold in your ordering -- and order the Basque wine!

NAME: GregFoodie1
REVIEW: First time dining at Casa Mono, and while the dining room is a little cramped, the array of delicious, crave-able dishes were first-rate. Interesting ingredient combinations, luscious flavors (cauliflower puree with uni!), an incredibly creamy burratta with anchovies, a perfectly spicy rabbit, super flavorful quail/coxcomb/mushroom combo and a spectacular crema catalana for dessert -- just a few of the evening's highlights. Plus, the service was attentive, and the servers were genuinely excited about sharing the Casa Mono experience with first-timers. And finally the General Manager, Miguel, was extremely welcoming and attentive to all our needs. Can't wait to return and try other dishes!

NAME: skydawg
REVIEW: Excellent spanish food. Original, tasty variety of tastes available.

NAME: Venus
REVIEW: We just got back from Barcelona and, after a few days, were already craving for tapas and the Recadero cava. The food at Casa Mono was really good, albeit not entirely traditional Catalan. It is also a tad salty, which is usually the case in all Batali and Bastianich restaurants. The expensive iberico ham was not properly sliced and was a disappointment. All in all, Casa Mono delivered a very good dining experience.

NAME: Amy1
REVIEW: LOVE THIS WONDERFUL LITTLE PLACE! BEEN DREAMING ABOUT THE DELICIOUS MEAL I HAD THERE ON FRIDAY NIGHT. CAN'T WAIT TIL MY NEXT VISIT, WHICH WILL BE VERY SOON. IF I LIVED IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD, I'D BE THERE EVERY NIGHT.

NAME: lagourmande
REVIEW: Too noisy, service was spotty, some of the hot tapas were lukewarm when they came to the table, overall two pegs down from our last experience there, not excited about going back.

NAME: Nyajira
REVIEW: I like the restaurant because of good food and service, but a little bit expensive for brunch.

NAME: Sarahreview
REVIEW: This was my favourite restaurant when I last visited New York. I took my parents here on our last visit and was disappointed. The service was fair at best but the waiter have the impression we were a chore and it was difficult getting anyone's attention all night. The food was good but only one dish we ordered (the duck) was amazing.

NAME: Princessmimi
REVIEW: We return to this restaurant as often as possible. The authentic Spanish tapas are outstanding.

NAME: CDNYC
REVIEW: Very small quaint place. Very tight space but doesn't feel overly crowded. Great selection of food no matter what your taste.

NAME: Selina
REVIEW: Casa Mona can be quite noisy and busy on certain nights, but it is a good hot spot and their food is great. We waited at their side bar next door and even that was crowded. We had some jamon and vino before sitting down for a formal dinner. Brian, our waitress, was very good to us. I would definitely go back.

NAME: mayonaka
REVIEW: The fiance and I had and loved the popular dish - razor clams. We were so amazed to find that the dish was better than the razor clams we had in Barcelona. Moving right on, we then had pulpo with fennel and grapefruit. The way how they pan fried the squid was...just tasty! We also had the skirt steak and the duck breast instead. Even though the dishes were only slightly larger than tapas portion, the combination of sauce and protein is enough to get us full. Again, both dishes were delicious and well executed. For the dessert, we had their new item on the menu - pear and mascarpone. It was so refreshing that we left the restaurant wanting more....will come back soon enough for some more razor clams.

NAME: graphicguy69
REVIEW: Casa Mono was exceptional. Our server was really helpful in building a dinner of 6 items to share. Standouts were the Razor Clams and the Duck Egg. Room is small and gets noisy, but to see the open kitchen working away and enjoying a delicious meal was well worth the noise

NAME: JAD538
REVIEW: We started with the pumpkin croquettes and a glass of sparkling wine (on the house, after my wife, who was very hungry had a hissy fit when we weren't seated on time for our reservation). Next up: burratta with grilled peach, honey, and a crouton - best cheese dish ever, hands down (although my wife still prefers the ricotta at Locanda Verde). The fluke crudo was so rich it blended perfectly with the spicy gazpacho sauce. Then the final appetizer: paella croquetas with uni. I can't describe it.  We then had 3 meat dishes: a goat dish my wife loved but I thought was only very good, duck breast that i thought was the best duck I ever had outside of Peking Duck House, and braised Beef Cheeck so sweet we decided that it would be dessert.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Tiny spot but delicious food & wine.

NAME: Dan2028
REVIEW: I have always loved Casa Mono. The blend of flavours are superb, the dishes are inventive and the ingredients are fresh.  I have a few favourites; sweetbreads, foie gras and the skirt steak and have notice the portion sizes getting smaller and smaller. This recent visit, the sweetbreads looked like a half portion. No joke.  So it was a little disappointing.

NAME: LWilliamz
REVIEW: Casa Mono never disappoints. A true food experience. Possibly my favorite restaurant !

NAME: Amy1
REVIEW: Really enjoyed casa Mano! Excellent unique dishes, attentive professional service and very charming comfortable setting. Looking forward to our next visit!

NAME: John
REVIEW: One of my favorite places for lunch, especially when the weather is mild and the doors are opened.

NAME: Foodisfun
REVIEW: Have eaten here twice and both times felt the service was very rushed. Too much food delivered all at once. We had to ask that one of our dishes be taken back and kept warm while we finished three others that had already been delivered. We love the small plate concept but it just wasn't executed well. Probably will not try it a third time.

NAME: Mediocre
REVIEW: Small and crowded but vibrant. Food is very unique and tasty on th most part. The goat cheese croquettes were kinda bland but everything else we had was delicious. Waiter was non descript but not offensive. Nice part of NYC.

NAME: steveM
REVIEW: This was the third or fourth time for us at Casa Mono. Always exceptional. The food is great (and so unique). The wine list is incredible. Loved it.

NAME: Rosie
REVIEW: Food was quite good but they are heavy handed with the salt.

NAME: CGessn
REVIEW: A good place for a small number of people. Not super romantic or private, since you'll be pretty close to other diners. Very good food and extensive wine list.

NAME: sandro
REVIEW: This place is not like is used to be.  Get ready for way too much salt and way too much garlic.

NAME: HCGS
REVIEW: Spanish cousine with modern and hip twist. Amazing dishes with being pretensious.

NAME: Pete
REVIEW: Casa Mono is a small tapas bistro with delightful creations and lots of flare. The seafood dishes were my favorite, particularly the razor clams. The cocktails were also creative and delicious. The only down side is that music was a bit too loud for dinner conversation.

NAME: CruzanGold
REVIEW: Casa Mono is a gem. The menu has so many delicious items that it is hard to choose. There are dishes for everyone. I recommend that you order lots of dishes and share. Do not miss the Chocolate, creme fraiche, sel de Mer. fpr dessert. Yummmm.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent food, Great atmosphere. Attentive service. Small space.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono is tiny, bustling, elbow to elbow kind of place that might initially make you wary that you will be pushed through the dining process in order to turn the tables rapidly. You would be wrong on this score, however, as the restaurant takes the leisurely Spanish pace for the course of the meal, and the food is really spectacular. On a recent outing we had some tried and true Casa Mono staples like the fried sardines and a fluke crudo, which were perfect as always, but we also had a confit of goat, a bit of crusty, savory perfection which was the favorite of the night, and oxtail stuffed piquillo peppers that were sublimely good.

NAME: Blair
REVIEW: I have been here with different group of people for many times in past six months. Still want to dine here again and again.

NAME: sjshanno
REVIEW: I liked Casa Mono well enough but I won't be going back. Nothing wrong or bad about the food, service, ambiance etc. but the tiny space had me feeling continually cramped (I'm 6'3") and more than anything else, simply a value for the dollar versus other choices in NYC. I will absolutely say that food was well-prepared, presented and was definitely very pleasing. If you are a foodie you will definitely enjoy Casa Mono.

NAME: Stearman
REVIEW: Cramped dining area, outrageous prices, even by nyc standards. The food will not disapoint. Delicious. The quantity might. Especially since they are a tappas restaurant. Barely enough on each plate for three people. You have to order five plates for a light lunch, add beer,wine and20% tip and youll be out two hundred bucks. Ive had as good for less around Union Square.

NAME: Marie
REVIEW: Food here is fantastic! But the place is not for a group (6). We had a 9:15 pm reservation, and they gave us a table at 9:53. We will go back but we will think twice before inviting people to join us (a couple) .

NAME: AlexandraJ
REVIEW: I had such high hopes for Casa Mono, as I hold Batali to a very high standard (as we all should!), and as his restaurants and Spanish tapas are among my two favorite things. But this restaurant was a major disappointment. First of all, the menu is not authentic Spanish tapas. It's just somewhat-Spanish/pan-European/"new American" food in tiny portions so that they can be called "tapas." Second of all, the food is just so-so. Nothing special. Ordered five different dishes, none of them really stood out, the best was the fluke crudo, but it wasn't special. Finally, the prices are absurd. I am happy to pay up for an excellent dining experience, but here, where the food was not special, and the portions tiny, the prices were ridiculous.

NAME: AnneS
REVIEW: The place was bustling on a Saturdsy night. Even though I had read that the restaurant was small I was still surprised by the size. Restaurant called twice to confirm the reservation on two different days. The food was delicious; the pumpkin and goat cheese croquettes were just ok. With the exception of the sommelier, the service was rushed and our server was gruff with a stiff demeanor. If you want a slower paced dining experience you won't get it. Server asked "are you ready to order"at least three times and once the check was given came over to the table three times to see if were ready to pay. The seating was extremely uncomfortable and the table(school desk) was too small.

NAME: RandyS
REVIEW: We had reservations yet they put three people at a table for two. Waiter was inattentive and two of the cuts of meat ordered were extremely fatty and undercooked.

NAME: Luvgdfood
REVIEW: The food was excellent and the overall atmosphere was great. Waiting staff and bartender next door were a bit rude but waiting staff were very knowledgeable and helpful with the menu itself. Certainly wont disappoint if you love great/creative food!

NAME: seseseko
REVIEW: always impeccable! and i'm not a mario batali fan.

NAME: RolandoCamacho
REVIEW: We loved it, the only thing is its size Its small.

NAME: Junnyc
REVIEW: Nice brunch place while enjoying saturday. Decent dishes and wines. Each dishes were good enough to make me re-visit later. Hope to try other kinds of dishes with nice weather. Confidentially recommend to my friend for casual brunch place.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono is a very small Tapas restaurant, which is always packed! It's always hard to get a dinner reservation on weekends so plan ahead.  They recommend ordering 2~3 tapas dishes per person. My personal favorite was the duck egg dish.

NAME: ZoeB
REVIEW: My husband and I loved the ambiance, we had a great bottle of wine. the tapas were all well presented and absolutely"Delish". I appreciated the decor of the place. Great Spanish music playing. I will definitely will go back.

NAME: Geezy
REVIEW: This place is amazing!! I don't know who comes up with the menu but it is genius!!! Pumpkin and goat cheese, beets and manchengo, soft crab with bacon aioli, and fluke with watermelon, and strawberries and cucumber. Delicisio!!

NAME: AgnesK
REVIEW: Came back after an amazing first time... Maybe it was because we went on a Fri night, but, whatever it was, everything was lacking. The foie that we received was very scant in comparison to the first visit. The bone marrow was maybe left on the hardtop too long because half of it was dry to the point of there being no marrow. The razor clams will always be my favorite here though.

NAME: Tomomot
REVIEW: Food was great and wine pouring was generous. However we weren't completely satisfied about waiter's service. He "suggest" us that we (5 of us, not so big eater Asian women) should order at least 2 or 3 plates each and the order have to be done at once (with adjust timing). We thought it's too much so ordered 8 or 9. Those dish are even over $15 each, he complained saying it's not enough and seems very unhappy. Yes, it was plenty of food, anyway. If it's restaurant's policy, we hope it should've been written somewhere.

NAME: RoseC
REVIEW: We where seated for our 5pm reservation and waiting for one more person in our party and we where told by the lady manger to remember that there was a 7 pm reservation after us. Then she proceeded to say that we needed to be finished by then. P.S. we where done with Tapas by 6 but decided not to order dessert because we felt watched and hurried. It was not a pleaseat experience. The waiter was apologetic because it wasn't his fault.

NAME: tpc83
REVIEW: Tapas style excellent variety Wine selection eclectic and excellent

NAME: gregg
REVIEW: the food is a knockout. the service leaves something to be desired.

NAME: Lovelylady
REVIEW: We had a girls weekend in NYC and decided to go to Casa Mono for dinner. Service was incredible, the servers were helpful with the menu and offering suggestions for the wine list. The hostess was very attentive and was flexible with the change in the number of diners. The food was incredible and very well thought out. Classic Spanish flavors. The only downside was it is very small and can get quite loud. Overall a wonderful night!

NAME: Gyro13
REVIEW: My girlfriend had been out of town and upon her return I wanted to treat her to something special. After checking the Michelin guide, casa mono looked like a great fit due to the Tapas style cuisine and location. We were seated immediately (even though we arrived 10 min early - awesome!) and selected a bottle of wine and 5 plates. Food and beverage were great! Our waitress was friendly but bus staff was frequently bumping us and interrupting at bad times (ie intimate moments). Also the noise level was really high and the table is not meant for larger humans (FYI if you are an avg size male - my legs were cramped and I'm only 5'11"). Overall would definitely return!

NAME: battistini
REVIEW: the food is great, but, the service was not, our waitress was characterless and seemed to be totally disengaged. the tables are far too small and the table setting was not the cleanest. the stemware was streaked and cloudy, plates felt as if they'd been washed in cold or luke warm water.

NAME: FitchburgDrJohn
REVIEW: Many of the wines - all Spanish - were unfamiliar to us. The waiter and somellier were very knowledgeable and helped us pair the wines with the intriguing "small plates". The wine list features numerous choices by the glass and bottle, with tastes and prices to appeal to all palates and budgets. The "small plates" also provide opportunity to experience foods not frequently available. I particularly enjoy sweetbreads, and they were very well done here. The three of us had eleven selections (inclusive of dessert) among us, and all were wonderful. Where else have you had olive oil ice cream? If you are looking for steak and potatoes, this is not the place for you; if you are looking to be transported to somewhere new and different, it is.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Ansolutely delicious. One of the best experiences for unique dining in the city. Incredible value.

NAME: DeeDee
REVIEW: It'd been a while since we had been to the restaurant. I was not disappointed dining at the restaurant. They had a couple of our favorites, delicious as we remembered. Oxtail stuffed peppers and the steak with romesco sauce are standouts. The waitress was very knowledgable regarding the food and the wine. Her recommendation for wine was spot on. The dishes are somewhat smaller than we had in Spain, so order accordingly. I recommend Casa Mono without reservation.

NAME: gmp216
REVIEW: I've been coming here for years and have never had a disappointing dish. One of the rare New York restaurants at this level that has maintained a consistently high quality. They continue to vary the menu but my old favorites, like the oxtail stuffed piquillo peppers, are still there. Evenings can be busy so stop in for a late lunch on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: the food is very good, although they do not use a very spanish way of doing things... go to tertulia for a more spaniard taste, but still the ingredients are very good and the food is very good. the place is small and cozy and people are very nice. expensive though, i guess ok for ny standard. not for spaniard standard.

NAME: Rye20Foodie
REVIEW: Food is good, well prepared, staff is nice. The place is hot though, and noisy.

NAME: BethR
REVIEW: We had 4 small plates which were fine for dinner for two but the food was really inconsistent and so disappointing. The cod cheeks were way too fishy (not typical for cod!) and definitely too salty; we even contemplated sending it back. The peppers stuffed with oxtail ragu was probably the best dish but just very good, tasty but nothing special. The squid was also good but the grits were too salty and uninspired. While the octopus was excellent it was a small part of the plate and the rest again was uninspired. All in all, not at all what we were expecting. Having been to Amada in Philadelphia several times, we'll stick to Philly for our expensive tapas where the food is amazing!

NAME: ak1181
REVIEW: What can I say - I have never had a bad meal here - I love Casa Mono. I freqent this restaurant more than any other in the city. Food and service are consistently great and the restaurant itself is a pleasure in which to dine - I recommend at least one time sitting at the bar in front of the open kitchen - its great fun to watch the meals pepared. Ingredients are top notch and the dishes are creative and well executed. Personal favorites - the pulpo and fideos.

NAME: JackieM
REVIEW: excellent food and service, cozy lively decor, but extremely noisy, can't carry on a conversation

NAME: Excook
REVIEW: such a cool small restaurant. food is exceptional with excellent Spanish wine list. Brian Williams is a great waiter.

NAME: Nice
REVIEW: We Dined at 4 well known restaurants on this trip and Casa was disappointing in its food, service and ambiance. The open kitchen design was interesting but the food failed to live up to expectations. We also had a poor experience with the host and then subsequently the manager. The area has numerous restaurants so it might be best to check out one of them.

NAME: Luv2eat
REVIEW: Great food you won't find very many places outside of Spain. Also has some great eclectic Spanish wines that you've never heard of or had. Well worth the visit.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I'll never go back. Dishes are too oily. The Fideos with Chorizo and clams used to be made with cockles. They now make it with huge clams. We only got 4 in the dish and the clams were VERY sandy. The peppers stuffed with oxtail had bone or something unidentified that was hard in it. The razor clams were still good, but you put that much garlic and oil on anything, it will taste good. The potatas bravas were so oily we didn't eat them. The soft shell crab was too salty but otherwise cooked ok. The pork croquetas were undercooked and inedible. The best part of the meal was waiting for our table at Bar Jamon next door and eating the chorizo, manchego and jamon iberico. I would go back to bar jamon, not to Casa Mono.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I'm always excited to see what is on the menu and never disappointed. Thankfully, their small plates make it possible to sample a few dishes because its always hard to choose!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Felt like I was in Barcelona... Food & service were excellent.

NAME: Teacupsugarqueen
REVIEW: Totally unprepared for the extraordinary! Foods prepared to be photo worthy and delicious beyond words! My first time in the restaurant and I will be become a regular! Fabulous combinations of perfectly grilled asparagus with a runny cool egg along with blue cheese and other secrets was heaven on a plate. Perfectly grilled sardines or generous portions of razor clams blew me off the map! A menu filled with unique and brilliant combinations for the real foodie. I wish I lived next door rather than across town.

NAME: Diner
REVIEW: This is a great restaurant- once you get to the table. The food is delicious, wait staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. However the hostess staff is disorganized and fairly rude. They called me 3 times to confirm my reservation even though I confirmed on the first call. My husband was 5 mins late and the hostess told me that they had another table coming after us and we'd have to be out - several times, quite rudely. Throughout our entire dinner and when we left there were empty tables and no one waiting.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: i have eaten lunch here 5 times over the past 2 years and they have been extremely consistent with the quality and taste of the food....great job!!!! and i look forward to going back

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The fried squid with broken egg was delish!

NAME: Alisa
REVIEW: This is my favorite restaurant in NYC. The Foie Gras Cinco Cebollas is beyond words. Of course there are a great many delicious things on the menu. I've never had anything mediocre there. It IS very small so prepare to be intimate with those in neighboring tables. You'll forget you're on some stranger's lap when the food arrives.

NAME: Adventurer
REVIEW: Wanted to catch up with my daughter, who's off to Africa for six months, and a foodie- great on all counts- un pressured, knowledgeable friendly staff, interesting food and wine options, and comfortable surroundings in great neighborhood- thanks Casa Mono!

NAME: kryanl2002
REVIEW: The food was delicious! The baby squid dish was amazing and I highly recommend it to everyone! The presentation of the dishes was excellent. All the food looked so beautiful. The only complaints I have was the size of the restaurant. It was so tiny, getting up from the table was extremely difficult. Also, because it was tiny, the noise level seemed amplified. But the food more than made up for that!

NAME: Monika
REVIEW: Read some of the reviews and was a bit apprehensive--> However, Casa Mono was a great Tapas place with the wait staff as nice and knowledgeable as in the other of Mario's places. The lamb and baby octopus plates are quite generous and are to die for. Not your typical tapas place with mini portions of 1-2 bites! Yes, it is a small place, but not uncomfortable since all the other diners were also cognizant of their close neighbors. It felt like some of the neighborhood places in Southern Europe.

NAME: Twiggy
REVIEW: Casa Mono has terrific food with great variety for everyone from diehard meat eaters to vegans. Although it is quite small and can feel crowded even when it isn't full, it is a great choice on a temperate day because the floor-to-ceiling windows are flown open, and you feel as if you are eating outdoors without being on the sidewalk. It can be deceptively pricey, because you aren't always sure how much food to order, and it adds up -- not just in price but in a feeling of fullness. If you do not want to overeat, ask your waitperson how many dishes to order, and then order one less. It's easy and quick enough to add another if you and your companion(s) are hungry.

NAME: DXCSF
REVIEW: what was most disappointing was that the service was so indifferent. With Batali's big personality and the warm service I've experienced at most other Batali restaurants, this really threw the whole experience off. No one on the staff was engaging to us in any way, or even engaging with each other, and really acted as if they were just at any job. For a restaurant from a big name, charging prices like they do, this doesn't cut it.

NAME: Foodyholic
REVIEW: This tapas place doesn't serve the usual tapas found everywhere else in the city which is why I like it. They also always have new specials in the menu. But my favorites are: the duck egg with truffle oil, razor clams, fideos, and the catalan creme brulee with the batter dipped fried bay leaf that you rip the crispy batter out off.

NAME: jjnewyorktourist
REVIEW: We had a nice lunch in this cozy spot. Be prepared to be squeezed in quite comfily. The small restaurant was perfect for getting together over a few tapas and wine to chat. The only drawback was the lack of legroom at our table (we were squeezed up in front). Otherwise, excellent food and great service.

NAME: BesteNanNan
REVIEW: We love the food at Casa Mono and it can be fun in the evenings with the energetic crowd, but it is often hard to carry a conversation and it seems the food comes all at once, and dinner is over way too soon! But if you arrive at noon when they open on Saturday, the room is yours and gradually fills as you are finishing a leisurely meal. The food is top notch!! I could rave about a dozen dishes - but I have the best artichoke hearts on the planet there! Thanks for the memories! I'll be back!

NAME: John
REVIEW: Food was pretty good. Did not like having to order all dishes up front. To me tapas are order as you go. Also tables were way to tight. I would go back, however, and now know what to expect

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food here is great along with an extensive wine list. The only draw back is the size of the restaurant. It's very tight and cramped.

NAME: anvasqu
REVIEW: I had high expectations for this restaurant. The food was good, nothing stellar, and the service left a lot to be desired.

NAME: Foodisfun
REVIEW: We loved the small plates and sharing style of eating. There were so many unusual dishes to try, we can't wait to go back and order more. The soft shell crab was excellent, as well as the goat livers we tried. All very good and nicely presented. My only complaint is that we were 20 minutes late for our 6:00 reservation (raining in NY, couldn't get a cab, took subway and got lost). We called twice to say we were on our way and we were told both on the phone and when we got there that our table was reserved at 8:00 so we had a time limit. Now I get the problem but I did think it was rude for the hostess to basically reprimand us for being late. We stayed any way and didn't worry about time but we could tell our food was somewhat rushed.

NAME: slee
REVIEW: I came here for lunch with my coworkers so I cannot give a good impression on their notable wine list though I heard it was pretty great. We ordered 8 different small plates off their menu and all were superb. I would definitely like to go back to try their wine one of these nights. I've tried before but this small space gets very crowded, a sign of a great restaurant/bar I suppose! Will definitely be coming back. Thanks!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Found the dishes--both small plate and entree-- inventive and delicious. Flavors enhanced each ingredient. Nice delicate touch with seafood. Cost adds up, but well worth it for a dining experience that transports you out of New York to enjoy relaxation for a few hours in Spain. Went three days after first visit to ensure other friends could experience as well. On my short list now for all NY trips.

NAME: Jessi
REVIEW: We ordered 5 dishes. Foie Gras, Razor clams and calamares were absolutely amazing, especially the foie gras with five onion sweet and sour sauce, perfect combination. definitely go back again.

NAME: JuliaL
REVIEW: I was excited to come back to Casa Mono after a 3 year absense. I was surprised to learn that the restaurant requires each table to place its full order at one time. This "rule" seemed counter to the tapas experience. With that said, we had a delicious meal with the exception of the Cod Cheeks (more about a texture than taste) and the Sommelier although he could barely smile did recommend a terrific wine.

NAME: NYC81
REVIEW: Tapas weren't that great. The waiter was not helpful in making a wine selection. Better food, better and more intimate ambiance, and better service can be found next door, at Casa Mono's offshoot Bar Jamon.

NAME: dfny
REVIEW: Casa Mono is a favorite of mine. The food never fails to impress and delight.

NAME: FilmFan
REVIEW: Excellent food; small restaurant with close tables. Very loud music -- not a good place for easy conversation.

NAME: leec21
REVIEW: First of all, I would like to say the food there was great. We ordered razor clam, squid, scallop , rabbit meat and we love all of them. The only complaint we have is their hostess. We were 10 minutes late (I had a long day walking in New York and can't walk too fast) and hostess said she can't seat us because we are late and it is a "protocol" to prevent her from seating us. "There will be full of people in next twenty minutes", she claimed. So we deiced to seat at bar. The next one to two hours we observed the restaurant and found there are plenty enough seats available.... Overall this is a great place for foodies but don't be late (not even a bit) because it is a "protocol".

NAME: jopopo
REVIEW: Lunchtime -service was pleasant but spotty and slow. We shared razor clams - the flavors were spot-on, but they were really gritty. Also a nice salad with anchovies - tasty if not memorable. We also had an enjoyable goat confit and a duo of lamb. The lamb was very mediocre. The chop was way overcooked. If it had benn mine rather than my husband's, I'd have sent it back. Even so, there was nothing special about the lamb - not really better than in many Greek restaurants. With one shared dessert and 2 coffees, this all came to $120, and in no way was it worth the expense. It's a very cute place that does feel very Spanish, and you could probably have a great meal there if you knew up front what was good, but we weren't so lucky.

NAME: MPEnjoy
REVIEW: Great perfectly sized, innovative and flavorful tapas!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: As always Casa Mono is a wonderful evening of great food!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Was so delicious - everything!...we had a lamb chop/belly special that was excellent. When the chef overheard my sister ask for two chops instead of belly - he agreed but added that we "didn't know what we were missing!"....we were sold, but the really classy part of the story was that this chef sent over two chops and the lamb belly --- completely unexpected surprise....great energy, great food!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Bone marrow was awesome! The place is very small and cramped so this is a 2-3 party place.

NAME: Halche
REVIEW: Contrary to what I was led to expect by other reviewers, I found the service to be excellent and friendly. The food places an emphasis on the intense flavoring of dishes with a distinct but not overpowering smokey taste. I did not find the dishes overly salty. While it's true the restaurant is small and noisy, I had no difficulty carrying on a conversation with my dinner companion. The portions seemed reasonably sized and fairly priced. Between the two of us, we ordered five tapas plus dessert and could probably have gotten away with four tapas and dessert and felt completely sated. The glass of wine recommended by our waiter was outstanding. I highly recommend the restaurant for a night of exciting but casual dining.

NAME: Danzilla
REVIEW: The food was exotic and fantastic; going to have to go back and try all new plates. The rabbit, razor clam, and baby squid dishes were AMAZING. Well worth checking out.

NAME: James
REVIEW: Excellent standard of food, great atmosphere, friendly staff & an eclectic 90s themed Britpop soundtrack!

NAME: NicoleS
REVIEW: Food was good, but I felt rushed and cramped during the meal. I was with a group of 6 and would definiteley not recommend going here with a group greater than 2 people - the space just isn't accommodating for that kind of crowd. The service was good but not excellent and the food was very good. The place was packed and if I go back, I will probably try sitting at the bar to avoid being at a table on top of other parties.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: My companion and I were so tempted by so many of the interesting menu items. everything was delicious and each dish served immediately when it was ready. Determined to go back and try a different selection each time

NAME: nycubanpete
REVIEW: Very disappointing upon return...service not up to par....although food was still incredible....

NAME: OtavioSFarah
REVIEW: The tapas there are incredible. You can always have a great meal there!!

NAME: Sarah
REVIEW: Love love love! We will make Casa Mono a ritual.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was good. Despite the fact we had a reservation late in the evening they made us wait 40 minutes. We almost left the place.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Worst service ever. Having lived in Manhattan nearly a decade and a half I'm used to coming across some quirky servers but ours took the cake that day. Our order wasn't taken for nearly fifteen minutes after we were seated, which I could understand if it was a crowded lunch, instead our server was busy giving a back rub to his colleague in the middle if the dining room. When he finally made the time to to stop by our table and take our order he refused to speak a single word- this continued throughout the meal - to the point where we were left wondering if he was mute - until we saw him chatting with a fellow server. The food here is consistently decent but I won't be back nor will I ever recommend this place after the horrific service

NAME: HHeller
REVIEW: Always a pleasure to eat at Casa Mono.Amazing how crowded it has been since day one.

NAME: ngmuipai
REVIEW: There are some very good tapas in NY right now -- Tia Pol, Txikito, Tertullia -- but Casa Mono remains at the top of the list. Problem is, the place is so small, it's really best for intimate groups, and that means you can't order everything on the menu, as you'd like.

NAME: roberto
REVIEW: good music, good service, good food, cheap price!!!!

NAME: afon
REVIEW: the food at this place never fails to impress me, the problem is the size of the restaurant. it's really small, so if you're showing up with a party of three your different small plates won't fit on your table (go to the bar or find a fourth person so you can get a larger table).

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Amazing service, waitress made great recommendations! I'm adding this place to my "must-visit" list when in NYC!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Delicious, unique tapas! Very charming little place with reasonable prices for New York. Loved the Foie Gras and the Skirt Steak!

NAME: GThomas
REVIEW: This could be a great spot if the portions were at least 50% larger which is truly not saying much! The fish, lamb and other dishes were gone in two bites. For $14 or so it is reasonable, but you really need to order 2 of everything to fill up.  Lovely ambiance though.....

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Try Bar Jamon next door for a drink beforehand.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The tapas was beautifully presented, the food itelf well thought out, and delicious. We would highly recommend it. The tables were squished together, but the waiters were effortless in their service, and very attentive. Our server recommended a wine that was wonderful.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We have tried their tapas bar next door( excellent) and decided to try the restaurant. Food was very good, wine list excellent, knowledgeable servers and quick service. Nice vibe inside given it's cramped quarters . Definitely a notch above.

NAME: mnyc
REVIEW: Food here is good, but not outstanding. At an average of around $17 per tapas plate, I would expect more. Service also leaves something to be desired. Go around the corner to Bar Jamon for less expensive but similar choices in food and wine.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The dining area is very small and tight. The food and service was very good.

NAME: Mirasol
REVIEW: Perhaps we had bad luck, but I wasn't impressed with most of the dishes we had. The Foie Gras and beef tongue were good but nothing special. The pork belly was dry and overcooked. The rabbit dish was too salty. The Dorada with Clam Ceviche, however, was great. Service was good.

NAME: scottykeats
REVIEW: Been to casa mono many time and the meal is usually excellent. Saturday night we had inedible fishy monkfish cheeks and other very salty food. We were totally disappointed

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Always wonderful! We were delighted to return and share with friends who'd never enjoyed!  Funny that in your options for vetting, considering 'noise' there is not the option for 'too loud' - which frankly is often the major problem! Casa Mono kindly did reduce the piped in sound level at our request!

NAME: victorc
REVIEW: We have been to this restaurant several times and although we enjoy the food we will not go back. Reason is that the wine is way over priced, the portions I know this is tapas, but even so the price is high for the size. The place is tiny and crowded so it's not like you're paying for comfort. We have been to Spain and know the price of jamon but the skimpy plate they serve is still way overpriced for both quality and portion. Also the menu does not seem to have changed much since we first went, is this kitchen tired? There is way too much competition to be this complacent and expensive.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great food. The Foi gras was excellent, The Kokokxas were excelent with a very good pil pil souce. The scallops very good A real good place with great food, wine list and ambiance

NAME: betsy
REVIEW: The maitre d' was unbelievably rude. WE had reservations and were told before we were even seated that we had to be out of there by 9:30. Service was friendly but inattentive. The food however was really wonderful.

NAME: Dilbert
REVIEW: Wonderful tapas, across the board-- felt like I was back in Barcelona!

NAME: NMR123
REVIEW: Went here for dinner on a Monday night. Had requested a corner table near a window, and unfortunately was given a two top right in the middle of the restaurant. Also had to wait 15 min past Res time. Despite these letdowns, the ambiance was fantastic, the service attentive and personal, and the food/wine delicious. Would recommend to anyone looking for a romantic tapas spot.

NAME: whkc
REVIEW: Must try the razor clams. A little salty for my taste but I must admit the food was amazing. The place is a bit small/cramped but it provided a cozy environment overall. Went with a friend and ordered 5 tapas, perfect portion.

NAME: londonman
REVIEW: A wonderful location on Irving Place - one of those quiet streets in Manhattan. Loved everything, except was disappointed about the portion size of the polpi. Very expensive for polpi and very little on the plate!

NAME: grettam
REVIEW: fantastic food. Go early. wehen it gets crowded, it is exceptionally noisy and the tables are very close together.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent for folks with diverse tastes, comfortable with a New York dining experience. Somewhat spendy but not excessively so. Your Midwestern relatives will feel cramped in the tight space and rely heavily on patatas bravas to feel sated. Whether these issues are flaws of the restaurant or the diner are a matter of perspective, but as in all matters of dining, "know your audience" is a good place to start in seeking a satisfactory experience.

NAME: LidiaR
REVIEW: Awful careless hipster-attitude female server. The food was super salty and over cooked. We were never asked if we were enjoying the dinner.The wine and plum ice-cream dessert were out of control. Although we did get some Dessert wine on the house when we complained on the food, it doesn't change the dissappinting experience we had to go through. I will spread the word and not recommend this place to anyone. I know this place is still going to be succeful and busy but I will never be back to this pretentious environment spot with unattentive service and not impressive food. What a shame, Batali, what a shame!

NAME: StacyJ
REVIEW: I love this restaurant! I have been here a handful of times, alone, with my husband, with friends, summer, winter and fall, and it is always a good scene. Not romantic but intimate in that you will be almost sitting in the laps of your neighboring diners. The food is wonderful and comforting. The staff is knowledgeable and warm (if you allow it), from food to wine and anything in between.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: very flavorful food, a bit on the salty side, but I have heard that is how many Batali restaurants tend to be. great wine

NAME: jojo
REVIEW: Very tiny place but great food and sevice ,the wine selection was terrific. We plan on going back

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Any place that asks $20 plus per small plate and says they are a tapas restaurant should not put a time limit on the table. $350 for three of us and only 1hr 45min and we were asked to leave and that someone else had a reservation, not cool. Lost my business for good

NAME: Excook
REVIEW: had scallops and they were minute and only 4

NAME: AppleAnnie12
REVIEW: Fabulous food in a too loud setting with postage size tables!

NAME: LaLa
REVIEW: Good food. Good service. The restaurant wasn't busy, so it's difficult to tell what it would be like when it is busy. There was 1 chef, so I don't know how she would be able to keep up if all the tables were full. Will definitely go back.

NAME: ynadal
REVIEW: One of my favorites when in town. Food is ewquisite and the service is consistently great!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This small Restaurant has many excellent features. Professional, attentive waiters and superb food. Negatives: small tables, noisy, not cheap. Would definitely recommend, and most assuredly return.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food is so fantastic (thinking first and foremost about the bacalao croquetas). However, the service is always a little disappointing - but I'll keep coming back for the food!

NAME: HeidiP
REVIEW: Truly my favourite restaurant in NY. I go for dinner on every trip. Spanish tapas done exceptionally well. Definitely lively so not your seen if you don't like noise. Seating is a bit cramped but it adds to the atmosphere!

NAME: Harald
REVIEW: We had a great evening and the food was amazing. Will definetely come back.

NAME: RichardS
REVIEW: we had an excellent meal and a good, reasonably bottle of wine

NAME: newyork
REVIEW: This restaurant does not deserve michelin starred one at all. Most of all managing staff are not considered to be courteous . And they are very rude and busy in filling the seats without caring customers.

NAME: gail
REVIEW: Enjoyed a very rich meal here after a glass of Spanish wine from the associated wine bar next door. We found the duck egg, beef tongue, scallops, and charcuterie to be excellent and interesting. The oxtail stood out for being rather boring, and I've already forgotten some of our other choices. The place is quite meat-heavy, despite the lighter fare tapas implies. The table was also quite cramped and it was a juggling game to share plates. Despite enjoying it, we may find a place with a mix of light and heavy fare next time.

NAME: chavi
REVIEW: The only sad thing about it is that if you arrive early there is no place to stay or wait. yo have to come back.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Very overrated. You can get much better quality tapas elsewhere, without the pretentiousness.

NAME: Lcedarpoint
REVIEW: ALWAYS a favorite for lunch for my hubby and I. Of all of Mario's places, still most unique flavors. Only critique this time, is that we came w our 3 kids, and we know its not kid place they were not even trying to accommodate. Just wont bring kids next time.

NAME: Manjusri
REVIEW: I'm disappointed to say that Casa Mono appeared to be resting on it's laurels when we visited last week. I have been dining there 2-3 times a year for as long as it has been open, and although the menu remains among the most creative, interesting, even exciting, the preparation and execution has drifted to mediocre. We found that some dishes were not prepared with care, and salt and other condiments were overused to the point of diminishing the natural flavor of the recipe. Service was at best barely satisfactory, which can be overlooked when the food special. Hopefully, Casa Mono will be able to return to it's tradition of exquisite preparation to go along with it's exceptional menu.

NAME: Steven
REVIEW: Tapas/small plates really don't get any better.

NAME: francemichele
REVIEW: Fabulous tapas, especially the caramelized foie gras over shallots. a dream....

NAME: LaSignora
REVIEW: Food and the wine recommended by our waitress was terrific. Unfortunately, the crowded tables and noise level really do detract from the quality of the experience. It is almost impossible not to be bumped into and a private conversation is simply impossible. I realize this is a hot spot, but these menu items and the corresponding prices deserve a more elegant experience!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Terrible experience. Rude service. Loud 80's music. Food that's meant to be shared yet incredibly difficult to share. Unimpressive food.

NAME: Jessyjessyjessy
REVIEW: Outstanding! The only reason I did not give the service an "Excellent" review is that we were in a corner table and the waiter had a difficult time getting to us physically. However, everything was just wonderful, and I would definitely go back. I had to impress someone on this lunch date, and it was the perfect place for that.

NAME: mitch
REVIEW: Food was very tasty and the wine list is very good. However, food service was rushed and could have been more friendly. Would advise restaurant managers to modify service to allow for a more leisurely dining experience. At Manhattan prices, allowing for a dining experience and not a fast food chain is recommended.

NAME: villagegal
REVIEW: Our second time at Casa Mono and second time we were on time for our reservation but are table wasn't ready and there is literally NO place to wait inside. Not great for a cold winter evening. But if you don't mind being sent outside and around the corner to a crowded bar where hopefully you'll be called for your table, go for it!  We do love the food and once seated were happy to given complimentary wine as apology for the wait. And were comped for the chewy artichokes that were the only disappointment on a VERY tasty and interesting menu from which we shared 11 dishes including dessert. Loved the "burnt custard" that was the best creme brulee ever!

NAME: Terrific
REVIEW: Spectacular! We ordered 10 dishes and every one was terrific!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The service was very rude.  After spending a lot of money for very little food, the woman told us that we had to leave to make room for the next reservation. We weren't even there for 2 hours. It was holiday season and we had a 5.30 reservation, and we were the only table there. The waiters were not friendly at all.

NAME: Pattilewmannel
REVIEW: I was disappointed that they asked me to wait outside in the subzero weather for 3 min to wait for my other person.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The wine list and wine bar/tapas next door were great but the food was disappointing. I found it to be neither authentic nor an interesting version of authentic, for example, the pumpkin and goat cheese croquetas were just bad - heavily breaded and an unpleasant pumpkin taste, and the patatas bravas tasted like potatoes with hot sauce poured on them. I did enjoy the skirt steak but nonetheless have no interest in returning to the restaurant.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: ridiculously small dining room with people sitting on top of each other at tiny tables with staff and others constantly bumping into you would not go back food was good but dont see what the fuss is all about

NAME: shutterbugnyc
REVIEW: This is probably one of the most over-rated restaurants I've been to in NYC. We ordered the pumpkin croquettes, skirt steak, oxtail, setas & a Muga Reserva. The pumpkin croquettes were bland and tasteless. The setas had way too much garlic and salt in it. We did enjoy the skirt steak and the wine, but that was all we enjoyed here. We also don't appreciate the host (who looks like Psy) smelling our wine by putting his nose up to the bottle opening before serving it to us. We would not recommend this place, nor would we return here for another meal.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great special occasion restaurant or a place to go before a movie. You will feel like you have taken a trip to Spain.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Disappointing food in cramped space. Nothing was memorable and prices were hefty for such underwhelming food.

NAME: Gratefuldoc
REVIEW: underwhelmed. expect much more from a Mchellin starred restaurant. spacing is horrific even for New York. no room on the tables. wait staff was disinterested and aloof. wine steward was great. food was uneven and portions small for the price. would choose other tapas restaurants despite the "rating". Definitely not the gem we were expecting.

NAME: LaFleur
REVIEW: Hot, dark, noisy, and cramped wine bar, so not for everyone, but if you like sampling lots of different flavors including grilled seafood and whole animal cookery, then this is the place. Fun to sit at counter. Great Spanish wine selections. Never disappoints.

NAME: KipC
REVIEW: Excellent food and service. Went two nights in one week, both times spectacular.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: great food love the small plates excellent wine suggestion

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The first 2 dishes were on the salty side, but as soon as I let the waitress know, the rest of the dishes were good. The tastes were incredible nonetheless. Service was great. There were only 2 a waitress and a waiter working at the time I was there. It was very busy, but their attitudes were great. It's on the pricey side, but I would say the service and flavors were worth it.

NAME: chrism
REVIEW: Made 11 pm reservation. Felt unwelcome from the start. Waiter was rude because we were his last table. The manager asked us to leave so she could go home, this after ordering a 200 bottle of wine. Food wasn't great this time around. Would never go back, mainly due to staff!!! Such a shame since it was my favorite place prior to Thursday nights experience.

NAME: MMG553
REVIEW: Too noisy. Overpriced for what you get. No ambience. Cramped in small tables and we were rushed to finish our meal so they could turn over the table.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was very good. Server went on break and didn't tell anyone so we were completely ignored for at least 45 min! Once alerted, the other staff tried to take care of us. Finally, the bartender came out and helped. Still, we expect much better from a restaurant of this reputation and cost.

NAME: TomP
REVIEW: Excellent. Better than a lot of the places we ate at in Spain. I would recommend this to everyone. If we go back to New York and Casa Mono is still there, we will go again.

NAME: Cynthia
REVIEW: Birthday dinner with two girlfriends - service was spotty at the restaurant but the food was simply outstanding and memorable. Was fun to share the tapas with my friends that night. Be prepared to sit very closely to your neighbors in this tiny restaurant. Very fun- recommend highly and look forward to returning!

NAME: JamesF
REVIEW: Outstanding tapas served in a tiny room. The staff navigates the space with amazing grace.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was outstanding! The foie GRAS was pure decadence and a perfect blend of seasonings.

NAME: ErickN
REVIEW: Enjoyed the variety of dishes. Very loud and cramped space.

NAME: Paulsito
REVIEW: Food was Horrible. It was so salty that by the end of the night my tongue was swollen.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Good spot

NAME: dabble
REVIEW: Wonderful experience. Interesting menu; better than I experienced in Spain. It challenges your palate to try new foods and food combinations but behind the seeming in congruency of the menu was actually well intended flavor combinations.

NAME: SandraS
REVIEW: Ended up going twice. Food is great!!! Feels like in Spain.

NAME: Rosie
REVIEW: Amazing and delicious. Unique flavours and plates you can share but you won't want to!

NAME: buster
REVIEW: Amazing, AMAZING Food!!! excellent combinations with fabuolous technique. Great recommendations from the server. Absolute entertainment to sit at the bar and walk through the menu; and don't miss the olive oil ice cream!

NAME: Vanessa
REVIEW: Really great food as usual. Service was not as great as my first experience. Felt a bit rushed with the bussers coming by and clearing plates before confirming if I was finished. Also showed up early for a reservation to try to get a seat at the bar only to be told that the "first come first serve" bar has a wait list. Seemed odd that there would be a waitlist if it was supposed to be first come first serve. The hostess was kind enough to put us on the list and called us within 30 mins to let us know that 2 seats had opened up. Didn't seem like the waitlist was very long and she could have handled the situation in a friendlier and more acommodating manner.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Foie gras dish was the standount, however my girlfriend's was served cold. Other dishes were only OK. We tried the goat cheese and pumpkin fritters, the sweetbreads and one of the salads. Interesting spot and the wine list is good with a number of smaller producing regions in Italy represented. Service was attentive. Maybe it was just an off night for the kitchen.

NAME: WaltF
REVIEW: Here's the place for a palate-pleasing pick-me-up — where small plates let you try out new tastes or new treatments.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Salsa Music in Spanish restaurant? It kill the whole ambiance !!! Food was good, services of the waitress terrible .

NAME: OtavioSFarah
REVIEW: Great food, great wines! We really enjoyed our meal. Outstanding!!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Our group was only 6... large for this tiny place. But from the moment we walked in, we felt enveloped by the adventure. Food was really excellent, with plenty to please both timid and the explorers. Our server was particularly adept at pairing wine with the many plates she arranged in courses. We spent more than three hours eating, sipping and laughing on a lazy Sunday, and all of us walked away satisfied and grateful for a friend's recommendation of Casa Mono.

NAME: MAAB
REVIEW: We took an out-of-town friend here for brunch recently; we live in the neighborhood. The food is served in small dishes, so it's great for sampling and sharing. We ordered about 3 dishes for each person, and it was more than enough. And we didn't leave feeling hungry or stuffed. The food and service were excellent. I'd definitely go back.

NAME: Taster
REVIEW: Great variety of tapas all cooked with sound knowledge of the products. Really nice taste combinations.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great for groups of 4 or less. Outstanding service and food. Went on a double date with the CEO/his wife, and my boyfriend...perfect venue for friendship, dates, and discussing business.

NAME: EdmundH
REVIEW: Restaurant is small and feels a little cramped

NAME: ArielaR
REVIEW: Wonderful!!!!enjoyed every moment

NAME: JohnF
REVIEW: Went on a Monday this time and while the food was still great it was not as solid as the first time we enjoyed this restaurant. A couple of items came out not quite as hot as they should have and the service could have been better.

NAME: DianneC
REVIEW: Terrific food for most part. 4 out of 5 tapas were excellent. 5th was good but a bit bland (mamilla clams with chorizo). The pork croquette and the piquillo peppers with oxtail were particularly tasty. Had a lower end wine that was quite satisfactory. Wait staff did nice job. Not the place to go to if desire any privacy, but we had a delightful time.

NAME: rina
REVIEW: Excellent tapas selection.. Razor clam is the best!

NAME: YiaYia
REVIEW: Like other highly rated & "reasonably priced" (for NYC) restaurants, this felt like a factory. Food was good, interesting, but the staff seemed more interested in ensuring our table turned over than in serving us. VERY loud. Next time I want a fun evening out, I'll go someplace where they're not so full of themselves.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: It was the worst restaurant I visited in the five days I spent in NYC.All the food was way too salty and cooked poorly.My two friends thought it was less than mediocre as well.

NAME: Graham
REVIEW: My wife and I spent a few days in New York going to plays and site seeing. A friend had recommended Casa Mono and we would recommend it to anyone. It is all small plates and a lot of not quite common dishes. The tongue was wonderful. The wine list is an extensive list of Spanish wines, also not that common, but very good quality. The bread pudding was delightful.

NAME: Quietbelow
REVIEW: I have been to Casa Mono twice now and absolutely love it.  For entirely reasonable prices you get wonderful food in a great cozy, laid-back and cheerful atmosphere.  The razor clams are a revelation, but the sepia, foie, and mussels with chorizo are all fantastic as well.  Though Casa Mono is great for foodies, not all the dishes are ambitious--but you don't need that from this neighborhood spot.  It's mostly about getting well-prepared, larger-than-average tapas-style dishes and sharing.  I would say four dishes take care of two people (many of them come with sauces you'll want to sop up with bread).    Surprisingly, the wine recommendations are more on point than higher-priced places.  Love Casa Mono.

NAME: AKDL
REVIEW: My husband and I LOVED Casa Mono. This is a small, tightly packed restaurant with fantastic tapas-style dishes. We had the mussels (wonderful), the Iberico ham (the real deal - expertly hand sliced), chorizo and garbanzos, and the much talked about Pork Belly. All were delicious. The place was packed (I recommend a reservation) and service is a bit slow - but everything is made as it is ordered, so when they are busy it is entirely understandable and worth the wait. We'll be back!

NAME: JamieI
REVIEW: Incredible. Just so sweet and perfect all around.

NAME: MV2017
REVIEW: Too noisy; otherwise, awesome; the food is great.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great food! Friendly wait staff, although the sommelier seems to be lacking in knowledge and has an unwelcoming attitude.

NAME: KarenD
