REVIEW: The food is interesting, well prepared variations on classic tapas. The wine list is long and too heavily weighted to the upper end. We would have been lost without the help of the wonderful sommelier. The noise level will keep me from returning

NAME: Vijay168
REVIEW: Second time around was not as satisfying as the first time. Fish was under salted; scallops were fantastic except for the sauce/small bits of cantoloupe did not work; pine nuts were good though. Lamb duo had a very good chop but the sausage was OK, a bit dry and salty; vegetable ragu good but not memorable. The tendency for the staff to ask for reservations when the restaurant is half empty (and remain empty for the next one hour) is too snooty.

NAME: ychungelle
REVIEW: Tapas menu was different from other restaurants, very original and tasty. Extensive wine list. Small place but with a lot of vibrant energy (and noise). I enjoyed all of my dishes, and overall was a great experience!

NAME: mian
REVIEW: I had not been to Casa Mono in years and decided to take my husband there for his birthday. The good food and wine was ruined by the server's efforts to rush us. No, we couldn't order tapas as we ate because the chef preferred the full order at one time, we were told. After we declined dessert but said we wanted another round of wine, we were told to go next door to the restaurant's bar to free up the table. I had heard such stories about restaurants in NY when I first moved to the city in the 1980s but had never experienced the humiliation. We eat out at least twice a week and I can't remember ever being rushed out like that. Needless to say, we won't be going back.

NAME: Wonderfulwino
REVIEW: CM has became a bit haughty with the Michelin star. Food is down to earth but not overwhelming. The wine list is fantastic, one of the best as far as Spanish wines are concerned. Overall a decent experience but for a hafty price...

NAME: Hotelie81
REVIEW: The food and the service were both unique and truly wonderful! Our server helped us pick an outstanding wine to compliment the food. As an operator of several fine dining restaurants in the Finger Lakes region of the state, I appreciate great food and service and this restaurant delivers both!

NAME: Anne
REVIEW: Interesting and unusual Spanish food, small plates, beautiful stemware to match incredible wine list. We sat at the bar, Fernando was attentive and friendly.  Our greeter at the door could have been more welcoming. We arrived early, there were only a few tables filled, restaurant was mostly empty. Maitre'd was brusque and took a phone call before seating us. He needs a lesson in warm welcomes when couples are about to drop $200-$250 for a meal in a tiny, noisy restaurant.  That being said, the meal was wonderful, and our bartender/waiter was outstanding.

NAME: Kerr
REVIEW: Wait staff happy to make recommendations that are generally spot on. Busy and loud but in a good way. Kitchen has great pacing and all wait staff are super attentive.

NAME: JulieK
REVIEW: Space is a little tight so recommended for groups of 4 or less.

NAME: ThomasS
REVIEW: Quality was great, quantity was dissapointing. I understand that we ordered tapas and not entres, but could be a little more generous with the portions - perhaps 20% more food per dish? Tasty. Service was good. Restaurant was romantic and relaxing - we ate late afternoon before the rush and place wasn't full so it was kind of nice and quiet. Overall, good but didn't leave feeling I had to tell someone that they had to go to this place. Been to many Batali/Bastianich restaurants and generally enjoy. Thanks for listening.

NAME: MoMo
REVIEW: Unusual ingredients artfully combined and prepared. Service was prompt yet not rushed. Overall, a superb experience.

NAME: Jennywar
REVIEW: We ate here 5 years ago and thought it was a knock out then! Even better 5 years later. Incredibly delicious and inventive food.... Baby artichokes grilled and dressed with mint, lemon and oil. Shave grilled octopus and shaved grilled fennel... an extraordinary texture sensation.Fabulous.It epitomizes quintessential New York neighbourhood dining and is so tiny with tables just elbow size in width and water glass in a small shelf under the table. Excellent attentive service. Great experience. Not cheap but worth it.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Loved the food and the staff was great with answering our questions! They also helped us to order the right amount of food since it was tapas. Small and quaint, wouldn't go with a large group of people. Can't wait to go back!

NAME: CCNYC
REVIEW: Wow, two people, 7 plates, three small pitchers of very good wine, not priceless exactly, but outstanding nevertheless!

NAME: Madison
REVIEW: We just love this restaurant. Cannot get enough of the wonderful delicious food. We also enjoy the next door wine bar. We usually get there ahead of our reservation to have a glass of wine and a plate of cheese with ham at the bar.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great little spot that you would probably pass over if you were just walking down the street.  Sit at the bar and watch the chefs prepare the tapas.  You will end up ordering everything though because it all looks so good!  Anything with seafood is a must!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Our experience was amazing, great food, fresh and very chic... We had a table of 6 and everything was just great. Would definitely go back... The wine list is beyond amazing !!!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We enjoyed our second visit to Casa Mono and would definitely recommend it! Great food and the bar right beside it was also a great place to wait until our table was available. Many wines to choose from. We had a table right beside the open windows. Busy little place so some great people watching as well. Cheers!

NAME: MartinG
REVIEW: Don't bother going unless you're a friend of the waitstaff. Items which were "no longer available" for the night mysteriously appeared at a neighboring table that was seated and ordered after we did. There are too many tables in too small a space and the food just isn't good enough to justify the experience.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Dining at Casa Mono is an energetic, flavorful and exciting experience.  The service -- from the Maitre D's first greeting to the last farewell of our knowledgeable waiter -- was outstanding. The latter recommended excellent, affordable, unpretentious wine that paired perfectly with our dishes. He coursed the meal very well, giving us time to savor such items as perfectly cooked scallops and indulgent sweetbreads before heading on to sublime desserts. Even when a nasty, jaded and generally despicable group of adults next to us argued with him over a trivial check error, our waiter did not compromise our eating experience.  All things considered, the meal was excellent. However, I would have enjoyed a more generous serving of Iberico h

NAME: RichardM
REVIEW: Absolutely excellent. A very different restaurant with great food, an interesting environment, and excellent service. It is very small so one cannot object to the hustle and bustle but that is part of the experience....

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono is centrally located in the Union Square area. The food is superb and this is a great option if you want to be adventurous and try new things. I'm a big fan of small plates so that I can try many different foods and I was not disappointed.

NAME: Customer
REVIEW: the food was very heavy but it's batali type intense floors the wine was expensive and selections by the glass were. limited. the wine list is marked up way to much paid 25 bucks for a quoting ( two small servings)of a mediocre Spanish wine batali must do better than that

NAME: tommy
REVIEW: Very loud, tables so close you can smell your neighbors, really interesting wines, great service, stellar tapas, try the goat it rocks

NAME: RussW
REVIEW: The food was terrific. Everything was well propepared and well balanced. I can't recommend the Charcuterie enough. On the othe best I have ever had.

NAME: E735
REVIEW: Dinner was superb in every aspect. We'll go back as soon as we can.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: bit  pricey and yer def crammed in, go next door for sanity

NAME: KarineB
REVIEW: Everytime I go to NYC I have to stop at Casa Mono, I usually like to write and tell what I had, but it has been a while and I don't remember. The only dish I do rememeber is the Clam with the little pasta. This is delicious. Everything is cook perfectly. I will be back again when I'll be in NYC. a place not to miss.

NAME: Bestofbest
REVIEW: have eaten here over a dozen times and am more impressed each time. one of my top in nyc

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I am a NY'er, and this was one of the worst dining experiences ever in NYC! The dinner started well with good appetizers and a somelier who knew his wines, but after that it was a train wreck. All of the pasta dishes we ordered were overcooked and had little to no flavor whatsoever. The worst of the worst was the ravioli dish which looked like it had come from a Chef Boyarde can and just dumped on the plate. Otto is supposed to be a 'hot spot' for dining, but it was simply a 'hot mess!' The owners really need to check in with the chef to improve the main dishes. This was such a disappointment since I know the owners must know better than to serve something like this!

NAME: dave50
REVIEW: Casa Mono was good, but failed to meet expectations. Some of the combinations in the tapas were overly ambitious, and didn't work well. While different and new combinations and flavors can be fun and enjoyable, sometimes you stretch to far, when its not needed. Otherwise, the quality and preparation was excellent, and the service was helpful and cheerful.

NAME: NewYork1
REVIEW: Very expensive and the food was barely okay. The waiter asked if he could take our order twice after we were seated for no more than a few minutes. Also he brought the check even though we didn't ask for it immediately after we were finished with our meal and indicated we did not want dessert.

NAME: ShankarM
REVIEW: Food quality is simply amazing. A bit on the expensive side, but well worth it.

NAME: Hoc500
REVIEW: I love this spot.....I am always treated well, and the food is interesting and delicious.  KH

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The waiter was very helpful with his opinions about th menu. The pork belly was excellent. Could have skipped the calamares.

NAME: tpujol
REVIEW: The area is really small and can be a little loud. Not a good place for first dates. The wine list was magnificent. I found a basque white that was fantastic, but only one item from the Balearic Islands. The food was very authentic, the squid is the star of the menu and the pan con tomate tastes like Spain.

NAME: IRAS
REVIEW: Nice

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food here (except the bone marrow, which I found to be very bland) is worth many visits (and the high price tag, and the sub-par service).  Highly recommend the bacalao croquetas!!

NAME: StephanieM
REVIEW: Amazing fois gras - the best I've ever had!! Fresh, innovative menu.. I highly recommend this place to foodies. If you love food and love to try new things, new flavors you will love Casa Mono. You cannot be afraid to try anchovies for example, as I guarantee you have never had anchovies like that. They were fresh and tender, served on delicious crusty toasted bread with this wonderful olive overtop -magnificent  One thing I did not enjoy was the pork charcuterie plate - Too fatty. Oh yeah and the tables have a compartment underneith in which they keep the water glasses, making it impossible for a woman to cross her legs. It wasn't the end of the world though ;)  Can't wait to go back.

NAME: looking4gems
REVIEW: The food was delicious, even though a little salty. We ordered dishes on the richer side and were satisfied with only 2 per person. The dishes were quite pricey, however, and their size and quality did not merit the price tag. Additionally, the service was disappointing. Our empty water glasses were never proactively refilled (we had to flag down our waitress four seperate times when our glasses were empty), our waitress's demeanor was generally curt, and we were seated more than half an hour after our reservation time (which was late in the evening and we were starving). Our group consensus was that we would return but only if someone else was picking up the tab.

NAME: MalcolmH
REVIEW: Casa Mono's high-end tapas is, without doubt, the best tapas I have had in my life. It is well worth the somewhat-high per-plate cost. The wine list is impressive; and even the least-expensive Rioja ($60) which I ordered was spectacular.

NAME: JohnP
REVIEW: There's a reason We go back to Casa Mono every time we're in NYC. The food and the experience keeps getting better. It was our 10th wedding anniversary and once again, Casa Mono surpassed our expectations. We'll be back soon.

NAME: tlala
REVIEW: Always wonderful and a must when visiting NY

NAME: Dave
REVIEW: Exceptional food. Service was professional this time, albeit a touch cold. Wine list is all Spanish, with an emphasis on expensive bottles. Can't miss dishes: duck egg with black truffle and fingerling potato; pork belly with plantain; clams with chorizo; baby squid. Can't miss.

NAME: JIMA
REVIEW: We were recommended CasaMono by my son George who frequented the rest when he was in new York The food was exceptional , full praise and congratulations to chef and mangement. Could not be faulted and the service was excellent Thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would most definitely come back and also recommend to any one. 10 out of 10 Jim Anassis Melbourne Australia

NAME: scottykeats
REVIEW: I've been to Casa Mono many times. I've benn here twice in the last 4 months and both times the food has been very disappointing. Salty weel done soft shell crabs, two tiny salty scallops for $17.00 and crispy calamari with a farm egg that came burnt and the egg hardboiled. We also noticed the people next to us returning their Paella. This used to be one of my favorite restaurants in NYC.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Loved every little plate - from the sepia to the rabbit. Fun to sit at the bar and watch the chefs prepare the food. Only slight negative was the dishes were a bit heavy-handed at times with the salt. Other than that, the meal was great, the staff friendly and welcoming, and the wine list interesting.

NAME: Apple
REVIEW: Cramped quarters...waitors and hostess were a bit aloof but their razor clam appetizer made it all worthwhile...

NAME: Jann
REVIEW: We shared 4 Tapas; Garlic Razor Clames-very tasty-a few were overcooked and very chewy, Beets with goat cheese were very good but overpriced at $14. Baby Octopus were delicious. Patatas Bravas were a surprise as these are traditionally fried potatoes. Casa Mono version were very good, not fried and in a sauce. It was very busy and noisy.

NAME: GraceH
REVIEW: Overpriced, overhyped tapas...just because it's Batali, doesn't make it good

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Big, beautiful flavors. My party watched our chef prepare food from the counter, and it made for an especially convivial early afternoon.

NAME: StuG123
REVIEW: Wow! just a great restaurant, food was incredible. Service and wine were off the charts.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent seafood. Razor clams were beautifully cooked. Softshell crabs were fresh. Duck and mole were a little salty but the cucumbers rescued it. Made "boring" salmon interesting.

NAME: KimC
REVIEW: Great food and service, very seasonal menu. Recommended for a nice night out.

NAME: Paul
REVIEW: Best Tapas in NYC! Worthy of a much larger dining room. Space is a problem.

NAME: Vanessa
REVIEW: Everything from the food to the service to the atmosphere was spot on. The kitchen was super accommodating for a friend that had several food allergies. They went the extra mile to ensure that he experience wa as great as the rest of us. The server also made an excellent wine recommendation based on the food we ordered and our budget. I would go back in a heart beat.  Must order: - foie gras - cod cheeks - stuffed calamares

NAME: lpete
REVIEW: Casa Mono is tiny and was already full by the time we arived for our 6 PM reservation. Loved the mosaic floor. I wish we didn't have to place our entire order at once...we ended up over ordering. (As with any tapas place, the recommendation is 2-3 dishes/person. We went with 6 which was about 1 too many for us.) We tried mussels with chorizo; roasted beet salad; pork belly; patatas bravas and scallops with carrots. The most memorable plates were the scallops and carrots and the mussels with chorizo. I would have both again. I found the pork belly less successful. It was served with plantains but seemed heavy and uninspired after the other fresher, summery dishes. Huge wine list with some reasonably priced options.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: some good some not so good dishes.....too much meat, fish, etc. not enough other options. Stay away from the charcuterie unless you enjoy headcheese. wine was quite nice, good selection.

NAME: Shelly
REVIEW: the food and service were good; however, the whole experience was ruined as the a/c was out and it was so hot I thought we were being punished for something. It was a shame that we got no reduction in cost for this painful experience. (the ambient temp was around 98 degrees)

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: unfortunately air conditioing was broen and a bit difficult without to enjoy what casa mono has to offer

NAME: choosey
REVIEW: creativity and quality of the food was excellent.

NAME: JoyB
REVIEW: Casa Mono always has great tapas and fresh tasting food. The recipes are definitely different than any other tapas restaurant in NYC. The wine selection is also big.

NAME: Connie
REVIEW: Very flavorful food however a bit heavy on the salt. Tiny restaurant so need to get a nice table by the windows or you'll be uncomfortable!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Visited Casa Mono 2 years ago was superb, food and service on the spot. Service was horrible, lack of training on pouring cava, dripping all over, she was not happy with her job, never encounter a server like this before in my life, i was suprise to be in a 1 star michelin establishment restaurant. I've been to all star michelin restuarnt in NYC and also in International arena, i am going to send a feedback to the board in france since my husband is french and in the industry regarding to this restaruant rating. i hope the management team will terminate her, she doesn't belong there and i would not return unless she is gone,i've been to restaruant for total of 8 times. I rarely being vocal or take my time to write a comment.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was very average and the portions small. The prices were outragous considering the small plates (portions) required ordering multiple dishes. It certainly was not worth the $100/ person cost. Nothing was particularily good and I would not go back.

NAME: Oziad
REVIEW: It might have been succeeded on creating as a tapas bar in Spain. But food hasn't.

NAME: JadwigaW
REVIEW: We went to Casa Mono on a Sunday evening, with a friend who was visiting from the UK. The food was too salty and very pricey for the portion sizes and the restaurant was very cramped. Overall, nothing to write home about - we won't be going back.

NAME: nickyd0314
REVIEW: This was our second visit to Casa Mono and I have to say this just might be my favorite restaurant in NYC. We love the tapas style so we get to try a variety of dishes and Casa Mono does not disappoint. The dishes are all so good its hard to have a favorite. The softshell crab, polpo and seppia are among the top, but also the rabbit and the foie gras were excellent. Love the atmosphere and our server was outstanding. Her recommendations for wines were excellent since my knowledge of Spanish wines is a little weak. All in all our favorite lille place to go.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Mario Batali's staff should take a lesson or two fom Danny Meyer in how to provide good customer service. Yes, the food is always good, but since the restaurant has opened, the staff has been consistently arrogant. From the host to the wait staff, rarely do you get friendly service, let alone a smile. In fact we were chastised by our waitress during a recent business lunch. We wanted to add a dish after ordering and were told quite bluntly that we couldn't do that...we had to have ordered all at once. Really? I've gone repeatedly, often at the insistance of others who are wowed by the name, but as a Gramercy Park denizen, there are plenty of other fabulous restaurants where I can get good food, and be treated well.

NAME: Olivier
REVIEW: The food was good but not memorable. The highlight for me as odd as this sounds was the olive oil ice cream. Service was very poor. Not a smile or kind word whatsoever and we had to stand up from our table and walk over to the bar to order a glass of wine. Too many restaurants in NYC to consider returning.

NAME: David
REVIEW: Excellent small plates. Would have given five stars, but the dessert left a little to be desired. I recommend the rabbit and the quail.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Amazing food. Totally recommended.

NAME: NYdiner7
REVIEW: Exquisite food & charming service. Waited over 20 minutes for table even with reservation but the food was worth waiting for.

NAME: ALLISONG
REVIEW: THE FOOD IS ALWAYS EXCELLENT, INVENTIVE & SEASONAL. THE SERVICE IS ALOOF & DISMISSIVE.

NAME: Jaynine
REVIEW: Fabulous food, great wine & excellent vibe - our first meal in New York set the bar high!

NAME: CraigR
REVIEW: If this is your first visit you should ask about the items on the menu. Some of them are different from what you assume. That being said many of the items are wonderfully unique.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent food. Old favorites done with a new twist. Each bite was a pleasure and I found myself trying to figure out what the secret ingredient in each dish consisted of. Excellent wine recommendation also.

NAME: CatherineS
REVIEW: Nothing spoils a great meal quicker than preposterous condescending service. Hopefully, it was just our waiter, or should I say Service Person, or whatever he would like to be called, but I know for certain he didn't like waiting on 3 women.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Perfection from start to finish. Fantastic food and service. Amazeb**lz.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was delicious, our seating was a little cramped, the restaurant is very small and therefore seating is at a prime and the 3 2-tops in the corner are VERY tight!  But once you squeezed into your table and were patient as servers and the other tables squeezed and bumped into you as they maneuvered around the tables you realized it was all worth it because the food was delicious.  We had the pork belly, ox tail, lamb, meat/cheese plate and octopus - ALL were very delicious! Would definitely go again, just request a table in the main dining area or outside.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: My wife and I got a day away from the kids so we spent it in NYC. My wife wanted to try a Mario Batali restaurant and we decided on Casa Mono. What a great choice! We were planning on either a show or comedy club later on so we had an early dinner (4:30pm). We decided on six plates to share: razor clams, lobster salad, soft shell carb, foie gras, beet/bacon salad, and the pork belly. Every dish had great presentation and fantastic flavor. My personal favorite was by far the foie gras followed by the razor clams. We also tried three of their bolder reds by the glass and were not disappointed with these either. Dessert put us over the top...my wife had the chocolate granache with olive oil ice cream and I had the bread pudding,great!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was great but a bit overpriced for what you get (they're tapas)....heard the service wasn't great and have to agree- waiter was a bit snobbish.

NAME: Steffi
REVIEW: Delicious food, but on the salty side... Lovely restaurant in a lovely neighborhood.

NAME: Sp00nful56
REVIEW: We loved the oxtail stuffed in piquillo peppers, the casa mono salad & fideos with clams. however, the dorada in tomato ancho sauce fell short of expectations. the sauce reminded me of the kind you get with canned sardines. olives were fantastic as was the bread. choc ganache & olive oil ice cream amazing! our waiter needed to smile. overall, a great experience. We were there for lunch, so I can't accurately comment on noise level. Quiet when we were there.

NAME: SteveS
REVIEW: Best Spanish wine list anywhere.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I was really looking forward to dining at Casa Mono, but was instead left very disappointed. The maître d' and waitstaff were totally cold. I don't know if that was the point, but they succeeded at being distant and inhospitable. We were seated in an out of the way table and were left without water or a menu for sometime. Our waiter never came to check on us or take our order, we had to always ask someone to send him over or stare down the maître d' to get his attention. And I was totally put off when, after ordering a bread appetizer to start, he asked if that was all we were having... as if we came by only to drink water and eat bread. $100+ and tip later, that might not have been a bad idea.

NAME: Seagal
REVIEW: Casa Mono was our choice for a post-Broadway dinner and it did not disappoint. We called ahead to say we would be adding one person to the reservation for two and the hostess said that would be fine. This cozy, candle-lit "boite" has about a dozen tables, so it was great that they made it work for us. The waiter was very helpful with Spanish wine selections and we loved the fresh Casa Mono salad and the sizzling pan of delicious paella for three which was a perfect late-night meal. Open-air walls of windows to the street were a lovely feature for the mild spring evening and it was a quick taxi ride down from Times Square. If you enjoy small, intimate restaurants with outstanding, authentic Spanish tapas then don't hesitate to visit.

NAME: Indigo
REVIEW: We were lucky to have seats by the open kitchen bar. The food was great and our dining experience was definitely enhanced by watching the chefs prepare our food. While our waiter was so-so, we were absolutely impressed by the restaurant management's responsiveness. When I commented that one dish was not quite as tasty as the rest, she promptly remove the charge for that dish from our bill.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Fried oysters, sweetbread and bone marrow were sublime. Mussels not so much. Will return though cause 3 out of 4 aint bad.

NAME: JayA
REVIEW: A somewhat cozy but delicious dining experience.

NAME: fredsfaves
REVIEW: Really outstanding experience. Great food, creative dishes well prepared, attentive service, good vibe. Two qualifiers: some tables sit too close to each other and the wine list is a bit pricey, with not enough moderately priced options.

NAME: Winniefood
REVIEW: Food was too salty.  Every dish was overpowered by salt and you couldn't taste the flavors of the ingredients.

NAME: Summer17
REVIEW: Service wasn't great this time even though there were only few tables in restaurant.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Not really like a tapas restaurant. Cold staff. Overpriced

NAME: bennyc
REVIEW: one of the best places in the city. always amazing food and the service never skips a beat, if you can get past the hostess

NAME: Gracie
REVIEW: This was my first visit. I will definitely come back. what an amazing experience. Thank you Casa Mono "A" Team.

NAME: JoseC
REVIEW: Friend who travels a lot said it was his favorite restaurant in NY. I might not go that far (Eleven Madison), but it was outstanding. A must try!

NAME: Hamov
REVIEW: The food was incredible. Sat at the bar facing the kitchen, it was awesome watching each course being prepared. Everything we ordered was perfect, have to try the razor clams!!!

NAME: RobinM
REVIEW: As long as you are prepared for the extremely cramped space, and don't need to speak to anyone because of the noise, Casa Mono serves excellent tapas. Try the rabbit!

NAME: MahiliaJ
REVIEW: The wine was wonderful, location ideal and dinning company was perfect It would have received a higher rating if not for the server. He completely ignored me except to take my dinner order - had my friend sample the wine (even though it was my birthday dinner), and not very welcoming. A great place to grab a glass of wine but there are many option in NYC.

NAME: Mars
REVIEW: GREAT fodd. terribly cramped space. Service was too rushed. Its got a good vibe though if they would just SLOW DOWN and let people enjoy the meal. Worth the effort tho - the food is that good.

NAME: Atilla
REVIEW: The wine prices are very aggressive....del posto prices In a neighborhood diner space.

NAME: Hoc500
REVIEW: We had a really excellent meal. The food was delicious, the wine was paired perfectly, and the obiance was true NYC. 2 thumbs way up., but keep it to yourself.:-).

NAME: Adrit
REVIEW: Go for the great and interesting food and excellent Spanish wines. Don't expect anything else (or anything less).

NAME: Patrick
REVIEW: Fabolous... Great food... Everything is superb... Im from manila visiting and im going back

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Very good food and service, good wine-list. Well worth 1-star in guide Michelin.

NAME: FourPPdineoutfriends
REVIEW: Our waiter was very helpful in guiding us through the menu as it was our first time there. He had excellent descriptions and recommendations. Loved the food and the space, looking forward to returning. We also want to go next door to Bar Jamon.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: tables are very close together so don't go if you want to have a business dinner or a very private one. Tables are small and uncomfortable for tall people. But they were very nice and even gave us a drink on the house for our anniversary. We will go back...

NAME: Alex
REVIEW: from thorough and thoughful service, an incredible wine menu, and expertly crafted tapas that reminded us of spain, all the way to the open doors with a perfect spring breeze and fresh air, we enjoyed every moment in my group of friends visiting from out of town.

NAME: Bobby
REVIEW: Staff was very helpful even though we were late(called at intermission of the musical to tell them we would be). We loved the place. It was just what we wanted, tapas, great wine and good music.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Way overpriced for the atmosphere (crowded) and the amount of food you get (very little). I know it's tapas, but maybe bring down your prices just a little?? Not worth it.

NAME: PeterC
REVIEW: We'd always sat at the counter and enjoyed watching the chefs and eating our meal. This time we had to sit at the table we'd reserved, as all the counter space was taken (now I know why!....they don't take reservations for the counter). The tables are cramped; I worried about knocking over the glassware. The room is too dark; my husband couldn't read the menu and 'show us the bottle' of wine?....who could see it! I guess there's more lighting at the counter, so the chefs can see what they're cooking. Someone came over to ask if we wanted help with a wine selection and when we asked for 'a minute', disappeared for at least 10. Service was take the order and that's it. The food, however, is delicious with an extensive wine menu.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Definitely need a make a reservation. This place is great for groups too (can order many tapas for sharing) as well as getting wine bottles.

NAME: ewindels
REVIEW: With the vast financial resources at their disposal, I'm a little surprised that the proprietors of this joint have opted to remain in the original miniscule, cramped, uncomfortable, painfully loud space. Plus the price ratio struck me as high: $90 (with tip) for the tiny portions we had left me dubious. Crossing this one off my list.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I first became interested in Casa Mono after having an amazing mid afternoon munch at Bar Jamon and wanting more. After actually going to Casa Mono, I can't say that I didn't enjoy my time, but I left wishing there was just a little something more to it. The food was good - some dishes were a little over seasoned for my liking (a bit too much salt), and the sweetbreads were slightly overpowered by the almonds. The Iberico Jamon was as delicious as it should be, and hand carved adds a nice difference in texture to the outstanding quality of the meat. Furthermore, the sommelier delivered an absolute amazing bottle of wine, exactly what I was craving, mild bodied Spanish red with just enough mineral bite. Good experience overall.

NAME: BarbaraM
REVIEW: This is a great place. We had a late lunch starting at 3 PM and it was a beautiful day with the side windows open to the outside. Our waiter was superb and each and every dish was spectacular. I picked this place because they serve sweetbreads and I was not disappointed. This is a small restaurant so going for a late lunch gave us time to enjoy the whole experience. Barbara

NAME: bob46
REVIEW: This restaurant can be hard to get into at night, but you can enjoy the same wonderful menu choices at lunch, when it's also quieter. The portion sizes are small, so you can sample a variety of dishes, especially if you and your companions share. This is not an inexpensive lunch spot, but the food, ambiance, service, and Irving Place location make it well-worth the money.

NAME: corvax
REVIEW: A turly remarkable place. Every time i go on open table i always check to see if casa mono is available, unfortunately its not all the time but tonight it was and i will savour the fideos till the next visit.

NAME: EdwinT
REVIEW: The food is highly overrated- many of the flavor combinations are complete misses. The portions are larger than tapas but smaller than appetizers. The seats are very uncomfortable- imagine trying to have a meal at your grade school desk with your knees constantly hitting your water glass. The service was fair- plates piled up on the tiny table.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: One word "Amazing"!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Had a great lunch with family from out of town. The food was fresh, excellent quality and well prepared. Our waiter was friendly and very attentive to the needs of the entire table. Thank you!

NAME: nycubanpete
REVIEW: An absolute delight in Gramercy Park....you do feel like you're in neighborhood tapas bar outside of Madrid...the food is just exquisite.....

NAME: susaningramercy
REVIEW: So so We live in the area and have been to this restaurant many times since it opened. It has gone from good to very ordinary. Tired food, lack luster wait staff, too noisy for words. I try desperately not to go back, but often friends want to go because it is near our house. Would not recommend.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Our favorite casual dining restaurant in the country. Food is amazing.

NAME: deecath
REVIEW: Always love Casa Mono. We sampled some new additions to the menu per our server's recommendations. Particularly loved the cod cheeks! Server was very knowledgeable and attentive though not overly friendly. Everything was excellent as usual.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was excellent even though the plate sizes were small.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: EXCELLENT FOOD AND WINES. GOOD SERVICE OVERALL

NAME: dovi6160
REVIEW: Over priced. Service was poor and food just OK The restaurant is very small so tables and chairs are close to one another.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We dined as a couple for lunch. The restaurant was about half full, but the atmosphere was still excellent - feels very authentically Spanish. The wine list is very Spanish, and the selection excellent! The food here is the real star though. We ate razor clams (amazing!), the spanish salad, and bacalao croquetas to start with. The croquetas were good, but a little heavy. The clams were memorable. We then shared the pork stuffed squid (highly recommended), boned quail with tomato raisins, and the duck egg with mojama. All were really good, and I would order them again. Overall this a destination for those wanting to eat very well (and, to bring back fond memories of Barcelona holidays!).

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Exceptional food, perfect service, not a weak link in the food chain whatsoever. Courteous, attentive and aware. I have nothing but good things to report.

NAME: IgnacioM
REVIEW: One of the best price/value restaurants in NYC. Its main atribute is certainly the quality of the food, absolutely amazing spanish food. Great for a moment when you wish to have a very good meal in a relatively informal setting. Pork croquetas are amazing.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We ordered 5 dishes to share between the 2 of us. Each dish was unique in taste, flavor, ingredients and cooking method. All dishes were incredibly tasty, with the crispy pork belly, skirt steak and salad being stand outs and memorable. The lamb in Moroccan spices was a tad too sweet and salty.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: My boyfriend and I were in the city Sunday night and decided to check out Casa Mono. The restaurant itself was really nice,great tables and space, small and love the open kitchen concept. The food though was just not as great as we had anticipated. Definitely felt a bit let down. We had several different plates and shared. Meat was tough and seafood seemed a bit overdone. Best part of the meal was our dessert and I'm not much of a dessert person. I most likely would not return as there really was nothing that stood out food wise for us.

NAME: Elemich
REVIEW: It's not always easy to get into Casa Mono--it's pretty jammed at night--but it's always worth it. The food is really outstanding--great unusual tapas like sweetbreads and bone marrow. Portions can be larger than the usual small Spanish tapas so order accordingly. The best time to get in is a late lunch.

NAME: RunsInHeels
REVIEW: One of my favorite spots in NYC. The pumpkin-goat cheese croquettes are heavenly.

NAME: Miguel
REVIEW: Outstanding food. Almost can't miss on any of the dishes. The service was good enough but the food is definitely what you come here for.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Delicious! It was the perfect choice for my boyfriends 30th birthday.  A nice dinner for two + exciting and delicious food + great wine = overall a very positive experience!  It is definitely a cozy space, so keep in mind if you don't like cozy spaces-though if you don't you are missing out on a lot of great places to eat in NYC!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Good was great and delicious just like the previous time (2008)! Our waiter seemed uninterested in serving us but was adequate and polite. The ambience was a little odd for daytime service with the low lighting and experimental-rock music playing in the background. Didn't feel like it went with the culture of the food.

NAME: Summer17
REVIEW: Food was great and pretty place with large wine selection however too small place and tables are jammed and it was really loud. I can hear everything from next tables.

NAME: Charly
REVIEW: I could go back here again and again.

NAME: LyndaH
REVIEW: The tapas were outstanding! The pumpkin goatcheese and the cod croquetas were fabulous. Everything that we had on the menu was memorable.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: AMAZING!!! a must visit.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Fantastic food. We've been going to Casa Mono for about 4 years now, and the food has never missed. Service is generally pretty attentive and friendly. I recommend the signature salad, skirt steak, and crispy pork belly. Caveats: It's a small space with small tables. Not a lot of elbow room. And the kitchen is open, so in some rare instances your clothes may smell a little.

NAME: dfny
REVIEW: Delicious! Can't wait to go back!

NAME: Lesdum
REVIEW: My favorite restaurant in NYC. Perfection!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was great. Mojama with duck egg and black tufles was outstanding It was loud but we were there late so that was expected.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We were really disappointed by our first encounter with Batali's cousine at Casa Mono. We were prepared for the Spartan ambience of the place. What we did not really expect was the coldness of the service and the low quality of the food. Apart from mussels, which were barely decent, the pork croquette, the staffed calamari and the charcuterie were below average standards. In order to escape an extreme taste of garlic which pervaded all dishes, we tried the chocolate ganache with olive oil and salt. Again, we met a very pretentious interpretation of a banal dessert. What a shame for an "iron chef", he really could do better by staying simpler!

NAME: alan
REVIEW: overall food is pretty good, but maybe with less choices on a menu it could be better. Everything was very salty

NAME: LaFleur
REVIEW: We love Casa Mono. We sit at the bar and watch them prepare all the amazing dishes. Each plate is rich and vibrant. The vibe of the entire restaurant is warm and inviting. I like to focus on the whole animal part of the menu. My wife loves the seafood dishes. The spanish wines are unique and delicious.

NAME: RodWat
REVIEW: This is a first class authentic Spanish experience. If you want to experience a great Spanish meal (or simply tapas and a drink at the bar) this is the place. Small, exciting atmosphere, genuine Spanish staff, and food to die for. Don't miss it.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I met two long-time dear friends for dinner here to celebrate holidays and we all 3 agreed that the people/servers were quite rude. We did call to say one of us was running late (approx 10 mins)- understandably this impacts a small restaurant- and when I arrived, I was told me my friend was next door and I should go get her and sit now and then told us at least 5x that we had to be out by 7:30(it was only 5:45 when we sat). They rushed us and were rude with order taking and delivery of food. They acted like they were doing us some favor by serving us. The food was very good and it is a warm interior-(although tight). None of us will return here as there was nothing that made us feel like we'd want to- lots of good food in NYC elsewhere..

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Most of the food was excellent. In particular - beets with blue cheese and bacon, pumpkin and goat cheese croquetas, razor clams (EXCELLENT!!), pulpo with fennel and grapfruit, oxtail stuffed peppers, skirt steak with onion mermelada. Not as good was the crispy pork belly, and the jamon iberico (for the price). We were a party of 4, and it was too cramped to serve more than 3-4 plates at a time. The tables are too small for the tapas type menu. Also - very loud. Anything more than a party of 4, and you would not be able to talk to all at your table. Overall - highly recommend.

NAME: SydneyFriends
REVIEW: Interesting menu with tapas style dishes - fusion Spanish-American modern. Very well trained and attentive staff in a small restaurant space

NAME: JayneelP
REVIEW: I took my girlfriend there for her birthday. We both are such foodies. We had the opportunity to try new things. The service, ambiance, and food were excellent.

NAME: wally
REVIEW: Amazing Spanish food , creative and full of both subtle and robust flavor. Such a treat!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food is extraordinary here. We didn't, however, appreciate the waiter trying to pressure us to order more than we wanted. When we put in our order he stated "I can't let you order just three dishes. The kitchen is busy so you must put in your complete order now." When we insisted that was our complete order, he kept pushing and warning us that we couldn't add food later, which seems antithetical to the ethos of tapas. We stuck to our guns and were perfectly full after "just" three dishes (plates may be small, but they're piled high and quite rich, so very filling).

NAME: Gormay13
REVIEW: Wonderful place to sit and graze at the bar. Food can come out a little too fast when it's not even so busy but other than that this place is wonderful for special small plates that are simple yet refined. YUM!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was delicious! The menu was full of bold moves, and the culinary technique was definitely impressive. The food is a little on the pricey side and the restaurant space is a little on the small side, but it was an enjoyable experience nonetheless. Oh, and they also have an excellent sommelier.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: My favorite restaurant of all time. Never disappoints.

NAME: RexG
REVIEW: Excellent food, excellent wine list. Tables are small and very close to each other. Overall we had a great night and would certainly return if we have the opportunity.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Cute, romantic place to go for dinner. Great selection of wine. The squid ink rice with clams was amazing. Tapas style, so great for sharing with a couple close friends. Thumbs up!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was wonderful, helpful waiter. My only disappointment was that we were sat in a table, just around the corner from the door tucked by the side of the bar. The restaurant was very quiet so we were a little annoyed to be seated in the corner. Apart from that everything was great.

NAME: MKRCharlotte
REVIEW: Tiniest restaurant and jammed packed with tables. It seemed that there were more staff than patrons, but we still had trouble getting the waiter's attention sometimes. Luckily, the food was excellent. The duck egg and jamon offering was my favorite. We had five tapas among 3 people and left very satisfied - nice portions.

NAME: MarE
REVIEW: Service: for dinner, there are 2 seatings 5:30 + 7:30pm and/or 2 hour dining experience. not explained in anything i read but was told upon arrival. with dessert, we were a little beyond the 2 hour dining through no fault of ours. Food: The food is excellent, small portions so order about 2 to 3 dishes per person. Even the "larger heartier" portions are small and difficult to share. Ambiance: The rock music does not match the ambiance. With such a tight space, my friend kept getting hit by wait staff walking by. WIne: was reasonably priced and excellent.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Ear-splittingly loud (difficult to hear the person I was with), uncomfortably crowded (I was jostled every time a server attended to any of the tables next to me), undistinguished menu, ridiculously expensive. Other than that it was excellent.

NAME: Foodie123
REVIEW: The food was delcious; however pricey. The tapas and entrees were excellent. Dessert was nothing special though. Service was good. Seating is very tight with small tables.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono was even better than I remember it ... I visited this place with a friend a few years back and I decided to come back on my last trip to New York. Booked a table for lunch at 3pm and it was the best time to go -- service was great, probably because there was little traffic, but the food ... oh man, the food. It is hands down the best tapas place I've been to this side of the Atlantic. Please, please have the duck egg with jamon and truffles -- it will change your life!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: My disappointment involved the food itself. I knew the bistro was Alsatian, but I didn't realize the food would be quite so heavy! Some of the dishes prized butter over actual flavor. So the food was rich without necessarily being complex.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono is one of the best restaurants in the best restaurant city in the world. Inventive tapas that taste better than anything you can get in Spain. Razor clams are to die for. Don't skip the bone marrow. My biggest regret that is that Casa Mono is not in SF where I live. I even spotted a place for it to replace one too many yoga studios.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This place had amazing food and service , only this last time I visited the restaurant we had this server that was chewing gum in or faces and made a face everytime we wanted something , next time will ask for Fernando, we always have a good time but when I had Fernando as a server it was great , plus their manager is very profesional , don't know his name but is the gentelman that comes around helping you choose your wine and he always understand your needs . This is a great place to visit just stay away the Skinni white blond guy with glasses .

NAME: Wonderfulwino
REVIEW: Excellent food and has been maintaining the high standards for years... A must for Spanish food lovers and wine aficiandos...

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Very noisy small restaurant with tables almost touching each other. Tables awkward to get in and out of. Good choice of Spanish dishes with many centred around offal.

NAME: OhYumm
REVIEW: We loved our waitress. She was very competent and knew her wines and made a great recommendation for us. She guided us through the menue, which was diverse and extensive. Our tapas meal selection included sweet potato croquttes filled with goat cheese which had a light sweet/salty balance, a delicious pan roasted fish, a braised oxtail filled pepper in a wonderful light tomato sauce and a flavorful house made chorizo sausage. Lastly we had a creme burlee with the most amazing batter dipped and fried bay leaf. ( a bit unusual, but was delicious)The only thing we found a bit odd was the selection of music...it just didnt seem to fit the restaurant.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great place although a very little. Waiting at Bar Jamon makes the wait a little better.

NAME: Plovdinka
REVIEW: The food was incredibly delicious-definitely not your ordinary tapas. Casa Mono serves the best foie gras I've had outside of Paris. The service was excellent and the wine list is extensive. Would recommend to anyone looking for a romantic date spot.

NAME: Gross
REVIEW: Food was good. Service was surprisingly unfriendly, even cold. Didn't have the best experience but will probably try again,

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: It was a great place to grab a bite but nothing blew me away. A little pricey for the portions. I get it, its a "tapas" place, but they're charging entree prices.

NAME: ACRY
REVIEW: Great, but SMALL. Too small. Kinda always makes you feel like you're in the way. Wine list is awesome, all Spanish, but a bit hard to understand and I wasn't thrilled with the white wine recommendation we got. Bottle seemed off, but I didn't know the grape or producer well enough to be sure. Food is incredible though.

NAME: CalifCondor1234
REVIEW: Very, very good food, tasty, creative preparations and thoughtfully combinations. The brussel sprouts were the best I've ever had

NAME: anNY
REVIEW: I don't like when a restaurant claims to have the real thing and give you something different than the name indicates. They use Spanish names (from Spain) to call an American version of the food. Sepia is sepia and not calamari, etc. Expensive, pretentious and deceiving. Not a good experience.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono was a very interesting meal which while I greatly enjoyed it, I cannot recommend it to everyone. You must be an adventurous eater to truly appreciate many of the options. I really enjoyed the sepia and the rabbit, while the my friend found her choices to be limited by her tastes. As a tapas style restaurant this becomes problematic as some people may want to try dishes which others do not. If you have a group who loves food and are willing to eat ANYTHING then Casa Mono would be a great choice.

NAME: RunsInHeels
REVIEW: LOVE this place!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Razor clams and head-on shrimp were insane!

NAME: AvaE
REVIEW: What a true gem! We sat at the chef's table (best seats in the house!) and were treated to a wonderful display of cooking talent. It was better than watching a cooking show on TV. Our server was very attentive and helpful with our food choices and wine selections. The menu was very creative. All the dishes coming out from the tiny kitchen looked delicious and virtuously presented. Unfortunately we couldn't sample all of them, we wish we could have. Make sure you make reservations as it is a small place and fills up quickly. That being said, we never felt rushed and it was a fantastic dining experience.

NAME: DeliaG
REVIEW: Tom Colichio from Top Chef was dining there!!!

NAME: Greenwichfoodie57
REVIEW: What a huge disappointment. The service was rude and rushed, which was ridiculous since the restaurant was almost empty. Any question we asked about the wines or menu seemed to be annoying to the waiter who could not conceal his boredom with his job. The food was below average, very salty. The lack of properly trained waiters was shocking for a Batali restaurant, especially one that is not gaining much traction.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: My Fiance and I celebrated our 7th and final dating anniversary here! It was the perfect spot to celebrate such a special day. The restaurant is small and romantic. Norah Jones was softly playing in the background. All of the small plates are DELICIOUS and I loved how when the food arrived all of the other tables would flirt with our entrees to see if they need to order anything else! The skirt steaks was our favorite. Apparently the sweetbreads are Amazing, but they were out of them. Loved my wine, the food, and the ambiance! Will definitely go back and will also be trying the wine bar next door soon- Bar Jamon!

NAME: ArtRios
REVIEW: Don't even bother. If you are a true/hardcore Tapas fan, this is not the place for you. Those that do not know true Spanish Tapas may like the "creative" approach taken by Casa Mono. But, if not, do not waste your time at this place. The service was fair, the wine list varied and interesting, but it just saddens me to say that I shall not return.

NAME: ClaudiaH
REVIEW: the table wasn't ready when we arrived and had to wait for 1/2 hour, which is great for them because they send you next door to the Jamon Bar! Nonetheless, the food was very good, even if the tables are small and you don't have lots of personal space. I would recommend it, but probably best for groups in even numbers (there was 3 of us in a table for 2!)

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: For our first night in NY we chose Casa Mono. The noise level was fairly high and the space was so tight that when a diner at the next table knocked her wine over it fell on our table. The staff was quick, and competent, and we barely missed a beat.  For the food we started with the Pumpkin and Goat Cheese Croquetas and the Dorada with Fennel puree. The croquetas were terrific; and the Dorada tasted alright but was cool, but that might have been due to the wine mishap. These were followed by the Pork Chop and the Chorizo. Both nicely seasoned and cooked perfectly. The pork chop's presentation was simple but it did not detract. We shared a Chocolate Torta and enjoyed it immensely.  The staff were attentive & helpful. All in all a good ni

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was well-presented and very good. Ambience was intimate and cosy.

NAME: RunsInHeels
REVIEW: Love this spot! Can be a bit of a tight squeeze, as it's a small place, but the food is always amazing and the staff are always a delight. The only place in nyc where I will race online to snag a reservation! Can't wait for their fall menu!

NAME: ScottS
REVIEW: The food was great a must try for everyone!!

NAME: ElaineR
REVIEW: The food was interesting and inventive. The creme desert was extraordinary...

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Wonderful spot for romantic lunch or anytime

NAME: APENY
REVIEW: Really small restaurant but very very good food. I will definitely come back here.

NAME: Squeaky
REVIEW: Loved the choices on the menu, our waiter was able to guide us and gave excellent advice. The wine was superb, a pinot noir from Spain.

NAME: StacyJ
REVIEW: I live in San Diego, but when I'm in New York I try to come here for lunch every visit. The food is fabulous if you like Spanish flavors. I am a big fan of Batali's restaurants because he tends towards the simple but intense flavors. Dinner is good, but much more crowded and noisy (it is a very small space), so a late lunch is wonderful as the tables are not filled, the noise is minimal and the staff is attentive. Because the restaurant is on a corner with west and south exposures, light is good no matter the weather despite the ochre tones which are quite appropriate to the cuisine. Between the 5 of us, with varied tastes, everyone raved about every one of the 12 tapas we ordered. I could go on, but space will not allow. Just go!

NAME: Brunch
REVIEW: DON'T BOTHER! The restaurant has a policy that all guests must be present to be seated. In the torential downpour this past Sunday, one of our party arrived early. The hostess did not let her come in the restaurant and made her wait outside in the rain! The tables are miniscule and you MUST order 2 items per person. There are wine glasses, bread/butter, silverware and plates on the table before the food arrives. We were juggling plates the whole time. What was worse, was that we asked for a larger table and were told it was "reserved". No one sat there the entire time we were there. The food was good, but I can sit at a larger table at Big Daddy's without the attitude. How Mario Batali can put his name on this place leaves me bafle

NAME: FoodWineChickie
REVIEW: Casa Mono was great as always. Love the whole tapas concept and sharing dishes allows you to experience a slew of dishes instead of just one. Service is cold and a bit stuck up, but the food and the amazing wine list make up for it, somehow.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Impressed with the quality of service and the atmosphere. The food was very good too and I look forward to going back to try more of the menu...

NAME: Rovi
REVIEW: Excellent small dishes. Dining room has limited capacity. Friendly service.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent Restaurant, the food was amazing, the decor and whole atmosphere: lovely!!!

NAME: NancyC
REVIEW: One of the best meals I've had, ever. The small plates allowed you to share and experience multiple dishes. The tastes and textures of each dish were very unique. We especially enjoyed the duck, rabbit and scallops. The bread pudding was the wonderful; I loved the crunchy sugar top coat! Space is very limited (scrunchy) and the music was very (too) loud.

NAME: LisaNas
REVIEW: excellent food in a small restaurant located in Gramacy Park- excellent Tapas and wine

NAME: Classic
REVIEW: They need to get a full liquor license and lower the prices a bit. The value factor is a bit on the lean side even given the quality of the food.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Really disappointed with the bartender (we ate at the bar). He rushed us out: repeatedly checked the bill folder to see if we had put a card down to pay, sighed impatiently when we hadn't. Threw out my dining companion's wine- which she wasn't finished with. About as far from gracious as you can get. Will not return.

NAME: EllenD
REVIEW: Although the food was good, it was way too hot!!! The space is way too small.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono never disappoints. Consistently excellent food. I especially love their sweetbreads, bone marrow and whole sepia.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We had our usual delicious meal here. Although our server was fairly new, she answered our questions about some items on the menu and was knowledgeable about the wines. Two of us enjoyed three dishes, which was plenty for lunch. The chaceuterie plate was fabulous with small tastes of four different meat preparations; the softshell crab sandwich fresh and tasty, and the pumpkin-goat cheese fritters perfectly fried, crisp and not greasy at all. Because we went for a late lunch, the room wasn't as full as usual, making for a quieter experience than usual.

NAME: idine
REVIEW: The food was excellent! Each dish is well thought out and executed. The kitchen organizes your menu thoughtfully, such that a balance of flavors and pairings work well. The only downfall is that the seating is terribly uncomfortable and cramped. I was thankful that the dishes arrived promptly so we could eat and get out of there. Too bad since the food is so good I would have loved to linger and savor more.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Spectacular tapas -- and wonderful wine.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was very good as usual. Only disappointment is that many of the menu items have not changed in two year...though they did have 2 specials which we ordered and they were excellent. It was busy, but the service was a bit spotty and we were sat at the very tight corner of the restaurant, but it is a very small and crowded restaurant. We always prefer the chef's table, but it was fully loaded this time around. Casa Mono still offer wonderful flavor and varieties and will keep us returning for many more times.

NAME: WorldDiner
REVIEW: I love this restaurant for their food and amazing Spanish wines. We were there twice in the winter but summer was great because they open all the doors so it is almost seemed like you were outside. I thought the wait staff was really rude this time, though. Not sure if they were upset to be working on a beautiful Sat afternoon, but it was a huge turnoff. They need to be more aware of their clients.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Really excellent food. We shared six things. The duck egg is great, a play on eggs, bacon and potatoes, but you'll not get food like this at a diner! Also had the croquettes, the rabbit, the goat, soft-shell crab, chorizo. As I said, it's all good. Will definitely go back.

NAME: JohnB
REVIEW: Batali adds another gem to his empire. Tapas size plates but prices are midway between an appetizer and an entree. Great food but just don't eat too much if you need to take a cab home.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: One of the best meals I think I've had ever. Really enjoyed sharing many smaller items around the table, which gave my palette a huge variety of experiences.

NAME: jsal
REVIEW: Definitely deserves its Michelin star. We had the pan con tomate, mussels, pumpkin and goat cheese croquettes, steak and pork belly. Everything was delicious, especially the pork belly. It's one of the best I've had. Service was very good. We were there for a weekday lunch and it was a bit empty but I could understand how people may find the space too tight when it gets crowded.

NAME: ChristopherC
REVIEW: good eats, but the tightness of the seating arrangements is horrific!!  i had a res for 4 people.  they held a 4 top for us.  me res size dropped to 3 people...they moved us to a 2 top.  that is so stupid it boggles the mind!!!  it want as if we were taking up extra room!  3 people didnt fit at a 2 top...i was absolutely pissed off, but my wife and friend convinced me to stay.  Batali, dont u have enough $$ that u dont need to have a money milking policy like that?!?!!??!

NAME: AngelaR
REVIEW: the restaurant space is small so I would not recommend groups more than 4 people.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We went to Casa Mono for Father's Day with our two young kids. If you like tapas, this is the place to go! Even the kids enjoy the food.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This was a great find. The food was great. A tapas style menu with huge choice. We tried a variety of dishes including some amazing duck with cherry's, melt in your mouth! I also loved the beet and strawberry dish. It was great to try a number of small dishes to share rather than just one big dish each. My husband love loved the lamb ribs with chickpea salad.

NAME: Gigi
REVIEW: It was fun, the food was okay but not what we had anticipated. The service was great.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent food. Cramped space and everything small. Hugely noisy with loud music over poor acoustics. Hard to hear.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Second visit. Food still delicious and interesting. Service noticeably improved.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This is the only time I have ever been disappointed by a Michelin star restaurant. We had a group of four celebrating a birthday lunch on a Saturday afternoon. The restaurant is small but was relatively empty. Our server was extremely slow and not very attentive. The food is priced like typical American enrtres but, the protions are just slightly larger than most American version tapas. Aside from being over-priced, the food was just average, definitely not Michelin quality. My wife grew up in Spain and we still visit family there often. Spain has some of the best food on the planet but, you won't find it here. Next time in NYC, we will take the train to Ironbound in Newark for great Spanish cuisine.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I really felt at a tapas bar in Spain, all the dishes were amazing. I rated fair the overall experience fair due to the service (in specific one waiter) i will recommend this restaurant to a friend with the condition to request a different waiter.

NAME: todds
REVIEW: Excellent tapas, a must is the razor clams. Seating was excessively tight in the corner but looked good otherwise.

NAME: LGeats
REVIEW: My boyfriend and I went to Casa Mona on a Sunday night recently. Even on a Sunday at 6 p.m. the restaurant was busy with people, all seeming to enjoy their meals. The wait staff was attentive and the waiter took a lot of time to answer our questions, describe his favorite dishes and even tell me how they made one of their items that I particularly liked. We had 6 tapas all of which were excellent and 2 desserts that were outstanding. In the summer, the restaurant is open giving it an indoor/outdoor feel that is really nice especially when the weather is pleasant. Overall, it was a great dining experience and one I would love to do again soon.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent food. Have been going to Casa Mono for years. The best seats are at the bar where you can watch everyone's food being prepared. Two annoying elements: First, the wait staff has been trained to push diner's into ordering all of their food at one time. Ignore the waiter when pushed and enjoy tapas the way they are supposed to be enjoyed -- one or two at a time. The second annoyance is the Spanish menu. Not everyone knows that, for example, setas are mushrooms. The wait staff will translate but who wants to order with the waiter hovering over you shoulder. The restaurant should have a little less arrogance and print the menu on a longer page with an English translation line added under the Spanish entries.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Need an Opentable option "Great for Hobbits" because Casa Mono certainly would be. The food and service were very good, but the uncomfortable seating took away from the dining experience. Specifically, the tables (at least the one we had) are very low, and my legs were sandwiched between the chair and the table.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: arrived early told our table was still occupied and would be free on time sent us next door to the bar they would call us called back in five minutes it was not the table we were shown as requested next to the window sat in the middle of the restaurant very uncomfortable

NAME: alakeev
REVIEW: innovative and adventurous menu - totally enjoyed it!!!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Spectacular find! A dinner to remember!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Went to Casa Mono last night. All in all the meal was good, but not amazing. Our server was very friendly and informative, he assisted when necessary but did not linger annoyingly. The wine list was excellent. However, one of the hostesses with glasses was not too friendly, and when I made the reservation on the phone, whomever I spoke to was not so friendly either (could've been the same person.)

NAME: deanas
REVIEW: Food was amazing, service was stuffy and made us a little uncomfortable. It would have been nice to be able a good time with great food for an early get together without the feeling that we shouldn't be having a good time (the server seemed strict and upset about having us for his table, although our bill was nearly $200 for a happy hour/snack get together for 4 people).

NAME: jin49
REVIEW: Cramped, crowded, but very good food. The food is a myriad of interesting combinations of small plates.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food here is excellent. I particularly like the razor clams, pumpkin & goat cheese croquettes, patatas bravas, and pulpo. Very savory.

NAME: textilegirl
REVIEW: I have been to casa mono many times and on this particular occasion, the maitre d was extremely rude. I had requested a corner table for Mother's Day and the maitre d tried to seat us at a table WITH other guests. When I explained my notes in the reservation he rudely accepted that they were there but he couldn't give us a corner table. We waited for more than 30 minutes after to get an individual table. In general the service was slow on that day but the food was as good as always. I would have hoped that since I was there for Mother's Day with my mother they could have treated us a bit more kindly.

NAME: zephyr221
REVIEW: Tables were a little bit too on top of each other for my liking. Service was ok; should have been more attentive for such a tiny location. Food was top notch, though.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was excellent and the service was impeccable! Will definitely visit again!

NAME: nySteakLove
REVIEW: The restaurant is little small but the dishes are so great! I will be back.

NAME: Steve
REVIEW: This is the second time (we returned) we went here at our NYC visit. Excellent selection and very tasty tapas style restaurant.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Nice, but too expensive for what it is.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great spot for tapas. Consistent. It's small of course so be sure to do the res thing. Iberian pig and their own Cava? C'mon! Very nice. Only one negative. The waiter wanted the whole order up front. Impossible when eating tapas. Will not stop me from making Mono a regular stop.

NAME: 108NYC
REVIEW: Wonderful, sophisticated 'little plates' tapas, with ingredients to meet any foodies expectation: quail, octopus, sweatbreads, fennel, sardines, pork belly, etc. Definitely recommend. and definitely recommend reservations there are very few tables.

NAME: MartinV
REVIEW: Still my favorite restaurant in Manhattan. A few months back, they were not serving the razor clams for one reason or the other, and I think I want into a slight depression. Came back this week to take my sister from out of town (she asked I take her there since she loved it last time she visited), and they had recently revised the menu, but kept the dependable favorites on there. As usual, the razor clams were sublime, and the sweet breads did not disappoint. We must have had about 7-8 small dishes (we were a group of 3) and a special mention to the muscles with chorizo which I hadn't tried out yet and will be one of my staples from now. Of course, the downside is that you have to reserve a few weeks out for a WEEKDAY spot. Oh well...

NAME: Foodie
REVIEW: This is like going to Barcelona without the hassle of a long flight. If I didn't love Lupa so much, I would've tried this place years earlier (there is only so much time to pack in old favorites and try new places). The octopus and razor clams a la plancha are phenomenal!

NAME: GMAC
REVIEW: Space is tight as tables are very close together. Luckily we were next two tables with very nice couples. Made some new friends that we are planning on meeting next month at one of Mario's wine tastings. Food was very good. The small plates give you an opportunity to venture into dishes that you would not normally try in larger portions. We will be back!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono was a great restaurant. Our party ordered 9 different tapas: razor clams, mussels & chorizo, chorizo & cabbage, shrimp, pork belly, lamb shank, bone marrow, pumpkin/goat cheese and the duck egg. The dishes ranged from good to excellent. Prices were not outrageous, but were on the high end. The place is SMALL, so be sure to make a reservation. Definitely worth a visit.

NAME: may091
REVIEW: Great tapas with extensive wine list! The best dishes were the bruschetta and brussels sprouts! The cheese and pumpkin croquettes weren't as good as expected! The dishes were all full and rich with flavor! We were seated almost as soon as our entire party arrived, tho the service could have been better overall.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The quality and composition of their 'tapas' is the poorest that I have experienced in ANY restaurant involved in Spanish cuisine, or even high cookery in general. The one Michelin star status creates expectations that this restaurant definitely does not meet.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent experience and great food

NAME: JessicaM
REVIEW: Overall, I was a little disappointed in the food. Everything just seemed a little bland and unremarkable. The service was attentive, which I alway appreciate. However, even at 6:00 p.m. on a Sunday night, it was so loud and cramped that it was difficult to have a conversation. I think that this place is for the "see and be seen" crown rather than the foodie crowd

NAME: Beerandmeat
REVIEW: A small cute restaurant. Had the seta mushrooms, sweetbreads, fideos, calamari with pork meatballs, and cod cheeks. Overall good and very interesting dishes with unique ways of using ingredients. Wasn't blown away by anything except the mushrooms, though, and quite expensive for tapas. Was expecting a bit more, but i had very high expectations. Worth a try though.

NAME: Chewzy
REVIEW: We always eat here when we are in new York. It is one of our favorites and we are never disappointed. The food is interesting and exciting. Makes me want to get on the next flight to Spain.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Went for a late lunch; reservations are tough here as this place is good and popular. Service was good but uneven. Food, though, was fantastic. The pumpkin fritters, amazing, fois gras, delicious, flank steak, wonderful, chorizo, mouthwatering, stuffed peppers, delectable and the sundae, fabulous. And, although the restaurant was a bit tight and uncomfortable, I can't wait to go again.

NAME: Boskid
REVIEW: Very cramped restaurant which makes you initially uncomfortable. The food is excellent but very small portions at a very high price. Some reasonably priced wines by the bottle. Overall given other options this is a very good choice especially for lunch when it is less crowded

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Rush is their motto , really bad experience , too bad , food and service used to be better, we'll not come back.

NAME: realhungry
REVIEW: Expensive given the small plates. Good for a special occasion. Lamb shank is my favorite. Service is excellent.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent food, good ambiance, unexpectedly horrendous service.

NAME: Mork
REVIEW: As always, a gastronomic experience: a must for anyone who loves tapas. A note regarding the wines: rosados go very well with tapas and the Bermejo is definitely worth a try

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: expensive but the food is so good!

NAME: Bmiger
REVIEW: The food at Casa Mono is still very good, but isn't as consistent as it once was. Example: Mussels with chorizo came to the table in a sauce that was not cooked long enough, so it was acidic and spicy with no flavor. Best to eat lunch there, as dinner is extremely noisy no matter when you arrive. Plates are pulled away too quickly at dinner, even when there is no one waiting for a table.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I was dissappointed in Casa Mono. The croquetas, of both pork and cod, which were suggested by our server as a specialty, were bland. The brussels sprouts - which I know from my own cooking become sweet and tender when roasted - were charred but undercooked. It's a cozy place for a glass of wine and a bite or two, but not a meal.

NAME: VWhite
REVIEW: My fiancé and I wanted to try one of Mario Batali's restaurants for quite some time now and we chose Casa Mono because of our love for tapas. The evening couldn't have gone better!! The food is top shelf, our waiter was excellent; actually the entire staff was excellent! The wine list is extensive and all Italian so if you don't know your Italian wines you should brush up on that, however, the bar next door is a great place to try a glass while you wait for your reservation. We will definitely be returning to try the rest of the menu out and I would highly recommend this restaurant to any of my friends or co-workers.

NAME: louvg
REVIEW: My only complaint is that the restaurant is very small so it is very cramped inside. Food however was fabulous!

NAME: JClem
REVIEW: menu was creative and very representative of spain, the pork belly was delicious, service attentive. tables were alittle too crammed, not a problem in warm weather when restaurant can be opened up.

NAME: WorldDiner
REVIEW: This was my first time at Casa Mono and it won't be my last. I really enjoyed the menu and the wine list that included only Spanish wines. The wines by the glass were very interesting and the pours were very generous. I particularly enjoyed the grilled octopus and braised lamb shank! The wait staff was very friendly and professional. Loved it!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Loved the food! It was so, so good, and authentic. Unfortunately the wait staff was NOT so good or attentive and spent more time talking to each other instead of making sure we didn't want or need anything else. At one point we wanted to order a couple of more items and had to get up and get our waiter's attention.

NAME: LindaF
REVIEW: Warm friendly service, varied and excellent choices on menu.. Dining area is small and cramped, designed for a quick turnover in tables not for leisurely dining.

NAME: StefaniaK
REVIEW: The attraction is the food - very flavorful and inventive. New additions and seasonal choices are great. Its a crowded, noisy place --- expect brunch/lunch to be a quieter, calmer dining experience. Its unique menu makes it really attractive - the service can be very attentive to uninterested & the tables are really too tight for the dinner traffic...

NAME: Angie
REVIEW: over rated, over priced, cramped, small, no place to wait for your guests

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I ordered a cheap wine bottle and they gave me one triple the price. Other than that, the food was amazing.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: It's become a tradition for us to go for my brother's birthday. Great menu! Great service!

NAME: Champagnetaste
REVIEW: The food was fantastic. Our servers were helpful selecting food and wine. Going at 3:30 pm was perfect. Not crowded and more relaxed than at dinner-time when you are shoulder to shoulder. Can't be beat!

NAME: dineout
REVIEW: We've had tapas all over and from reading the reviews, we had high hopes.  It's just okay and nothing special.  But it's a fun place to eat.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food is very different at Casa Mono but also very good. We enjoyed our food but not the service. It was very rushed. The waiter would not allow any additional tapas orders after the initial order and tried to push us to order more at the start of the meal. We will not go back to Casa Mono as the waiter made our experience unpleasent.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Everything made to order. Great food. Will recommend.

NAME: Nyc10029
REVIEW: Really good food...but they need to work on the service. Staff not overly friendly...
