NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono is really incredible. mario Batali never dissapoints! If you are lucky enough to get a table....indulge in incredible tapas with a twist!

NAME: paris27
REVIEW: The food, the wine and the service were amazing.  We had a reservation and had to wait outside for 15 minutes on a 30 degree day which was not ideal. ANd one, additional note - the classic rock music they were playing was wayyy too loud/heavy for a Sunday afternoon brunch.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: just a great lunch place. the house wine is superb the food well prepared highly recommend a little pricey but worth it.

NAME: DEKKOR
REVIEW: What can we say ....great Job M.Batalia.... Great food and great service !!!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The portions were perfect for the food. They were just enough to satify without being to small leaving you wanting more or to large that you felt bad about eating it all or throwing it away. Very good wine selection. Service staff very helpful in offering advise.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono is now my favorite NYC restaraunt. The tapas menu allows for a sampling of many items for 2 people. Every dish we have was a new favor experience.

NAME: JeanF
REVIEW: We are Batali lovers although we were not that impressed with Casa Mono. It is small plates/tapas style. We were there for lunch and ordered the bacala fritters which we swear was mashed potatoes - no sign of Bacala in there. Sardines and scallops were good, not great. Skirt Steak was good but nothing different. Wine list was expensive. It was about $30 more expensive than we are used to at Lupa which wouldn't have been an issue if it was as great.

NAME: papi
REVIEW: Ok, it was Thanksgiving Day. Ok, it was a lazy lunch time. So, what's to be so critical about it? Relax. The staff being reasonably and seasonably relaxed is not a sin, even in a socalled "hot spot". End of the niceties. Bluntly put: who was minding the store? There is a difference between being relaxed and being asleep from the moment the customer enters the restaurant up to the moment he leaves. No sin, of course. But if the food is involved in the overall catatonia, it is time for some questions. Bye bye Mono.

NAME: Mork
REVIEW: I keep returning to Casa Mono for some very simple reasons: the tapas are outstanding,the staff is friendly, yet professional, and the wines are diverse. In addition the overall experience always seems to be a positive one in terms of the joy of dining. So i'll keep returning and likely will keep saying nice things about it. Kudos to the entire operation!

NAME: HWeil
REVIEW: Glorious cooking is badly compromised by loud music that requires conversation to be even louder, by slow service, and by the tightest seating in New York (the wait staff couldn't help jostling my chair every time someone passed; eating the excellent sardines made me feel like a cannibal). Too bad, because the food is top-notch.

NAME: A1inLV
REVIEW: We enjoyed it, but did not think it wasgreat

NAME: BonnieJeanne
REVIEW: Casa Mono was great, the only thing I would note is that it is not a romantic place. With the Michelin Star/great food/great chef/big prices for some reason we thought it would be a little more romantic. It was fantastic and delicious, just not what we expected, a little crowded for a special occasion. Also, great Spanish wine list, but our waitress was not very knowledgable.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Try the Patatas bravas and the Sardines!

NAME: DSHfromNWK
REVIEW: I've only been to Casa Mono twice--I realize that for affluent New Yorkers this restaurant would be a casual place to dine, but for me the price range means this is special occasion dining. I brought my best friend for his birthday. The food was phenomenal! I love the variety of options on the menu: we had goat cheese and squash croquettes, scallops, mackerel, lamb shank, oxtail, and goat. The mackerel, lambshank and oxtail were the standouts. We each had a cuarto of red wine; both were delicious. For dessert, he had the chocolate torte and I had the bread pudding. They were both scrumptious, although we thought the portions were small for the price. Expect tight quarters here as the restaurant is small and they use all the space.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The pork belly is to die for and all of the dishes we ate were prepared with care and tasted superb

NAME: COLDTablecustomer
REVIEW: Casa Mono was simply horrible. Unfriendly staff, not enough space, tiny tables, mediocre food and too much time between dishes and totally overpriced. We do not recommend this restaurant to any one who has tasted real Spanish food before.

NAME: KurtF
REVIEW: Somewhat condescending service. Excellent choice of tapas dishes but some have gone a little stale. A notice a decline. Almost sherrified white wine--which can be enjoyed but ought to be singled out from regular--was offered with no advance notice.

NAME: ChrisE
REVIEW: Dinner was great, each dish was carefully preapred and all were delicious. Mario Batailli even pulled up right outside on his scooter, orange crocs and all, and came inside to sit with some folks for a while. My only compliant would be that we would have liked to have probably done a second bottle of wine and ordered a little slower, but we were asked to place all of our order at once. Part of the beauty of tapas/small plates is trying this and that as you go along. Having to place the order at once, somewhat rushed the meal. While maybe this is something you need to do on a Friday or Saturday, this was a Monday night and the table next to us was empty until we left. But, this wouldn't keep me from coming back.

NAME: Malvolio
REVIEW: When I've been to Casa Mono for dinner, it has usually been packed and crowded. At lunch time, it is far more sedate. Oddly Open Table indicated no availability at 12:30 p.m. but the restaurant was half empty. The food as always was terrific, and the wait staff helpful.

NAME: thepurplestain
REVIEW: Food at Casa Mono was very good. Service was good. The noise level was not to my liking. Rock and roll played so loudly the server had a difficult time hearing us and I enjoy the Black Crows. I would suggest Spanish music since it is a Spanish restaurant. The atmosphere leaves a lot to be desired, kind of dumpy looking on the inside. While the wine list is quite extensive, the restaurant really gouges the clientele. Mark-up on the wines exceeded 300 percent.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Nice restaurant, very good food even though slightly expensive for the area. the place is not that big so the table are a little bit too close from each other Service is good but not very attentive.

NAME: 1CYNICALDINER
REVIEW: 4 "little plates", dessert, one of their cheapest bottles of wine? NOT priceless, over rated and over priced, $200 +. In this economy? Kudos if they can keep it up. Although the service was very good, the dishes were just OK and left us unsatisfied. While I appreciate striving for authenticity, you are in America people, we don't read Italian, at least put English descriptions of the food below the Italian! Also called to see if we could add two to our party (more revenue for you, Mr. Batali & Co.) and move it back 1/2 hour, said they were full and couldn't accomodate us, yet there were at least two tables open the entire time we were there.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: It was extraordinary. We have been to Spain many times and found the food at Casa Mono just as if we were eating in Madrid, Barcelona, or any Spanish city. Excellent service and prices were very reasonable. We stopped first at the bar next door and the tapas were just incredible. Will definitely go back whenever we are in New York. From 1 to 10, our experience was 11.

NAME: CarmenG
REVIEW: It was awesome! The food was really good. We really enjoyed the place and the food. Best dinner during our vacations in NYC. We are from Mexico and Australia and our family background is spanish, so we definetly know about spanish cuisine, and yours was outstanding. Thank you very much and congratulations!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Loved every morsel. Only fresh ingredients are used. I licked everything off the plate.

NAME: Naiad
REVIEW: The four dishes my friend and I shared were tasty and inventive. We both really enjoyed the pulpo and the goat cheese/watermelon salad, and the dessert, the Mono sundae, was delicious. There's a really extensive and good wine list. The negative is the tiny tables and extremely close quarters, although the design of the tables and the layout makes the most of the tiny square footage.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Everything was delicious!  Will definitely go again......

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: slight step below last time, but who knows may have been an off night. Still excellent.

NAME: sksun
REVIEW: Very cosy and the food was excellent ---

NAME: ChantalA
REVIEW: It was definitely worth the effort to make arrangements in advance. This restaurant, as well as the attached Bar Jamon, are on our "can't miss" list - we will recommend to anyone and everyone, and will be back ourselves without a doubt. The food was incredible: pumpkin and goat cheese croquetas, cana de cabra and watermelon salad, mussels with cava and chorizo, scallops with tomatillos con pepitas, duck breast with peach mostaza, pork belly with sweet corn and sandia, yunquera, and sorbet and sweet wine for dessert. All to die for. The atmosphere was cozy - not an ounce of extra space to be had - but lively and energetic. The service was attentive and prompt. Come here for incredible food and wine, but not for a private conversation.

NAME: Steve
REVIEW: This is a seriously good tapas bar. High quality food. The sweetbread choice was out of this world. All be it seating is like in a sardine can.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Didn't like the food, very small tables.

NAME: MarH
REVIEW: The food at Casa Mono was outstanding, as always. The biggest drawback of the place is that it's tiny and is always packed. If there are only 2 of you, opt to sit at the bar (watching them cook is a treat and there's more room than at many tables). Had some fried goat cheese and a great salad, the skirt steak is fantastic, the scallops were good but not my favorite thing there; also had some good grilled artichokes and the bread pudding dessert was excellent. They have a nice wine list. Service, as always, was phenomenal--all the servers are friendly, attentive and knowledgable about both the menu items and the wine list. Mono can get a little pricey for a "regular" dinner out but I think it's worth it.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was amazing. We tried 6 different tapas and all were fabulous. The only problem is the small size and our 1pm Sunday lunch date was perfect as it wasn't very crowded yet. While I understand the reason for having to order everything at once, I was disappointed we couldn't order one thing to curb our hunger while we agreed to what we wanted to order.

NAME: ElisaE
REVIEW: Amazing! Amazing! Amazing! Great service, unbelievable food, and good wine. Best desserts we have ever eaten. The restaurant is small but I never felt cramped.

NAME: JoyB
REVIEW: we love dining at Casa Mono! the food is amazingly prepared and the wine list is extensive.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The restaurant offers very good food and an extensive wine list. It is a very small place with little room to maneuver, and it get a bit uncomfortable.

NAME: papi
REVIEW: The food is generally above average, with the surprising exception of the available shell fish, which certainly does not reach high standards of excellence. The service is fairly pretentious, we shall see if the waiters will change their attitude when this hot spot falls from grace. Patience is the name of the game.

NAME: graceb
REVIEW: This is advertised as kid friendly but it's not. There isn't anything really on the menu for small children. The waiter suggested pasta without the sauce or mussels. It was, in the end, plain pasta. Guess what, it costs $18 to eat plain pasta at Casa Mono. I know it's New York but that was extraordinarily expensive. The foie gras and the fried pork belly were delicious. The fried pumpkin filled with goat cheese were overly breaded and over cooked. It was a good experience, though. I wouldn't recommend that anyone with a small child go there. The portions are also appetizer size. 3 or 4 orders per adult would satisfy an appetite.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Very cramped place but overall experience, the food was ok-to moderately good. I find other tapas place much more authentic and better.

NAME: DJ12
REVIEW: The food was great but the restaurant was too loud. The music was deafening at times - had trouble hearing our dining companions.

NAME: NickB
REVIEW: Casa Mono never fails to deliver. Tight seating, but adds to ambiance. Food combinations and flavors are worth the visit.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was great. The service was terrible, the waiters were more interested in pushing the tab higher than giving advice. Great food but you can not let the waiters intimiate you. After we order the first round of 6 dishes the waiter said in a nasty tone "thats not enough food" We asked for wine recommendations Sommelier pointed to a group of wines starting at $150 bottle, when I suggested that was a bit high he said that was all he had that met my comments and left me to pick something on my own.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The menu was totally done in Spanish and wasn't broken up into groups or types of tapas so be prepared to ask questions about the selections. The wine list was also quite extensive but there was a sommelier on hand to help pair the food with the wine.

NAME: Mary
REVIEW: Casa Mono is a very special place. The tapas (small plates) are outstanding here: the duck comes served 5 different ways including sweetbreads, the crispy mackerel is served over a roasted eggplant puree that could be a dish in its own right, the lamb chops with rosemary rub are first-rate, and the oxtail stew is phenomenal. Even better--the wine list is a true expression of the variety of Spanish wines, and the wait staff are friendly, willing and able to help you find the best matches for particular dishes. Many wines are available as quartos--enough for 2 glasses--so you can try different wines with your food if you enjoy that kind of culinary experimentation. This place is a real gem for foodies and wine lovers alike!

NAME: RichardC
REVIEW: food was quite good, but the wait staff & host were rather pretentious & not very accommodating... it's rare that the service detracts from such good food, but alas casa mono's service did.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We had a memorable evening with great friends. Service was fantastic, loved the wine. Menu offered something for everyone; one that was the finicky, one not so excited about seafood and 2 adventures. Loved that it was not a trip to a celebrity chef's" Disney World", but a great little restuarant to share great food with great friends on a Summer evening. Great time was had by all! Try the Scallops and Razor Clams!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This is my second time here and defiantly not the last. Love the food

NAME: Vixvegas
REVIEW: This tiny Batali addition to his array of great establishments offers a unique menu of tasty tapas. Each item is a clever twist on traditional Spanish small plates and each is delicious and flavorful. Don't miss the patatas bravas (spiced potatoes) or the skirt steak which is tender and incredibly flavorful, sliced to be shared. There are only a few tables but energy and flavor abound and the counter seating offers a chance to see the artistic chefs at work. Great place to visit for a small group who love great food.

NAME: DaveW
REVIEW: I sometimes feel that this is my favorite restaurant in the city. I love Spain: the food, culture, and wine. Casa Mono delivers on all of those things.  I really can't say enough.  Just go. Drink some wine. Eat some tapas.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: love the food, great for couples/adults. not very children friendly: 2/2 times some of the staff had issues with our - well behaved! - kids.

NAME: LaFleur
REVIEW: The food was phenomenal, especially the Hudson Valley pork menu. Also plenty of options for non-meateaters. We sat at the bar and watched the open kitchen; a fascinating way to enjoy the experience. Three dishes per person was the perfect amount of food. Can't wait to go back.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: A bit of a disappointing 2nd visit (only a week after my first) - maybe expectations were too high? Food is good, but it'd be great if they could change the menu up a bit every now and then... Service isn't the best here (I usually don't care about service if the food is good).. our waiter wasn't very friendly, didn't explain which dishes he was bringing out (there was a substitution), and rushed us out blatantly.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Every dish was so delicious and equally well executed. Amazing food!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Overall, the food was good, but a bit greasy (ex. duck egg w/ potatoes & blk truffles), and salty (ex. romesco) Also, the pumpkin with goat cheese balls were dry and over fried -seemed like they came out of a frozen food box. The steak over the romesco was cooked nicely, the bread con tomate was perfect & the meat free Monday veggie special was very good.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: My husband and I went for our anniversary and absolutely LOVED IT!! We are big foodies and Casa Mono came recommended to us. The place was small, empty when we arrived at 5:30 but packed by the time we left at 7:30. Very loud and almost a little too intimate, we felt as if we were dining with the 2 other couples next to us. You couldn't help but be part of each others conversations. Razor clams rocked as did the scallops, lobster, and calamari with pork meatballs. I'd skip the chorizo with sumer beans, too much chorzio. Our waiter recommended some great Spanish wines that went well with our meal. They paced everything perfectly so that you had time to eat before the next round of plates began. We cant wait to go back. Casa Mono nailed it!

NAME: alexandras
REVIEW: perfect as always, esp the array of Spanish wines and a skirt steak. have been there many times and never get tired or less than impressed with each details.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was amazing. We went at lunch so it was quiet but the space is small and very tightly packed--I can imagine that it is much louder when it is busier. Next time I would try to sit at the bar and watch them prepare the food. We were very happy with the experience. My daughter had the pork belly and it was one of the best dishes I have ever tasted.

NAME: boulezl
REVIEW: Generous portions for wine; exciting dishes; well-executed. Definitely not a place for quiet conversations.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We were excited for our first time here. Tight seating arrangments, cozy, and you can catch neighboring conversations here and there. There was one 'order taker' and a group of servers. The order taker did not exude a warm welcoming demeanor. When she was taking our order, she had to correct one of my guests to say you have to order all at one time, in kind of crisp townhall delivery. Well, we said, give us some more time and we will adhere to your system. Sounded like a stressed work environment than the start of a nice sunday brunch, and with my out of town guest from midwest, concluding, yes it is in fact stressful in NYC. The food and attentive servers (changing plates, serving the dishes) redeemed the rest.

NAME: Foodie
REVIEW: Excellent is all I can say. A memorable evening.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was utterly amazing. The calamari was wonderful and the chorizo was the best I've had. The green beans were just better than I've ever tasted. My new favorite place! Everything was truly delicious and made for a fun meal. The service was so-so.

NAME: BigMo
REVIEW: outstanding. At 10 pm on a Sunday night in the summer, Casa Mono was packed with a lively crowd. Even though the space is small, we did not feel cramped at all, and the service was timely -- neither rushed nor too slow.

NAME: MetshaR
REVIEW: Ive eaten her before and enjoyed the food. I had the Fideos and for the first time, the soft shell crab, it was amazing. I went in with 3 friends who were eating at Casa Mono for the first time and they loved the food. Our server, Fernando, was great extremely patient and helpful. Its a very intimate place with a laid back ambiance. Will be returning!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Awesome tapas... pricey, but overall worth the cost. The selection, both hot an cold, was superb and flavorful, and they do have some less expensive wines, by the glass and the bottle, if you don't want to break the bank completely! Best to go with several people and taste the assortment. We went for lunch and they did not rush the experience.

NAME: nycubanpete
REVIEW: A wonderful experience - I felt like I was having lunch on the some back street in Madrid - an absolute gem! The razor clams are worth the price of admission! :)

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: While all Batali's restaurants seem to feature unsmiling, unpleasant hostesses, the rest of the experience was great.

NAME: LadyBoddington
REVIEW: Although we enjoyed the meal, the service was poor from the word go. We arrived right at noon which was the time of our reservation but found the door locked and could see employees inside still setting up. They could see us waiting on the street, yet didn't let us in until almost 10 past noon and then didn't apologize. From there things got worse as the waiters were only interested in a larger party that was drinking lots of wine. We had to ask for spoons, bread, more water, etc. All in all, we wouldn't go back due to the poor quality of service.

NAME: Mlacc
REVIEW: This quaint little restaurant served melt in your mouth grilled polpo and razor clams. The soft shelled crab was meaty and tender with tremendous flavor. The original server was knowledgeable and friendly as his relief was cold and impersonable. I would highly recommend this intimate place for brunch/lunch at any given time.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I really liked their wine selection, and 2/4 dishes were great but a bit small (even for a tapas place). Also, I really wanted to like their bone marrow dish but it was just overly salted plus with the strong taste of capers, it was just too much salt. Highly recommend their octopus special.

NAME: PeterH
REVIEW: MB never fails to amaze us. The seared scallop, red snapper, and bone marrow tapas we had were spectacular. Tight space, but vibrant crowd.

NAME: SusanO
REVIEW: food pretty good. service slow and waiter a snob.

NAME: PeterR
REVIEW: our experience at Casa Mono was undoubtedly a good one. the food was outstanding but very pricey. we were a party of three and were sat at a very small table that would have been fine for 2 but it proved a little problematic with all the small plates. the host and most of the servers were very nice and helpful but our main waitress seemed a little impatient and not as helpful as she might have been in helping us understand the menu better. the wine was superb but again very expensive. all in all a wonderful place if you don't mind dropping a big bundle on tapas delights.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: razor clams and sweet potato goat cheese croquetas were standouts but everything was beautifully cooked, ordered 8 dishes for a table of 4 and we were all pleasantly full. highly recommended for a fun and very delicious group outing, although as others have noted seating can be cramped.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Loved the food which provides a person willing to experiment with several extremely good options.

NAME: FGS1201
REVIEW: Always fantastic and very creative. The red snapper 'tartare' was sublime; just about everything else was delicious.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Having lived in Spain several years ago, Casa Mono felt like I was there all over again. From the tables and tiles, to the delightful food, it was a great overall experience, and quite authentic!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I ate at Casa Mono a couple of nights ago. Overall everything was great. My only small complaint was the skirt steak with onion mermelada. I think the problem had more to do with how it was sliced than anything. It just seemed a little chewy despite being cooked nicely. The star of the night was the sweetbreads. The other standouts were the Pulpo with fennel and grapefruit, red snapper crudo, mussels with chorizo,and the pork croquettas. I ate at Amada in Philly a few nights before, though it was good Casa Mono blew it out of the water.

NAME: UnwantedGuest
REVIEW: great super inventive dishes, very well executed; bass/cod cheek pil pil was exceptional!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Only my second visit to this restaurant. I was thrilled with the variety of tapas and enjoyed every selection.

NAME: Mark
REVIEW: Great food in a very cozy atmosphere

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono was a good choice for out of town guests who are familiar with Mario Batali. However, I think his other restaurants are more representative of why he's so popular. The food here ranges from average (pork croquette) to great (razor clams). While the portions are appropriate and fun to share, I thought the pacing was off considerably. No one should be in a hurry when having tapas for lunch and we certainly took everything at a leisurely pace, but we were waiting up to 15 minutes between finishing one dish and being ready for the next round to arrive, so it felt long.

NAME: salvadorm
REVIEW: Outstanding! A little bit noisy but it dosen't matter at all because it was great food, wine and service. Thanks a lot. Salvador.

NAME: BS222
REVIEW: Best tapas we've found in the city. One thing to note, this restaurant is very small, which explains why it books quickly. We went on a warm day and the restaurant had the doors to the sidewalk open which made the place feel a bit bigger. Razor clams and cuddlefish were fantastic, and the bone marrow was a great recommendation from the server (something we probably wouldn't have tried without a little nudge)

NAME: jasonnunan
REVIEW: Stunning ingredients. Well prepared. Great, knowledgeable server. Many thanks!

NAME: Luvfood
REVIEW: It was such an amazing experience. The food was so good. The restaurent is not that spacious, but nice and warm atmosphere. I highly recommend even though it was a little pricy. The portion of each dish was like an appetizer, thus it would be better to order 2 dishes per each person.

NAME: foodie
REVIEW: Easily the best all around meal I've had in a long time. The food was outstanding, the service even better. My wife and I went for her birthday. It was great!

NAME: TamarN
REVIEW: Unique intimate neighborhood restaurant, special experience and good tapas food

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was fantastic; I recommend both the razor clams and the duck with asparagus. The seating is very tight and the tables small as are the portions-which is to be expected-I would order 2 plates each at least, 3 if you're a little hungrier/want to try more items. In my experience, nothing on the menu has disappointed. Come prepared for a lively scene with good music, especially if you're into alternative indy-rock like the Friendly Fires. It's certainly geared toward a younger crowd. Go early on a nice evening and start out at Bar Jamon next door and then over to Casa Mono for a great open-air meal.

NAME: bordeaux
REVIEW: Casa Mono is one of the best restaurants in NYC. The food was delicious the wine was great. It was loud and full of energy that you can only get in New York. It was a warm night so we sat with the doors open . We had a wonderful time and our waiter was so helpful w/ all his recommadation.  Marianne Bulfamante

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was good but was expecting something better. The bar around the corner is great.

NAME: Alex
REVIEW: Perhaps the finest Spanish wine list I've seen this side of the Atlantic.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Went to Casa Mono with my 15 year old son, an up and coming foodie, and we enjoyed a nice variety of dishes. Best, by far, was the razor clam dish, although the other samplings were quite good as well, including the goat confit. Overall, expect tight seating (we went early prior to the dinner rush), but this shouldn't detract from some great tapas. We were seated next to a window and it felt like an intimate local neighborhood restaurant.

NAME: mcf524
REVIEW: Every dish was a hit! Only wish I could have tried everything.

NAME: FLLdiner
REVIEW: Terrific tapas. The red snapper crudo was fantastic. Had a second order for dessert.

NAME: JulieV
REVIEW: Another great lunch at Casa Mono. The food is always excellent, more upscale than authentic Spanish tapas (which is essentially bar food), but consistently superb. Try the artichokes with mint, the bacalao croquetas, the deep fried peppers (seasonal, not available yet unfortunately). The wines by the glass are very good as was the manzanilla we started with.  Always a pleasure, if you haven't been here yet, you really should. Make sure you book though, it's tiny and always crowded.

NAME: KatieB
REVIEW: The restaurant is small, which is okay except we were in a table that was on top of another one and we might as well have dined with the people sitting next to us. You have to pull out the table to fit into the back seat which is not good. The food was good, overpriced, but good. The waiter was friendly but didn't seem to have much knowledge of the menu or wine, he had to step away and ask others about the wines before giving a suggestion. The wine menu is in spanish which presents a challenge for those who don't speak it, a simple Tinto (red) would have helped not only us but the couple sitting next to us who were as confused as we were.

NAME: dessert20
REVIEW: Excellent food. Great lively feel and accomodating wait staff. The restaurant is small and tables close together but the staff do a great job of making it all work.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This was my husband's birthday and we only managed a 3pm reservation on Saturday. After reading some reviews I was a bit worried about service being not up to par, because it can ruin the whole experience no matter how good the food is. BUT IT WAS AN ABSOLUTE PLEASURE!!! Our server was a charming, knowlageble, intelegent and warm young man. Can't wish for anything more. He was all there when we needed him and not there when we didn't. Thank you very much! I dined in Casa Mono before and it can be tight for space and a bit noisey, but it's the nature of the beast. So if between hours works for you try it.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We had a fantastic experience at Casa Mono. We asked the waiter to bring a glass of whatever white wine he thought was best and it was delicious. We did the same for the tapas and he brought plate after plate of delicious and beautifully-prepared food. What a great find!

NAME: KatH
REVIEW: The food was delicious and definitely the best part of the meal.  Our first server was excellent and then someone else took over who had a little bit of an attitude.  The tables are too close together and we were sat right by the service station (note to managers - we can hear everything the servers say and it's not always good).

NAME: ParkerK
REVIEW: Given all the hype surrounding this place, I was a bit disappointed. I enjoyed the atmosphere, although it is extremely small. We were at a two top and were almost right on top of the table next to us. It didn't bother me too much but some people might feel a bit cramped. The outside doors were open and it had a very nice neighborhood feel to it.  As far as the food goes, I was a bit unimpressed. The Jamon Iberico took me back to my days living in Spain, but was a bit overpriced for what you were getting, and was not the best Jamon I have tasted. The Lamb was well seasoned and cooked well, while the pork and tomato croquetas were overcooked and need a little work. All in all, I was left wanting and expected more. Great wine list though.

NAME: MamikoS
REVIEW: I usually go there for dinner, but tried lunch since I had a day off. Food were wonderful as always and the restaurant was not as crowded as dinner time. My friends and I could relaxed and enjoyed a weekday afternoon. I felt wine was a little pricey for the ambiance.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: A top choice for Spanish food in NYC. One of the great Spanish wine lists in the US. It's fairly small so lunch is more relaxed than the usually packed and noisier dinner scene.

NAME: Bourbonman
REVIEW: The food was very good but the experience was ruined by the manager wh could not find a way to accomodate a table of 3 in a nearly empty restaurant well after lunch-hour. That lack of service attitude is the kiss of death of any restaurant.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: One of my all time favorite restaurants, never failed me once when it comes to food. Cramp space with open kitchen so prepare to smell a little smokey after you're done eating.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Everything was too salty and very tight seating

NAME: Wilse
REVIEW: There were only two tables occupied during our visit. The wait staff was preoccupied with stocking shelves and taking care of other business. We had to constantly ask for service. The waiter was annoyed that we did not want to order our entire meal at one time, stating that the "kitchen" would not be able to accomodate us properly if we did not order all together (remember, there were only two tables occupied). The food was exceptional, but clearly the wait staff forgot who was buying and who was selling. I used to consider the staff at Casa Mono to be exceptionally knowledgeable and helpful, but this experience was disappointing. I will have to seriously consider whether to return or recommend it to another.

NAME: ebenc
REVIEW: Excellent all around. Great recommendations from the sommelier. Should have lingered longer.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food is creative, delicious, and beautifully served. Very noisy and the music seems out of place with a Spanish cuisine. Our waiter, William, was stand-offish, disinterested, unhelpful, and humorless. Despite that, we would recommend for the food and the hope that you were served by a better, more engaged and fun waiter. Some highlights--pumpkin and goat cheese croquettes, sea scallops on pureed parsnips, grilled beets with salted granola, pork belly, sweetbreads, skirt steak, dorada. What is also nice is that you can order dishes to share or you can make your own meal by ordering 2 or 3 dishes. Desserts also outstanding.

NAME: LisaT
REVIEW: grood food, music is too loud for such a tiny place. Pricing is also too high for this venue especially considering the size of the plates.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I was excited about dining at Casa Mono having eaten at both Bar Pinotxo and Cal Pep. I read Mr. Batali stating that "we basically ripped them off completely", so I thought the food at Casa Mono (especially considering the prices) was going to be a slightly more upscale version. But everything I ordered had more or less the same basic taste to it, which was a very overpowering acidity and excess heat/spice. This was case with all 5-6 dishes, which were made of entirely different ingredients. The lack of table space did not bother me, I found it cozy and intimate (European). The service was good, but the food itself is just NOT very Spanish. The food from the kitchen did not meet my expectations. Next time I'll just order jamon and manchego.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Don't expect to be treated well when you're here. The food is good, but I've had better tapas elsewhere, without the accompanying attitude. The tables are crowded too close together for diners to feel comfortable. The service was lackluster and the reception at the hostess desk seemed to reflect a belief that diners should consider themselves fortunate to have the chance to eat here.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great food but very tight seating

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This tucked away newcomer is a beauty at night with its warm glow and greenhouse appearance. It is quite small and popular now so plan time slots accordingly because it gets cramped. Many dishes were delicious, but a preponderance of them are too "extreme" in their tastes or ingredients and more "mainstream" candidates are needed, and a bit less salt would be wise. The fideos with clams was superb. The wine list is impressive, as was the tab (almost $500 for 5 with one bottle of wine and just a few drinks).

NAME: tishj
REVIEW: I love this restaurant -- the food is memorabe which is high praise from me! Despite the wonderful pedigree, I feel right at home here.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Casa Mono is always consistent, the food is authentic and creative, service is friendly and yet really professional. We have never be disappointed.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: My expectations were high because I live in Atl & assumed that NYC would have better tapas. While Casa Mono was good, it was not as good as I had expected. The restaurant was tiny...claustrophobics beware. The wine list was huge...wines from every region in Spain. We ordered the Pumpkin croquetas w/goat cheese(interesting), Calamares Fritos (good),Piquillo Peppers w/Oxtail (excellent) and Veal cheek Tagine w/sweet potato cous cous (excellent). We were about to skip dessert but thankfully decided to order Crema Catalana con bunuelos...it was the highlight of the meal...closely resembling creme brulee but with a darker caramel crust. It was accompanied with batter fried bay leaves...the dessert made the meal.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: A friend and I had lunch at Casa Mono in mid December and thought it was okay, but not great. Maybe we ordered the wrong things, but 3 out of the 4 things were pretty average. This place is VERY small and only 4 tables were filled. Service was decent, but the waiter's attitude was not.

NAME: RMB2024
REVIEW: The food was fine (missteps: gritty clams, undercooked artichoke, overcooked patatas). The service could have been better: it took a good minute or two for anyone to greet me when I arrived, which seemed rather inexcusable given that the restaurant was otherwise empty. Also, because the restaurant was empty, it seemed unnecessary to ask me to step next door (the better to purchase more wine?) until the rest of my party (a single person) arrived. The meal itself was conducted on a fairly leisurely scale- -which in general I appreciate, though it seems excessive to have to wait 10 minutes on an empty house, and at the counter, for a server to inquire after a drink order. Also: server needs to know that artichokes aren't brussel sprouts

NAME: HGWT
REVIEW: The small plates here are very good but the space is just too cramped to enjoy the food.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: not only is the food delicious, but much of the menu has uncommon items for NYC, so that already makes the restaurant an exception.

NAME: LJReviewer
REVIEW: Very small but great food. Only comment would be to have additional plates available so that the various tastes from each tapas selection are not mixed. We had 4 individual items that we shared but were only given one plate each.

NAME: JuneS
REVIEW: Food was good but not as great as I expected based on other people's reviews. Everything that I ordered was a bit too salty. However, the pumpkin croquettes were amazing. Overall, there are better tapas, which were priced more reasonably.

NAME: SFaphile
REVIEW: It was the lowest Michelin rated restaurant we visited, so it wss interesting to see what passes for 1-star in NYC, and the answer is not much. The food was fair and I imagine there are better tapas bars in the city. The wine list was reasonably priced. The room is too small for a nice evening and we felt rushed to finish our meal so they could turn the table over to the next group.

NAME: MichelinStarHunter
REVIEW: One of my favorites: food is amazing, top ingrediants and so tasty. Tiny and crowded, but this is what makes it romantic. If you want to taste what real tapas tastes like, go here!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This is my fourth time at Casa Mono, and I still recommend it to my friends. It's also a good date place.  With so many choices on the menu, it's fun to experiment (and hard to go wrong). Some of the highlights are the bacalao fritters, the lamb ribs, and the pumpkin & goat cheese croquetas. Leave the tripe for Mario...
